Preheat oven to 375f. Butter muffin cups or line muffin tins with paper baking cups. In a large bowl, cream butter with brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg until well mixed. Stir in oatmeal. Combine flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamonstir well. Stir into oatmeal mixture just until combined. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups filling each cup 2/3 full. Bake for 18-20 minutes, until toothpick inserted into center of muffin comes out clean. Cool on racks for 5 minutes before removing from pan to cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

Melt Velveeta with milk and cayenne pepper in microwave until smooth. Add paprika and stir well. Slice lobster tails and add them to the sauce. Add in chopped sweet red pepper and fresh parsley. Serve with french bread and enjoy!

Combine sake, soy and mirin in saucepan and heat until boiling. Add ginger and spring onions. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add chicken wings and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove and cool. To make glaze: combine mirin and soy and heat until boiling. Add chicken wings and coat well. Allow to cool. Serve with steamed rice and lemon.

Peel and core apples. Cut into 1/2 inch wedges. Combine apples and water in a large saucepan. Heat to boiling over medium heat. Reduce heat. Simmer 1 hour. Cool. Combine sugar, molasses, apple juice and spices in a small bowl. Add to apples and stir until well blended. Return to saucepan. Cook over medium heat to desired thickness. Pour into hot sterilized jars. Seal. Makes about 4 cups.

Melt butter in medium saucepan over low heat. Add sugar, stirring until butter is melted and sugar is dissolved. Increase heat to medium and continue cooking, stirring constantly for 2 minutes or until mixture starts to boil and turns amber in color. Add almonds and stir constantly for 1 minute or until almonds are coated in caramel and turn a light golden brown color. Remove from heat and stir in sesame seeds. Let caramel mixture cool to room temperature and spread evenly over 12-inch square baking pan or any pan lined with foil or parchment paper. Melt chocolate in microwave for about 2 minutes or until smooth and shiny, stirring every 30 seconds. Spread evenly over caramel. Let stand at room temperature until chocolate is firm. Cut into squares with a sharp knife or break apart with your hands.

Beat the cream cheese in a stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment until smooth and creamy. Add in eggs and beat for 2 minutes until light and fluffy. Add in vanilla and honey and mix well. Add in flour and mix just until combined. In a separate bowl combine milk and baking powder and mix well. Add milk mixture to cream cheese mixture and beat for 2 more minutes until smooth. Pour into a greased 9-inch square pan. Bake in a preheated oven to 350f for about 35 minutes or until puffed and golden brown. Cool before cutting into squares and dusting with powdered sugar.

Cut celery into 2 inch pieces. Combine celery with 3 cups water and 2 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan. Bring to a boilcover and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from the heat. Puree in a blender or food processor until smooth. Return the mixture to the pan. Combine the flour and milk with the 1/2 cup remaining butter and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until the mixture thickens and boils. Reduce heat and simmer 1 minute. Add the celery mixture and 1/2 teaspoon peppercook and stir until heated through. Sprinkle with peanut butter.

Preheat the oven to 350. In a large skillet over medium heat, add the olive oil. Add the onion and cook until it is soft. Add the carrot and cook until soft. Add the dry sherry and let evaporate. Add the tomato. Add the veal chops and brown on both sides. Add the mushrooms and green pepper. Cook until the veal is done and the vegetables are tender. Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Serves 4.

Mix soy sauce with ginger, cornstarch, sugar, vinegar and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add mustard and ginger root and boil 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Pour half of this mixture into crock pot. Put ribs into crockpot. Add remaining marinade to crockpot. Cover. Cook 6-8 hours or until ribs are tender. Remove ribs to platter. Stir up liquid. Return ribs to crockpot to keep warm. Serve with rice.

Place a large skillet over medium heat. Place chicken breasts in skillet. Cook chicken breasts for about 5 minutes per side. Turn chicken breasts over and cook for another 5 to 8 minutes. Turn chicken breasts over. Cook for another 5 minutes per side. Remove chicken breasts from heat. Sprinkle with paprika and season with salt and cinnamon. Set aside. In medium bowl combine syrup, mustard, and butter. Brush mixture over chicken breasts. Place chicken breasts back on heat. Cook over medium heat until mixture forms a glaze. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease baking sheet. In a mixing bowl, combine molasses, brown sugar, cider vinegar, and eggs. Beat well. Combine dry ingredients. Add to molasses mixture. Stir well. Drop by teaspoons onto greased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool.

Melt butter in a small skillet over medium high heat. Add steak seasoning and stir until evenly coated. Remove from heat and add dried parsley flakes and dried thyme. Cut fillets into serving-size pieces and coat with seasoned butter. Arrange fillets on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 375f for 10 minutes. Flip and bake an additional 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet brown ground beef and onion over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Add garlic and barbecue saucestir to combine. Drain cooked macaronistir into beef mixture. Pour into 1-1/2-quart casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Sprinkle with pepper and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Makes 4 servings.
Brown cube steaks in hot butter. Add black pepper. Deglaze with water. Add lemon juice and worcestershire sauce. Bring to boil. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

Preheat oven to 400f. Remove stem end from brussels sprouts then halve each. In a large bowl combine sprouts, thyme, oregano and 1/2 teaspoon of each pepper. Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add pine nuts and saute 2 minutes. Spread nuts out on a plate. Add sprouts to skillet and saute 2 minutes. Transfer sprouts to a large baking dish. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle nuts over sprouts. Bake for 25-30 minutes until sprouts are tender. Drizzle with additional oil if desired.

Heat the coconut milk in a large non stick pan. Add the green curry paste & cook for about 2 minutes. Add the chicken breast and cook until just cooked through. Add the eggplant and cook for a few minutes more. Add the kaffir lime leaves, fish sauce, sugar, sweet basil & hot chili. Stir well. Taste & adjust seasoning with more sugar if you want it sweeter. Serve over steamed jasmine rice.

Combine all dry ingredients except raisins and peanut butter in large mixing bowl. Pour honey over dry ingredients and stir until well coated and mixture begins to clump. Add raisins and peanut butter and stir again until well blended. Put into wax paper lined pan and pat into desired shape, pressing firmly to shape well. Refrigerate for one hour and then cut into desired size nuggets.

Slice pineapple into bite size pieces. Mix together honey and passion fruit. Pour over pineapple and stir until coated well. Chill and serve cold. Top with dark rum. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, beat together peanut butter and butter until smooth and creamy. Stir in brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla until well blended. Sift together flour, baking powder and saltstir into peanut butter mixture until just mixed. Spread into prepared baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle chocolate chips evenly over the top of the unbaked brownie batter. Return brownie batter to the oven and bake until chips are melted and the top is light golden brown, about 15 minutes. Let cool before cutting into bars. Store in an airtight container.

Soak the casings in water for 30 minutes. In a large mixing bowl combine the cheddar cheese, buttermilk and sage. In a separate bowl combine the ground pork with the remaining ingredients and mix until well blended. Add the sage and cheese mixture and blend. Stuff into casings and twist off. Refrigerate overnight. In a large skillet heat the olive oil until hot and add the sausage links. Cook until brown and then flip and brown the other side. Serve with mustard and sauerkraut.

Peel the sweet potatoes and parsnips. Cut into 1-inch cubes. Place in a pot of boiling salted water. Cook until tender. Drain. Mash in a bowl with butter, milk and nutmeg. Add chives. Season to taste.

Prepare a large pot of boiling water. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine carrots and watercook 30 minutes or until carrots are tender. Drain wellreserve 3 cups of cooking liquid. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine carrots, water, raisins, butter, brown sugar, cayenne pepper and saltbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer, uncovered, 5 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Stir in reserved liquid. Remove from heatstir in nutmeg. Serve warm.

In small bowl combine cream cheese and sugars until smooth. Stir in crushed pineapple, yogurt, nuts and milk or water. Chill until ready to serve. For individual servings, pour mixture into lined muffin tins. Freeze for about two hours, or until set. Garnish with additional pecans, if desired.

Heat butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add the leeks and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally until leeks are wilted and lightly browned. Stir in the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the heavy cream. Heat until just bubbling. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls. Garnish with a little more grated cheese and serve.

In a slow cooker or crock pot, combine the chicken, pineapple juice, brown sugar, soy sauce, cinnamon and cloves. Cover. Cook on low for 3 to 4 hours. Stir in the pineapple chunks. Cook for an additional hour. Remove the whole spices. Stir in the shredded coconut.

In a small saucepan, melt the butter and the brown sugar over medium heat until the sugar dissolves and begins to boil. Pour the mixture over the prepared brownie pan and bake for approximately 20 minutes or until the top is lightly golden brown. Remove the pan from the oven and sprinkle the pecans on top. Let the brownies cool completely before cutting into squares.

Place the milk, vanilla bean and cinnamon stick in a saucepan and heat gently until hot. Remove the vanilla bean. Break the egg yolks into a large bowl and gradually beat them into the hot milk until the mixture is very smooth. Strain through a fine sieve and return to the saucepan. Add the sugar, cornflour and zests. Bring to the boil over a medium heat and cook for 5 minutes, stirring continuously. Pour the mixture into four 1 litre ramekins or shallow ovenproof dishes and bake in a bain-marie for 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly. Dot the tops of the ramekins with the soft brown sugar. Turn the oven down to 150°C and cook for a further 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool in the oven for another 2 hours. The custard will set slightly. Serve the crema catalana hot.

Combine the sugar, cornstarch, coffee, soy sauce, vinegar in a saucepan. Whisk until smooth. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Brush on chicken or pork before baking. Refrigerate any leftovers. Makes about 2 cups.

Saute onion and celery in butter until tender. Add barley and saute for 1 minute. Add chicken broth. Simmer, covered, 1 hour. Stir in flour and salt and pepper to taste. Add cream. Heat through. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Spray an 8x8x2-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray and line it with wax paper, letting it hang over two sides of pan to help lift cake out later. In a medium bowl, stir together flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside. In a large bowl, cream together vegetable shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in milk and vanilla, then beat in egg whites until just blended. Add dry ingredients and stir until just blended. Scrape into pan and bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack 10 minutes. Remove cake from pan and remove wax paper. Cool completely on wire rack. Frost when cooled.
Cook noodles as directed. Drain and set aside. In a pot, melt the butter and stir in the parsley, chives and rosemary. Add the noodles and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Wash the leeks well, then trim off the root end. Slice the leeks into half lengthwise. Cut into 2-inch strips. Brown the leeks in the oil for about 10 minutes. Add the ham, tomatoes and seasoning to taste. Cook for another 5 minutes, then add the cheese and mix well. Make a hole in the middle of the mixture and break the egg into the middle of the hole. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for about 15 minutes until the egg white is set but the yolk still runny.

Drain artichokes and place in a 1 quart bowl or baking dish. Add cheese. Stir to blend. In a small bowl or measuring cup, combine the mayonnaise, garlic, salt and pepper. Spoon over artichokes. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Makes 4 servings.
Put the pork in a 3 1/2 quart slow cooker. Pour over the Pepsi. Mix together the cream of mushroom soup and onion soup mix. Pour over the pork. Cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.

Cook pasta and drain. In a large sauce pan, combine pasta sauce and broccoli florets. Heat through. Meanwhile, slice the potatoes into 1/2 inch rounds. Heat 1/4 inch of olive oil in a saute pan until hot. Add the potatoes in one layer. Fry until golden brown. Add to the sauce pan. Add green peppers and mozzarella cheese. Heat through. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve over pasta.

Cut shrimp in half and saute in butter with bacon. Remove from pan and set aside. Add scallions and saute in bacon fat. Add cream cheese and mayo and cook until heated. Add horseradish and spices to taste. Add shrimp and bacon. Bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes. Serve with crackers.

In a saucepan combine the oats and water. Bring to a boil. Simmer covered for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in cocoa powder, cinnamon and protein powder. Let stand 10 minutes. Mix in peanut butter. Serve with milk or fruit juice.

Combine ketchup, vinegar, onion, garlic and mustard in a large saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat and simmer for five minutes. Stir in dry mustard and cayenne pepper. Cook one minute longer. Cool before using. Makes about 3 cups.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Heat a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. In a bowl combine the mustard and 2 tablespoons of the oil. Stir in the herbs. Add the beef and turn to coat. Place the beef in a large roasting pan. Roast for 20 minutes. Sprinkle the beef with the garlic. Roast for about 10 more minutes or until an internal thermometer registers 145 degrees for medium rare. Combine the remaining 1/4 cup olive oil and the mustard in a small bowl. Mix in the sour cream. Season the sauce to taste with the black pepper. Serve the tenderloin with the sauce.

Marinade: In a food processor, pulse walnuts until they are finely ground. Transfer walnuts to a small bowl. Add pomegranate molasses, 1/2 teaspoon each of cinnamon, nutmeg and turmeric and saffron. Stir to blend. Add 1/2 cup water and mix well. Remove 1/2 cup marinade. Reserve for basting. In a large bowl, combine walnut mixture with remaining marinade. Add chicken. Toss until chicken is well coated. Cover bowl with plastic wrap. Marinate 4 to 24 hours in the refrigerator. Remove chicken from marinade. Reserve marinade for basting. Discard walnuts. Pat chicken dry. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil until hot but not smoking. Add chicken. Fry 5 minutes on each side or until no longer pink. Remove from skillet. Add reserved marinade. Cook until thickened. Pour over chicken. Garnish with walnuts.

Combine the water, sugar and lemon zest in a small saucepan. Cook over low heat until the sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and cool completely. Combine the lemonade mixture, lemonade concentrate and lemon juice in a pitcher or blender. Add the ice cubes and stir well. Pour the mixture into the molds. Freeze for at least three hours, or until firm. To unmold, dip the molds into hot water for a few seconds. Serve immediately.

In a large pot, combine milk and sugar over medium heat. Cook for about 8 minutes, or until sugar dissolves. Add vanilla and stir well. Let cool to room temperature. Pour into individual cups, about 1/2 full. Insert popsicle sticks into cups and place in the freezer. Freeze for a minimum of 6 hours. Remove the cups from the freezer and insert a wooden popsicle stick into the center of each. Serve immediately.

In a 2-quart saucepan melt butter. Stir in flour until blended. Slowly stir in milk. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until thick. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese until melted. Add paprika, salt and cayenne. Serve immediately.

Mix all the marinade ingredients together. Place fish in a large glass dish and pour the marinade over it. Refrigerate overnight. Remove the fish from the marinade, pat it dry, then brush it with oil. Place the fish in the middle of the alder plank or the grill grate and cook for 15 minutes per inch of thickness until the fish is firm. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to a warmed serving dish. Garnish with sesame seeds and scallions.
Boil water and add potatoes. When done drain and place in butter. Add flour and milk. Add salt to taste. Pour into greased baking dish. Bake at 400 for 45 min.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream butter and sugar. Add raisin bran cereal. Add dry ingredients alternating with buttermilk. Add dried cranberries and eggs. Pour into greased muffin tins. Bake for 20 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Makes 12 muffins.

Season the lamb chops with salt and pepper. Dip the lamb chops first into the flour and then into the eggs and finally into the breadcrumbs and coat well. Heat the butter in a pan and brown the lamb chops on both sides. Transfer the lamb chops to a warmed plate and keep warm. Add the lemon juice to the pan and stir well. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper. Pour the lemon juice over the lamb chops and sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Brown the kangaroo mincemeat in a large frying pan over medium heat in a little oil. Add the chopped onion and saute until the onion is softened. Add the canned tomatoes and tomato paste, and stir to combine. Bring to the boil and simmer uncovered for 1 hour or until the sauce has thickened and the meat is tender. Season with salt and pepper. To serve, place the kangaroo in the centre of each serving plate and spoon the bolognese sauce over the top. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and garnish with parsley. Serve with pasta or rice and a green salad.

Combine celery, mayonnaise and pistachios. Spread on bread. Top with cooked chicken and sprinkle with coriander. Cut sandwich in half on diagonal. Melt butter in pan. Brown butter on both sides of sandwich.

Preheat oven to 400f. Line a baking dish with foil with a slight overhang around edge. Mix flour and butter together until crumbly. Add wine and stir until combined. Place fish in dish, skin side up, and pour butter mixture over. Bake at 400f for 8 minutes. Remove from oven, garnish with almonds and top with lemon slices. Serve with lemon juice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease an 8x8-inch baking pan with butter. Slice bananas in half and arrange them cut side down in pan. Bake until tender and golden. Remove from oven and let cool. Unroll spring roll wrappers and lay them flat on work surface. Melt chocolate over double boiler or in microwave. Spread 1 tablespoon melted chocolate on each spring roll wrapper. Top with a banana half. Roll up spring roll. Place on a baking sheet. Repeat with remaining wrappers and bananas. Melt remaining chocolate. Drizzle over spring rolls.

Melt margarine in a large saucepan. Add the flour and cook over low heat for about 2 minutes. Add the onion and cook until it softens. Add the chicken broth. Cook for a few minutes and then add the milk. Bring to a boil and add the broccoli. Stir in the celery and cheese. Cook until the broccoli is done. Season with salt and white pepper. Serve with crackers.

In a large pot over medium heat melt butter and add onion, carrot and mushrooms. Saute until tender about 10 minutes. Add broth and thyme and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add potatoes and simmer for about 10 minutes more or until potatoes are tender and broth is reduced by half. Add turkey and season with salt and pepper. Puree with immersion handheld blender until smooth and return to pot. Heat through and serve.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the cabbage, garlic, wine vinegar, and 1/3 cup of the reserved cooking liquid to the skilletstir to combine. Season with salt to taste and cook for about 5 minutes or until the cabbage is tender, stirring often. Serve with the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter on top.

Heat oil in a large soup pot over medium heat. Add garlic and onion and saute until tender, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes, chicken broth and water. Bring mixture to a boil and reduce heat to medium-low. Add basil, pepper and rice and simmer until rice is tender about 30 minutes. Add zucchini and cook until tender, about 10 minutes longer. Serve hot. Garnish with parmesan cheese if desired.

Place broccoli in a 13 x 9 baking dish. In a large bowl beat cream of celery soup and milk until blended. Add egg. Stir in mayonnaise. Sprinkle with horseradish and blend well. Spread over broccoli. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake until golden and bubbly. Mix cheese cracker crumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle over casserole. Bake for 2 minutes longer.

Slice bacon into small pieces. In a saucepan on low, melt bacon grease. Add flour and stir. Add milk and continue stirring till smooth. Add swiss cheese. Add garlic powder. Add salt and pepper. Add breaded chicken patties. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove chicken patties. Pour sauce on top of chicken patty. Serve.

In a large mixing bowl combine the potatoes and flour. Add olive oil and mix until potatoes are lightly coated. Add seasoning and mix well. Roll potato mixture into small balls and place on a baking sheet that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with sauce of your choice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare pie crust. Press crust into a greased 9-inch pie pan. Set aside. In a medium bowl, combine chicken, ham, swiss cheese and eggs. Stir in milk and Bisquick. Spoon into crust. Bake in oven for 45 minutes or until center is set. Serve warm.

Brown ground beef and drain. Stir in barbecue sauce and tomato sauce. Cook on low until heated through. Pour over macaroni and cheese and stir well. Sprinkle with chopped tomatoes and shredded lettuce.

Heat oil in wok or large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add ginger and garlicstir-fry 30 seconds. Add chops and stir-fry 2 minutes per side or until done to your liking. Add scallions and saucestir-fry 1 minute. Serve over rice.

Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add garlic and ginger and stir-fry 10 seconds. Add scallops. Sprinkle with soy sauce. Stir-fry until just opaque in center. Add snow peas. Stir-fry until just crisp-tender. Add broth and bring to a boil. Cook 1 minute or until liquid is almost evaporated. Stir in green onions. Remove from heat. Dissolve cornstarch in a small amount of water. Stir into scallop mixture. Cook until thickened. Add eggs and cook just until set. Serve over rice.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, saute bell pepper, corn and red pepper in a little canola oil until tender. Add green onion and yellow squash and zucchini. Cook until tender. In a bowl, beat egg substitute, egg whites and mustard. Add cheese. Spread vegetables and cheese mixture over bottom of skillet. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. In a small bowl, beat egg. Add light cream and vanilla. Stir into flour mixture. Divide batter evenly among 4 greased muffin cups. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle the top of each cupcake with 1/2 teaspoon each of marshmallow crme and ice cream. Return to oven and bake for 3 - 5 minutes more or until topping is melted. Cool 1 minute in pan. Remove from pan and cool completely.

Crumble bacon and saute with onion and celery until bacon is crisp and onions are soft and clear. Add spinach and flour and saute until all liquid is evaporated. Add milk and stir until thick and smooth. Add eggs and mix well. Pour into greased casserole dish. Sprinkle cracker crumbs over top and dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until puffed and crusty on top and golden on the bottom. Serves 4-6 people.
Lightly toast bagel. Spread each half with egg mixture. Arrange avocado, tomatoes, and onions on each half. Top with cheese. Sprinkle with sprouts. Top with bacon and serve.
Mix the rest of the ingredients together in a bowl and refrigerate for 1 hour before using. Rub the turkey breast tenderloins with the marinade and broil 3 minutes per side for medium well.

Cook the noodles in boiling water until tender but not mushy. Melt the butter in a saucepan. Blend in the flour and cook over moderate heat for two minutes. Remove from heat and gradually stir in the milk and seasonings. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Add the noodles and the roquefort cheese, stirring until the cheese is melted and the pasta is well coated with sauce. Makes about 4 servings.

In a skillet, saute the ground beef, onions and garlic until beef is browned. Drain off excess grease. Stir in the mushrooms and soup. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the Miracle Whip. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve over hot noodles or mashed potatoes.
Mix together dressing, oil, mustard and garlic. Place chicken on barbecue. Brush both sides with dressing. Cook for 5 minutes on each side.
Bring the corn to a boil in a large pot. Add the cream cheese and heavy cream and whisk together. Add the butter and Splenda and whisk together. Remove from heat and let cool. Add pepper to taste.

In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and saltset aside. In a large bowl, beat eggs and sugar until blended. Beat in the butter and vanilla. Alternately add the flour mixture and the yogurt to the egg mixture. Beat just until blended. Stir in the buttermilk. Fold in the strawberries. Heat a lightly greased griddle or large frying pan over medium-high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake. Brown on each side and serve warm. Makes approximately 12 pancakes.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut cinnamon rolls lengthwise into 1 inch strips. Spread strips in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. In a small bowl, combine sugar and cornstarch. Add water. Bring to a boil. Cook, stirring frequently, until thickened. Add butter. Add apples. Cook for 5 to 10 minutes. Spoon filling over cinnamon strips. Sprinkle with raisins and nuts. Bake for 5 minutes more. Cool. Cut into wedges to serve. Serves 4.

In large bowl beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in flour and salt. Shape into a ball and wrap in wax paper and refridgerate overnight or until dough is easy to handle. Roll dough out on a lightly floured surface into a circle about 1/4 of an inch thick. Cut into rounds with a biscuit cutter and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 325 for about 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks and spread with preserves. Roll up as tightly as possible and wrap tightly in wax paper. Place in ziploc bag and refridgerate until ready to serve. Yields about 3 dozen cookies.

In a large bowl, combine cauliflower, bacon, sugar, mayonnaise, onion, and 1/4 cup of the Parmesan cheese. Spread into a 13-by-9-inch glass baking dish. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. In a small bowl, combine the lettuce with the remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan. Spread over the cauliflower mixture. Refrigerate, covered, at least 1 hour before serving.

Preheat broiler. Sprinkle steaks with salt and fresh ground pepper. Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a heavy skillet over medium-low heat. Add shallots and saute until translucent. Add the wine and vinegar and let the mixture reduce by half. Whisk in the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and the worcestershire sauce. Taste and adjust for seasoning. Turn the broiler on high. Melt the remaining butter in the skillet over medium-low heat. Place the steaks in the pan and cook until the shallots are browned on the bottom. Flip and cook for 1 minute on the other side. Transfer the steaks to a broiler pan. Broil until cooked to your desired doneness. Remove from broiler and sprinkle with parsley. Serve with the shallot butter.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Place the chops in a dish. In a small bowl combine the garlic, thyme, and rosemarymince the mixture well. Sprinkle the herb mixture over the chops. Sprinkle lightly with kosher salt. Add the olive oil and rub the chops with the herbs and salt. Roast the lamb chops 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and let rest 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Steam sweet potatoes in large pot of boiling water until tender when poked with fork (about 20 minutes). Drain well. Add broccoli florets in a separate steamer basket in same pot, cover, steam until crisp-tender (10-15 minutes). Drain well. In a large bowl, combine sweet potatoes and broccoli. In a small bowl, combine chickpeas, lemon juice, curry powder, mustard, honey, salt, pepper and vinegarset aside. In a small saucepan over low heat, melt butterstir in flour until blended. Add milkcook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Add sweet potato mixturetoss until well coated. Add chickpea mixturetoss until blended. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 6-8 as a side dish or salad.

Mix baking mix and sugar together well. Add dried apricot and stir well. Add whipping cream and egg and stir well. Add milk and stir well. Divide dough into 8 equal balls and place balls 2 inches apart on greased cookie sheets. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.

In a pan combine flour, sugar and powdered milk. Put margarine and add water. Stir until well blended. Cook for about a minute. Cool. Form into round or square shapes and roll in powdered milk. Store in airtight container.

Grind chili, gingerroot, and shrimp paste into a paste. Heat 2 tbsp vegetable oil in wok over medium-high heat. Add ground paste. Cook stirring constantly until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add onion and continue stirring until onions turn transparent, about 5 minutes. Add brown sugar and continue stirring until sugar dissolves, about 2 minutes. Add 2 cups water, then beef. Cook until meat is tender. Add green beans. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with steamed rice.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Pour batter into two greased and floured loaf pans. Bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees or until golden brown.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add diced onion and saute until tender. Add water and bring to a boil. Add potatoes and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes. Add salmon and simmer for an additional 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in evaporated milk and diced corn. Stir in dill weed, lemon pepper seasoning and salt. Heat through. Serve immediately. Yields 5 servings.

In a food processor, combine almond meal, cocoa powder, salt and agave. Pulse until almonds are finely ground. Add water and process until a ball forms. Press into a 10x15 inch baking dish. Bake 10 minutes. Cool. In a small bowl, combine cocoa nibs and 2 tablespoons agave. Spoon over cooled brownies. Sprinkle with sea salt. Refrigerate 3 hours before cutting into bars.

Cook pasta according to package directionsdrain. Meanwhile heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add meatcook and crumble until no longer pinkdrain. Add tomatoescook until heated through stirring frequently. Add baby spinachcover and cook until wilted stirring occasionally. Remove from heatstir in olives and feta cheeseset aside. To assemble toss pasta with sauce. Serve warm sprinkle with parsley if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Melt butter over medium heat in a fry pan. Add mustard, worcestershire sauce and horseradish sauce and whisk until well blended. Add corn on the cob to the pan. Stir to coat. Cover pan and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Turn corn to coat both sides. Cook uncovered for an additional 10 minutes. Serve hot or cold. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl, toss asparagus with onions and mushrooms. Add oil to a shallow baking dish. Arrange asparagus mixture on top of oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with garlic powder and parmesan cheese. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the creamed corn, whole kernel corn, and sour cream and set aside. In a medium bowl, beat the eggs until well combined and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the margarine and cornbread mix and stir until well blended. Press the mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking dish and bake until set, about 20 minutes. Remove from oven and top with the corn mixture. Sprinkle with the paprika and return to the oven. Bake until set and lightly browned, about 25 minutes.

Combine banana and yogurt and stir together to make a smooth puree. In a small bowl beat egg with fork until light and foamy. Add to banana puree and stir well. In a small skillet heat maple syrup and butter until hot and bubbly. Pour banana mixture into skillet and cook on medium low heat until slightly thickened, about 4-5 minutes. Turn onto a plate and roll up. Sprinkle with chopped walnuts and serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Brown the beef in the oil in a large skillet. Drain the fat. Add the onion and cook until tender. Stir in the ketchup, sugar, chili powder, garlic powder and hot red pepper flakes. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Spread the mixture on the hamburger buns. Place the buns in the oven and bake for 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Makes 6 sandwiches.

Pour boiling water over the strawberry gelatin in a bowl to make it dissolve completely. Cut angel food cake into cubes and pour in the strawberry gelatin mixture. Let sit for 15 minutes or longer. Stir in the vanilla ice cream and strawberries. Serve in a glass or bowl, or in a large scoop of angel food cake with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream.

Cook macaroni according to directions. Brown bacon in skillet. In a separate pan saute onion in butter until tender. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink. Drain pasta. In a large casserole dish, place half of pasta in bottom. Top with half of mushroom soup and half of chicken mixture. Repeat layers. In a bowl, mix sour cream and spinach until smooth. Spread over top of casserole. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 375 degrees for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 250f. Cut each plum tomato into 4 wedges and place in a single layer on a large cookie sheet. Drizzle with olive oil to coat lightly. Sprinkle with thyme leaves, coarse salt and pepper to taste. Roast for 2 hours or longer until tomatoes have shrunk and browned slightly. They will keep for several days when refrigerated or frozen for up to 6 months.

Brown chicken in a large skillet. Drain and set aside. In a 4-quart slow cooker, combine the onion, beans and corn. Stir in the tomatoes and green chilies. Add the tomato sauce and taco seasoning. Add the chicken and enough water to cover. Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours. Remove and shred chicken. Stir well. Serve with toppings and tortilla chips.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl combine the chickpeas and chorizo sausage. Add the onions and saute until chickpeas turn golden brown and sausage is cooked through. Add the red pepper and saute until pepper is slightly softened and the chickpeas and sausage are heated through. Add the chickpeas mixture to a casserole dish and cover with foil. Bake for about 20 minutes and then remove foil and bake another 5 to 10 minutes untill chickpeas are crispy and brown. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste and garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

Grate potatoes into a large bowl. Add egg, flour, allspice and salt. Stir to mix well. Place bacon pieces into a large skillet. Cook over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon to paper towels. Add onion to bacon drippings. Cook over low heat until brown. Stir onion into potato mixture. Divide mixture into 12 portions. On a lightly floured surface roll each portion into a thin rope about 12 inches long. Cut into 1/2-inch slices. Place onto lightly greased baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for about 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with bacon pieces. Serve warm.

Drain the beans and place in food processor. Add the onion, oats and spices. Process until smooth. Add the egg and liquid. Process just until smooth. Turn mixture into a bowl. Form into 4 patties. Brown the patties in a skillet over medium heat. Serve on a bun with your favorite toppings.
Mix together first 8 ingredients. Place in a 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Then cool in refrigerator.

In a large nonstick pan with a tight fitting lid add tomatoes and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and cover. Simmer for 15 minutes. Uncover and add the garlic and dill. Stir and cook for 1 minute. Add the shrimp and simmer 3 to 5 minutes or until the shrimp are cooked through. Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a separate large pot of boiling water according to the package directions. Drain well and add the pasta to the shrimp mixture. Stir in the kalamata olives. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a large serving bowl. Sprinkle with the feta cheese. Serve with extra feta cheese on the side.

Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the rosemary and cook, stirring frequently for one minute. Add the almonds and stir for one minute. Remove from the heat and add the salt and cayenne pepper. Pour onto a foil lined baking sheet. Cool for 15 minutes. Transfer to an air-tight container and store at room temperature.
Boil water and remove from heat. Add green tea bags and steep for 5 minutes. Remove bags and pour into cup. Add agave nectar and lime juice to taste. Garnish with fresh mint leaves and lime slices.

Cream together the butter, sugar and egg yolks. Add vanilla and cherry extracts, then the cocoa. Sift together the flour and baking soda and add to the creamed mixture. Mix well. Roll dough into 1-inch balls and place 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten each ball with a fork. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes. Let cool for a few minutes before removing from the cookie sheet.

Combine the manioc starch and water in a small saucepan. Stir over medium heat until it thickens like gravy. Add the oil and stir to melt the oil. Remove from heat and add the milk. Stir and cool the mixture. Beat the eggs together until frothy and add to the cooled milk mixture. Add the parmesan and cheddar cheeses. Stir the mixture until blended. Pour into muffin tins and bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until the bread is lightly browned. Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes before serving. Serve hot with salsa. The recipe makes 6 small muffins. Variations: use shredded cheddar or mozzarella. Use more eggs for a higher protein content. Use 2 percent milk for less fat and calories. You may also bake the bread in mini muffin tins.

Cut chicken breasts in half lengthwise. Place in a large ziploc bag with olive oil. Close bag and shake until chicken is coated. Set aside. Heat a medium pot over medium high heat. Add chicken broth, water, penne pasta and Italian seasoning. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 8 minutes. Add chicken breasts to the pot and cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center. Stir in the corn and diced tomatoes with garlic and olive oil. Cook for another minute or so. Remove from heat, add the cooked great northern beans, stir to combine, serve immediately.

Rub each flank steak with a little salt and pepper and then place in a plastic baggie with the remaining ingredients and shake well to coat the steak all over. Marinate at least an hour or overnight. Grill steaks to your liking.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl combine wheat bran, soy flour, Splenda, baking powder, eggs, cream and banana extract. Stir in macadamia nuts. Spoon batter into greased muffin cups. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Makes 24 muffins.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with foil. Peel potatoes and cut into 1-inch dice. In a medium saucepan, bring half-and-half and orange juice to a boil. Add sweet potatoes and reduce heat to medium-low. Cover pan and simmer until potatoes are tender, 5 minutes. Stir in honey, half-and-half mixture, orange zest, coriander, ginger and salt. Transfer potatoes to prepared baking sheet. Bake until potatoes are browned on one side and potato mixture is thickened, about 15 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Cook pasta according to directions. In a large bowl add the pasta to the chicken. Add the frozen peas and carrots. In a large skillet over medium-low heat, heat the oil. Add the garlic, red pepper flakes and dried basil leaves. Cook 1 minute. Pour the mixture over the pasta. Toss together. Pour into a 9x13x2 inch pan. Bake for 20 minutes.

In a small bowl, combine all seasonings. In a wok or large skillet, stir-fry shallots in oil for about 30 seconds. Add garlic and stir-fry for another minute. Add asparagus. Stir-fry over high heat for 1-2 minutes or until asparagus is crisp-tender. Add broth and seasonings. Stir to blend. Cook for another minute or until seasonings are blended. Serve immediately.

Preheat a grill to medium-high. Toss asparagus with the olive oil and 1 tsp of the salt in a medium bowl. Transfer to a baking sheet. Thread asparagus onto skewers. Brush the skewers with the remaining 1 tsp salt. Grill the asparagus for about 2 minutes per side or until the asparagus is slightly browned but still crisp. Serve sprinkled with lemon zest.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Cook the chicken and the onion in oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat until the chicken is no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook 30 seconds more. Add the lemon juice and cook 1 minute more. Add the tomatoes and the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the red pepper flakes and cook 1 minute more. Stir in the cilantro. Drain the pasta. Add the pasta to the skillet and toss. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serves 4.

Place mangoes in a large pot and cover with enough water to cover by several inches. Bring to a boil over high heat and boil for 5-7 minutes or until mangoes are soft when pierced with a knife. Drain and set aside to cool for a few minutes. Puree the mangoes in a food processor or blender and return mangoes to the pot. Add the lemon juice and zest and the ginger and red chile and stir well. Add the sugar and stir well until sugar is dissolved and the fruit is thick and jammy. Stir in the sultanas and balsamic vinegar and cook over medium heat until the preserves are thick and bubbling and the sultanas are plump. Store in a tightly sealed container in the refrigerator for up to one month. Makes about 2-1/2 cups.

Heat peanut oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add scallops in batches and cook until golden on each side about 1 minute per side. Remove scallops and set aside. Add shiitake mushrooms and baby bok choy and stir fry for 1 minute. Add bok choy stems and stir fry for 1 minute more. Add gingerroot and garlic and cook until fragrant about 30 seconds. Add scallops and stir fry until heated through about 1 minute more. Serve over rice with lime juice and drizzle with sesame oil.

Cut off the tops of the bread. Lay slices on top of each other. Put the top of the bread on top of the sandwich. Spread butter on the outside of the sandwich. Cook sandwiches on the grill until toasty. Put cheese on each side. Add chilies on top of cheese. Put sandwiches back on the grill until cheese is melted. Remove sandwiches from grill. Slice sandwiches and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Combine the cream cheese, garlic and herbs and spread over salmon fillets to coat. In a small bowl combine the balsamic vinaigrette and wine and pour over salmon fillets. Sprinkle pecans over salmon fillets and bake for 20 minutes or until salmon is flaky and done in the center. Serve with lemon wedges and chopped parsley.

Soak the tea in boiling water for 20 minutes, then remove the tea leaves with a strainer or tea ball. Add the other spices, cloves first, then the ginger and fennel seeds, peppercorns and cardamom. Bring to a boil again, then simmer for 5 minutes. Add the milk, honey and vanilla extract. Strain and serve.

Place apples in an ungreased shallow 2-quart baking pan. In small bowl, combine sugar and cream cheesemix well. Spoon over apples. Bake at 350f for 30 to 35 minutes or until apples are tender and topping is browned and bubbly. Cool for about 5 minutes before serving. To make caramel dip, combine all dip ingredients until well blended. Serve apples with caramel dip. Makes 2-3 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 f degrees. In a large bowl combine all the above ingredients and stir until well blended. Spread into a 1-1/2-quart casserole. Sprinkle the top of the dip with the paprika. Bake 20 minutes or until heated through. Serve with crackers or pita bread wedges. Yield: 2 quarts.

In a cocktail shaker or blender combine ice, blood orange juice, tequila, triple sec, kosher salt. Cover and shake or blend until frothy. Serve immediately in margarita glasses rimmed with kosher salt. Garnish with an orange wedge.

Brown the bacon in a large saucepan. Add celery and onions and cook until softened and bacon is crisp. Add flour and stir constantly for 2 minutes to form a roux. Gradually stir in clam juice until the mixture is smooth. Add half-and-half and bring to a boil. Add clams, white pepper and cooked clams. Cook until clams are heated through, about 2 minutes. Serve immediately with crackers.
Brown turkey in skillet. Drain. Add macaroni and cook until done. Drain. Add all remaining ingredients except pasta. Heat until warm. Mix pasta into sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cut butter into flour with pastry blender until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Stir in cheese. Pat mixture into 8-inch square. Bake until golden brown and crisp, about 20 minutes. Cool 1 minutecut into 64 squares. Dust with paprika.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Season the tenderloin on all sides with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with cornstarch and then toss the tenderloin to coat evenly. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add tenderloin and cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove tenderloin from skillet and set aside. Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter and remaining ingredients to skillet and cook for about 5 minutes or until tenderloin is cooked through and sauce is bubbly. Serve over mashed potatoes.

In large pot, combine tomatoes, broth, tomato paste and beef. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in onion and kidney beanscontinue cooking for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add cabbage, cover and cook 5 minutes longer. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Heat a non-stick pan and add a splash of oil. Add the garlic cloves and cook until they turn golden. Remove the garlic from the pan and set aside. Add the chicken and cook until browned. Add the herbs and the juice of 1/2 lemon. Season with salt and pepper and mix well. Add the garlic and remove from the heat. Place the mixture into the food processor. Add the breadcrumbs and pulse until combined. Take a small portion of the mixture and form into a ball. Dip in the remaining lemon juice and press into the Panko breadcrumbs to coat. Heat a non-stick pan and add a splash of oil. Add the chicken burgers and fry until golden on both sides. Serve with fresh herbs and a green salad.
Mix all ingredients together well, except celery and green pepper. Stir in celery and green pepper. Chill. Spread on bread and top with lettuce, if desired.

Wash cauliflower and cut into florets. Mix mayonnaise and mustard together. Put cauliflower in a shallow dish and pour mixture over it. Cover with cheddar cheese. Bake at 375 degrees f until cauliflower is tender and cheese is bubbly. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the squash and onion. Pour the soup, sour cream and cream of mushroom soup into the bowl and mix well. Add the carrots and stuffing mix, and stir until well combined. Spoon the mixture into a greased 2 quart casserole dish. In a small bowl, combine the butter and parsleysprinkle over the casserole. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven.
Brown ham in oil until crispy. Add onions, saute until soft. Add eggs, parmesan cheese and black pepper to taste. Cook until eggs are done to your liking. Serve with toast.

Blend corn syrup and cream cheese in medium bowl with mixer until well blended and fluffy. Stir in half the cocoa powder and sugar substituteblend well. Add remaining cocoa powder and sugar substituteblend until smooth. Fold in chocolate chips and vanilla. Spoon into pie crustcover with plastic wrap. Freeze until firm. Thaw in refrigerator overnight or until firm enough to cut into pieces with sharp knife. Serve with reduced-calorie whipped topping, if desired. Makes 10 servings.

Place sugar in bottom of slow cooker, add water. Place cinnamon sticks on top of sugar. Add cranberry juice. Stir in frozen orange juice concentrate. Stir well. Cover and cook on low for 2 to 3 hours. Add frozen orange juice concentrate & lemon juice. Stir well. Cook for another 2 hours. Serve hot.

Cook ground turkey with onion soup mix and chili powder until cooked through. Add drained kidney beans and black beans. Stir. Simmer for 20 minutes. Serve with shredded cheese and chopped lettuce and tomato.

Cook rice according to package directions. Cut chicken into cubes. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Cook broccoli according to package directions. In a 13x9 inch baking dish, layer half of the chicken, broccoli and rice. Top with 1 cup of the cheese. Repeat layers. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter and when melted add spinach. Cook for about 1 minute or until wilted. Remove spinach to a plate. In a 1-quart casserole dish or skillet melt oil. Add spinach and top evenly with cheese. Make wells in mixture. Break eggs into wells. Sprinkle lightly with sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Pour in cream. Bake until eggs are cooked to desired doneness. Serve immediately.

Cream together butter & brown sugar until well mixed. Add evaporated milk & vanilla. Beat until well blended & frosting is smooth. Add powdered sugar a little at a time until desired consistency is reached.

Place the sugar and cranberries in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring often. Boil until mixture is thick and jam like, about 30 minutes. Remove from heat and add the marshmallows and the apples. Pour into a 8x8 pan. Refrigerate until chilled. Drizzle with whipping cream and sprinkle with walnuts and green grapes.

Brown ground beef in a large skillet, drain and return to heat. Add tomato sauce, spices and hot sauce to taste. Cook 10 minutes more or until sauce thickens and is smooth and tasty. Serve in tortillas and top with cheese, lettuce and tomato.

Melt butter in skillet. Add worcestershire sauce and fresh lemon juice. Season with ground pepper and hot sauce. Add garlic cloves. Cook until shrimp are just pink. Serve over french bread with sliced lemon wedges on the side.

Melt the butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in the worcestershire and catsup and bring to a boil. Add the pecans and cook, stirring frequently and adjusting heat to maintain a rolling boil, until the nuts are lightly browned and coated with the liquid. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve hot.

Melt butter in large heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until translucent about 10 minutes. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon sea salt and cook until onions are golden brown. Stir in cider and beef stock and bring to a simmer. Add thyme and season with more salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cook until flavors meld. Ladle into bowls or mugs. Top each bowl or mug with one slice of baguette or cracker and top with cheese and mustard. Broil until cheese is melted and serve immediately.
Add water and tea leaves into a saucepan and boil. Turn off heat and add crushed ginger. Stir and leave for about 10 minutes. Add basil leaf and honey and stir. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Peel and cut the sweet potatoes into long thin strips. Spray a baking sheet with vegetable oil cooking spray. Toss the sweet potatoes with the oil, cumin, coriander and pepper until well coated. Spread the sweet potatoes out evenly on the baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until the sweet potato strips are crisp and browned. Serve as a snack or side dish.

Mix parsley, basil, garlic in a small bowl. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook shrimp in hot butter until pink. Turn and cook an additional 2 minutes or until shrimp turn opaque. Stir in parsley mixture. Serve with lemon wedges if desired.

Remove seeds from jalapeno pepper & mince in food processor. Add all other ingredients except cilantro & process until finely chopped. Taste & adjust seasoning if necessary. Serve in lettuce cups or with tortilla chips for dipping.

Heat the broth and the teriyaki mix in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the noodles and cook according to package directions. Add the beef roast and frozen carrots. Reduce the heat and simmer 30 minutes. Stir in the frozen broccoli florets. Remove from heat and stir in the sour cream. Season with the kosher salt and the red pepper flakes. Serve.

Cook rice in a saucepan of boiling water for 12 minutes or until tender. Drain. Cool. Beat together spinach, spring onions, dill, lemon juice and zest. Combine rice and spinach mixture. Season to taste. Makes 4 servings.

Place pie shells in 9-inch pie plates and press evenly up sides and over edges.In a large bowl combine strawberries, 1 cup margarita mix concentrate and 2 cups ice cubes. Stir well.In a small bowl combine cream cheese and remaining 1/2 cup margarita mix concentrate. Spread evenly into each pie shell. Spoon strawberry mixture over the top.Cover and freeze at least 6 hours. Garnish with whipped topping and remaining margarita mix concentrate.Slice and serve.

In a large pot, boil the lentils with water. Add the couscous. Stir in the olive oil. Simmer for about 20 minutes or until couscous is cooked through. Add the remaining ingredients. Simmer for another 20 minutes. Serve with a garnish of fresh parsley or cilantro.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 6-8 minutes or until al dentedrain pasta and run cold water over it to cool it down quickly. Drain well and set aside in a large mixing bowl. Cut cucumber into small pieces and add to bowladd red onion and peppers as welladd in Miracle Whip and Italian Dressing and stir welladd in grated cheese and stiradd in Italian seasoning and stir wellcover and refrigerate for at least one hour before serving

Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan. Add the garlic and sauté over low heat for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and sauté for 5 minutes until the mushrooms are soft. Add the wine and cook for a further 2 minutes. Add the parsley and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
In a bowl mix soy sauce, rice wine, garlic, lemongrass, cinnamon, chile and sugar. Whisk in peanut oil. Taste and adjust seasonings. Let sit at room temperature for a few hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter an 8x8-inch baking pan. In a medium skillet, brown sausage with celery, celery seed, onions, sage, marjoram, and pepper until sausage is browned. Drain sausage mixture. In another medium bowl, combine bread cubes with broth. In a third bowl, combine sausage mixture with bread cubes. Transfer mixture to prepared pan. Dot with butter. Bake 40 minutes. Serve warm. Serves 4-6.

Soak breadcrumbs in butter. In a heavy 9x12 inch baking dish (nonstick preferable) spread half the breadcrumb mixture. Sprinkle with lemon peel and cinnamon. Layer apples evenly over mixture. Sprinkle with remaining breadcrumb mixture and top with apricot jam. In a small bowl beat together the cream and vanilla. Pour over charlotte. Chill overnight. Just before serving sprinkle with rum.

Combine egg yolks, sugar, and vanilla extract in medium bowl. Combine cocoa powder in small bowl. Combine mascarpone cheese and frangelico in another small bowl. Place cocoa powder in medium bowl. Dip 6 ramekins into cocoa powder. Pour mascarpone cheese mixture evenly into cocoa powdered ramekins. Divide cream evenly among 6 ramekins. Bake puddings for 10 minutes. Top each pudding with hazelnuts. Serve warm.

Fill a saucepan with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and add eggs. Boil eggs for 15 minutes. Remove from water with slotted spoon and place in bowl with ice water to cool. Heat a skillet on medium-high heat and add 1 tbsp butter and eggs to the pan and cook for 3-5 minutes until light brown on bottom and white on top. Remove from heat and place on a plate to cool. Carefully remove egg from shell with spoon. Melt remaining butter in saucepan on low heat and add eggs and cook for another minute or so until whites are set and yolks are soft. Serve on toast or english muffin.
Mix all together. Serve on crackers with lettuce.

Place chicken in shallow dish, mix remaining ingredients and pour over the chicken. Cover and refrigerate at least 3 hours and up to 24 hours turning chicken every 1 to 2 hours. Grill or broil chicken 10-15 minutes or until tender, basting with any remaining marinade during the last 5 minutes of grilling/broiling time.

Roll out pastry dough until thin enough to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Cut out with a round cookie cutter or by hand, placing the dough in the pie plate and trimming the edges with a paring knife. In a medium bowl, toss together the apples with sugar, flour and cinnamon. Spread the apples evenly into the pie crust. Sprinkle with the chopped nuts if desired. Roll the dough scraps into balls and place evenly over the apples. Brush the dough with the melted butter. Bake 30-45 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream if desired.
Spread a small amount of marshmallow on the graham cracker and add the chocolate bar on top. Add a fresh raspberry. Roll up and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). In small bowl, combine 2/3 cup italian dressing and 1/3 cup lemon juice. In small saucepan over medium heat, bring 1/4 cup of the italian dressing mixture to boil. Remove from heat. Cut chicken into 1/2 inch thick slices. Divide the biscuits into 8 equal portions. Roll each portion in 1/4 cup of the italian dressing mixture. Arrange 3 biscuit pieces in each of 8 ungreased muffin cup. Top each biscuit piece with 1/2 teaspoon of the olives and 1/4 teaspoon of the artichoke hearts. Top each biscuit piece with 2 teaspoons of the chicken slices. Top each chicken slice with 1 teaspoon of the tomato and 2 teaspoons of the cheese. Top each biscuit piece with 1/3 tablespoon of the remaining italian dressing mixture. Sprinkle each biscuit piece with

Preheat oven to 450. Lightly spray a baking dish. Lay the chicken thighs in the pan. Add the butter. Add the parsley. Melt the butter. Sprinkle with the parsley. Cut a garlic clove into slivers. Sprinkle the chicken with the garlic slivers. Sprinkle with the paprika. Drizzle with the lemon juice. Add the wine. Toss to coat. Bake for about 20 minutes. Remove the chicken from the oven. Add the olive oil. Toss gently. Sprinkle the chicken with the onion powder. Bake for an additional 10 minutes. Remove from the oven. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line baking dish with tomatoes cut side up. Stuff each tomato with 1/3 of the stuffing mixture. Combine broccoli, crumbs, accent seasoning, salt and pepper until well mixed. Stuff each tomato with 1/3 of the broccoli mixture. Combine bacon, onions, butter and parsley in small skillet. Cook over medium heat until bacon is crisp. Stir into remaining broccoli mixture. Spoon mixture over stuffed tomatoes. Bake 20 minutes or until tomatoes are tender. Sprinkle each tomato with a little of the cheese mixture and bake 2 to 3 minutes more or until cheese is melted.

Mix the fish with the ketjap manis and sesame oil and add the garlic clove and seasoning. Prepare the spring roll wrappers by brushing the outside of the wrapper with the peanut oil and place it in the middle of a plate or board and place the filling in the middle of the wrapper and fold over the left and right side and roll. Slice them in 1/2 inch strips and serve with sambal or ketjap manis. Serve with sambal or ketjap manis.

Heat sugar, corn syrup and butter in microwave for 6 minutes. Stir constantly. Add nuts. Heat for another 4 minutes. Remove from microwave. Add vanilla and maple extract. Stir until the mixture is thick. Add baking soda. Mix well. Spread onto cookie sheet. Let cool until hardened. Break into pieces. Store in refrigerator.

In a saucepan, combine sauerkraut and bouillon cubes. Cook over medium heat until tender. Combine with spareribs and remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours. Serve with hot mashed potatoes.

Peel and grate fresh ginger. In a nonreactive pan, heat canola oil and cook chicken over medium heat for 3 minutes. Add onions and garliccook and stir for 2 minutes. Add soy sauce and vinegarcook and stir until chicken is no longer pink. Stir in ginger and water. Cover and simmer 3 minutes. Uncover and simmer 2 minutes. Stir in sugar and cook 1 minute. Sprinkle with scallions. Serve with white rice.

In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and bell pepper. Cook until the onions are translucent. Add the minced garlic. Cook for about a minute. Add the Rotel. Stir in the cooked pinto beans. Heat through. Stir in the rice. Add the chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. Cover the pot. Simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the lime juice. Taste for seasoning. Serve with grated cheddar cheese.

Prepare biscuits according to package directions. Place in a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour crushed pineapple over biscuits. Sprinkle with light brown sugar. Dot with cherries. Drizzle with butter. Bake at 350 f degrees for 25 minutes or until biscuits are lightly browned. Yield: 8 servings.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, combine butter and pecans. Cook, stirring frequently, until nuts are golden and butter is nutty brown in color, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a small bowl and let cool for about 5 minutes. Pat catfish fillets dry and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Coat fillets with flour. In the same skillet over medium-high heat, heat olive oil until shimmering. Add fillets to the pan and cook for 2 to 3 minutes per side until golden brown. Top each fillet with a few tablespoons pecan butter. Sprinkle with more salt and pepper and a pinch or two of cayenne pepper if desired. Serve with a wedge of lemon.

Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in a large pot or dutch oven. Add bacon and fry until crispy. Add in the onion and saute until translucent. Add in the clams and stir for 5-7 minutes or until they are all open. Drain the clams over a bowl and reserve the liquid. Add in the reserved clam juice. Add in the butter and the water. Bring to a simmer and add in the uncooked rice. Cook for another 10-15 minutes or until the rice is tender and the liquid has thickened slightly. Add in the peas and stir for another minute or until warmed through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with the bacon and parsley if desired.
Saute onion in butter and oil until browned. Add spices to taste. Add couscous to broth mixture and bring to a boil. Turn down to simmer, cover and cook until couscous is done.

In a large skillet heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic, broccoli florets, carrot, salt, pepper and cook 2 minutes or until crisp-tender, stirring occasionally. Add broth, pasta and peasbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 7 minutes or until pasta is tender, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving. Serves 4-6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt the butter and mix with the cornstarch to form a paste. In another bowl combine the cocoa and the remaining ingredients. Add the cocoa mixture to the melted butter mixture and whisk until smooth. Pour into pie shell and bake for 30 minutes or until knife inserted comes out clean. Allow to cool. Refrigerate overnight before serving.

Cream shortening and sugar together and add molasses and egg. Beat well. Sift together flour and soda and add to creamed mixture. Stir well and add cinnamon and spices. Chill for 2 hours or until easy to handle. Roll into 1-inch balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 6 minutes or until done. Cool on wire racks.

Melt margarine and add sugar substitute and vanilla. Stir in the water and the flour. Let cool. Take the mixture and roll it into 1 inch. Balls. Place onto wax paper and place in refrigerator for 30 minutes to firm up. In the meantime put the egg white into a bowl and add the peanuts. Roll the balls in the egg white and then roll them in the peanuts. Refrigerate and serve.

Poach the eggs in boiling water for 3 to 4 minutes, or until the whites are opaque and the yolks are still runny. Divide avocados among bread slices. Top each slice with a poached egg and a sprinkling of cheese. Drizzle with lemon juice and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Melt a pat of butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add bread to pan and cook until lightly browned. Serve open sandwiches with avocado toast.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Combine vegetables and soup and put into 9x13-inch baking dish. Layer with cooked chicken breasts and rolls. Beat egg and water together and brush over the rolls. Bake 25 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Serve immediately.

Cut the lemon in half and squeeze the juice over the fish. Cut the tuna in small pieces. Cut the hard boiled egg in small pieces. Mix all the other ingredients together and season with the parsley. Serve on a lettuce leaf.

Brown chicken in butter. Add vegetables. Add seasoning salt. Cook until vegetables are tender. Fold in tarragon. Spoon into 2 individual casserole dishes. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the tortillas in batches of 2, cook 30 seconds on each side or till lightly browned. Repeat with the remaining tortillas. Lay tortillas on a baking sheet. Top each tortilla with 1/4 of the chicken, 1/2 of the cheese, 1/4 of the mushrooms, 1/4 of the cheddar cheese, and 1/4 of the monterey jack cheese. Roll up tortillas tightly. Place the quesadillas on the baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes or till golden brown and cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Top with salsa and sour cream. Serve warm.

Mix mayonnaise and onion together until well blended. Rinse fillets and pat dry. Place fillets in shallow baking dish and spoon mayonnaise mixture evenly over each fillet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve immediately and enjoy the compliments!
Combine the jello with the boiling water and stir. Add the orange juice and stir. Add the vodka and triple sec. Chill for several hours. Serve in shot glasses.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter and add asparagus and ham. Cook for 3 minutes. Add milk and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. In a small bowl combine chives and cream cheese. Spread over warm pasta.

Cut potatoes in quarters and carrots in chunks. Peel onion and slice thinly. Peel and slice cabbage. Combine apple juice, brown sugar and mustard in slow cooker insert. Add potatoes, carrots, onion, cabbage and corned beef brisket. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or on high for 4 hours.

Place the rolled oats in a bowl and add the brown sugar and salt. Add the vanilla and mix well. Add the butter and mix until it is evenly distributed. Add the walnuts and mix well. Press the crust mixture onto an ungreased 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 8 minutes and then lower the temperature to 350 degrees F and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Soften cheese in a bowl. Beat together tuna and onion flakes until well blended. Beat in cheese, add egg yolks, beating well after each addition. Combine flour, baking powder, and spicesadd to tuna mixture. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks formfold into tuna mixture. Turn into a greased 1-1/2 quart casserole. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Serves 4.

Hard boil the egg for 15 minutes then cool it in cold water. Grate it to a bowl. Add the spinach to a bowl. Squeeze the garlic clove out onto the spinach then toss it in. Dress it up in the egg yolks, oil, vinegar, salt and pepper to taste. You can add any other ingredient you would like such as avocado or tomatoes or bacon or whatever your favorite salad topping is.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Season salmon fillets with salt and cracked black pepper. Place salmon fillets on baking sheet. Place baking sheet on the center oven rack. Cook for about 12 minutes or until salmon is opaque. Meanwhile, prepare salsa by cutting up the lime and ginger into small pieces. Add the lime zest and juice and the ginger zest to the lime juice. Add the olive oil to the mixture. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt. Remove salmon from oven when done. Top with the salsa. Serve immediately.

Combine flour and salt in large bowl. Add water gradually and beat until dough forms. Knead dough well. Wrap in waxed paper and refrigerate for 1 hour. Divide dough into 4 equal portions. Roll each portion into a rectangle about 12 inches by 6 inches. Combine oil and sesame seeds. Spread 1/3 of the mixture over each rectangle. Roll each rectangle into a cylinder shape and slice each cylinder into 12 slices. Arrange on lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes or until light brown. Makes 48.

Mix flour and mustard in a small bowl until well blended. Stir in milk until well combined. Bring to a boil over medium heat and boil for 1 minute while stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in butter. Combine ham and peas in a medium bowl and season with pepper. Spoon ham mixture over cooked noodles and pour mustard mixture over all. Bake at 350 for 20-30 minutes or until golden and bubbly.

Brown the ground beef with onion and green chilies. Add the cream of mushroom soup and enchilada sauce. Heat to boiling. Stir in milk and let boil for 1 minute. Serve with corn tortillas and cheese. Makes 4-6 enchiladas.

In a large bowl, mix sourdough starter and water. Stir in flour and sugar. Add shortening. Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth. Cover and let rest for 15 minutes. On a lightly floured surface roll out dough to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut dough with a 4-inch round cookie cutter and place on lightly greased baking sheets. Bake in a preheated oven at 375 for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Combine sugar and milk in a small saucepan and stir over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute or until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and pour onto hot sheepherder bread. Allow to cool. Makes about 30.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch pan. Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. In a separate bowl, combine the sugar and butter. Beat until creamy. Beat in the ricotta cheese and low fat milk. Beat in the eggs and vanilla until smooth. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated over for 35 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool for 10 minutes before frosting. To make the frosting, combine the frozen berries in a blender and puree until smooth. Pour into a bowl and stir in the confectioners' sugar and lemon juice. Frost the cake.

Mix soup, water, onion and seasoning in a bowl. Stir in rice and let stand for 5 minutes. Combine the rice mixture with the chicken, celery and carrots. Spread mixture evenly in a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350f for 45 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with green pepper and serve.

Preheat oven to 375. Trim brussels sprouts and remove any discolored or damaged leaves. Rinse sprouts and drain well in a colander. Place sprouts in a baking dish and coat with margarine. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until tender. Combine lemon juice and cashews in a small bowl. Toss sprouts with lemon mixture and cashews. Sprinkle with pepper before serving.

Heat the butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium-low heat. Add the steaks and cook 3 minutes on each side. Remove from pan and keep warm. Add the wine and salsa to the pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Serve over the steaks.

Preheat oven to 325f. In a shallow baking pan, combine wine, chicken pieces. Cover with foil. Bake for 1 hour. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook until golden. Stir in parsley. Remove chicken from the oven. Add chicken to the skillet. Cook for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve over rice or noodles.

Cook beef in large skillet. Drain fat. Add water and cook until tender. Drain beef. Combine beef, onions and potatoes. Mix well. In a small saucepan combine soup and water. Cook until hot. Pour over meat mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 more minutes.

Mix sugar, honey, butter and hot water in a saucepan. Add the rum flavoring. Stir until the brown sugar is melted and the mixture is smooth. Turn the heat to high until the sauce boils for 1 minute. Turn off the heat. Add the rum.

In a dutch oven over medium heat, saute carrots and onion in butter until onion is translucent. Add broths and bring to a boil. Add remaining ingredients and simmer for 10 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Serve warm.

Heat butter in a heavy pan over medium heat. Add green onions, mushrooms, red pepper and garlic and saute until onions are tender about 3 minutes. Add spinach and basil stirring until wilted and cooked down. Beat eggs in a bowl with ricotta cheese. Add parmesan cheese salt and pepper. Pour egg mixture into pan and stir together until eggs are cooked but still runny. Cook on low heat for another 2 minutes stirring constantly until eggs are set. Top with more parmesan cheese and serve warm.

Pare and halve peaches. Combine sugar, sauternes wine and orange liqueur in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add peaches to saucepan and simmer over medium-low heat for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Arrange peaches in a serving bowl or on individual plates. Serve at once.

Wrap tortillas around marshmallows and miniature chocolate chips. Dip the marshmallow side in the peanut butter and roll in crushed cereal. Wrap in aluminum foil and place in a preheated 400 degree oven for 5-10 minutes. Carefully open and eat.

Sift together flour and powdered sugar. Cut butter into flour mixture until crumbly. Gradually add milk and egg yolk and mix until dough forms a ball. Refrigerate dough for 30 minutes or until cold. Roll out dough on floured surface to 1/8-inch thickness. Cut into 3-inch circles with a biscuit cutter or a glass with a straight edge. Heat oil to 350 degrees f. Fry one or two circles at a time until golden brown. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve immediately.

In a large mixing bowl combine graham cracker crumbs and powdered sugar. Melt butter. Add it to the graham cracker and powdered sugar mixture. Stir until well blended. Add peanut butter and milk chocolate chips. Stir until well combined. Press the peanut butter mixture into a greased 13x9 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for about 30 minutes or until the top is lightly browned. Let the bars cool completely. Melt the milk chocolate chips in the microwave and pour over the bars. Let the bars sit at room temperature for at least an hour before cutting.

Cook macaroni in boiling water. Drain. Blend cottage cheese with milk. Stir in egg, garlic and vegetable oil. Add macaroni and cracker crumbs. Season with salt. Bake in greased casserole dish at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until set.

Heat oil over medium high heat until it shimmers. Add onion and saut for 3-5 minutes until soft. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds more. Add flour and stir until it is well incorporated. Gradually add stock and whisk constantly until smooth. Add cumin, oregano, and cayenne. Cook until thickened.

In a medium bowl, stir together lemon juice, sugar and water until sugar dissolves. Add orange juice and green peppercorn and let stand 10 minutes. Remove and discard green peppercorn. Add strawberries and mint leaves and toss gently to coat berries. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving with half and half.
In a large saute pan, saute the garlic in the oil and butter until golden brown. Stir in the chili bean sauce and water. Bring to a boil. Add the prawns and boil until pink and done. Serve over rice.

Combine butter, sugar and corn syrup in a large saucepan over medium heat and stir until smooth and melted. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and almonds. Press mixture into an ungreased 9×5 inch loaf pan and bake for 30 minutes. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, chocolate chips and milk. Cook until sugar is dissolved and chocolate is melted and smooth. Pour over baked crust and spread evenly. Sprinkle with toasted almonds and bake for 5 minutes longer. Cool completely and cut into squares.

Cut off and discard stem ends of beans. Cut green beans into 1 1/2" pieces. In a 12" skillet, heat bacon and oil over low heat until bacon is crisp. Pour off all but 1 tablespoon of the bacon drippings. Add green beans to skillet and toss to coat. Cover and cook for 2 minutes.
