Uncover and continue to stir for 3 - 5 minutes longer or until tender crisp. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a blender or food processor, place 1 banana and 3 tablespoons dark rum. Blend on high speed until smooth. Add lemon juice and process until smooth. Pour into 8-ounce glass and top with fat-free whipped topping. Store in refrigerator. Makes 1 serving.

Heat oil and butter in skillet over medium-high heat until butter has melted. Add garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add shrimp and cook for about 4 minutes or until they turn pink, then stir in lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with lemon wedges on the side for added zest.
Combine all ingredients except parmesan cheese in food processor or blender. Blend until smooth. Toss pasta with pesto. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serves 4. Points-2.

Prepare the marinade by combining all the marinade ingredients in a blender or food processor and pulse until well blended. Rinse the chicken breasts under running cold water and pat dry with paper towel. Place the chicken breasts in the marinade and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Heat the grill to high heat. Remove the chicken breasts from the marinade and grill until just cooked through. Serve with the hot curds and coriander-mint sauce.

Peel and cut potatoes into thin sticks, about 1/2 inch thickness. Put into a large pot of boiling water and cook for about 10 minutes or until tender, yet not falling apart. Drain the potatoes and put into a large bowl or basket. Add about a tablespoon of oil and a good shake of sea salt and vinegar to the potatoes and mix well. Refrigerate until serving time. Heat up a large pot of oil over medium heat, about 1/2 inch high. Dunk each potato stick into the hot oil for about a minute or less, depending on how crispy you like your fries. Remove potato sticks and place on a paper towel lined plate or bowl to drain excess oil. Sprinkle with more sea salt and vinegar and serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine the mandarin oranges, pineapple tidbits, mini marshmallows & nuts. In a small bowl combine the sour cream, maraschino cherries & coconut. Spread half of the mixture in a 9 by 13-inch baking dish. Top with the remaining mixture. Chill.

Mix flour, sugar, and cocoa powder. Add baking soda and salt. Stir in the vegetable oil and water. Mix in the vanilla and beat until smooth. Pour into a greased and floured pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 for 45 minutes or until done. Frost with the frosting below.

Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the eggs and whisk until well combined. Add the flour and whisk until smooth. Add the salt. Add the parmesan. Turn down the heat to low and allow to simmer for about 15 minutes. Whisk occasionally. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onions and garlic and cook for about 10 minutes. Add the crushed tomatoes and simmer for about 20 minutes. Add the brown sugar and simmer for another 15 minutes. Add the fresh basil leaves and simmer for another 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Combine the fettuccine and sauce. Serve topped with parmesan cheese.

Bring water and juice to a boil. Stir in oatmeal and cook for five minutes over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Add nutmeg and stir. Add dates and banana and stir until they are incorporated into the oatmeal mixture. Let cook for one minute more and serve. Add a sprinkle of salt and enjoy this orange date banana oatmeal for breakfast or a snack!
Beat eggs with sugar. Add dry ingredients. Stir in corn, milk, butter & cream. Bake in greased pudding dish in 350f oven for 1 hour. Serves 8-10.

Combine all the ingredients in a blender and blend on high speed for about 1 minute. Taste and adjust the seasonings as you like. Use within 24 hours for best flavor. Use this marinade for any kind of meat and fish and it s also great for grilled vegetables. It s best used as a marinade or dressing and not as a cooking or dipping oil.

Combine tofu, mayonnaise, mustard, lemon juice and garlic in food processor and process until smooth. Add onion powder and process until mixed. Drain artichokes and spinach and squeeze out excess water. Add to food processor and mix until combined and smooth. Sprinkle with parmesan and paprika and serve with vegetables or crackers.

Combine milk and rice in a heavy saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Remove from heat and stir in sugar, egg yolks and vanilla extract. Return mixture to heat and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Add butter and stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and add Grand Marnier. Stir until mixed. Spoon into four serving dishes and chill in refrigerator 4 hours before serving. Garnish each serving with a dollop of whipped cream.

Place the baby spinach in a salad bowl with the lemon juice and garlic. Let it wilt and marinate for about 30 minutes. Drain the olives and add them with the salt and pepper. Mix well and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large skillet, saute the spinach with the sour cream until it begins to brown. Season with salt. Melt the butter in another skillet. Add the stuffing mix. Stir in the milk. Stir until the mixture is moistened. Remove from heat. Add the sour cream mixture to the stuffing mix. Add the cheese and stir until melted. Lay out the crescent rolls. Spoon about 1/4 cup stuffing mix down the center. Top with about 2 TBSP ham. Roll up the crescent rolls. Place in baking pan. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake for 15-18 minutes. Serves 4.

Cook quinoa in a large saucepan of boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat vegetable stock in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add cherry tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes. Add chickpeas and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Heat a char-grill pan to high. Slice halloumi into 8 equal rounds and place on hot grill for 2-3 minutes on each side, until golden. Top with rocket and a sprinkle of mint. To make dressing, whisk lemon and olive oil together. Pour dressing over salad.

Melt chocolate in microwave. In medium bowl, stir together sugar, oil and vanilla. Add eggs one at a time and beat until smooth. Add dry ingredients and mix well. Fold in melted chocolate. Shape into 1 inch balls. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until tops are dry to touch. Cool for 1 minute before removing from baking sheet to wire rack. Roll cookies in confectioners sugar. Let cool completely. Store in air tight container.

Melt butter in a heavy-bottom skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle with onion soup mix. Add pork and brown on all sides. Sprinkle with cumin. Pour in cranberry sauce and mustard. Add water just to cover roast and bring to a boil. Cover and cook over low heat about 2 hours or until meat is fork tender. Uncover and cook until liquid is thickened and reduced by half.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease bottom of 13-inch by 9-inch baking panset aside. In large bowl with mixer beat butter and sugar until creamy. Add vanillamix well. Add eggs one at a timemix well after each addition. Add flour, cocoa and baking sodamix well. Press mixture evenly into prepared baking panbake 20 to 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack, about 1 hourcut into 2-inch squares. Melt chocolate in top of double boiler over simmering water until melted and smoothset aside to cool slightly. Place candy in small resealable plastic bagseal bag by pressing out air and kneading bag to remove airmake sure all air is removed and seal bag. Working with one mint patty at a time, cut a 1-inch square out of center of each patty with sharp knifediscard centersplace centers in bag with melted chocolateseal bag

Heat a dutch oven over medium high heat. Add bacon and cook until crispy, about 4 minutes. Add shallots and cook until tender and translucent, about 4 minutes. Add rice and cook until lightly toasted, about 3 minutes. Add zucchini, chicken broth and thyme. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover. Simmer until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed. Stir in cheddar cheese. Serves 4.

Combine the plain flour with the salt and pepper to taste and dredge the steak on both sides. Heat the oil in skillet and saut the steak on both sides until cooked through. Remove steak and set aside. Saute the onions in the skillet until tender. Return the steak to the skillet and add the pizza sauce. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes. Top with cheese and return to the oven until cheese melts. Remove from oven and serve with crusty french bread.

Peel the shrimp. In a skillet heat the olive oil. When the oil is hot add the garlic. Saute the garlic for a minute. Add the shrimp to the skillet. Sprinkle the chili pepper flakes into the shrimp. Add the butter. Add the dijon mustard. Stir until the mustard is melted. Add the lemon juice. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Sprinkle the parmesan cheese on the shrimp. Sprinkle the parsley over the shrimp. Season with salt and black pepper.
In a bowl add prawns, oil, peppers and lemon. Cook 5 minutes on each side. Add parsley. Season with salt.

Wash and slice pears and raspberries in equal amounts. Put in crock pot and sprinkle with sugar. Add water to cover fruit by about 1 inch and stir to combine. Pour in pectin and stir well. Set crock pot on high heat and cook for 4 hours. Transfer to jars or store in refrigerator.

Peel, core, and slice the apples. Combine the apple slices with the sugar, lemon juice, cinnamon, and a pinch of coarse sea salt. Microwave the apples in a microwave-safe bowl for 5 minutes. Turn the apples over and microwave for another 4 minutes or until the apples are soft. Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

In a large bowl, combine the apple juice, mint leaves, applesauce, sugar, lemon juice and salt. Cover and refrigerate at least 8 hours or overnight. Pour into a nonaluminum bowl. With a fork or whisk, scrape the frozen mixture into a slushy consistency. Serve immediately or transfer to an airtight container. Can be prepared several hours ahead. Refreeze. Scrape into a slushy consistency just before serving.
Saute the veggies in oil. Add the ham steaks. Add apricot jam. Roll up the crescent rolls around the veggies and ham steaks. Bake for 15 minutes at 350f.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish with butter. Peel sweet potatoes and cut into 1/2" cubes. Place cubes into large pot of boiling water and cook for 12-15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Drain and set aside. In a medium bowl, combine the sugar and eggs. Stir in melted butter and vanilla extract. Beat until smooth and pour into the prepared baking dish. Stir in the cooked potatoes and pecans. Sprinkle with the brown sugar and cinnamon. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and the top is golden brown. Serve warm or cold with a dollop of vanilla ice cream on top.

Place the dried tomatoes in a heatproof bowl or a small saucepan. Add 1 cup of the boiling water. Let the tomatoes soak for 10 minutes. Drain the tomatoes and discard the soaking liquid. Process the tomatoes along with the remaining 1/4 cup water, garlic, 1/3 cup of the oil, the orange juice concentrate, apple cider vinegar, tamari, red chile powder, and black pepper until smooth. With the motor running, gradually pour in the remaining 1/3 cup of oil. Makes 1 cup.

Combine the water and honey in a small saucepan. Heat to 130 degrees F. or until the honey dissolves. Stir in the yeast. Let stand 5 minutes or until yeast is foamy. In a large bowl, combine the oats and 2 cups of the flour. Stir in the yeast mixture. Let stand 5 minutes. Add the butter and the salt. Gradually add the remaining flour, stirring until a soft dough forms. Turn onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth and elastic (about 10 minutes). Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease the top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume (about 1 hour). Punch dough down. Shape into 4 loaves. Place in 4 greased 9-in. x 5-in. loaf pans. Let rise until doubled (about 1 hour). Bake at 375 degrees F. for 35 minutes or until loaves are golden brown. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks

In large saucepan bring milk and sugar to a boil. Add eggs, salt, and vanilla. Stir until smooth. Reduce heat and cook until mixture thickens. Add rice and raisins. Cook two minutes longer. Pour into buttered baking dish. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Bake at 350 degrees until set. Cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Beat egg, butter and sugar together. Add buttermilk and almond extract. Slowly add flour mixture until blended. Spoon batter into paper-lined muffin cups. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan. Dust tops with powdered sugar.

Brush tilapia with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill tilapia for 10 minutes per side until fish is cooked through. In a medium pot of boiling water, blanch spinach for 1 minute. Drain and set aside. Heat pasta sauce in a small pan over medium heat. To assemble the dish, place spinach on a plate. Place a filet on top of spinach. Top the filet with a generous amount of pasta sauce and feta cheese. Serve with a lemon wedge.
Mix together poppy seed, sugar, honey and eggs. Beat in vanilla extract. Add flour, beat well. Spread in 9-inch pie crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Cool. Slice.

Boil potatoes in water until just tender (about 10 minutes). Drain and cool. Cut into wedges. In a medium bowl, mix together mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, cheese, and onion. Add potatoes and toss lightly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
Drain the beans. Add the oil and vinegar. Salt and pepper. Chill. To serve, scoop onto plate or shallow bowl and surround with assorted crudites. Serve with pita bread.

Lay out the bread slices on cookie sheets. Lay out the beef slices to cover the bread. Cover each slice with tomato soup, cheddar cheese soup and onion rings. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until brown on top. Cut each slice into 3-4 pieces to serve.

Melt butter, add milk and sugar. Cook 3 minutes stirring constantly. Add vanilla. Add oatmeal and stir. Spread evenly on wax paper to cool. When cool break into small pieces and add chocolate chips and peanut butter. Roll into balls. Store in plastic container.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place chicken in a shallow roasting pan. Combine broth, carrots, onion, sour cream, soup, and stuffing mix in a blenderprocess until smooth. Pour over chicken. Bake for 1 1/2 hours or until chicken is done. Remove from ovensprinkle with parsley. Let stand 10 minutes. Serve with rice or noodles.

Season pork chops with salt and pepper. Combine soup and water in a saucepan. Heat to boiling. Place pork chops in the saucepan. Cook uncovered over medium heat for 45 minutes or until chops are done. Pour off fat from the chops. Add cream cheese and stir until melted. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350F. Combine chicken, potatoes, butter, salt, pepper, garlic powder and chili powder in a large shallow baking pan or casserole dish. Cover tightly with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 1 1/2 hours or until chicken is tender and cooked through and potatoes are tender. Remove pan from the oven. Uncover and sprinkle with paprika. Let stand 5 minutes.

Hard boil eggs and then chop into small pieces. Chop chicken nuggets into very small pieces as well. Mix together chopped eggs and chicken nuggets in bowl with mayonnaise, salt, and black pepper to taste. Add sugar to taste. Serve on crackers, toast, or bread for lunch or snack.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Line baking sheet with parchment paper or wax paper. Whip egg whites with cream of tartar on medium speed until stiff peaks form. Gradually add salt and vanilla extract. Beat until stiff peaks form again. Add superfine sugar 1 tablespoon at a time. Scrape down sides of bowl. Beat until stiff peaks form again. Fold in red food coloring. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle each mound with mini chocolate chips. Bake 10-12 minutes or until chips are melted and cookies are set. Cool 3 minutes. Gently remove from pan and place on wire rack to cool.

Combine dressing and panko in a large resealable bag. Add salmon to bag and toss to coat. Pour oil to a depth of 1 inch into a large skillet or Dutch oven and heat over medium heat until hot. Add salmon and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Transfer to paper towel to drain. In a small bowl, stir together peanuts and coconut. Sprinkle over salmon.

Brown ground beef and drain off fat. Add vegetable oil to pan. Add onions, salt, pepper and garlic salt, cook for about 5 minutes until onion is translucent. Add tomato sauce, water and beef broth. Simmer for about 5 minutes. Add beef and mix well. Preheat oven to 350f. Take 1 can of rotel tomatoes, drain off excess water, put in blender with 1 can of tomato sauce. Blend until smooth, then pour into 1 1/2 quart casserole dish. Put half the meat on top of tomatoes and pour half of the beef broth over the top of the meat. Pour remaining meat on top of tomatoes, then pour remaining beef broth on top of meat. Top with shredded cheese. Bake for 30 minutes or until cheese is bubbly.

Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Combine brown sugar and vanilla extract. Add to egg whites and beat until well blended. Spread mixture on baking sheet. Bake at 250 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove and cool on wire rack. Place pecans on baking sheet and toast at 250 degrees for 20 minutes. Cool. Store nuts and candy in tightly covered containers. Makes 1 1/2 pounds.

In a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat, saute bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and crumbleset aside. In a small bowl, combine the mustard, barbecue sauce, and liquidset aside. In the same Dutch oven over medium-high heat, saute celery and onion until tender. Add black-eyed peas and cook until heated through. Stir in mustard mixture and bacon. Simmer, uncovered, over medium heat for 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in green pepper and potato chipssimmer until heated through. Makes 6 servings.

Mix together the first three ingredients in a large bowl. Divide and freeze in two freezer containers. In blender or food processor, puree bananas. Combine bananas and juice in small saucepancook over low heat until thickened. Combine juice mixture with frozen cream mixture in blender. Add sugar and ground nutmeg. Blend until smooth and well combined. Pour into two tall glasses and top each with whipped cream and chopped coconut.

Put instant coffee into a bowl. In the microwave for about 40 seconds to dissolve the coffee into the hot water. Put the eggs and sugar into a large bowl or the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. Beat the mixture until it is thick and pale yellow, about 3 minutes. Whisk in the melted chocolate until it is smoothly combined with the other ingredients. Fold the hot coffee into the mixture. Refrigerate for about one hour or until chilled. Serve.

Boil water with butter. Add plain flour to the boiling water. Add chicken stock and bring to boil. Add peas and cook until just tender. Drain and add to hot buttered lettuce leaves. Garnish with fresh mint. Serve hot or cold.

Peel beet and cut into chunks. In large pot add olive oil, onions and beets and saute until beets are soft about 20 minutes. Add leeks and garlic and saute about 5 minutes longer. Add fresh rosemary and bay leaves and balsamic vinegar and reduce heat to medium low and cook until liquid is reduced by half and sauce is thick, about 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from heat and remove bay leaves and rosemary sprigs and serve

Cook ground beef in a large skillet. Drain and return to skillet. Add the mushroom soup and stir until well blended. Add the potatoes and enough boiling water to cover the potatoes completely. Sprinkle with parsley and Romano cheese. Cover tightly and microwave on high for 10 minutes. Uncover and stir well. Continue to microwave at intervals of 3 minutes until potatoes are done to your liking. Stir in the vegetables and serve.

In a large bowl, stir together the butter and semolina flour. Add the egg and mix until incorporated. Add the all-purpose flour and salt. Beat until smooth. Beat in the nutmeg. Stir in the broth. Heat a large saute pan over medium heat. Add a small amount of the dumpling batter to the pan and fry until golden brown. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve in a bowl with the beef broth. Sprinkle with the chives.

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add potatoescook & stir 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Stir in sausage & cook & stir 3 minutes or until no longer pink. Stir in onion & cook & stir 2 minutes or until tender. Add eggscook & stir 2 minutes or until eggs begin to set. Stir in tomatoes & cook & stir 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir in hot sauce & cheesecook & stir 1 minute or until melted.

Place the bread pan into your bread machine and add all the ingredients. Set your bread machine on the Dough cycle. Once your dough is ready, remove it from the bread machine and let it rise on a lightly floured surface for about an hour. Once it has doubled in size, divide it into eight equal portions and roll each portion into a 6-inch-long cylinder. Heat a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Place one cylinder in the skillet and cook for three minutes on each side. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine honey and water in a large bowl. Cut each bacon slice in half. Wrap each piece of bacon around a carrot and place on a baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until bacon is crisp and carrots are tender. Drain on paper towels. Drizzle with honey and serve.
Cook ramen according to package directions. Drain. In a large bowl combine broccoli coleslaw mix, almonds and sunflower seeds. Add cooked ramen noodles, green onion and dressing. Toss lightly.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place brats on a baking sheet. Place a piece of cheese on each brat. In a small bowl combine beer and seasoning. Pour mixture over brats and cheese. Bake for 12 minutes. Remove from oven and top with onion. Place brats in hot dog buns and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter one side of each muffin. Place muffins buttered side down into muffin cups and toast in the preheated oven until light golden brown. Melt 1/2 teaspoon of butter in a small frying pan over medium heat. Add the egg and saute until it begins to set. Remove the muffins from the oven and divide the egg evenly between the four halves. Top the egg with swiss cheese and return to the oven. Bake until the cheese has melted and the egg is set. Serve immediately.

Bring water and milk to boiling in large saucepan. Gradually add grits. Reduce heat and cook grits 30 to 45 minutes or until thick and creamy stirring frequently. Stir in butter and cheese. Cook and stir 5 minutes more or until cheese is melted. Stir in hot pepper sauce if desired.

In a medium saucepan, combine water and bouillon cubes. Heat over medium heat until bouillon cubes are dissolved. Add fresh mushrooms and butter. Cook until mushrooms are tender and butter is melted. Add flour to mushroom mixture and cook over medium heat for 1 minute. Add wine. Bring to a boil and cook until mixture thickens and is slightly reduced. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Serve over pasta or other cooked grain.

Heat the water and sugar together until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture is warm. Combine the cocoa and salt and pour into the mixture and stir constantly until smooth. Add the vanilla and cool completely. Store in airtight container.

Prepare strawberry gelatin as directed on package. Cool completely, about 2 hours. Combine ice water and peppermint extractstir well. Pour strawberry gelatin into pink ice cream mixturestir until well blended. Spoon into 8 to 10 dessert dishescover and chill 1 hour or until firm. Garnish with chocolate sprinkles just before serving. Serves 8-10.

Brown the bacon in a skillet until crispy. Add raisins and cook until they plump up. Drain bacon on paper towel and crumble into smaller pieces. Cook tortellini according to package directions. Drain in colander and rinse with cold water until cool to touch. Combine the broccoli, tortellini, bacon, raisins, onion, mayonnaise and sugar in a large bowl. In another bowl whisk together vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper until the salt is dissolved. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently until well mixed. Serve salad at room temperature or chilled.

In a large pot, add onions and saute until tender. Add bacon and ham hock. Add onion powder, salt, sugar, garlic and cayenne pepper. Stir. Add green beans and cook for 10 minutes. Add potatoes and cook for another 20 minutes.

Mix together sausage, cracker crumbs and egg. Shape into a ring. Put apple slices around the ring, then add more sausage. Put milk over the top. Bake at 350 for one hour. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Cut okra lengthwise into halves or fourths and place in a large glass casserole. Toss with oil and sprinkle with seasonings. Cover and bake for about an hour or until tender. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs and bake for a few minutes more until crumbs are golden. Serve hot or cold.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat the pan with cooking spray. Add the zucchini, mushrooms, garlic cloves, onions, egg whites and salt. Cook until the vegetables are tender. Sprinkle the mixture evenly with the pepper, chili powder and cayenne pepper. Transfer the mixture to a 13 x 9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle the mixture evenly with the egg whites. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the egg whites are set. Sprinkle the frittata evenly with the garlic powder. Cool for 5 minutes. Cut into 12 pieces. Serve immediately.

Toss the onion and basil leaves together in a bowl. Slice the orange into 1/4-inch-thick slices, then cut each slice into 3 wedges. Toss the orange wedges with the onion-basil mixture, add the red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper, and toss to combine. This makes 4 servings as a side dish. I like to add feta cheese to this for lunch. I just sprinkle some feta cheese on the top and serve with crackers.

Beat together the eggs and yogurt. Heat a frying pan over medium heat and add the picante sauce to the pan. Swirl pan to coat bottom of pan with sauce. Pour egg mixture over sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Cook until eggs are done. Serve hot.

Bring water to boil in medium saucepan. Add celery and green onions. Cook for 5 minutes or until crisp tender. Draincool. In large bowl combine chicken with celery mixture. Add mayonnaise, stirring until blended. Cover and refrigerate for several hours. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serves 12.

Pat ribs dry and rub with salt and pepper. Heat a large heavy saute pan over high heat until very hot. Add ribs and sear for 2 minutes on each side. Remove ribs to a plate. Add olive oil and onions and saute until brown. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add wine and scrape up any brown bits from bottom of pan. Return ribs to pan and add tomatoes and rosemary. Add broth just to cover. Reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered for 2 hours. Remove ribs from sauce and place on a platter. Strain sauce to remove solids and skim fat. Add some of the reserved braising liquid and bring to a boil. Boil until sauce is thickened slightly. Pour sauce over ribs and serve.
Combine grapes and dressing in large bowltoss gently. Refrigerate 1 hour. Garnish with powdered sugar and cinnamon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix sugar, flour and cinnamon together. Sprinkle half the mixture on bottom of 9x13x2 inch baking dish. Arrange apple slices in a single layer over the top of the sugars. Beat together eggs, yogurt, vanilla, sugar and salt until well blended. Stir in cereal. Spread over apples. Sprinkle remaining cinnamon sugar over cereal mixture. Dot with butter pieces. Bake 30 minutes or until set. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped topping.

Spread a little mayonnaise on both sides of a sub bun. Sprinkle with a little cheddar cheese. Top with green olives. Place a slice of summer sausage over olives. Sprinkle with a little more cheese. Top with thinly-sliced roasted red pepper and chives. Sprinkle with a little garlic salt. Top with a little more cheese. Add another slice of summer sausage. Top with a little more cheese. Add a little more mayonnaise to hold sandwich together. Wrap sandwich in plastic wrap or wax paper. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add chicken thighs to pan and brown on both sides. Add onions and cook until softened but not brown, about 5 minutes. Add wine to pan and cook until liquid is reduced by half, about 5 minutes. Add cilantro and garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add lemon juice and water. Add salt and pepper. Cover pan with lid and simmer for 45 minutes or until chicken is tender and flavors have blended. Serve chicken thighs with sauce on top. Serve with rice and cornbread

Prepare green beans by cutting off ends and cutting into two-inch lengths. Place in a saucepan and add water until beans are just covered. Add salt and pepper. Cook until tender. In a skillet, saute boneless chicken breasts until done. Cut into strips and set aside. In a bowl, combine green beans and lemon juice and stir. Add cooked chicken and cheddar cheese and mix well. Serve over hot cooked rice and enjoy!

In a large pot add 1 Tbsp vegetable oil and heat over medium high heat until very hot (but not smoking). Carefully add the popcorn and cover the pot. Cook until popping slows down and shaking is no longer necessary. Remove from heat and let sit for 5 minutes with the lid on the pot. In a small bowl mix together the chili powder and the lime juice. Pour the chili powder mixture over the popcorn and toss until coated.

Brown meat in hot fat, season with salt and pepper. Remove from skillet and set aside. In skillet, saute onion, celery and bean sprouts. Add boiling water and soy sauce. Return meat to skillet and simmer until meat is tender and vegetables are cooked. Serve over hot rice.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallot and cook 1 minute or until softened. Add asparagus and cook until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Add butter and curry powder and cook until butter is melted and asparagus is coated with curry mixture, about 2 minutes more. Drizzle with lemon juice and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add rice, stir to combine. Add 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium. Cover skillet with a tight fitting lid. Simmer for 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Combine remaining 1/3 cup water and lemon rind in a small bowl. Stir until rind dissolves. Stir lemon mixture into rice. Add turmeric, salt, lemon juice and cilantro. Cook another 10 minutes or until flavors blend. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line baking sheet with foil. Cut parsnips lengthwise in half. Remove woody core with a spoon. Brush with olive oil and nut oil (a mix of both) and sprinkle with salt. Place cut side down on baking sheet. Roast 25 minutes or until tender. In a small bowl combine spices. In a small pan, heat nut oil until it just begins to smoke. Sprinkle spice blend over parsnips. Roast for 5 minutes more or until lightly browned. Serves 2.

Combine crabmeat, Miracle Whip, and pepper in a bowl. Spread about 1/3 cup of the mixture on each tortilla. Sprinkle each tortilla with about 1/4 cup of the cheese. Top each with about 1/4 cup of olives. Roll up tortillas tightly. Place tortillas seam side down in a baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut each quesadilla into four wedges. Serve with salsa if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Slice zucchini into long strips. Heat oil in skillet over med heat. Saute zucchini in oil until tender but still slightly firm. Add garlic, green onions and tomatoes. Salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Butter a 13x9x2 casserole pan. Arrange zucchini mixture in pan. Arrange scallops over zucchini. Top with fresh parmesan and freshly ground pepper. Bake 10 minutes at 375 or until scallops are cooked through.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onions and saute until soft and golden. Add the kale and garlic and saute until wilted. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and a pinch of salt and pepper. Top with almonds and serve.

Peel the potatoes and cut them into 1/4" thick slices. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, garlic, rosemary and 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper. In a large frying pan over medium-high heat, heat 1/2 inch of canola oil until very hot. (Use a candy thermometer to measure the temperature of the oil. It should be between 350-375 degrees.) Working in batches, fry the potatoes until golden and crisp, turning once, about 3 minutes. Transfer to paper towels to drain. Repeat with the remaining potatoes. Sprinkle the potatoes with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon black pepper and drizzle with the remaining 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil. Serve immediately. Serves 4-6.

In a medium bowl combine crabmeat with remaining ingredients. Spoon into the hollow of each tomato. Place on a shallow baking pan. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or until crab is heated through and tomatoes are softened. Serves 4.

Wipe ribs dry and pat dry with a kitchen paper towel. In a large bowl, combine the dark soy sauce, marmalade, garlic clove and onion. Place ribs in the bowl and turn to coat. Cover and marinate for 3 hours in the fridge. Preheat the oven to 150C/300F/Gas 2. Cover the ribs and bake for 1.5 - 2 hours. Mix the stock and vinegar in a bowl. Take the ribs out of the oven and brush with the stock mixture. Cover and return to the oven for a further 30 minutes. To serve, heat the ribs for 10 minutes in the oven to crisp the skin. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease a 9x9 baking dish. Mix cornmeal mix, skim milk, egg and oil. Spread evenly in baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Makes 12 servings.
In a blender or food processor combine salmon, cream cheese, liquid smoke, lemon juice and tabasco. Process until smooth. Fold in chopped parsley. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve with crackers.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add tomatoes, pesto sauce and sun-dried tomatoes. Cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add bacon and cook 1 minute or until bacon is crisp. Add pasta to skillet. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with cheese and pepper to taste.

Prepare crust and bake in a deep-dish pie plate according to package directions. Beat together the eggs and sweetened condensed milk until well blended. Add vanilla and stir well. Pour over hot baked crust and bake for 30-40 minutes at 350 degrees. Remove from oven and sprinkle with vanilla ice cream topping. Top with corn flakes and bake until golden brown. Let cool slightly before cutting and serving.

Bring water to boil in teapot. Add lemon and gingerroot slices. Steep about 5 minutes. Remove lemon and gingerroot slices. Pour tea into glasses, add ice cubes and peaches. Stir in sugar and mint leaves. Serve immediately.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl until smooth. Chill and serve with crackers.

Spray a 9X13 pan with cooking spray. In a mixing bowl combine cake mix, margarine and eggs. Stir to combine. Press mixture into the pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Cool. Beat together sweetened condensed milk, vanilla and toffee until smooth. Spread over cooled cake. Sprinkle with pecans. Refrigerate. Cut into 36 bars.

Pour water into bread machine pan. Add oil, lemon juice and brown sugar. Sprinkle in salt and bread flour. Add instant nonfat dry milk powder and active dry yeast. Select dough setting. Add dried apricot and ground nutmeg. Turn off machine and remove paddle. Prepare 2 loaf pans by spraying with cooking spray. Pour dough into pans. Let rise until doubled in volume. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes. Remove bread from pans and allow to cool on wire racks. Store in plastic bags.

Season chickens inside and out with curry powder and salt. Brown in oil. Drain. Add onion and cook until tender. Add garlic. Stir. Add sugar and cook until melted. Add chicken stock. Add chickens. Simmer for 30 minutes. Add water. Cook another 15 minutes. Stir. Serve over rice.

In large saut pan, melt butter and add shallots and garlic. Saut until shallots are clear and add chicken stock. Bring to boil and reduce by half. Add whipping cream and reduce again until sauce is thick. Add dry white wine and chili powder. Remove from heat and add brie and chili peppers. Serve with pasta.

Combine the onions and vinegars in a large bowl. Add the sugar and whisk in the oil. Add the beans and the remaining ingredients and toss to combine. Let stand at room temperature for 1 hour, or refrigerate overnight. Just before serving, heat the dressing over low heat in a small saucepan. Toss the beans in the warm dressing and serve.

Cut the challah in half lengthwise and set aside. Whisk eggs and milk together in a large bowl. Stir in the semisweet chocolate bars and peanut butter until smooth. Heat the skillet over medium-high heat. Melt the unsalted butter in the skillet. Dip each side of the challah into the egg mixture. Lay the challah into the skillet. Cook the sandwich until golden brown on the bottom and the bottom is lightly browned. Flip the sandwich and cook until the other side is golden brown. Sprinkle the powdered sugar on top and serve.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray 18 muffin cups or line with paper liners. In large bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, baking soda. In another bowl combine butter and buttermilk. Add to flour mixture. Beat with electric mixer until combined. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 18 biscuit muffins.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add onion, cabbage, green pepper and celery. Cook for 5 minutes or until the cabbage is just tender. Add tomatoes. Cook another 3 to 5 minutes or until the cabbage is tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to a greased shallow 2-quart baking dish. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Cover bottom of 9X13 casserole with hash brown patties. Sprinkle with onion and season with salt and pepper. Top with hamburger, onion slices and peas. Mix cream of mushroom soup with milk and pour over top of hamburger mixture. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with french-fried onions before serving.

Brown the beef with the onion and celery. Stir in diced tomatoes and 1/2 can water. Bring to a boil. Stir in 1/2 can pasta. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in onion soup mix. Cover and cook 5 more minutes. Sprinkle with cheese and serve.
Place tea bags into a large pitcher. Add boiling water. Let steep for 15 minutes. Add peaches and sugar. Let steep for 2 more minutes. Add cold water to fill. Serve over ice.
Dice avocado in small pieces. Add dressing. Add onion. Stir in feta cheese. Add tomatoes. Mix well. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil. Arrange salmon in single layer on prepared baking sheet. Whisk together oil, cider vinegar, whiskey, honey, lemon zest, salt and pepper in small bowl. Pour mixture over salmon fillets. Bake for 15 minutes or until fish is opaque and flakes easily with fork. Serve immediately.

Cut the baby marrows lengthwise into 1cm strips. In a large bowl, toss the marrow strips with the lemon juice, garlic cloves and olive oil. Season with salt and leave to marinate for 30 minutes. Serve drizzled with a little extra lemon juice, olive oil and a sprinkle of parsley.

Combine sugar and flour in a saucepan. Stir in water and butter and bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir in milk and vanilla extract and reduce heat to low and cook until thick and smooth, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon. Let cool. Beat eggs in a large bowl until foamy. Gradually add the cooled chocolate mixture and beat until smooth. Pour into pie shells and bake in a preheated oven at 400 degrees for about 25-30 minutes or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool.

Cook the pasta according to package directions. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Whisk in the heavy cream and bring to a boil. Stir in the cheese until melted and smooth. Toss the pasta with the sauce and top with additional parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the chicken breasts between 2 pieces of wax paper and pound flat with a meat mallet or rolling pin. Heat oil over medium heat in a large pot and add the chicken breasts. Cook for about 8-10 minutes or until no pink remains and then transfer the cooked chicken breasts to a plate. Pour off all but 2 tablespoons of the fat from the pot and then add the remaining ingredients except the sour cream and cheese. Bring mixture to a boil and simmer for 15-20 minutes until all the vegetables are tender. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream. Divide into bowls and top with cheese. Serves 4-6.

In a medium bowl, combine milk and cornstarch until well blended. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, honey and vinegarset aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken in a large mixing bowl. Pour soy sauce mixture over chicken and stir well. Place chicken in a shallow baking dish. Bake 1 hour. Combine cornstarch mixture with 1 cup cold water. Stir well until cornstarch is dissolved. Remove chicken from oven. Brush with the cornstarch mixture. Bake 10 minutes more or until chicken is browned and cooked through. Remove chicken from baking dish. Sprinkle with green onions. Drizzle with hot chili sauce. Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve.

Saute ground beef with onion and garlic in a medium skillet over medium heat until no pink remains in beef. Add crushed red pepper flakes and cook 1 minute. Drain beef mixture. Add parmesan cheese. Mix with marinara sauce. Simmer 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in sugar. Serve over cooked pasta. Makes 4 servings.

Dice the avocados and mix with the tomatoes and shrimp. Add the minced garlic and the chili sauce. Add the serrano pepper and the chopped onion and stir until well mixed. Add the lime juice and the cilantro. Add a little more lime juice and the cilantro if needed. Mix well and serve.

Prepare the brie by opening the wheel. Arrange the apple, pear, raisins, and nuts on the brie. Drizzle with apple juice. Cover the brie with foil. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees F. Remove the foil for the last 10 minutes of baking. Serve warm with crackers, baguette slices or bagels.

Cook bacon in skillet. Drain on paper towels. Place 1 piece of bacon in each piece of bread. Lay bacon flat. Top with cheese. Heat in microwave for 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Spread mayonaise over each sandwich. Top with onion, celery salt and red pepper. Cut in half. Makes 2 sandwiches.

In a large bowl mix together flour, sugar, baking soda and baking powder. In a separate bowl beat together egg and milk. Add egg mixture to the dry mixture and stir until well blended. Heat a lightly greased griddle or frying pan over medium heat. Using a 1/3 cup measure pour batter onto the griddle to make 4 inch rounds. Brown on each side and serve with butter and syrup.

Place beef in a large bowl. Add onion and mix with clean hands until well combined. Form into 8 patties. Preheat grill or broil in oven. Cook patties 5- 7 minutes on each side. Top with cheese and serve immediately.

Mix all ingredients together well in a medium bowl. Roll mixture into balls (about 1 inch). Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on baking sheet for a few minutes then transfer to a serving plate. Serve with ranch dressing or your favorite dip. Makes about 20 poppers balls.

In a 2-quart slow cooker, combine the onions and butter. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until the onions are golden, about 30 minutes. Add the broth, wine, sherry, and worcestershire sauceincrease heat to high and cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the romano cheese. Melt the cheese in the slow cooker over medium heat. Place the french bread in the slow cooker to absorb the broth. Serve in large bowls. Sprinkle with romano cheese. Serves 4.

Put 2 tea bags in a pitcher or a 4 cup measuring cup. Pour the boiling water over the tea bags and steep for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Add 8 cups cold water. Stir in sugar to taste. Serve over ice cubes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut the pork chops into 1 1/2 to 2-inch pieces. Heat butter and oil over medium heat. Add pork chops and brown on all sides. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir. Cover with foil. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 45 minutes. Uncover the last 15 minutes of baking time. Stir occasionally.

In a large bowl beat together butter, cream cheese, sugar and vanilla until fluffy. Beat in flour and egg. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Roll dough into 1 inch balls. On ungreased cookie sheets place balls 2 inches apart. Bake 8 minutes or until set. Cool for 2 minutes. Dip in melted chocolate. Place chocolate covered cookies in refrigerator until chocolate is set. Store cookies in an airtight container.

Place fillets on a broiler pan. Spread each fillet with a small amount of sour cream. Sprinkle with paprika. Place onion on top of fillets. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes or until fillets flake easily. Stir together lemon juice, hot sauce, parsley and parmesan cheese. Spoon over the fillets. Serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned. Add the soup, broth and corn. Bring to a boil and cook 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Place one tortilla on a work surface and spread with 1/4 cup of the filling. Roll up tightly and place, seam side down, in a 13-inch by 9-inch baking dish. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling. Top with the remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve with lettuce and tomato.

Line a baking pan with foil, making sure to fit it into your oven easily. Spray with cooking spray. Layer mashed potatoes over the foil, spreading evenly across the bottom of the pan. Add bacon slices on top of potatoes and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Crack eggs over bacon. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes, or until the eggs are cooked through. Serve warm with toast on the side if you like.

Cook according to package instructions. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine the dressing and cheese. Drain the pasta and toss with the dressing mixture. Serve on bed of salad greens with tomatoes and olives.

Roll out your frozen pizza crust to about 1/4 in thick. Combine your eggs and milk and brush all over your crust. Sprinkle your pepper on the crust and then layer your ham and cheeses. Bake in your pre-heated oven at 350 degrees until crust is cooked and cheese is melted. Serve.

Heat coconut oil in a casserole. Season fish with salt, pepper and curry powder. Fry fish until golden brown on both sides. Add chopped green pepper, chopped onion, curry powder, lime juice to taste. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve over white rice.

Place gelatin in small bowladd cold water. Stir 2 min or until completely dissolved. Stir in fat-free cottage cheesemix well. Stir in nonfat yogurt, artificial sweetener, coconut flavoring, and allspice until blended. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until slightly firm. Spoon into 12 dessert bowls. Top each serving with 1/4 cup mango and 1/4 cup banana. Refrigerate 30 minutes or until slightly firm. Garnish each serving with a mint sprig, if desired.

Grill the chicken breasts at 400 degrees. Grill 30 minutes for well done. While the chicken is grilling, combine the onion and olive oil in a small saucepan and heat. Add the apricot preserves and cook until the apricots are mushy. Add the ketchup, red wine vinegar and ground ginger. Stir and cook for 3 minutes. Serve with the grilled chicken breasts.

Combine egg and breadcrumbs. Dip steaks into egg mixture then bread crumbs. Brown steaks in oil about 1 minute per side. Place steaks on baking dish. Spoon sauce over steaks. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve over pasta.

In a small bowl, mix together the flour, sugar and salt. In a small saucepan, combine the milk and cream. Heat until very hot. Stir into the flour mixture. Beat on medium speed until smooth. Stir in the egg. Beat on medium speed for 30 seconds. Pour into ungreased 8x8x2-in. pan. Bake at 400f for 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cut into squares. Yield: 48 squares.
Mix all ingredients in microwaveable bowl and cook in microwave at high for 2 minutes stirring once half way through cooking time.

Mince garlic, then roast in olive oil for 30 minutes or until tender. Slice tomatoes very thin. Place garlic in a bowl with tomatoes. Add basil. Let mixture marinate in fridge for at least 1 hour. Spread mixture over 1 side of bread. Sprinkle with parmesan, romano and asiago. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Bake in toaster oven for 5 minutes or until bread is crispy.

Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add the pasta. Cook according to package directions. Add the asparagus to the pasta. Drain the pasta and asparagus. In a large bowl, combine the pasta and asparagus with the oil. Add the lemon juice, green onions, parsley, salt and pepper. Serve topped with the shrimp.

Cook wild rice according to package directions. When done, drain and cool. In a large bowl combine rice, carrots, green onions, olive oil and red wine vinegar. Mix well. Add raisins and pecans. Add salt to taste. Serve on a bed of lettuce with grilled chicken.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.Peel the pumpkin and cut it into small pieces. Roast in the oven on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper for about 30-40 minutes. After roasting the pumpkin, let it cool and then puree it. In a large pot of salted water, boil the potatoes until they are very soft. Drain them and then mash them. Add the pumpkin puree to the mashed potatoes and combine thoroughly. Add the flour and the eggs and work them in. Knead the mixture and let it rest for 10 minutes. Roll the mixture into little balls and then set them on a floured baking sheet. Boil a large pot of salted water. Boil the gnocchi in small batches until they rise to the top. Remove them with a slotted spoon and place them in the butter and sage mixture. Toss them to coat. Add salt and pepper.Serve in a shallow soup bowls.

In a saucepan over medium-low heat combine water, sugar & cocoa powder. Whisk to dissolve. Stir in nutmeg and cinnamon. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in milk. Add vanilla and heat over low heat. Pour into mugs and sprinkle with cinnamon. Top with whipped cream & a cinnamon stick.

In a small bowl, combine 2 teaspoons Louisiana hot sauce and 1/2 teaspoon water. Place chicken between 2 sheets of wax paperpound to 1/2-inch thickness with a meat mallet or rolling pin. In a large skillet cooked over medium heat, heat 1 teaspoon canola oil. Add chickencook 4 minutes on each side or until done. Cut into strips. Heat remaining teaspoon of canola oil in same skillet over medium heatadd remaining 1/2 teaspoon Louisiana hot sauce and 1/2 teaspoon water. Heat until hot. Place 1 lettuce leaf on each of 4 tortillastop each with 1/4 cup buffalo strips and 1 tablespoon ranch dressing and 1 tablespoon blue cheese crumbles. Roll up tortillas. Makes 4 wraps.

Heat oven to 200 degrees. In a crockpot combine the onion, peaches, golden raisins, brown sugar, ginger, mustard seeds, cinnamon stick and cloves. Stir in flour and stir well. Add vinegar. Cook on low for 8 hours. If the mixture gets too thick add more vinegar. Cool and refrigerate.

Melt butter and peanut butter together over low heat. Mix together the corn syrup, sugar, and salt. Add the peanut butter mixture to the corn syrup mixture and mix well. Add the vanilla and mix well. Fold in the cereal and the chips and mix well. Pour into buttered 9 X 13 pan and bake at 350 for about 20 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Let cool and cut into squares.

Combine milk and eggs in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture thickens and coats the back of the spoon. Pour into pie shell. Beat butter with honey and vanilla until smooth. Spread over custard. Combine coconut and flour. Sprinkle over butter mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool before serving.

Mix onion and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 15 minutes or until tender. Add garlic and ginger. Cook 3 minutes longer. Stir in cabbage and soy sauce. Cook 2 minutes longer or until cabbage is crisp tender. Remove from heat. Stir in sesame oil. Serve immediately.

Grease an 8 by 8 inch square baking pan with butterset aside. Combine maple syrup, sugar, pecans, butter and egg together. Then add flour, baking powder and saltmix until batter is smooth. Pour batter into prepared panbake until firm to the touch and golden brownabout 35 to 40 minutes. Cool completely in pan before cutting into squares. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve.
Cook bacon in pan until crisp and crumble into bowl. Add broccoli to bacon and cook until tender. Add green onions and nuts and toss lightly and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place chicken breast halves in shallow baking dish. Brush both sides of chicken with mustard. Sprinkle with curry powder. Brush chicken with honey. Bake uncovered for one hour or until done. Cool for several minutes before slicing.

Combine 1/4 cup broth, 2 cloves garlic (crushed), 2 tablespoons fresh basil (finely chopped), 1/3 cup parmesan cheese (grated), and 1/4 cup pine nuts (toasted) in processor. Blend until smooth. Serve sauce drizzled over chicken or poultry dishes. May store covered for up to a week in refrigerator. Makes about 2 cups sauce.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until golden brown. Add onion soup mix and broth. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Cook until orzo is tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in water. Add pasta and cook until orzo is tender and liquid is almost gone, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in peas and parmesan.

In a medium bowl combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. In a large bowl with an electric mixer beat butter and white sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and orange zest. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in cranberries and chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheets about 2 inches apart. Bake for about 8 to 9 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown at the edges. Cool on wire racks.

Dice the chicken breast into 1cm chunks. Heat the butter and oil in a large saucepan and add the chicken. Brown the chicken for about 3 minutes and add the chopped onion. Stir and cook for 1 more minute and then add the ras el hanout spice mix. Stir for another minute and add the rice. Stir and add the chicken stock cube and a cup of water. Season with the juice of the lemon and the chicken stock cube and bring to the boil. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes with the lid slightly ajar, then stir and add the apricots, chickpeas and chopped flat leaf parsley. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes more or until the rice is tender. Serve with pistachio nuts.

Mix vegetable oil with barbecue sauce. In a bowl, combine the pancake mix, cornmeal, sugar, water and vanilla. Stir just until the pancake mix disappears. Let the batter sit for about 20 minutes. Heat a deep-fryer or heavy-bottomed pan to 200 degrees. Slide hot dogs down the center of the wooden skewers. Dip the dogs in the pancake batter and fry them in the oil. Cook until golden brown and crispy. Dip in barbecue sauce.

Mix together sugar, flour and vanilla. Add in eggs one at a time. Then add in buttermilk. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes. Then lower temp to 350 degrees and bake for an additional 40 minutes. Let cool for 1 hour. Serve with whipped topping.

Combine all ingredients for marinade except pork tenderloin in a zip lock bag. Add pork tenderloin and marinate. Prepare barbecue. Grill pork for 6-8 minutes per side for medium. Transfer to a platter. Let stand 10 minutes. Slice thinly and serve.
Peel pineapple and mango. Cut into chunks or wedges. Combine all in a bowl and refrigerate overnight. Serve chilled.

In a large bowl, stir together flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda and salt. In another large bowl, beat egg whites until stiff. Fold egg whites into flour mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for about 10 minutes in a 375f oven. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Clean artichoke by removing excess tough leaves and rubbing remaining leaves with lemon. Rinse with cold water and drain. Heat olive oil in large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add onionssaute until golden brown. Add artichoke bottomcover and cook over medium-low heat for 10 minutes. Add chicken stockcover and cook 15 minutes more or until artichoke is tender. Season with salt & pepper. Puree soup with an immersion blender or regular blender. Stir in cream & return soup to medium-low heat. Cook until heated through. Divide pasta among 4 bowlstop with artichoke mixturesprinkle with hazelnuts and parsley. Garnish with fresh parsley.
In a small bowl, combine the radishes, olive, scallions, olive oil and vinegar. Season with the Dijon mustard, garlic salt and pepper. Chill for 1 hour. Serve on the lettuce leaves.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream sugar and butter together. Add eggs, mashed banana, and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt. Add to creamed mixture and mix until just blended. Stir in pecans and coconut. Pour into greased 9x5 loaf pan. Bake 1 hour, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
In a blender combine ice, rum, lime juice, lime zest and sugar. Blend until sugar is completely dissolved. Add club soda to blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into tall glasses. Serve.

Combine butter, sugar and egg in a large mixing bowl. Add the flour and baking soda and mix well. Add the oatmeal and stir with a fork until well blended. Roll dough into small balls about 1 inch diameter and place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for about 12 min or until lightly browned on the bottom. Store in an air-tight container or freeze for future use.

In a skillet saute meat cubes in oil until no longer pink. Remove meat from pan. Add onions to pan. Cook and stir until golden. Stir in sliced mushrooms. Cook and stir until tender. Drain fat from pan, add meat cubes. Cook 5 minutes over medium heat, stirring constantly. Pour in 1/2 cup cream of mushroom soupstirring well to blend. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in 1 can cream of mushroom soup, and garlic salt until heated through. Spoon over rice. Serve immediately.

Quarter and core the oranges. Slice into thin rounds with a very sharp knife. Place the onion and orange slices in a large bowl. Add the olive oil and lemon and orange juice and toss to coat. Add the mint and toss again. Season the salad with salt and pepper. Refrigerate for about an hour before serving. Garnish with black olives if desired.

In a large bowl, combine the pudding and milkbeat with a mixer on low speed until well blended. Beat on high speed for 2 minutes or until thick. Stir in the peanut butter and whipping cream. Spoon half of the filling into the crusts. Spread with whipped topping and top with remaining filling. Freeze for 1 to 2 hours or until firm. Remove from freezer 15 minutes before serving. Makes 2 pies.

In a saucepan over medium temperature, combine broth, avocados, garlic powder, lime juice, half-and-half, and salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for about 10 minutes until slightly thickened. Serve in a bowl, garnished with lime slice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 12 cup muffin pan with butter or nonstick cooking spray. Cut bread into quarters. Place one quarter in the bottom of each muffin cup. Top each piece of bread with 1/2 tsp vegemite and 1/2 tsp bacon. Sprinkle with 1 tsp mushrooms. Divide cheese among cups. Add 1/2 tsp to each. Beat cream with eggs, chives and pepper. Divide among cups. Bake for 15 minutes. Mini quiches will puff up slightly while cooking. Serve immediately. Makes 12 mini quiches. Serves 4.

Combine graham cracker crumbs and butter in medium bowl. Press crumb mixture onto bottom of 9 x 13-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake for 10 minutes. Combine sweetened condensed milk, chocolate chips, white chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, peanut butter chips and flaked coconutstir until well-blended. Spread over baked crust. Bake for 8 minutes or until bubbly. Cool completely on wire rack. Cut into bars.
Cook asparagus in boiling water until tender-crisp. Rinse under cold water and pat dry. Toss with honey and soy sauce. Chill. Just before serving, stir in vinegar. Top with nuts and pepper.

Wash and soak the cucumbers in a brine solution made with one quart of water, one quart of white vinegar and three tablespoons kosher salt for about two hours. Place the cucumbers in a nonreactive pot, add enough fresh, cold water to cover the cucumbers by two inches. Bring the water to a boil and remove the pot from the heat. Add the garlic cloves and dill to the pot. Place a plate on top of the cucumbers to keep them submerged in the brine. Let stand overnight in a cool place. The next day drain the cucumbers and place them in a large glass jar. Cover with brine solution. Add an additional garlic clove or two and two sprigs fresh dill to the jar. Seal the jar and let it stand at room temperature for four days. Store the pickles in a cool place. Serve after two weeks or refrigerate for up to a year.

Sprinkle cheese over top of bisquick mix. Stir together until cheese is evenly distributed. Slowly add milk 2 tablespoons at a time. Stir until soft dough forms. On lightly floured surface pat dough into 4 inch circles. Cut each circle into 8 wedges. Place on greased baking sheet. Bake at 425 degrees 10 to 12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9×13-inch baking pan. In a bowl, mix together brown sugar, flour, and butter. Stir in oats. Spread into baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool. Spread apple butter over the top. Bake for an additional 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into bars.

Season pork loin with salt and freshly ground black pepper. In a large saute pan over medium heat, add the olive oil and add the pork loin. Brown the pork loin. Turn the heat to low. Add the onions and garlic and saute for about 5 minutes. Add the apple cider and bring the liquid up to a boil. Add the sage and thyme. Reduce the heat and cover the pan. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add the apples and turn the pork loin over and cook for another 15 minutes. Add the water and cook for 15 minutes longer.
Cook pasta according to directions on package. Drain and place in large bowl. Add olive oil, lemon juice and basil. Stir to coat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve warm or cold.

In a saucepan combine water, soy sauce, sugar, red pepper paste, black pepper and red pepper flakes. Bring to a simmer. Add chicken wings and simmer for 20 minutes, turning once halfway through cooking. Meanwhile, in another saucepan saute the vegetables in olive oil until tender. When chicken is done, add vegetables and stir gently to combine. Serve over rice. Makes 4 servings.

Mix together the crushed pineapple and brown sugar. Place each biscuit on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a pre-heated oven at 350 degrees F for 12-15 minutes until biscuits are golden brown. Remove from oven and allow to cool for several minutes. Spread with butter and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar. Makes 6 servings.
In a bowl mix together coleslaw dressing, pickle juice, celery seed, and coleslaw mix. Cover and refrigerate. Serve over fried chicken or any sandwich.

Peel and cube potatoes and turnips. Add to boiling water and cook for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain well and return to pot. Melt butter in small skillet. Add cream and flour. Mix well and cook until thickened. Stir into potatoes and turnips. Add salt and pepper to taste. Bake for 20 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in saucepan. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add chicken broth and tomato juice. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in heavy whipping cream and basil. Cook until heated through. Stir in tortellini and serve.
Melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onions, salt & pepper. Cover & cook for about an hour or until the onions are dark & sweet. Remove from heat & stir in bourbon. Allow onions to cool.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Combine pumpkin seeds, cajun seasoning, paprika, salt, and worcestershire sauce in a large bowlstir in butter until mixture is evenly moistened. Spread onto a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes or so, until the seeds are crisp and toasted. Serve warm.

In a large bowl combine blueberry filling and walnuts. Set aside. In another large bowl combine sweet potatoes, brown sugar, and maraschino cherry. Add the mixture of blueberry and nuts and stir well. Pour into pie crust and bake at 375 for 45 minutes. Cool and refrigerate for several hours or overnight before slicing and serving.

In a heavy-duty plastic bag or in a large bowl, combine sugar, corn syrup and water and stir until dissolved. Add peppermint extract and stir until fragrant. Add food coloring and stir until well mixed. Knead dough for several minutes to blend and soften it. Line baking sheet with wax paper. Divide dough into 24 equal pieces and roll each piece into a 1/2-inch thick rope. Tie each rope in a knot to form a candy cane. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks or freeze for up to 3 months.

On a lightly floured surface roll out one of the pie crusts until 1/4 inch thick. Line a 9-inch pie plate with crust. Reserve remaining crust for top crust. In a large bowl combine eggs, ricotta, asiago, parmesan and seasoned bread crumbs. Add spinach. Mix until combined. Spoon filling into the pie crust. Sprinkle sun-dried tomatoes over top. Roll out remaining crust. Cut into 8 equal strips. Arrange strips over top of pie. Seal edges of top crust. Using a small sharp knife cut 8 slits into top crust to vent. Brush top of pie with beaten egg. Bake at 400 for 45-50 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cool 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine water and sugar in a small saucepan and stir over medium heat until the sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil. In a large bowl, combine the evaporated milk and applesauce. Add the boiling sugar syrup and stir to combine. Pour into a 9x13 pan and stir in the raisins and rum. Cover with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator overnight. The next day, puree the mixture in a food processor or blender until smooth. Stir in the honey and ginger. Transfer the sorbet to a freezer safe container and freeze until ready to serve. To serve, remove from freezer 15 minutes before serving to soften. Stir in the honey and ginger. Transfer the sorbet to a freezer safe container and freeze until ready to serve. To serve, remove from freezer 15 minutes before serving to soften. Stir in the honey and ginger. Transfer the sorbet to a freezer safe container and freeze until ready to serve. To serve, remove from freezer 15 minutes before serving to soften.

Stir together the starter, milk and honey. Add the flour, salt and rosemary. Knead the dough 10-15 minutes until smooth and elastic. Add the egg white and water. Knead for an additional 5-10 minutes. Place the dough ball in an oiled bowl, turn once to coat and cover. Let rise until doubled. Punch down and divide into 4 equal balls. Place balls onto a greased baking sheet. Cover and let rise until doubled. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and brush with the melted butter. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Bake for an additional 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

In large bowl stir together banana muffin mix, quick oats and mini chocolate chips. Stir in the mashed banana. In a small bowl stir together egg and milk. Add to muffin mixture. Stir until moistened. Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups three-fourths full. Bake at 375 for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.

In a small bowl mix together hoisin sauce, plum sauce, soy sauce and cornstarch. Mix well and set aside. Add chicken pieces to crock pot. Add hoisin mixture and stir. Add fresh garlic and lime juice. Cover and cook on low for 5 hours or on high for 3 hours. Before serving add salt and pepper to taste. Serve over hot rice.

Combine all the ingredients in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cover and cook until reduced by about one-third. Uncover, stir in the pineapple and cook until the mixture thickens to the consistency of a relish.

Drain imitation crabmeat and place in medium bowl. Add fat free cream cheese and mix together well. Add garlic cloves, garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste. Spread mixture into each mushroom cap. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Place mushrooms on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12 minutes or until topping is golden. Makes 24 servings.

Mix together kool-aid and 1 tablespoon of pectin in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly until thickened (about 1 minute). Remove from heat and stir in 1/4 cup of sugar and 2 cups of water. Skim off any foam, then ladle into hot sterilized jars, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Wipe rims of jars with a damp paper towel, then seal with hot lids. Process in a boiling water bath for 5 minutes. Remove jars from canner and set aside to cool. Makes 5-6 pints.

combine flour, salt, baking soda in a large bowl. Mix with a fork until well blended. Make a well in the center of the flour mixture add yogurt and water and mix just until moistened. turn onto a lightly floured surface knead lightly until the dough is smooth and elastic, about 8-10 turns. form into a round loaf place in a lightly oiled 9 inch pie plate. bake in the sun for approximately one hour or until the bottom of the bread is a deep golden brown and the crust is crisp.

Prepare quinoa according to package instructions (usually 1 cup quinoa to 2 cups liquid). Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add spinach and onion and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in feta cheese and serve warm.

Boil water in large pot or sauce pan. Cut tofu into cubes and place in boiling water. Cook about 3 minutes or until firm. Drain tofu in colander and place in bowl. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Bake in casserole dish at 350f degrees for about 15-20 minutes until heated through and cheese is golden brown on top. Serve with salad or broccoli.

Toast bread and set aside. In a large bowl combine eggs with salt and sugar. Add in nonfat milk and vanilla. In a smaller bowl combine brown sugar and cinnamon. Melt butter in saucepan. Add bread and mix with the brown sugar/cinnamon mixture. Pour into greased baking dish. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until center is firm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Mix the chicken pieces with the dressing, cranberry sauce, onion soup mix, and thyme. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 baking dish or other greased baking dish. Bake for 1 hour or until the chicken is cooked through. Yield: 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350. Combine honey and rum. Place chicken breasts in a shallow dish and pour the honey rum over them. Marinate for 10 minutes. Place in a shallow dish and spray with a little nonstick cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and cover the chicken with the honey rum mixture. Bake for 30 minutes longer. To prepare the sauce, combine the mayonnaise and rum. Drain the chicken and arrange the breasts on a platter. Spoon the sauce over the chicken. Sprinkle with black pepper and drizzle with a little extra rum. Serve immediately.

In a food processor, combine almonds, honey and orange zest. Pulse until almonds are finely chopped and mixture forms a dough. Transfer mixture to a bowl. Combine spices and apricots and dates in a small bowl. Stir into almond mixture. Transfer to a platter. Mound icing sugar in the centre of mixture. Drizzle almond oil over top. Roll mixture into balls and roll in icing sugar. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Pound out each breast to 3/8 inch thick. Lay out spinach and lay each breast in the middle. Sprinkle with garlic powder and salt and pepper. Fold over the sides of each breast and roll up. Beat together cream cheese and sour cream until smooth. Fill the rolled up breasts with the mixture. Place in small baking dish with about 1/2 inch of water. Bake about 15 minutes. After 15 minutes remove from oven and cover the baking pan with foil. Bake an additional 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Roll in whole wheat bread crumbs to coat. Return to oven and bake until brown and crispy. Serve with fresh fruit.

Combine mustards in large bowl. Beat egg white in small bowl with wire whisk until frothy. Dip catfish in mustard mixture then in egg white mixture. Toss in cornmeal and flour. Heat oil in deep-fat fryer to 375 degrees f. Fry fish in small batches until golden brown about 2 minutes. Drain on absorbent paper towels. Serve hot with lemon wedges for squeezing.

Preheat the broiler or the grill on medium high heat. Mix the oil, garlic and herbs together and rub over the salmon fillet. Sprinkle the salmon fillet with cracked black pepper and sea salt. Place under the broiler for 3 minutes or on the grill for 5 minutes or until the salmon is done to your liking. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil or lemon juice.

Preheat oven to 180 C. Grease and line two 20 cm round cake tins. Sift together the flour and baking soda. Beat together the egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually add the sugar and beat until stiff. Fold in the applesauce. Fold in the flour mixture. Fold in the chocolate chips. Spoon into the cake tins. Bake for 35 minutes or until the cake springs back when pressed gently in the middle. Meanwhile, mix together the juice and rind in a small saucepan. Bring to the boil over medium heat. Cook for 5 minutes or until thickened. Remove from the heat and cool. Spoon the topping over the cakes and leave to set. Serves 10.

Place 2 ice cream balls in center of each miniature powdered sugar doughnut. Top each ice cream ball with hot fudge. Top hot fudge with 1 tablespoon whipped cream and 1 maraschino cherry. Repeat process for each stack. Place stacks on serving plate. Garnish with additional whipped cream and cherries. Serves 4.

In a medium sized bowl mix together the cream cheese, sharp cheddar cheese and garlic clove until thoroughly blended. Add the beer and mix well until the cheese is smooth and creamy and the beer is no longer visible. Add the Worcestershire sauce and dry mustard and mix well. Add the cayenne pepper and mix well. Transfer the dip to a serving bowl and refrigerate for at least one hour or until ready to serve. Serve with vegetable slices such as carrots or celery.

Cook bacon in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat for 5-7 minutes or until crisp. Drain on paper towelscrumble. In a bowl, combine the cream cheese, cheddar cheese and half-and-half. Microwave at high 1-2 minutes or until cheeses melt when stirred. Stir in the bacon, Worcestershire sauce, onion flakes and mustard. Season with salt and tabasco sauce. Serve with crackers.
Combine all ingredients in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth and store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Mix cornmeal, flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl. Beat egg substitute and milk together in a small bowl, then stir the egg mixture into the flour mixture, and mix until just moistened. Pour into a 9 inch square baking pan that has been coated with non stick cooking spray. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. While the cake is still warm, spread 1/4 cup jam over the top of the cake. Let cool completely before cutting. Serves 6-8.

Preheat oven to 180 C / gas mark 4. Grease and line a 2lb loaf tin. Cream the bananas and butter together. Beat in the caster sugar. Add the eggs and beat well. Sift the flour and baking powder into a bowl. Stir into the banana mixture with the milk. Mix well and stir in the walnuts. Spoon into the loaf tin and level the surface. Bake for 1 to 1 1/2 hours or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean. Cool in the tin for 10 minutes before turning out to cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. In a large mixing bowl, combine bisquick mix, milk and cheddar cheese until just blended. Stir in margarine until crumbly. Turn onto floured surface and knead lightly 3 times. Pat or roll to 1/2-inch thickness. Cut with floured 2-1/2-inch biscuit cutter or glass. Place on ungreased cookie sheet 1-inch apart. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 12 biscuits.

Cook the bacon and set aside. In a large saucepan, heat the butter until foamy. Add the carrot and onion and cook over moderately high heat until golden, about 5 minutes. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and add the lentils and the salt. Cover and cook over low heat until the lentils are tender. Add the bacon and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the marjoram and the parsley. Transfer the lentils to a bowl and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Serve with crusty bread. Serves 4.

In saucepan, mix skim milk and cornstarch. Bring to boil over high heat and stir constantly until mixture thickens and boils for 1 minute. Add cayenne pepper and black pepper and stir until well blended. Add potatoes and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until potatoes are just tender. Add parmesan cheese and cook and stir until cheese is melted and sauce is thick and creamy. Serve immediately.

In a skillet brown the ground turkey and drain fat. In the crockpot add the ground turkey and all the remaining ingredients except the coleslaw mix. Cook on low 7-8 hours. When done add the coleslaw mix and cook another 4 hours.

In a medium saucepan, combine broth, sugar and saltbring to boil over medium heat. Add carrots. Reduce heat to medium-lowcover and simmer until carrots are tender-crisp, about 12 minutes. Stir in dill and butter.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Brush both sides of chicken breasts with teriyaki sauce. Place chicken breasts on a baking sheet. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in preheated oven, or until juices run clear and a thermometer reads 165 degrees F (75 degrees C). Cut each chicken breast in half horizontally and spread each half with orange marmalade and garlic butter. Serve immediately.
