Roll balls in white chocolate. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until set. Cool for 1 minute before removing from baking sheet to wire racks. Cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Wash potatoes thoroughly. Slice potatoes 1/8 thick. In a large bowl toss together the potatoes, olive oil, curry powder, pepper, allspice, onion powder, lemon juice and dill. Spread potatoes onto a greased baking sheet. Bake 20-30 minutes until potatoes are tender. Turn potatoes over halfway through baking. Remove from oven, sprinkle with salt to taste. Cool. Serve at room temperature.

Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add chicken and stir-fry until lightly browned. Stir in eggplant and bamboo shoots. Add coconut milk, curry paste, fish sauce, sugar and lime leaves. Bring to a simmer. Add basil and chilies. Cook 1 minute. Serve over rice.

Heat a large frying pan over a medium heat. Peel the aubergines and slice into 1/4-inch slices. Dust each slice in seasoned flour on both sides, shaking off the excess. Gently slide them into the hot oil. Fry for 4-5 minutes on each side until golden brown, turning frequently with tongs so they do not stick together. Drain on kitchen paper and sprinkle with salt while still hot.

Cook the rice in 1 1/2 cups stock according to package directions. Drain rice. Place in an ungreased 1 1/2 quart casserole dish. Stir in the rest of the stock, curry powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the tomato slices. Mix the buttered bread crumbs with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, the parsley and cheese. Sprinkle over the tomato slices. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

Wash and cut potatoes in quarters. Add to a large pot and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender. Drain and return to pot. Add milk and butter. Mash with potato masher until smooth. Add seasonings and blend in cream cheese. Stir in chives and onion. Serve warm. Makes 8 servings.
Peel and devein shrimp. Combine the shrimp, garlic and oregano in a large bowl. Add the oil and lime juice. Toss to coat. Toss in the pasta. Add the cheese and toss. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until the garlic is very fragrant but not brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the onions and cook until soft but not brown, 6 to 7 minutes. Add the salt and pepper. Stir gently. Add the eggs and stir until well mixed. Reduce the heat to low and cook until the eggs are just set but still moist on top. Sprinkle with the chili powder.

Mix together Old Bay Seasoning and spices. Form into a patty and grill or fry. Cut onion in half and place on top of burger and grill until desired doneness. Toast the buns and place the burgers on top of the buns. Add pretzels and top with pickles. Serve with ketchup and mustard.

Cut white bread into 1 inch cubes. Add to a bowl with egg whites and 1 tsp of milk. Mix and let stand for 10 minutes. Divide the cubes into 20 equal portions. Add 1 tsp of flour to each portion and roll into balls. Place into a greased 9 x 5 inch dish. Bake in preheated oven at 180C for 30 minutes or until golden. Mix together the remaining milk and cheese. Dip the bread balls into the mixture and return to the oven for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted.

In a large bowl mix the cream cheese with butter. In a separate bowl combine the eggs with vanilla sugar and light cream. Add the cream cheese mixture to the egg mixture and mix well. Add the farmer cheese. Mix until combined. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the noodles and cook for 12 minutes or until al dente. Drain the noodles and immediately rinse them under cold running water to stop the cooking process. Add the noodles to the filling mixture. Toss until well coated. Add the cinnamon. Mix to combine. Spread the filling in a 9x13 baking dish. Place in the preheated oven and bake for 50 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes then serve.
Boil water. Pour into 2 cups. Add 2 tea bags and steep for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Stir in sugar and lemon juice. Serve over ice. Makes 2 servings.

In a large dutch oven saute onions in olive oil until tender. Add potatoes and saute until brown. Add stock and milk. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 30 minutes. When potatoes are tender, mash them lightly with a potato masher and add butter and season with salt and pepper.

Combine olive oil, lemon juice, thyme leaves and caster sugar in a large bowl. Add mushrooms and stir to coat well. Roast for 10 minutes, or until tender. Drizzle with extra oil if needed, season with pepper and leave to cool slightly. Toss together mushrooms, green beans and tomatoes in a large bowl. Divide between plates. Top with spinach leaves, parmesan cheese and drizzle with extra oil, if liked.

Heat a skillet and add oil. Sauté onions and peppers until tender. Add ground beef and continue sautéing until completely browned. Add remaining ingredients and simmer uncovered for 30 minutes. Serve in hamburger buns.

Heat oven to 450 degrees. On a sheet pan, toss potatoes with garlic cloves, pepper and salt. Roast for 20 minutes. Add thyme and savory and continue roasting for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and add olive oil. Return to the oven for 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl combine soup, sour cream and margarine. Add squash and onions. Stir in the chicken stuffing. Place in a 2-quart casserole. Bake for 1 hour or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In large bowl, stir together milk, eggs, honey and cinnamon. Stir in squash. Pour mixture into unbaked pie shells. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack. Serve warm or chilled. Yield: 2 pies.

Combine all ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Chill thoroughly. Pour into ice pop molds and freeze overnight. To remove from molds run molds under warm water for 2 to 3 minutes.

Cut fillet into 8 pieces about 1 inch thick. Roll in flour and shake off excess. Brown onion and mushrooms in butteradd parsley, pepper and salt. Add cider to cover meat and cook until tenderabout 30 minutes. Serve with apple slices.

Preheat oven to 400. Wash beets well and place them in a shallow baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Bake for about 30 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Cool slightly and wrap in foil. Slice thinly. In a large bowl combine the greens with the walnuts. In another bowl combine the dressing with the fresh basil. Toss the greens with the dressing. Arrange the greens on a serving plate. Add the beets and cheese. Drizzle with extra dressing.

In a medium bowl combine butter and corn syrup. Add the sugar and peanut butter and beat well. Add the cornflakes and mix well. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto parchment paper. Bake for 7 minutes and cool. Makes 12 chews.

Peel yams and cut into cubes about 1 inch. Place cubes in a casserole dish. In a small bowl combine the melted butter, chili powder, cinnamon, and cayenne. Pour the seasoned butter over the yams and toss to coat well. Sprinkle the salt over the top. Bake, uncovered at 400 degrees for 30-40 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 220°C. Grease 12x4-inch rectangular cake pan with butter. In a large bowl combine the flour and ground almonds and set aside. In another bowl beat together the butter and icing sugar until creamy and combined well. Add the egg whites and beat well until smooth and creamy. Add the lemon rind and beat until just combined and mixture is thick and creamy. Add the flour mixture and beat until combined. Spoon into prepared cake pan and smooth out with the back of the spoon. Bake until the top is golden and the friand feels firm when you press the middle of the friand with your finger, about 20-25 minutes. Transfer pan to wire rack and let cool completely before slicing. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

Pre-heat oven to 450 degrees. In a small bowl combine oil & old bay seasoning. Slice 4 large baking potatoes 1/2 - inch thick. Sprinkle with salt. Pour oil mixture on top. Bake on cookie sheet for 25 minutes or until crisp. Serve hot.
Place fruit in bottom of pie shell. Blend together sugar and flour. Sprinkle over fruit. Bake at 400 for 30-35 minutes. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.
Cook potatoes and onion in 6 cups water, 2 tablespoons oil and seasonings. Add tomatoes. Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender. Makes 4 servings.

Place onions and roast beef in crock pot. Add potatoes and onion soup mix. Mix cornstarch with enough water to make a thin sauce. Add to crock pot and stir well. Pour in dry red wine and stir. Cover and cook on low setting for 7-8 hours. Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans.

Wash potatoes well. Boil potatoes in salted water for about 30 minutes or until done. Drain. Cut potatoes lengthwise. Beat cream cheese with nonfat milk, onion salt and pepper. Spoon mixture into potatoes. Melt butter and sprinkle with paprika. Place potatoes on a baking sheet. Bake in 375 degree oven for 20 minutes or until potatoes are heated through.

In a medium saucepan bring sausage drippings, bouillon and pepper to a simmer over medium heat. Remove from heat and pour into blender with cream and whipping cream. Process until smooth. Return to saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Whisk Wondra into milk mixture and continue to heat until gravy thickens and comes to a boil. Boil until thickened, stirring constantly. Season with butter, salt and pepper. Serve over biscuits.

In a large bowl combine the olive oil, mustard, lemon juice and 1/2 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Add the cabbage mixture and toss well to coat. Toss in the carrots, bell peppers and snow peas. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour or longer. Just before serving toss with the blue cheese crumbles.

Mix lychees with lime juice and sugar. Let stand at least 30 minutes before serving. Drain lychees and set aside. Juice remaining lychees and limes. Fill champagne glasses half full with lychee mixture. Top with sparkling wine and garnish with a lime slice and lychee.

In a large skillet melt the butter over medium heat. Saute the mushrooms and shallots until tender. Remove from heat and stir in the chicken. Season with salt and pepper and top with mozzarella cheese. Cover and let stand until cheese is melted and chicken is warmed through.

In a 12-inch skillet cook green pepper and red pepper in 2 tablespoons butter until tender. In a 13 x 9-inch baking dish combine 3 cans baked beans with 1 can ranch-style beans, 1 can vegetable juice cocktail and 1 can water. Stir in ketchup, barbecue sauce and brown sugar. Blend well. Spoon over pepper mixture. Top with remaining 1 can baked beans and remaining 1 can ranch-style beans. In a small bowl combine brown sugar and 2 tablespoons water. Drizzle over top. Bake, uncovered at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Stir after 20 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 8.

Soak celery in salt water for 1 hour. Drain & pat dry. In a small skillet, cook onion in butter over low heat until softened. Add flour and cook until lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in chicken broth and simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes. Add cream and ham and continue to simmer until thickened again and heated through, about 5 minutes more. Spread half of mixture evenly in a 13-by-9-inch baking dish and top with half the celery, ham, and cheese. Repeat layers. Bake at 375f until bubbly, 35 minutes to 40 minutes. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and bake until golden brown, about 5 minutes more.

Brush salmon with oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Wrap salmon in foil with herbs inside. Roast in preheated 375 degree oven for 15 minutes. Turn fish and roast another 10 minutes or until fish is cooked through and flakes easily when tested with a fork. Meanwhile prepare sauce. In a small saucepan combine wine and lemon juice. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in capers. Spoon sauce over fish. Garnish with lemon slices. Serve with steamed vegetables if desired.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger paste and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add onions and cook until light brown, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add jalapeno and salt to taste and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add water and dried fenugreek leaves and simmer until slightly thickened and liquid has evaporated, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly. In a food processor add paneer and process until smooth. Add cream and pulse until blended. Serve with rice or naan.
Cook lentils according to package directions. Drain and let cool. Combine lentils with remaining salad ingredients. Whisk together remaining salad ingredients. Drizzle over salad. Toss gently. Serve.

Place tofu, maple syrup, vanilla extract, cinnamon, allspice and nutmeg into a blenderblend on high speed until completely smooth. Pour into a large bowlstir in cranberries. Microwave uncovered on high (100% power) for 4 minutes. Stir in ricemicrowave, uncovered, on high (100% power) for 4 minutes longer or until heated through. Stir in almondssprinkle with nutmeg to serve. Makes 6 servings (about 1/2 cup each).

Combine the water and sugar in a small saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil. Add the dried fruit and cook for 1 minute. Add the cranberries and cook for 1 minute more. Remove from the heat. Stir in the ginger. Spoon the mixture into serving bowls. Sprinkle with the apple slices and orange segments.

Trim the cabbage leaves and discard the core. Cut the cabbage into wedges. Place the cabbage wedges in a bowl and toss with canola oil. Place the wedges in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast until they are tender but still have some bite to them (15-20 minutes). Combine the rice wine, soy sauce, rice vinegar and distilled white vinegar to make the black bean garlic sauce. In a small bowl combine the black bean garlic sauce, scallions and toasted sesame oil. Place the cabbage wedges on a serving platter. Spoon the black bean garlic sauce over the wedges. Sprinkle with hot sauce.

Place water, ginger, sage, thyme and rosemary into a 2-quart pot. Bring to a boil, then lower heat to simmer for 5 minutes. Strain tea into a heatproof pitcherlet cool to room temperature. Stir in lemon juice, honey and cinnamon sticks. Cover and refrigerate for up to 1 week.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In a small bowl combine mustard, brown sugar, coca-cola and a dash of hot sauce. Pour into crock pot. Add ham. Cook on high 3 to 4 hours or until ham is tender. Increase heat to 450 degrees and broil until ham is brown. Serve on toast with hot mustard.

Peel & thinly slice potatoes. Fry with onion in bacon grease. Brown kielbasa & bacon. Slice & add to the potatoes& onions. Add a little water & simmer about 10 minutes. Slice the cabbage & add to the pot. Saute with bacon drippings until the cabbage is tender. Season with flour& bacon grease. Add water to cover the kohl & simmer until it is tender & the liquid is thick. Add sour cream & caraway seed to taste. Serve with crusty bread

In a large bowl, combine the apples with the cinnamon and allspice. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the flour, salt and baking powder and set aside. In a large bowl combine the apples, rolled oats, brown sugar and apple juice and mix thoroughly. Stir the dry ingredients into the apples and mix well. Spray a large baking dish with cooking spray and pour the apple mixture into it. Sprinkle the top of the apple mixture with the melted butter and bake for 35-40 minutes or until the apples are soft and the crumble topping is golden brown. Serves about 8.

In a medium bowl, mix together tofu, corn oil, maple syrup, salt and vanilla. Blend until smooth. Spoon into serving cups. Sprinkle with walnuts. Serve immediately or cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Place halibut steaks on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper. In a bowl beat together butter and worcestershire sauce. Spread on top of each halibut steak. Sprinkle with parsley and top with scallions sliced lengthwise. Bake for 15 minutes or until halibut flakes easily with a fork. Serve with rice or noodles.

In a medium bowl combine mayo, green onions, pickle juice and cider vinegar. Season with coarse salt and pepper. Add the coleslaw mix and toss to combine. In a large skillet cook the chicken on medium heat until browned. Add the BBQ sauce and cook until the sauce thickens and the chicken is cooked through. Cut the buns in half and spread the mayo mixture on the bottom half of the bun. Top with the BBQ sauce and pulled chicken. Top with the coleslaw and top with the other half of the bun.

Heat oil over medium heat. Saute onions until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add corn. Stir over medium heat until corn is heated through. Add chicken broth. Bring to boiling point. Stir in rosemary leaves. Simmer 5 minutes longer. Season to taste with salt and white pepper.

Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add scallops, seasoning with salt to taste. Cook scallops until browned on both sides and the centers are firm. Remove scallops from pan. Add vermouth and reduce by 2/3rds. Add tomatoes and basil. Add butter to skillet and stir to combine. Add scallops back to pan, tossing gently to coat with sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Rinse chickens and pat dry with paper towels. Season with salt and pepper. Cut off necks and reserve for stock. Discard backs and giblets and set aside breasts and drumsticks. Heat oil to 350 degrees in a large frying pan. Cut chicken breasts lengthwise into three pieces and drumsticks in half. Dip each piece in mayonnaise and roll in mustard and crackers. Dip in buttermilk and roll in cracker mixture again. Dip in oil and roll in cracker mixture one last time. Place in frying pan and cook until golden brown and crispy 2 to 4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Season with more salt and pepper to taste. Put chickens in shallow baking dish and bake 15 minutes per pound at 450 degrees or until juices run clear. Serve with pan juices and parsley garnish.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion. Cook for 5 minutes. Add garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Add all other vegetables. Cook until vegetables are soft. Add tomatoes. Simmer until thickened. Stir in salt and pepper. Serve over pasta.

In a large pot, heat the oil and onion and saute until onion is translucent. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant but not browned. Add the beans and bay leaves and pour in enough water to cover the beans by 1 inch. Add the thyme and season with salt and pepper to taste. Bring the mixture to a boil then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 2 hours. Drain the beans and discard the bay leaves.

In a bowl stir together the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Using a pastry blender, cut the butter into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Gradually stir in the buttermilk until the dough just comes together. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until it forms a soft dough. Roll or pat out to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut out the scones using a 2-inch cutter. Place the scones on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. Makes 12 scones.
Mix cream cheese, sugar and cool whip until blended. Place in graham cracker pie crust. Chill at least 4 hours. Serve with pie filling or strawberries.
Soak the peas overnight. Drain and rinse well. Blend with the remaining ingredients. Chill at least 2 hours or overnight. Serve with pita or crackers.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, cook celery, onion and rice together in nonstick cooking spray until celery and onion are tender. Stir in corn. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine milk powder, water and lemon pepper. Cook until thickened. Stir into rice mixture. Stir in cheeses. Cook until melted. Sprinkle with parsley. Makes 8 servings.

Heat oven to 350F. Split the English muffins lengthwise and spread both sides with butter. Beat eggs, milk and salt in a bowl with a whisk. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook ham slices for 1-2 minutes per side or until browned. Remove ham from pan. In same pan, pour egg mixture and cook, stirring frequently, for 2-3 minutes or until eggs are scrambled and cooked through. Layer ham on bottom of each muffin half, and top with cheese. Spread with egg mixture and sprinkle with paprika. Bake on a baking sheet for 10-12 minutes or until cheese is melted and muffins are browned. Cut each muffin half into 2 triangles and serve immediately.

Place steaks on wire rack on baking sheet. Pat steaks dry with paper towels. In bowl stir together oil, garlic, brown sugar and soy sauce. Spread evenly over both sides of steaks. Let stand 15 minutes. Sprinkle steaks with thyme and harissa. Let stand 30 minutes. Grill over medium heat or broil 4 to 5 inches from heat about 7 minutes per side for medium-rare. Serve immediately.

Cook the lean hamburger, drain, add onion. Cook until browned. Mix all of the above ingredients together. Roll into balls. Bake in a crockpot on low for approx. 8 hours. Serve on a toasted bun with condiments of your choice.

Place dill pickles in a jar or container. Mix together the rest of the ingredients and pour over pickles. Make sure pickles are completely covered in the liquid. Refrigerate overnight before serving. This recipe was adapted from http://www.koolaid.com/recipes/pickles/index.html

Place chocolate and coffee in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture is smooth. Add sugar and salt. Stir until dissolved. Add milk and cream. Heat to almost boiling. Stir in vanilla. Serve immediately.

Lightly coat a cookie sheet with cooking spray. Unroll crescent roll dough. Layer dough with butter and then with cheese. Cut each roll into 16 slices. Place slices in rows on the cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 11-13 minutes or until golden brown. Drain french-fried onions and spread over warm rolls. Cool slightly before serving. Yields 16 servings.

Cook the bacon in the skillet until crisp. Remove the bacon from the skillet with a slotted spoon and set aside. Sauté the onion, green pepper and fresh herbs until tender-crisp. Stir in the soup and milk. Heat through. Serve in bowls garnished with the crisp bacon.

Sauté the onion, carrots and celery in oil for about 10 minutes. Add the split peas and 3 cups of water. Bring to a boil. Add salt and pepper. Reduce heat, cover tightly and simmer for about 1 hour or until peas are tender. Check the liquid level and add more water if necessary. Makes about 10 servings.

In a small bowl, whisk the fennel seed, red wine vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper. Add the olive oil in a steady stream whisking to emulsify. In a large bowl, combine the lettuce leaves. Add the arugula and mint. Add the vinaigrette and toss well. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

Follow box directions for angel food cakes except add a few drops of almond extract with water in mixing bowl. Bake in angel food tins for about 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely. Frost with wild cherry vanilla frosting.

In a blender combine the chipotle chiles and 1/4 cup water and blend into a smooth puree. Transfer to a large nonreactive saucepan and cook over medium heat until reduced to 3 tablespoons. In the same blender combine the lime juice and next 4 ingredients and blend until smooth. Season with salt to taste. In a nonreactive saucepan combine the pork and next 5 ingredients and cook over medium heat until pork is cooked through, about 12 minutes. Cut the pork into 1-inch pieces and divide among 6 plates. Divide the salsa among the 6 plates and top each serving with 2 teaspoons of the chipotle puree and 1 teaspoon of the cilantro oil.

Spread 1/4 cup mayonnaise over each tortilla. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup cream cheese. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup chopped spinach. Top with 1/4 cup sour cream. Top with bacon bits and onion flakes. Roll up each tortilla. Cut each roll into four pieces. Makes about 16 pieces.

In a large bowl combine cooked chicken, spaghetti sauce, picante sauce, taco seasoning mix & cheeses. Heat oven to 350. Spread 1 cup of colby/monterey jack on each tortilla & place them on baking sheets. Spoon the filling mixture onto each tortilla to within 1/2 inch of edge. Top with remaining cheese & stuffed green olive. Roll tortillas up jellyroll fashion & place seam side down on baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes or until filling is bubbly & cheese is golden brown.

wash strawberries and dry. Cut off stems. Cut berries lengthwise, and cut halves lengthwise again. Fill with chocolate chips and almonds, and roll up jelly-roll style. Dot with red licorice strings and swiss cheese. Refrigerate. Makes 48 pieces.

Preheat oven to 350. Toss asparagus with olive oil and seasoning salt in a large bowl. Roast on a baking sheet for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir in lemon juice and parmesan cheese. Let stand for a few minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350. Arrange frozen wedges in single layer in shallow baking pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden. Meanwhile combine the mayonnaise, cheese and tuna in a small bowl. Drain wedges and transfer to a serving platter. Top with the cheese mixture. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve immediately.

Melt butter in a sauce pan. Saut garlic until fragrant. Add cottage cheese and continue to cook until cheese is melted. Add the green onions, dill, and pepper. Remove from heat. Put in a bowl. Add in the salmon. Add the egg noodles and sour cream. Mix well. Add in the Monterey jack cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Garnish with green onions if desired. Serve immediately.

Mix together the chicken pieces, liquid honey, butter, dijon mustard and curry powder. Spread the chicken mixture out onto a 9x13 inch baking pan. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Turn the chicken pieces over at the 30 minute mark. Remove the foil. Sprinkle the top with cayenne pepper. Bake for another 15 minutes until the chicken is fully cooked.
Mix all the above ingredients in a casserole dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven. Top with cornbread. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes more.

Preheat the oven to 350. Combine the oats, flour, wheat germ and cinnamon. Add the honey and stir until well mixed. Add the raisins. Press the mixture into a 9×13 pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Let cool and cut into bars. Store at room temperature.

Line a 9x13 inch pan with wax paper. In a large heavy bottom pot combine brown sugar and evaporated milk over low heat until sugar is melted and mixture is smooth. Stir in butterscotch chips and marshmallow cream. Pour into pan and spread evenly with a spatula. Refrigerate until firm. Sprinkle top with nuts and chips and drizzle with vanilla. Cut into squares and serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the shredded coconut, oil and rice. Add the broth and milk and stir. Spoon the mixture into the prepared pan. Top with the cilantro leaves and cashews. Sprinkle the frozen peas on top. Bake for 30 minutes or until the rice is tender. Cool for 5 minutes before serving. Serve as a side dish to meat or poultry.

Rinse chicken breasts then pat dry with a paper towel. Sprinkle with kosher salt and fresh cracked black pepper on both sides of each chicken breast. Cut a few slices into each breast. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of the parsley over the bottom of a 4 quart crock pot. Place chicken breasts on top of parsley sprinkling the remaining 1/4 cup parsley over each chicken breast. Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder over each breast. Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder over the wild rice then add rice to crock pot. Add water to crock pot. Squeeze half of one lemon over chicken breasts in crock pot then squeeze remaining half of lemon over wild rice. Cover crock pot with lid and cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 6 hours. When done remove chicken from crock pot to cool for at least 10 minutes then slice into thin strips. Add sliced chicken strips to wild rice then stir to combine.

Brown hamburger in a large skillet over medium heat until browned. Drain fat. Stir in pasta sauce, tomato paste, onion and oregano. Simmer 10 minutes. Spray a 9x13 inch pan with cooking spray. Layer half the pasta in the pan, cover with a layer of the meat mixture, sprinkle with half the cheese. Repeat layers ending with the cheese. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until heated through. Serves 6-8.

Lay out all the ingredients. In a shallow bowl combine the egg and garlic. In another shallow bowl, combine the pork rind and seasonings. Dip the chicken in the egg mixture and then coat with the pork rind mixture. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium high heat. Brown the chicken on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan. Remove from heat and add tea bags. Let steep for 10 minutes. Strain out the tea bags and add the sugar and baking soda. Stir to dissolve the sugar and baking soda. Serve over ice.

Combine soy sauce and sake in a shallow container. Add oil and mix well. Add ginger and garlic and mix well. Add shrimp to mixture and mix well to coat all sides. Let marinate in refrigerator at least one hour or overnight. Soak bamboo skewers in water for at least one hour. Thread vegetables and shrimp onto skewers and place in shallow baking pan. Bake at 450 degrees F for 5 to 7 minutes or until shrimp are cooked through. Remove from oven and brush with ginger sauce and return to oven. Bake an additional 3 minutes or until shrimp are glazed. Serves 4 to 6.

Melt butter in a large pan over medium heat. Cook onions and celery until onions are transparent. Add Bisquick and stir until mixed. Stir in milk slowly. Cook on low heat for about 5 minutes. Add tuna and cook for another 5 minutes. Serve on toast.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, sugar and salt. Cut in the butter with a pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add 1/4 cup ice water. Mix until just combined. Roll out 1 pie crust on a lightly floured surface until it is 14-inches wide. Fit into a 9-inch pie pan. Flute the edges. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, buttermilk and vanilla. Stir in the flour mixture. Stir in the semisweet chocolate morsels. Pour into pie crust. Bake for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees. Bake 30 minutes longer. Let stand 1 hour before cutting.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10 inch jelly roll pan. Beat together margarine and sugar until creamy. Beat in egg, vanilla and zucchini and carrot. In a separate bowl stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamon. Gradually add to margarine mixture and mix well. Spread mixture into prepared pan and bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are lightly browned. Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack. Cut into bars. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

Combine 3 cups of flour, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 1/3 cup of Crisco. Cut in 1/3 cup of butter until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Beat 1 cup of sugar, 1 cup of Crisco, 1 egg, 1 teaspoon of vanilla, and 1/4 cup of milk together until smooth. Add to flour mixture. Toss 6 cups of fruit (I used 4 apples and 2 pears) with 1 tablespoon of flour. Add to batter. Pour batter into 2 quart casserole. Bake at 400 degrees for 1 hour.

Heat olive oil in a saute pan. Add the onions and saute over low heat for 15 - 20 minutes or until they are golden brown. Stir occasionally. Meanwhile, in another bowl, stir together the sour cream and the goat cheese. Once the onions are ready, stir the goat cheese mixture into the onions and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately with tortilla chips or fresh vegetables. Garnish with chives.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat butter in a small bowl until fluffy. Stir in powdered sugar and beat well. Add flour and beat until mixture holds together. Turn out onto floured board. Divide into 3 pieces. Pat each piece into a 1/2-inch-thick round. Place 1 pecan in center of each round. Fold over ends of round to form a triangle. Press ends together. Place on lightly greased baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from baking sheet to wire rack. Drizzle with vanilla glaze. Cool completely. Makes 9 biscuits.

Dissolve yeast in warm milk. Add sugar, salt, butter, egg. Gradually add flour to form a soft dough. Knead until smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowl, turn once to grease surface. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled in bulk. Punch down. Divide dough into 16 pieces. Roll into balls. Place in greased baking pan. Cover with cloth. Let rise in warm place until doubled in bulk. Bake at 375f for 10 to 12 minutes. Makes 16 rolls.

Pat chicken dry. Mix together flour, cornstarch and seasonings. Dip each piece of chicken in the mixture to coat both sides. Heat a nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the coated chicken breasts and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side. Add the raspberry preserves and balsamic vinegar. Stir and cover. Cook for a few minutes more, or until the sauce thickens. Sprinkle with the fresh parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a large pot cover potatoes with cold water by 2 inches. Add 2 tablespoons kosher salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife. Drain and transfer to a bowl. Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a skillet over medium-low heat. Add thyme. Stir 1 minute. Add half-and-half and nutmeg. Increase heat to medium. Cook until sauce is slightly reduced, about 2 minutes. Whisk in remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Stir in potatoes. Transfer to a 3-quart gratin dish. Sprinkle with gruyere. Bake until sauce is bubbling around the edges, about 20 minutes.
Beat sugar and butter in large bowl with mixer until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and flourbeat well. Gradually beat in milk until blendedbeat until frosting is of spreading consistency.
Mix cake according to directions on box. Add 1/2 cup of pistachio pudding mix. Bake as directed. Cool. Mix frosting according to directions on box. Frost cake.

peel the fruit and remove the seeds and pulp, then cut the fruit into wedges. Place fruit in a large pitcher. Pour wine into pitcher and stir in sugar and rum. Refrigerate for about one hour, stirring occasionally. In a tall glass filled with ice, pour one part sangria and one part orange juice and stir. Garnish with fruit wedges and serve.

Cook the rice according to package directions. Mix the soup and water together in the same pot. Add chicken and scallion. Bring to boil. Remove from heat and stir in rice. Spread into 13 x 9 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 450 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes. Serve.

Prepare instant pudding according to package directions. Let cool. Combine pudding with pie filling mix. Mix in crushed pineapple. Place angel food cake layers in the bottom of the pan. Spread pudding mixture over the cake. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Top with berries.

In large saute pan heat olive oil over medium high heat. Add asparagus spears and saute 3 minutes or until slightly tender. Remove from heat and set aside. Roll prosciutto around each spear and secure with a wooden pick or a toothpick. Place on a serving platter and drizzle with lemon juice and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Peel bananas. Cut them in half lengthwise. Arrange halves, cut side down, in a buttered 13 by 9 inch baking pan. Bake until tender. Meanwhile, mix cream with Amarula until blended. Pour over bananas. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake 15 to 20 minutes longer until hot. Drizzle with honey. Serves 10.

Melt butter in sauce pan. Add the green beans. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the garlic clove. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the vegetable stock. Bring to a boil and cook until the green beans are tender. In a blender or food processor, puree the green bean mixture. Return to the sauce pan. Add the cream. Heat through. Season with the parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Serve hot. Garnish with parsley.

Mix cornstarch with cold water to form a smooth paste. Combine soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, garlic, ginger and pepper in a large zip-top plastic bag. Add the chicken, seal the bag and turn it to coat. Remove as much air as possible and massage the bag to coat well. Refrigerate for 15 minutes. Heat oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook for about 2 minutes per side, until nicely browned. Transfer to a plate. Add the pineapple to the pan and cook over high heat until it has caramelized and reduced to a syrup. Pour over the chicken. Serve.

In a small bowl mix brown sugar, vanilla, karo syrup and baking soda. Pour popcorn into bowl. Toss with syrup mixture until coated. Place popcorn on wax paper to cool. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 4 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Melt butter in 10-inch ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add hash browns and stir until crisp and brown. Remove from heat. Layer with ham and cheese. Beat eggs and half-and-half with mustard and pepper. Pour over hash browns. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until set. Sprinkle with bacon. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Mash banana with a fork in a medium bowl. Beat egg and vanilla in a small bowl. Stir banana mixture into egg mixture. Stir in yogurt. Add water. Stir in baking powder and baking soda. Stir in cocoa powder. Stir in flour. Let stand for 5 minutes. Lightly coat a nonstick griddle or skillet with cooking spray. Spoon batter onto griddle. Cook over medium heat for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes per side or until golden brown. Sprinkle pancakes with powdered sugar. Serve with butter, if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Bring chicken broth to a boil in a 12-inch heavy skillet or oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat. Add pasta, stirring often to prevent sticking. Cook until pasta is al dente. Add sun-dried tomatoes and shrimp to pasta and cook until pink. Stir in pesto and whipping cream. Serve immediately. Garnish with fresh basil.
Melt the butter in an 8-inch pie dish. Arrange potatoes, broccoli florets and parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Add eggs. Cook in 350 degree oven until set.

Dissolve yeast in water. Heat milk until very warm (120° F), stirring constantly. In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in the warm milk. Add salt and pepper. Beat until smooth. Add flour. Mix at low speed until dough comes away from the sides of the bowl. Knead on a lightly floured surface until the dough is smooth and elastic. Return to bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until doubled (about 1 hour). Punch down. On a lightly floured surface, roll into a 14 inch square. In a medium bowl, mix together the mustard, salt and pepper. Spread over the rolled dough. Arrange the tomato slices in rows on the dough. Sprinkle with thyme. Fold the edges of the dough over the filling. Place on a parchment paper lined baking sheet. Brush the dough with the melted butter. Bake until golden brown (about 30 minutes). Cool for 1
Combine all the ingredients in a mixing bowl and chill. Slice the bagels in half and spread on the shrimp salad mixture. Sprinkle with the swiss cheese and serve immediately.

In a large wok, heat oil over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add cashewsstir-fry until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate. Add pork and stir-fry until almost cooked through. Stir in greens and red chile, stir-frying until just tender, about 1 minute longer. Stir in soy sauce and cook until pork is cooked through, about 1 minute longer. Remove from heat. Add lime juice and zest. Stir in papaya, cashews, and riceserve immediately.

Place the butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat, and heat until melted and very hot, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and whisk in the lime and lemon juices and salt. Whisk in the egg yolks and continue whisking until the sauce is thick and smooth, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the hot sauce and orange juice and whisk until thickened and smooth.

Melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until the foam subsides. Add the mushrooms, garlic and thyme and saute until the mushrooms are softened and the garlic is aromatic. Remove the mushrooms and garlic from the skillet and keep warm. Add the green beans and a small amount of salt and pepper, and cook until they are crisp-tender, stirring frequently. Add the cream and return the mushrooms and garlic to the skillet and stir until heated through. Divide the green beans between 4 serving plates. Spoon the mushroom cream over each and top with parmesan cheese and parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel hard-boiled eggs. Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Stir in mustard until smooth. Gradually add half-and-half. Cook and stir until mixture boils and thickens. Stir in eggs and cook until heated through. Stir in salt and pepper. Sprinkle with paprika and pour into greased 1 1/2-quart casserole dish. Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Slice peaches into thin wedges. Mix all ingredients together in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil on the stove-top over medium heat. Reduce heat to simmer for 10 minutes or until peaches are softened. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Refrigerate overnight to let flavors blend. Serve chilled.

In a large bowl combine the cream of mushroom soup and 1/2 cup of milk. Add the green beans and mix well. Add the green beans and mix well. Place in a 9x13 casserole dish. Brown the hamburger and drain. Add to the casserole dish. Bake for 30 minutes. In a bowl mix together the tater tots and the remaining 1/2 cup of milk. Spread over the top of the casserole. Bake for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake for 5 minutes longer. Serve warm.

Heat oil in saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion, bell pepper, garlic, and cumin. Cook until onion is tender, about 8 - 10 minutes. Stir in chili powder. Add beans and tomato. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer until thickened, about 1 hour. Stir in thyme. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Makes about 4 servings.
Preheat oven to 375f. Beat eggs in a bowl. Add milk and mix well. Pour mixture into a 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle matzos on top. Dot with butter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Place ham in a deep baking dish with the mustard, brown sugar, salt, beer, apple cider, cloves, bay leaves, and pepper. Cover with foil and bake for 3 hours or until a thermometer inserted in the ham reads 150 degrees. Remove ham from oven and uncoverbake for 15 minutes more. Remove ham from ovenlet stand for 15 minutes before serving.

Peel rutabagas, turnips or swedes and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Put into a pot with water to cover by 1 inch. Boil until tender, about 20 to 25 minutes. Drain. Add potato to boiling water. Boil for about 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Add to rutabaga mixture. Add 2 tablespoons butter, whipping cream and salt & pepper to taste. Mash with potato masher until smooth. Serve hot.

In a medium skillet cook garlic in oil until soft. Stir in onion and cook 1 minute. Add zucchini and corn and saute until tender-crisp, about 3 minutes. Stir in green chilies. Season with salt. Transfer mixture to a lightly greased 1 1/2-qt baking dish. Sprinkle cheese on top. Bake at 375f for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Beat together the first six ingredients. Beat in pudding mix and then add the chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-11 minutes in the preheated oven. Frost with chocolate frosting as desired.
Spread hummus inside tortilla. Layer with chicken, spinach, artichoke hearts, red peppers and top with more hummus.

Brown sausage in large skillet over medium heat. Cook onions in skillet until softened. Add mushrooms and cook 3 minutes longer. Stir in hash browns and seasonings. In another skillet fry eggs over easy. Serve sausage mixture over hash browns with eggs on top. Sprinkle with cheese and serve immediately.

In a sauce pan over medium heat melt half of the butter and then add the rest of the ingredients except the mushrooms and basil and half the pecans. Bring to a boil and then simmer for 1 minute, stirring occasionally. Pour the mixture into a shallow casserole dish and spread evenly. Place the mushrooms in the mixture and sprinkle with the rest of the pecans and the basil leaves. Bake in a 400 degree oven for about 10 minutes until the filling is hot and the mushrooms are tender. Serve at once with crackers or small sliced french breads.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (180 degrees c). Line a shallow roasting pan with foil.Lay chicken thighs in a single layer in prepared roasting pan. Sprinkle with sumac, salt and white pepperdrizzle with olive oil. Roast for 30 minutes in the preheated oven.Cover potatoes with water in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Add onion and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes. Drain potatoes and onion into a colander and set aside to cool.Place a medium skillet over medium heatadd garlic and oil. Cook until garlic is golden brown, about 2 minutes.Stir garlic mixture into chicken with potatoes and oniontoss to combine. Season with salt and white pepper.Place chicken mixture in a serving dishsprinkle with fresh parsley.

Combine milk and condensed milk in a medium saucepan. Heat over medium heat until it starts to boil. Turn heat down to low and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla instant pudding mix. Add bananas and mix well. Fold in cool whip. Line a 8x8 baking dish with vanilla wafers. Fill with pudding mixture and top with more vanilla wafers. Refrigerate.

In a medium bowl, combine pasta sauce with low-fat cream cheese. Add cheddar cheese and stir until melted. Add frozen mixed vegetables. Put pasta into a small bowl with some olive oil. Mix together well and pour into a greased 13 x 9 glass baking dish. Spread pasta evenly in baking dish. Top with vegetable mixture. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes until bubbly and heated through. Serve immediately. Serve with a side of whole-grain bread.

Combine garlic, shallots, pepper and salt in a bowl and add spareribs. Toss to coat. Marinate in refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight. Drain marinade and set aside. Preheat oven to 350 F. Combine wine and oil in a large frying pan. Add ribs and fry for 5 minutes. Add marinade and continue to fry until ribs are lightly brown and crisp. Add water and bring to boil. Cover and bake for 1 hour and 30 minutes. Remove ribs from pan and set aside. Add remaining marinade to the pan. Bring to a boil and reduce to 1/2 cup. Strain and reserve. Add lemon grass to the sauce and set aside. Cut ribs into 1-inch pieces and arrange on a serving dish. Pour reserved sauce over the ribs. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a baking dish with foil and place salmon on top. Drizzle with lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle parsley on top. Bake for 10 minutes or until salmon is cooked through. Serve with your favorite sides.

In a shallow bowl or plate beat the eggs and milk together until well combined. Add the maple syrup and cinnamon and mix well. Dip the bread into the egg mixture. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Place the dipped bread into the hot oil and fry until golden brown on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side. Transfer the french toast to a platter and sprinkle with powdered sugar and garnish with the carrot and sweet potato slices.
Mix soup and milk. Heat in microwave on high for 2 minutes. Add honey and frozen veggies. Stir well. Pour into pie crust. Bake in 400 degree oven for 15 minutes. Top with cooked chicken.

Sift together the dry ingredients in a large bowl. Cream the shortening, sugars and vanilla together until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the dry ingredients until blended. Fold in the chips. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto lightly greased baking sheets or parchment-lined baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until the edges are golden brown. Cool for a few minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 3 dozen cookies.

Melt butter in large sauce pan over medium heat. Stir in flour. Cook for 30 seconds. Gradually stir in milk. Continue stirring until mixture comes to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Stir in tomato paste. Increase heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Stir in tomatoes. Continue simmering for 5 minutes. Add potatoes and onions. Season with basil and pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add broccoli florets and cook for 4 minutes or until crisp tender. Drain. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise and Dijon mustard. Add lemon juice and mix well. In a small bowl combine paprika and cayenne pepper. Stir into mayonnaise mixture. Pour over broccoli florets and toss to coat. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine water and oil. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute or until oil is hot and shimmers. Using a slotted spoon, carefully pour oil over broccoli florets. Place broccoli on a serving platter. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley and serve immediately.

Boil 4 cups water in medium saucepan. Add shrimpcook 2 minutes. Drain. Peel shrimp. Cool 5 minutes. Transfer shrimp to blender containeradd onion and lemon juice. Coverblend until smooth. Add curry powderblend until smooth. Transfer mixture to medium bowl. Stir in mayonnaise and next 5 ingredients. Coverchill 8 hours. To serve, spread shrimp mixture onto bottom of baguette slices. Top with lettuce, tomatoes and cucumbers. Roll up. Cut crosswise into 1-inch-thick sandwiches. Makes 2 dozen sandwiches.

Line a 20cm square cake tin with baking paper. Melt 100g dark chocolate melts in a double boiler. Remove from the heat and mix in 200g marshmallows and 50g glace cherries. Pour mixture into cake tin and refrigerate until set. Melt 50g dark chocolate melts in a double boiler and pour onto the base. Sprinkle 200g unsalted peanuts and 200g desiccated coconut. Refrigerate until set. Cut into squares.

In a medium-sized heavy skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add the light corn syrup and sugar. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture boils. Lower heat slightly. Stir in the cinnamon and salt. Stir until the mixture thickens. Immediately pour mixture over the pecans. Let stand until cooled.

Clean and wash chicken thoroughly. Place each piece of chicken breast-side down on a clean cutting board and make slits on each side of the chicken. Stuff the slits with garlic cloves and bay leaves. Place the chicken pieces into a large plastic bag. In a large pot over high heat, bring soy sauce, vinegar and water to a boil. Pour the boiling liquid into the bag and seal tightly. Let the mixture marinade for 20 minutes. In a large frying pan over high heat, heat oil to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place the chicken pieces in the hot oil and fry until lightly browned and cooked through. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels. Serve the fried chicken with the garlic and bay leaves.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Beat eggs with milk, mustard, scallions, cheese and paprika in a bowl with a wire whisk until smooth. Spray a 12-inch skillet with cooking spray, and place in oven while oven heats. When oven is heated, pour egg mixture into skillet, and bake for 7 minutes. Remove skillet from ovenspray skillet with cooking spray if necessary. Flip omelette over, and bake for another 7 minutes. Remove skillet from ovensprinkle with cheese if desired. Serve immediately.

Place plums in a bowl with cranberries and toss. Combine cumin, whole cardamom pod and kaffir lime leaves in a small bowl and set aside. In a large saucepan combine all ingredients except jalapeno and cook over medium heat. Once plums are soft and sauce is thickened about 10 minutes, stir in jalapeno and cook 1 minute. Transfer to a bowl and let cool. Remove whole cardamom pod. Stir in sugar and cumin. Serve as an accompaniment to grilled meat. Makes about 2 1/2 cups.

Mix butter with sugar until creamy. Beat in egg and orange zest until well blended. Blend in frozen orange juice concentrate. Stir in flour and baking powder until dough is crumbly. Stir in Grape-Nuts cereal. Roll dough into walnut-sized balls and place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten slightly with a fork. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Store in an airtight container for 1 week.

Saute onion and garlic in butter until tender. Add ground beef and saute until cooked through. Add flour and mix well. Add the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Serve over wide egg noodles.
Brown hamburger. Add onions and mix. Add Manwich Sloppy Joe mix. Add tomato sauce.

In a heavy-bottomed pan or a skillet, combine the hazelnuts and melted butter. Stir over medium heat until the hazelnuts become fragrant and start turning brown. Then remove from heat. In a bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Add salt and beat again. Then slowly pour in the sugar. Add 2 tablespoons of hazelnuts and mix. Then fold the rest of the hazelnuts into the mixture and mix until everything is incorporated. Turn into a greased pan or container and bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 10 minutes. Cool and break into pieces.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large saucepan combine the soup, milk and mushrooms. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Stir in tuna and parsley. Add lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve over noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl combine olive oil and garlic. Place squash in a single layer on a baking sheet and drizzle with garlic oil. Sprinkle with pepper and bake for 30 minutes until squash is tender. Cool slightly before serving.

Wash squash, then slice lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices. Place squash in a bowl with butter, sugar, salt & pepper. In a separate bowl beat eggs. Dip squash in egg wash then place in a 9x13 pan. Pour remaining egg over top. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Meanwhile, make sauce: In a small bowl mix together onion & vinegar. To serve, place 1/2 a roll in each plate. Top with squash. Drizzle with onion sauce.

Fry bacon and cut into small pieces. Cook ground beef and onion in bacon grease until brown. Drain. Add pork and beans, molasses, ketchup, dry mustard, worcestershire, and salt. Cook until heated through. Serve over hot dogs, hamburgers, or on nachos.

Brown meat in oil. Remove meat and drain. Saute onion in pan drippings until tender. Add flour and brown. Pour in beef broth and stir in mushroom soup. Add meat, potatoes, carrots and simmer until tender. Serve on a bed of noodles.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).In a bowl, combine egg, milk, cheese, oats, onion powder and salt. In a separate bowl, combine beef, ketchup, brown sugar and prepared mustardshape into 1 inch meatballs. In a greased 9x13 inch pan, layer one third of meatballs into bottom of pan. Spoon half of egg mixture over meatballstop with another third of meatballs. Repeat layers. Bake for one hour in the preheated oven.

Spray baking pan with cooking sprayplace ham in pan. Combine all ingredients except ham in saucepanbring to a boilpour over ham. Bake at 350 for 1 1/2 hours. Remove ham from panplace on cutting boardslice thinly across the grainarrange on a serving platterdrizzle with remaining saucesprinkle with chives. Serve with rolls.

Spray pie plate with nonstick cooking spray. Line crust with plastic wrap. Fill with maraschino cherries. Cut back sides of plastic wrap to release air from crust. Freeze until firm. Layer ice cream into pie crust. Cover with chocolate magic shell topping. Decorate with peanut butter cups. Freeze until firm.

Place butter in a bowl and beat until soft. Add sugar and beat until fluffy. Add milk, flour, cocoa, bicarbonate of soda and almond meal. Beat for a few minutes. Add eggs one at a time, beating until mixed after each addition. Stir in almond essence. Pour into greased cake tin and bake in a preheated oven at 160 C (325 F) for 35 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from oven and cool in tin before removing from tin to a wire rack to cool completely. Cut into slices to serve.

In blender or food processor place yogurt, lemon juice, honey and olive oil. Blend well and set aside. Wash and dry spinach leaves, removing any tough stems. Combine the spinach leaves with cucumbers and onions in a large bowl. Toss well with yogurt dressing. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 days in an airtight container. Stir before serving.

In a large bowl combine the yeast and sugar and let it stand for 10 minutes. Add the warm water. Stir in the flour and salt. Knead the dough until smooth and elastic. Roll out the dough and place on a lightly floured surface. With a pizza cutter or sharp knife cut the dough into 8 wedges. Place the dough wedges on a lightly greased baking sheet. Cover the dough with a towel and let rise in a warm place for 20 minutes. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Bake the pizza crust for 10 minutes. Remove the crust from the oven and brush with the oil. Spread the pizza sauce over the crust. Sprinkle with the mozzarella and cheddar cheeses. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes until the cheese is melted and the crust is browned. Let the pizza cool for 5 minutes. Cut into 8 pieces.

In a sauce pan over low heat melt the cream cheese until melted and smooth. Add the cream of chicken soup and the wild rice mix stir until combined then add the broccoli carrot and almonds. Simmer over low heat until heated through then serve immediately.

Muddle mint leaves with the brown sugar until the leaves are pulverized. Add pineapple chunks. Muddle some more. Add the juice of one lime wedge to the mixture, then the rum and the pineapple juice. Stir well. Add ice cubes and stir again. Garnish with lime wedge.
Combine coconut cream, spring onion and red curry paste. Stir to combine. Add crabmeat. Season to taste with fish sauce. Add egg. Stir to combine. Serve with rice crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl cream together butter and brown sugar until smooth and fluffy. Beat in eggs. Add lemon juice and zest. Stir together flour and baking powder and add gradually to mixture and mix well. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheets and cool completely. To make icing beat together confectioners sugar and lemon juice until smooth and spread over cooled cookies. Dip cookies in chopped pecans if desired. Store in airtight container.

Combine seasoning mix in a small bowl. Rub all sides of corn with seasoning mix. Heat a grill to medium-high heat. Grill corn, turning frequently until charred and cooked through, about 20 minutes. When corn is cooked, remove from grill and wrap in foil. Rub top of each ear with softened butter. Slice the kernels off the ear with a sharp knife. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375. In small bowl, combine chicken, ham and cheese. Unroll crescentsseparate at perforations. Spoon 1 tablespoon chicken mixture in center of each triangle. Fold up sides to form a triangle. Press edges with fork to seal. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheet. Beat egg with waterbrush over tops. Bake 12 to 14 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350. Divide oatmeal into six 1/2 cup measures. Place a piece of ground beef into each measure. Place an olive-sized piece of onion into each meat patty. Place a raw egg into each meat patty. Form each into a round and place in a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake 20-25 minutes until no longer pink. Remove from oven and top each with barbecue sauce. Bake another 15 minutes. Makes 6 servings. Serve on hamburger buns.

Cut the celery and the olives into small pieces. Cut the bread into slices. Rub the butter over the slices. Cut the breasts into small pieces. Beat the eggs and the mayonnaise. Cut the cheddar into slices. Spread the mixture onto the bread slices. Add some celery and olives. Sprinkle with the onions and the cheddar slices. Roll the bread slices. Wrap the sandwiches and the salad dressing in plastic wrap and refrigerate. Cut the bread into slices. Rub the butter over the slices. Cut the breasts into small pieces. Beat the eggs and the mayonnaise. Cut the cheddar into slices. Spread the mixture onto the bread slices. Add some celery and olives. Sprinkle with the onions and the cheddar slices. Roll the bread slices. Wrap the sandwiches and the salad dressing in plastic wrap and refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Remove cauliflower from package. Place on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and roast 25 minutes. In small bowl mix cauliflower, mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, dried onion and sun-dried tomatoes. Spoon onto bread rounds. Garnish with fresh avocado. Sprinkle with sea salt and pepper. Serve.

Combine egg, milk & sour cream. Combine dry pancake mix with butter. Add liquid mixture to dry mixblend well. Pour 1/4 cup batter into each muffin cup or into waffle iron. Sprinkle bacon & cheese on each one. Bake at 400 degrees 5 minutes or until waffles are golden. Serve hot.

Cut onions into thin rings. Place chickens in a shallow dish. Spread onion rings over the chickens. In a bowl mix remaining ingredients. Pour over chickens. Refrigerate overnight. Bake at 400 degrees for one hour. Serve with a tomato salad and rolls.

Peel and slice potatoes into thin strips. Boil in lightly salted water until tender. Drain well and place in bowl with cherry tomatoes, onion and green peppers. Drizzle with oil and rice vinegar. Top with fresh udon noodles and sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Boil pasta according to package directions. Drain. In medium bowl combine ground beef and next 6 ingredients. Stir until well blended. Spread over pasta. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 375f degrees for 25 minutes or until cheese is melted. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve with vegetables and rolls.

In a large bowl mix together the eggs, milk, vanilla and powdered sugar. In a 9×13 baking dish spread the cubed bread and top with the raisins. Pour the egg mixture over the bread and raisins and bake for 40-45 minutes. Serve warm with maple syrup.

Beat egg whites in a clean metal or glass bowl until stiff peaks form. Combine sugar and cream of tartar in a small bowlstir into egg whites. Beat until stiff peaks form. Add nuts and vanillafold in. Divide mixture in half. Spread each half into a 9-by-13-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 250 degrees for 1 hour. Cool in pan for 15 minutes. In a double boiler or in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water, stir together the chocolate and shortening until smooth. Remove pan from heatstir in vanilla. Spread half of the chocolate over one cookie. Sprinkle with candy canes and nuts. Top with remaining cookie. Spread remaining chocolate over top cookie. Makes about 24 cookies.

Combine the milk and the cream in a saucepan and bring just to a boil. In a medium bowl, whisk the egg yolks and sugar. Gradually add the hot mixture to the yolks, whisking constantly. Whisk in the cornstarch and vanilla. Strain the mixture into a bowl and return to the saucepan. Cook over low heat just until thickened. Serve warm or chilled. Makes about 2 cups.

In saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup, water, and salt. Heat to boil. Cook for 3-5 minutes to thicken. Remove from heat. In large mixing bowl beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually beat in the hot syrup mixture. Return to saucepan. Heat to 110 degrees F. Add vanillaremove from heat. Beat until mixture thickens into soft marshmallow consistency. Quickly fold in nuts. Spread evenly into buttered 9x13 pan. Cut while hot into 12 squares. Cool completely. Store in tightly covered container.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add garlic and cook until aromatic. Add tomatoes, basil, oregano, red chili pepper flakes. Season with salt to taste. Add cooked rice and artichoke hearts. Mix until well incorporated. Transfer to a 2-quart baking dish. Top with feta cheese. Bake until browned on top. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

Heat olive oil in non-stick skillet over medium heat until hot. Beat eggs, cumin, salt and pepper in large bowl until well combined. Pour into skillet. Cook without stirring until eggs begin to set on bottom, then gently tilt skillet and continue cooking until top is set. Turn omelette out onto plate. Cut into 4 equal pieces. Spread 2 pieces of omelette evenly on bottom halves of hoagie rolls. Spread 1/3 cup salsa evenly over omelette on 4 bottom hoagie rolls. Top with remaining omelette pieces. Spread salsa evenly over remaining omelette pieces. Replace top halves of hoagie rolls. Wrap each sandwich securely in aluminum foil or plastic wrap. Store sandwiches in refrigerator up to 24 hours. Reheat sandwiches in microwave oven on high until hot, about 1 minute 30 seconds. Cut each sandwich in half on an angle to serve.

Mix the chicken with a fork in a bowl. Add the cheddar cheese. Stir to combine. Then add the marinade. Stir to combine. Place on a microwave safe plate or bowl. Microwave for 1 to 2 minutes. Spread the onion onto a plate. Grill on a preheated grill. Serve on a toasted bun with lettuce and tomato.

Melt margarine in a skillet, add onion, green pepper and squash. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and thyme to taste. Cook for 5 more minutes or until vegetables are tender. Serve hot or cold.
In a double boiler, melt together the chocolate chips and creamy peanut butter. Pour over Rice Chex. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Heat butter in a 12 inch skillet over medium heat. Add onion and shallotsaute until softened. Stir in thyme and bay leaf and cook for 1 minute. Add wine and water and bring to a boil. Add mussels and covercook for 2 minutes or until mussels open. Discard any that do not open. Remove mussels from skillet and keep warm. Boil wine mixture until reduced to 1 1/2 cups. Remove bay leaf and stir in creme fraiche and mussels. Stir in parsley and season with salt and pepper. Serve in shallow bowls.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water and let cool. Add lime gelatin mix and miniature marshmallows. Beat in cottage cheese and cool whip. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Top with crushed pineapple and shredded coconut. Chill overnight. Serve with a cherry garnish.

Peel the prawns and devein them. Heat the oil in a frying pan then saute the onion for one minute. Add the prawns, season with a little salt, pepper and red pepper, then fry them until they are done. Stir in the paprika then add the wine, a little more paprika and the garlic. Continue cooking until the wine is evaporated. Stir in the parsley just before serving. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Pound chicken breasts to about 1/2 inch thickness. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a skillet. Saute chicken until done. Remove from heat. Pour cream of chicken soup over chicken. Stir in sour cream. Add mushrooms and sherry. Top with paprika. Garnish with parsley. Serve over rice or pasta.

Mix the dressing with soy sauce. Marinate the chicken for at least 2 hours in the fridge or overnight. In a wok over medium heat add the olive oil, add the chicken and stir fry for 4-5 minutes then add the red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, green onions and garlic cook for another 3-4 minutes then add the Italian dressing mixture. Cook for 2 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve over rice.

Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes or until browned all over. Turn chicken over. Sprinkle chicken with mixed spice. Add onion to pan and cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Add tomatoes and zucchini to pan and cook for 2 minutes or until zucchini is tender. Stir in couscous and 1/2 cup stock powder. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 10 minutes or until stock has absorbed into couscous. Add parsley and lemon zest to couscous and toss to combine. Serve chicken on top of couscous.

In a large pot, bring potatoes and water to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife. Drain potatoes in a colander. Return potatoes to pot. Add sour cream and mash with a potato masher or with an electric mixer. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in green onions and spinach. Stir in cheddar cheese just before serving.

Boil ravioli until tender. Remove from water and set aside. In a saute pan, saute the garlic in olive oil. Add the beans and cook until just tender. Add tomatoes and saute until just tender. Add fresh spinach and cook until wilted. Season with thyme and black pepper. Remove ravioli from water and add to the pan. Heat through. Makes 4 servings. Serve with grated parmesan cheese.

In a large bowl, combine the cucumber and salt. Let stand 15 minutes. Drain and rinse the cucumber. Combine the vinegar, soy sauce and oil in a small bowl. Drain the cucumber again and add to the bowl. Add the sesame seeds. Add the pepper flakes. Mix well and refrigerate for one hour.

Heat oil in large pan. Add garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Add onion and saute until transparent. Add tomatoes and water. Season with seasoning salt and beef bouillon. Bring to boil. Add ground beef and simmer for 10 minutes. Add potatoes and continue cooking until beef and potatoes are tender. Serve with hot rice.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Coat large roasting pan with olive oil or cooking spray. Cut sprouts in half. Place in pan in a single layer. Bake 20 - 25 minutes or until sprouts are tender and lightly browned. Toss sprouts with butter, garlic, parmesan cheese, salt, pepper. Serve warm.

Cook fries according to package directions. While fries cook, combine steak seasoning and cheddar cheese in a small bowl. Add green onions and bacon bits. Stir to blend. Remove fries from oven and place in a shallow dish. Pour cheddar cheese mixture over the fries and stir to combine. Bake for an additional 5 minutes.

Combine chocolate almond bark, German chocolate and semi-sweet chocolate chips in a microwave safe bowl. Heat in 15 second intervals in microwave stirring each time until melted. Pour mixture in crock pot. Stir in the peanuts and almonds. Cook for 3 hours or until melted and nuts are coated. Stir occasionally. Remove and let stand for 1 hour or until firm. Cut into squares. Keep refrigerated.
Mix all ingredients except pecans well. Shape mixture into a ball. Roll ball in pecans and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350f. Rub cornish hen with curry powder inside and out. In small saucepan over medium-high heat combine jam, chutney, broth, lime juice, curry powder, salt and pepper. Simmer until thickened. Remove from heat. Place hen in a baking dish. Baste hen with glaze. Bake 45 minutes. Serve garnished with green onions and peanuts.

Saute onion in olive oil. Add tomato sauce, soup, bay leaf, celery seed, italian seasoning, and simmer until thickened, about 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Place spaghetti in bottom of 9x13 inch baking dish. Top spaghetti with tomato sauce mixture. Arrange the chops over the top of the spaghetti mixture. Cover and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until chops are done, about 30 minutes.
Pour light rum and lime juice into a glass filled with ice cubes. Stir in the curacao and orgeat syrup. Add dark rum and maraschino cherry. Stir and serve.

Mix together all of the above ingredients. Place wings in a greased baking pan and pour over sauce. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Flip wings over and bake an additional 1 hour until wings are cooked through.

Heat the beef broth to a boil. Lay the rye bread slices flat onto a plate or tray. Pour the hot beef broth over each slice until it is soaked through, about 5 seconds. Lay the slices on a baking sheet lined with paper towels and sprinkle lightly with salt. Set aside for 10 minutes or until the slices are soft. Meanwhile, spread the mustard evenly over the slices. Arrange the slices in a single layer in a baking dish or shallow casserole dish. Layer with the pastrami slices, pickles, and the Havarti slices. Bake for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the pastrami is heated through. Serve on the rye bread slices.

Boil potatoes until tender. Peel and mash. Heat oil and fry bacon till crisp. Add onions and fry until browned. Add to mashed potatoes. Combine with buttermilk and season to taste with salt and pepper. Mash again until smooth. Garnish with chopped parsley. Serve with steaks or any other meat.

Cut the avocado in half and remove the pit. Scoop out the avocado flesh and place in a bowl. Mash together the avocado and cream cheese. Mix in the lime juice and cumin. Stir in the garlic powder. Season with salt. Spoon the mixture into the avocado halves. Sprinkle the tops with the mozzarella cheese and bacon bits. Bake until the cheese is melted and the avocados are heated through. Serve with lime wedges.

Place pie crusts on cookie sheet. Divide tomatoes and basil between the two pies. In a bowl combine mayonnaise and crackers. Spread over tomatoes and basil. Bake for 12 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan and bacon bits. Bake for another 12 minutes. Sprinkle with black pepper.

Rinse the beans well under cold water. Drain the beans, but do not remove the water that remains in the pot. Place the beans in the pot with the water and bring to a boil. Cook at low heat for 1 hour or until beans are tender. In a large frying pan or Dutch oven heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and saute until lightly browned. Stir in the chili powder, cumin, salt, and cayenne pepper. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Drain the beans well and place in a large bowl. Stir in the sauteed onion mixture and the oregano. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 425. Grease muffin cups. Beat together sugar and cream cheese until smooth. Add milk and oil. Beat in egg. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Stir into creamed mixture. Fold in miniature chocolate chips. Fill prepared muffin cups three-fourths full. Bake for 18 to 22 minutes or until muffins spring back when lightly touched. Cool in pans for 5 minutes. Remove muffins from pans and cool completely on a wire rack.

In a small saucepan, combine lemon zest, cloves, bay leaf, cinnamon, allspice, black peppercorns and 1/2 cup of water. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and let cool. Remove zest and bay leaf. Strain lemon mixture into a small container. Stir in 1/4 cup of lemon juice. Add 2 tablespoons of the oil. Stir until well blended. Repeat until all of the oil is added. Store the oil in the refrigerator. Makes 1/2 cup.
Mix together cauliflower, imitation crabmeat and miracle whip. Stir in frozen peas and celery. Chill.

Preheat oven to 450. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. Mix together 1/2 cup flour, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. In a separate bowl, beat together 1 egg, 1/2 cup buttermilk, 1/4 cup milk, 1/2 cup butter, 1/2 teaspoon sugar, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg, 1/2 teaspoon ginger. Slowly mix in the dry ingredients. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown. Serve warm. Makes 12 servings.

In 10" skillet, brown kielbasa in oil until done. Add onion and bell pepper and cook until tender. Add salsa and water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in Spanish rice. Heat through. Sprinkle with pepper.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. For crust, mix flour and salt in a bowl. Cut in butter with a pastry blender or your fingertips. Add water 1 tablespoon at a time just until dough holds together. Divide dough in halfform each half into a disk. Wrap in plasticrefrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight. For filling, combine apples and cranberries in a large bowl. Add brown sugar and flour. Toss to blend. In a separate bowl, combine butter and cinnamon. Add to fruit mixturetoss gently to combine. Pour fruit mixture into prepared pie shell. Top with second crustseal and crimp edges. Cut slits in top crust. Brush top with milk. Bake for 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Cool on a wire rack.
Brown chorizo sausage. Warm buns. Cut hot dogs in half. Warm onion slices. Add salsa to taste. Put chorizo sausage into bun. Add cheese. Put onion on top.

Cook sausage in a skillet over medium heat until cooked through. Drain off fat. Add vegetable soup and water and stir well. Cut baking mix into pieces. Spray 9 in. pie plate with cooking spray. Unroll crescent rolls and press into pie plate. Mix eggs and milk with sausage mixture. Add swiss cheese and baking mix to sausage mixture. Pour into pie plate. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting.

Heat 1 teaspoon oil in large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add prosciutto to pancook 45 seconds or until crisp. Remove from pan with slotted spoonset aside. Add remaining oil to pan. Sprinkle tilapia fillets with sage leaves and salt. Place fillets in pan. Cook 2 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove fish from pan. Divide prosciutto among four plates. Top with fish and any pan juices. Serve with lemon wedges.

Melt butter over medium heat. Saute onion flakes until they are brown. Add flour and stir. Add tomatoes and bring to a boil. Add green chili pepper and cilantro. Add a little bit of water at a time until it is the consistency you would like. Season to taste with salt. Serve with rice or tortillas.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease an 8 x 8 baking dish. In a blender or food processor, combine all ingredients except the chocolate chips. Blend until smooth. Stir in the chocolate chips. Spread the batter in the prepared baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until the top is dry and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for at least an hour. Cut into bars.
Peel apples. Cut into chunks. Put in blender. Add sugar. Blend until smooth. Stir in apple juice and food coloring. Pour into freezer safe container. Freeze until slushy.

Put soup in large bowl and add vermouth. Add chicken and mushrooms. Spread mixture in a casserole dish. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes. Sprinkle top with artichoke hearts and bake 15 more minutes. Serve on buns or noodles.

Drain and rinse pork chops. In a shallow dish mix together the seasoning salt and pepper. Dip pork chops into the seasoned flour, coating thoroughly. Heat oil in skillet over med heat. Add pork chops. Brown on both sides. Add onions and cook for 3 minutes. Pour off fat and any onions not cooked. Stir together ketchup and water. Pour over pork chops. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Uncover and continue cooking until pork is no longer pink. Serve over rice.
