In a large saucepan, cook the ground beef and onion until beef is browned. Drain beef and onions. Add refried beans to saucepan and heat through. In a small bowl combine cheese and picante sauce. In a large bowl combine beef mixture, chili powder and cumin. Add cheese mixture and mix well. Place about 1 teaspoonful of meat mixture into the center of each wonton skin. Brush edges of wonton skins with water. Fold skins over filling and press edges to seal. In a large skillet or wok, heat oil over medium heat. Add wontons and cook until golden brown, turning once or twice.

Heat large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add oil. Add red onion, bell pepper, and mushrooms. Saute until softened about 3-4 minutes. Add scallops. Saute until cooked through about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove scallops from pan with slotted spoon and place on serving platter. Top with mango salsa, sour cream and green onions. Garnish with lime wedges if desired. Serve with tortilla chips, if desired. Serves 2-3 as an entree or appetizer for 4-5.

Bake squash for 45 minutes in the oven at 350 degrees f. Cool slightly. Slice in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds. In a skillet, saute onion in oil until tender. Add carrot and cook for 2 more minutes. Combine the squash with the onion mixture and the soup. Add the stuffing mix. Spoon into baked squash halves. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees f. Top with sour cream before serving.

Combine mayonnaise, yogurt, basil, scallion, garlic clove, vinegar and salt in small bowl. Set aside. In a large saucepan of boiling salted water, cook pasta shells until al dente or until desired doneness, drain immediately and rinse with cold waterset aside. In a small bowl combine 1 tablespoon vinegar and cornstarchstir until smooth. In a large skillet heat oil over medium heatadd shrimp, 1 teaspoon vinegar mixture and salt. Cook until shrimp is just opaque, about 2 minutestransfer shrimp to a large bowl. Add 1 tablespoon vinegar mixture to shrimpstir in pasta shells. Stir in yogurt mixtureseason with salt and pepper. Serve with avocado slices and lime wedges.

Prepare potatoes according to package instructions, but do not drain the liquid. Add remaining ingredients to potatoes and mix well. Place potato mixture into greased 2 quart casserole dish. Bake at 350F degrees for 1 hour or until hot and bubbly. Garnish with cheddar cheese before serving.

Boil water in a large pot for the pasta. Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until it is softened, stirring occasionally. Stir in the garlic and cook for 30 seconds to 1 minute more or until fragrant, stirring constantly. In the large pot of boiling water, add the linguine and cook for 1 minute less than the package directions for al dente pasta. Drain the pasta well. Pour the linguine into the skillet with the garlic and onion mixture. Stir to combine. Turn the heat up to medium-high and add the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Add the parsley and toss for 30 seconds to 1 minute more or until the pasta is well coated with the oil mixture and the parsley is wilted. Sprinkle the parmesan over the pasta. Toss again to combine. Serve immediately, season to taste with the salt and pepper, and serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the crabmeat and parsley and continue to saute over medium heat until the crabmeat is lightly browned and moisture evaporates. Cool the crab mixture completely. Combine the breadcrumbs and 1/2 cup of the Parmesan cheese in a bowl and set aside. Season the snapper with the lemon thyme, 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Coat the snapper evenly with the breadcrumb mixture. Pour the cream into a shallow bowl. Dip each snapper in the cream and then dredge in the remaining breadcrumb mixture. Place the stuffed snapper on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Serve with the lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place oven rack in center of oven. Prepare fish fillets by cutting them into 1-inch cubes. Toss fillets in mayonnaise. Combine salsa and seasoning salt. Spoon a portion of salsa onto each fillet. Bake fillets until they are firm and flake easily. Garnish each fillet with a small slice of cheese. Serve with crackers.

Prepare popcorn in a large pot. While the popcorn is popping, mix the sugar and baking soda together in a small bowl. Once the popcorn is finished popping, dump it into a large bowl. Pour the butter and sugar mixture over the popcorn and toss until evenly coated. Pour the brown sugar and light corn syrup into a large saucepan and stir over low heat until the sugar has completely dissolved. Add the popcorn and toss to combine. Pour in the bourbon and toss to combine. Sprinkle the salt and bourbon over the popcorn. Transfer to a baking sheet and let cool. Store in an airtight container.

Combine powdered sugar and white sugar. Cut in shortening or margarine and egg. Beat well. Sift together flour, salt and baking soda and add to sugar mixture. Stir until well blended and form dough into a ball. Knead lightly and roll dough 1/4" thick on a floured board. Cut dough with floured cookie cutters and place cutouts 1" apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 for 7-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 1 minute and remove from baking sheets to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 4-5 dozen depending on size of cutouts. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for 1 week or freeze up to 3 months.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook elbow macaroni until al dente but still firm to the bite, about 7 minutes. Drain well and return to the pot. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt butter and stir in flour, salt and milk until smooth and thickened, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in Velveeta and stir until melted and smooth. Pour mixture over pasta and toss until all the pasta is evenly coated. Transfer pasta to a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate or casserole dish and top with shredded cheese. Bake until the cheese is bubbling and browned on top, about 25 minutes. Cool for at least 10 minutes before serving.

Melt butter in a 9x13 baking dish. Add ramen noodles. Toss in walnuts. Bake at 350 degrees for 5 minutes. Toss in broccoli and bake for 5 more minutes. Add lettuce and green onions and toss. Combine sugar and soy sauce. Add 1/4 cup water. Cook until thickened. Pour over salad and toss. Chill.

Whisk together flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. Beat together the egg and milk. Melt the butter. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Combine the flour mixture with the milk mixture. Stir in the melted butter. Cook the pancakes in skillet. Cook for about a minute on the first side. Flip the pancake over. Cook the other side. Serve hot.

In a small saucepan, combine sugar, cocoa and salt. Add milk and butter and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter and quick oatmeal. Press into a greased 9x13 pan and chill for about an hour. Cut into squares and store in the refrigerator.

Crush cookies. Add cream cheese and margarine. Beat till smooth. Add powdered sugar and mix well. Add milk to vanilla pudding and beat well. Add to crushed cookie mixture. Fold in whipped topping until mixed well. Chill overnight.

In a microwave safe bowl combine sugar, cocoa, water and marshmallowsmicrowave for 30 seconds. Stir until marshmallows are melted and mixture is smooth. Cool slightly. In a separate bowl combine cake mix and vegetable oil until crumbly. Press half of mixture evenly into bottom of greased 9x13 baking dish. Spread cooled marshmallow mixture over crumbly mixture. Sprinkle pecans over marshmallow layer. Press remaining cake mix over nuts. Bake 35-40 minutes or until set. Cool. Cut into squares to serve.

Preheat oven to 400f. Toss wings in soy sauce mixture. Place wings in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 40 minutes. In a small bowl mix honey and bbq sauce. Remove wings from oven. Turn wings over. Bake for 10 more minutes. Remove from oven. Toss wings in honey mixture. Broil for 5 more minutes. Turn wings over. Broil 5 more minutes or until wings are browned.

In a large stock pot saute the onion in oil until tender. Add the salt and stir. Add the cinnamon, tomatoes with the juice and vinegar. Add the allspice and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the pickled peppers. Ladle the chili sauce over hot dogs or hamburgers.

In a large pot heat up the oil over medium heat. Add onions and bell pepper and cook for about 10 minutes until the vegetables are softened. Then add garlic and cook for another minute or two. Then add tomatoes and cook until tomatoes are softened for about another 10 minutes or so. Then add shrimp and cook for about another 10 minutes until shrimp is cooked. Then add coconut milk, tomato paste, and lemon juice. Stir well and let cook for a few minutes more. Serve warm over rice with cilantro on top.
Combine all ingredients in small bowl. Taste and adjust seasonings to taste. Keep refrigerated until needed. Brush glaze over steaks and meats while grilling.

Combine sugar and cinnamon in a small bowlset aside. In a large bowl, combine cereal and raisins. In a medium bowl, combine the butter, peanut butter and vanillamix well. Blend in the sugar mixturemix well. Press mixture firmly into a 9-inch square baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 1 hour in pan on a wire rack. Cut into squares. Yield: 16 servings (2 cookies).

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Cook macaroni and drain. Melt butter in saucepan. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually stir in milk. Cook over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Stir in cheddar and velveeta and continue cooking for 2 minutes. Stir in macaroni. Add pepper and salt to taste. Sprinkle with additional shredded cheese if desired.

Split bread horizontally. Top bottom half with tomato and cheese. Place top half on top. Cook butter and basil on medium heat until butter is melted. Add salt and pepper. Spread on top slice. Broil until cheese is melted.

Heat the oven to 300f. Peel the onions and cut off the root ends. Quarter the onions. In a large bowl, combine the onions with the olive oil and vinegar. Cover the bowl and place it in the oven to roast for 45 minutes. When the onions are soft and roasted, remove the bowl from the oven. Stir in the sherry. Add the thyme and season the onions with salt and pepper. Remove the thyme sprigs before serving. Serves 4.

Fry bacon. Remove bacon from pan and crumble into a separate bowl. Add onion and saute until tender. In a separate bowl, combine rice and water. Bring to a boil in a saucepan. Add tomatoes, bacon, green pepper and jalapeno peppers. Cover and simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Fluff rice with a fork. Add seasoning to taste. Sprinkle bacon over top.
In a blender, combine water, sugar and rosemary. Blend well, about 2 minutes. Add lime juice and ice cube. Blend for an additional minute or two. Pour into glass and garnish with lime slice.
Preheat broiler. Combine butter, salt, and pepperadd onion slices. Broil 12 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with cheese. Broil 1 minute. Makes 4 servings.

Cut steak into pieces about 1 inch thick. Heat oil in large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook 3 to 4 minutes, stirring often. Remove from heatstir in soup and gravy mix. Spoon steak mixture over biscuits. Garnish with parsley if desired. Serve with fresh fruit.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. In a large bowl or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat together sugar and oil until light and fluffy. Add vanilla extract and then add in the flour mixture. Beat until just combined. Add in the soymilk and mix until smooth. Fold in the chocolate chips. Pour batter into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Cool completely before cutting.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a large bowl, combine self-rising flour, milk, egg and sugar. Add enough milk to make a thin batter. Dip 1/4-inch thick slices of papaya into the batter and coat well. Heat 1/2-inch of oil in a deep skillet over medium high heat until a deep-fat thermometer registers 350 degrees. Carefully place as many pieces of papaya as you can into the hot oil. Cook 1-2 minutes per side or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Continue with remaining papaya. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Combine soy sauce, vinegar, ginger and garlic in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil and remove from heat. In another small saucepan combine chili sauce, sugar and sesame oil. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Combine chili sauce mixture with soy sauce mixture. Pour 1/4 cup sauce into a small dish. Place steaks in dish and turn several times. Remove steaks and place on grill. Cook 2 minutes per side for medium rare. Remove from grill and let sit for 5 minutes. Cut steaks on the diagonal against the grain. Serve with scallions and toasted sesame seeds.

Melt butter and shortening in a large pan. Stir in sugars and salt until dissolved. Add cocoa and mix well. Add sour cream. Heat to boiling. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and walnuts. Spread into a buttered 9" x 13" pan. Chill until firm. Cut into squares.

Combine the garlic cloves with the dark soy sauce in a bowl. Add the palm sugar and mix well. Heat the oil in a frying pan over high heat until it is almost smoking. Add the steak, sprinkle with the spring onions and fry for 1 minute. Pour the wine over the steak and stir. Reduce the heat to low and pour over the dark soy mixture. Fry for 3 minutes more. Turn the steak over and fry for another 3 minutes. Sprinkle with the pepper. Serve the steak immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. Beat together the flour, baking powder, cinnamon and 1/2 cup of the raw sugar in a large bowl. Beat together the butter and the remaining 1/2 cup of sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg yolks, one at a time. Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold the flour mixture into the egg yolk mixture with a spatula until just combined. Stir in the cinnamon chips. Fold in the egg whites until just combined. Divide the batter among the muffin cups. Bake until the cakes test done, 15-18 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the sour cream and remaining 1/4 cup of raw sugar in another bowl. Spread the mixture over the cakes while they are still warm in the pan. Cool the cakes in the pan on a rack for 20 minutes before serving. Top with the fruit of your choice or serve as is. Makes 12

Slice lamb shoulder into 1/4 inch thick steaks. In a small bowl combine soy and oyster sauces. In a skillet cook lamb steaks in soy sauce mixture over medium heat until no pink remains. Sprinkle with green onion slices. Makes 4 servings.

Prepare the cake mix according to package directions for a 9x13 pan. Pour half of batter into greased 9x13 pan. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Spread mandarin oranges over hot cake. In a mixing bowl beat eggs and add the oil and cool whip. Pour over oranges and spread to cover top of oranges. Sprinkle with crushed pineapple. Pour remaining batter over pineapple and oranges and sprinkle with coconut. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes or until done.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to package directions. Drain. In a small skillet heat margarine over medium heat. Stir in the garlic. Cook 2 minutes. Add asparagus, basil, thyme, salt and pepper. Cook until the asparagus is crisp tender, about 3 minutes. Mix the pasta with the asparagus mixture. Serve with roasted red peppers.

In a large bowl stir together the rolled oats, orange zest, cinnamon and dried cherries. In a microwave safe bowl combine the skim milk and brown sugar. Stir until the brown sugar dissolves. Pour over the oats and stir. Microwave for an additional 2 minutes or until the oats are tender and the milk is absorbed. Pour into bowls and add a dollop of cream. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve warm.

Grease a 9x13x2 inch pan and preheat the oven to 375. In a medium bowl combine cake mix, pudding mix and walnuts. Cut in the cold butter. In another medium bowl whisk together the eggs, oil and water. Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and mix until combined. Spread into the pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until a pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack. In a small bowl combine the apples, raisins and granulated sugar. In a small bowl combine the icing sugar and milk. Spread the icing over the cake. Refrigerate overnight. Cut into squares.

Combine turkey with soup. Place in 9x13 baking dish. Combine soup mix and sour cream. Top turkey mixture. Combine onion soup mix and French style green beans. Top turkey mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

In large skillet, saute mushrooms in butter till lightly browned. Add wine, worcestershire, garlic, dill, and pepper. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Add bouillon cubes, water, and simmer till liquid is almost evaporated. Stir in cream and cook until heated through. Stir in parsley. Serve over hot cooked noodles or rice. Serve hot.

Cook and drain pasta in boiling water. Add milk and dry mustard, cook and stir until thickened, 5 to 6 minutes. Stir in macaroni mixture and cheesepour over hot frankfurters and bake at 350 degrees f for 35 minutes or until bubbly and topping is golden brown. Cool slightly, serve with lettuce if desired.

Cut cauliflower into florets. Steam cauliflower florets until crisp tender, about 5 minutes. Drain. Combine mayonnaise, dried onion, prepared mustard, and cheese. Add cauliflower. Mix to coat. Serve at room temperature.

Toast the English muffin. Place on a plate. Crack an egg on top of the English muffin and sprinkle with a little salt and pepper. Heat in a microwave until cooked. Cut the cheese into small cubes and arrange on top of the egg. Top with the bacon and serve.

Heat oil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onioncook until softened but not browned, about 3 minutes. Add garliccook until fragrant but not browned, about 30 seconds. Add macaroni and cook until lightly toasted, about 2 minutes. Add butter, eggs, milk, hot sauce, kosher salt, fresh black pepper, dry mustard and sharp cheddar cheesecook until sauce has thickened slightly and is bubbling around edges of pan, about 2 minutes. Serve with crackers and more hot sauce.

In a saucepan bring water and apple juice to boil. Add oats and cover. Cook for 25 minutes or until water is absorbed. Add dried apples and ground cinnamon. Cook for an additional minute. Serve with maple syrup and flax seed oil. Top with walnuts.

Preheat oven to 400f. Coat baking dish with cooking spray and set aside. In a bowl, toss carrots with bacon, butter and brown sugar and spread in baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and top with green onions. Bake for about 15 minutes or until carrots are tender and top is browned and crisp.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Brush olive oil on chicken breasts and season with salt and pepper. Place in a baking dish. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain, rinse with cold water and set aside. Cut chicken breasts into chunks. Combine with pasta in a baking dish. Stir in artichoke hearts, tomatoes, cream, pesto sauce and cheese. Bake for 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.
Blend together bananas, strawberries, orange juice and ice cream. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 400 F. Lightly grease cookie sheets or line with parchment paper. Cream butter and sugars in large bowl until blended. Beat in eggs and vanilla until smooth. Blend in baking soda and salt. Stir in flour just until blended. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts if desired. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutesremove to wire racks to cool completely.

Combine lemon juice, water and seasoning salt in a large ziploc bag. Add the ribs. Close the bag tightly. Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. When ready to grill, preheat the grill to medium high. Remove the ribs from the bag. Discard the juice. Place the ribs on the grill. Grill 10 minutes or until meat is no longer pink. Brush on the barbecue sauce. Turn the ribs over. Grill an additional 10 minutes. Turn again. Brush on barbecue sauce. Grill until meat is tender. Serve on hamburger buns with coleslaw.

Mix cream cheese and gelatin in large bowl until smooth and creamy. Blend in splenda and vanilla. Beat on medium speed until fluffy and smooth, scraping down sides of bowl occasionally. Divide equally into four 8 ounce ramekins or custard cups. Refrigerate for 3 hours or until firm. Unmold and garnish with raspberries or strawberries. Yields 4 servings of low carb no bake cheesecake.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour an 8-inch square baking pan. Set aside. In a medium mixing bowl combine yellow cake mix and vegetable oil until well moistened. Add water and egg and mix well. Pour into baking pan and bake for 20 minutes or until the edges start to brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and cool completely in pan on wire rack. To make the caramel layer, melt caramel ice cream topping in a microwave safe bowl for 20-30 seconds. Spread over top of the yellow cake layer and cool completely. To make the white chocolate layer, let cookie dough stand at room temperature for 10 minutes or until soft enough to stir. In a small bowl combine all the cookie dough ingredients and stir until well combined. Spread over the caramel layer and cool completely in the pan. To make the ganache layer, melt chocolate chips in a microwave safe bowl for 1 minute. Stir and continue to microwave for

In a medium nonstick skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook until they begin to brown around the edges. Add the soy sauce and cook until the mushrooms are very tender and the liquid is absorbed, 10-15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. In a large pot of boiling water, cook the ramen for 2 minutes. Drain in a colander and rinse under cold water. Place the noodles in a large bowl. Add the mushrooms and toss. Sprinkle with the parsley.

Cut sourdough bread into 1/2 inch thick slices. Spread a layer of ricotta cheese onto each slice of bread. Top each slice of bread with mozzarella cheese and a few slices of green pepper and red pepper. Top the sandwiches with parmesan cheese and ground cumin. Broil in oven for 1-2 minutes until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown. Serve with garlic spread for a little extra flavor.

Mix soup, water, stuffing mix and garlic powder. Pour half of mixture over frozen vegetables. Arrange pork chops on top of vegetables. Pour remainder of soup mixture over top. Cover with foil. Bake at 350 for one hour. Remove foil. Sprinkle with seasoning salt. Bake additional 20 minutes. Serve over rice.

To make the peanut sauce, combine the peanut butter, soy sauce, water, lime juice and brown sugar in a bowl. Stir well, then pour into a shallow serving dish. Cut the chicken into bite-size pieces, add the rice to a medium bowl, toss with 1 tablespoon of the peanut sauce, then place in a shallow serving dish. Slice the mangoes and papayas into thin strips and place in separate serving dishes. Place the iceberg lettuce leaves on a platter or into serving bowls and arrange the chicken, rice, mangoes, papayas and peanuts on top. Serve with the remaining peanut sauce on the side for dipping.

Combine egg and milk in a small bowl. Place flour and breadcrumbs on two separate plates. Dust pork with flour, shaking off excess. Dip in egg mixturethen coat with breadcrumbs, pressing to adhere. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add porkcook 10 minutes on each side or until done. Remove pork from skilletkeep warm. Add spaghetti sauce to skilletheat through. Return pork to skillettop with cheese. Broil 3 inches from heat 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve with spaghetti.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Spray a 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups flour with baking powder and salt. In another bowl, combine egg, brown sugar and 1/4 cup granulated sugar. Beat with a mixer until combined. Stir together all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, egg, brown sugar, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, fat-free sour cream, buttermilk and butter until just combinedfold in blackberries. Divide batter evenly among cups. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Makes 12 muffins. Serves 2 to 3.
Combine mayonnaise, jalapeno juice, jalapenos, and next 4 ingredients. Serve with tortilla chips. Yield: 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a small bowl, stir together the onion, sausage, cheeses and mushrooms. Unroll the dough. Separate into 12 triangles. Layer the bottom of the pan with 10 dough triangles. Place 2 triangles on each side. Place the remaining 4 triangles on top. Spread with the cheese mixture. Beat the eggs, salt and pepper. Pour over the cheese mixture. Bake for 45 minutes or until the eggs are set.

In a large bowl or in a bread machine combine yeast and warm water. Add sugar. Mix and let stand for 10 minutes. Add flour and salt. Mix in bread machine. Knead for 3 minutes. Add oil and milk. Knead for 1 minute. Let rest in oiled bowl for 1 hour. Punch down and form into 2 loaves. Let rise in a warm place for 20 minutes. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from pans and cool completely before slicing. To prepare this recipe in a bread machine, follow the manufacturer s instructions for white bread. Add 1/2 cup of flour and the salt to the yeast and liquid in the bread machine. Let stand for 10 minutes. Continue as directed in the recipe.

Heat oil in a large soup pot. Add onions and saut for 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add chestnuts. Pour in the chicken stock. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add chorizo. Cook for another 5 minutes. Stir in the parsley. Taste for seasoning. Serve hot.
Combine cream cheese and cheddar cheese and mix well. Add ranch dressing mix and mix well. Add chopped pecans and mix well. Press into a ball shape and refrigerate. Serve with crackers.

Line an 8 inch square pan with aluminum foil, allowing a couple inches of overhang on all sides. In a large bowl combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press crumb mixture onto bottom of pan and up sides to form crust. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool completely. Beat cream cheese until fluffy and smooth with mixer. Beat in sugar until well mixed. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition and scraping down sides of bowl as needed. Beat in strawberry jam and strawberries, folding in gently until just combined. Pour filling over crust and spread evenly. Place in refrigerator for several hours or overnight to set. Run knife along sides of pan to loosen the filling. Lift out of pan using foil handles and place on a serving plate or cutting board. Cut into bars with a sharp knife and dust with powdered sugar. Serve and enjoy.

Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar and beat until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Fold in pecans. Pour into pie crust. Bake 55-60 minutes. Let cool. Beat eggs and corn syrup until frothy. Add milk. Pour over pie. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake 15 minutes more. Let cool.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. With a paring knife, cut a 2 inch slit in each lemon half. Stuff the lemon halves with garlic cloves. Brush the cavities and the outsides of the lemons with the olive oil. Season the chicken inside and out with salt and pepper. Tie the legs together with kitchen twine. Place the lemons, breast side up, in a large roasting pan. Place the chicken breast side down over the lemons. Pour the wine around the chicken. Cover the pan with aluminum foil and roast for 1 hour. Remove the foil and roast for about 1 hour longer, until the skin is brown and crisp. Serve the chicken with the lemon halves. Serves 6-8.

Combine sugar and water in a saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add corn syrup and butter. Stir until smooth and creamy. Add popped corn and stir until completely combined. Pour mixture onto a sheet of wax paper or aluminum foil. Spread evenly and allow it to cool completely. Once completely cooled, use your hands to roll mixture into balls. Roll each ball in sugar and place on a baking sheet. Allow to set for an hour or until firm. Store in airtight container.
Place deep dish pie shells in pie plate. Blend pumpkin, eggs, sugar, spices together well in bowl. Pour into pie shells. Bake at 350f degrees for 50 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

In a medium bowl stir together the sugar and 2 cups of the water. Let stand for 5 minutes, until sugar is completely dissolved. In a medium saucepan bring the remaining 2 cups of water to a boil over high heat. Gradually stir 1/2 cup of the boiling water into the sugar mixture. Stirring constantly, add the tofu, chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon, and chili powder to the sugar mixture. Continue to stir until the mixture is smooth. Pour the tofu mixture into the saucepan with the remaining boiling water. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until the mixture comes to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan and cook for 1 minute more. Remove from the heat and let stand for 5 minutes to thicken slightly. Spoon into 4 bowls and garnish with chocolate shavings. Serve warm.

Peel apples, cut in half crosswise. Remove cores. Cut each half into 6 wedges. Arrange apple wedges in single layer in a large shallow bowl. In a small bowl whisk together lemon juice, sugar, cinnamon, eggs, potato starch, and kosher salt. Pour lemon mixture over applestoss gently. Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, place apple mixture into skillet. Cook until golden brown on each side, about 3 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

Cut biscuits into fourths. Arrange in the bottom of an 8x8 baking dish. Pour apple pie filling over the biscuits. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar mixture. Bake for about 25 minutes until biscuits are golden brown and apples are tender. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

Melt butter in heavy skillet over medium heat and stir in green onions and garlic. Cook about 1 minute. Add parsley and stir until wilted. Cool slightly and stir in cream and vermouth. Heat through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside for snails. Boil snails in water with onion and garlic for about 1 hour or until tender. Drain and cool. Cut into quarters lengthwise and remove snail from shells with tip of sharp knife. Slice mushroom caps. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of butter sauce into each mushroom cap. Top with snail and sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

In medium saucepan over high heat, saute shallot, ginger and garlic until fragrant. Add broth and coconut milkbring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add cilantro and lemon juice and stir until blended. Ladle into bowls and top with chili sauce and soy sauce. Garnish with fresh spinach leaves. Serves 2-4

Place pork loin in the refrigerator for 8 hours before cooking. Prepare dry rub seasonings and rub over the loin, patting it into the meat. Wrap loin tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 24 hours before cooking. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Heat a grill pan or griddle over high heat for 2 minutes. Sear the pork loin 2 minutes per side. Cook loin in the oven for 1 1/2 hours. During the last 30 minutes of cooking time, baste the loin with honey every 10 minutes. While pork is cooking, slice figs into wedges. Chop basil and pine nuts. After the pork has cooked for the allotted time, remove it from the oven. Slice the pork loin into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Lay each slice of meat flat. Spread 1 teaspoon feta cheese onto each slice. Place 2 pine nuts, 2 basil leaves and 2 fig wedges onto

In a large bowl or the bowl of an electric mixer, combine the flour, baking powder and salt. In another bowl, beat the sugar and instant coffee granules together. Add the egg, milk and coffee liqueurbeat well. Add the flour mixture and beat just until the ingredients are combined. Spoon the batter into a greased 12 cup muffin pan. Bake at 375 degrees F for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Let cool in the pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Dip the muffins in the whiskey-coffee mixture and serve.

Combine all ingredients in medium sauce pan. Cook and stir constantly over medium-low heat until mixture comes to boiling. Boil and stir 3 minutes. Cool slightly. Pour into freezer container. Freeze 4 hours or overnight. Beat every hour with electric beater until smooth and creamy. Makes 2 quarts.

In large saucepan combine sugar, corn syrup, and water. Stir over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Cook without stirring until temperature reaches 260f. Remove from heat. Add peanuts. Stir to coat. Pour onto cookie sheet. Let sit. When mixture begins to harden break into pieces.

Cook macaroni in boiling salted water for 8-10 minutes. Drain. Melt butter. Add flour and stir over heat for 2-3 minutes. Add milk. Add macaroni. Stir well. Add cheese. Add black pepper. Spoon into ovenproof dish. Sprinkle with fresh breadcrumb. Bake at 180c for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

In a pot over high heat, add in the vegetable oil. Once the oil is hot add in the spaghetti sauce. Let it simmer for 5 minutes. Cook the potatoes until they are soft. Fry the cheese curds until they are golden brown.

In a large bowl combine butter and condensed milk. Beat at medium speed until smooth. Add flour to butter mixture, 1 cup at a time. Beat at low speed until dough forms. Press into a 9" x 13" baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with nuts. Cool. Cut into bars. Makes 48 servings.
Brown the meat in a large pot. Add tomatoes and green chilies. Add taco seasoning. Simmer for 15 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Prepare a hot grill. Trim fat and gristle from steak and cut into 1-inch cubes. Whisk together oil, vinegar, soy sauce, thyme, garlic and black pepper until well blended. Toss steak with marinade and place in shallow dish or large zip-top bag. Refrigerate for 2 hours turning steak occasionally. Remove steak from marinade and reserve marinade. Place steak on grill and cook until desired doneness. Turn occasionally and baste with marinade while cooking. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute until golden. Add the zucchini and mushrooms and cook for 8 to 10 minutes until they are lightly browned and tender. Add the sun-dried tomato, the vegetable broth, and the basil. Cook for 5 minutes until the mixture is thickened and the mushrooms are completely tender. Season the mixture with salt and fresh ground pepper. Serve warm.

Combine first 7 ingredients and chill. Serve on pita bread or any other bread of your choice. Serve with diced tomatoes or lettuce for garnish if desired. Serve with your favorite chips and/or pickle spears.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add green onions and saute until tender. Add mushrooms and garlic and continue cooking until mushrooms are tender. Stir in bok choy and cook until tender-crisp. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes. Stir in coconut milk and heat through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Mix eggs. Add margarine and salt to eggs. Add noodles and cook on low for 10 minutes. Add 1 cup of lemon juice and 1 cup of sugar. Turn heat to high. When boiling add vanilla and corn flake crumbs. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Top with pineapple tidbits.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a small bowl stir together flour, sugar and cocoa. In another bowl whisk together egg and milk. In a microwave safe mug stir together the flour mixture and egg mixture until just combined. Stir in melted butter and vanilla extract. Stir in chocolate chips. Microwave for 1 minute 40 seconds. Allow to sit for one minute before serving. Drizzle with chocolate syrup and serve immediately.

Heat oven to 425 degrees F. In large skillet, cook ground turkey over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in potatoes, vegetables and turkey gravy. Pour into 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle evenly with cheese. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and potatoes are hot. Serve immediately.

Defrost hash browns and mix together with sour cream. Add butter and mix until creamy. Add onion. Add chicken soup and stir. Bake in 9" x 13" pan at 350 for 30 minutes. Top with cheese and corn flakes. Bake an additional 10 minutes until the cheese melts.

Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add vodka and fresh mint leaves. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Add lime juice. Top with sugar syrup and Chambord. Garnish with fresh mint sprig and a few raspberries.

In a large pot over medium heat, cook ground beef until completely browned. Add 1/2 cup water. Add chicken broth. Stir in french onion soup mix. Add diced tomatoes, celery, frozen mixed vegetables, small shell pasta and seasonings. Simmer 10 minutes. Serve.
In a large bowl combine the broccoli, bacon, onion, cranberries, and mayonnaise. Fold in the sugar and vinegar. Cover and refrigerate.

Bring the milk to a boil in a pot. Add the cardamoms, saffron and sugar. Boil for another minute or so. Strain the milk into a separate container and set aside to cool down a little bit. Add the cottage cheese to a mixing bowl and add the flour to it. Add the pistachio nuts to the cottage cheese mixture and mix everything really well. Add the cooled milk to the mixture in the mixing bowl. Mix it all really well. Make balls out of the mixture and boil the balls in the same milk in which you made the cottage cheese mixture.

Beat cream cheese in medium-sized mixing bowl. Add 1/4 cup sugar and 1-2 tsp. vanilla extract. Set aside. In separate mixing bowl beat 3 eggs with 1/2 cup milk. Set aside. Beat 1 egg white to a froth in separate mixing bowl. In medium-sized frying pan melt 2 tablespoons butter. Add 2 slices of bread. When browned on one side flip over. Spread 2 slices with cream cheese mixture. Then top with 1/4 cup fresh blueberries. Continue until all 4 slices are covered with cream cheese mixture. Top each slice with 1/4 of egg mixture. Continue until all 4 slices are covered. Fold 1 tablespoon of egg white froth over each slice. Brown on both sides. Serve with syrup.
Mix pudding and pie filling. Add orzo. Chill. Gently stir in fruit and marshmallows. Top with whipped topping. Refrigerate.

Place water for pasta into a large pot. Boil pasta according to package directions. Drain water from pasta. Pour heavy cream into skillet where bacon was cooked. Simmer over medium heat until creamy. Stir in cooked bacon pieces, pasta, peas, and onions. Stir until pasta is coated with creamy sauce. Add parmesan cheese, stirring until cheese is melted into pasta. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

In 3-quart saucepan over medium heat, melt margarine. Add onion. Saute for 2 minutes. Add flour. Stir until light brown. Gradually add broth. Add creamed corn. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Simmer for 3 minutes. Add frozen corn, pepper and hot sauce. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add cheddar cheese. Heat through. Serve with oyster crackers.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly spray a 9×13-inch baking pan. In a large bowl, combine the thyme, garlic salt, milk, white pepper, onion powder, and crushed red pepper flakes. Dip chicken into the milk mixture. Place in the prepared pan. Spray the top of the chicken lightly. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until done. Sprinkle top of chicken with black pepper. Serve hot.
Mix all the ingredients in the crock pot. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours. Serve over rice.

Slice and dice onion. Brown ground beef with onion. Drain excess fat and add taco seasoning. Add cream of chicken soup and milk. Cook until mixture is thickened. Stir in green chilies. Pour mixture over warm tortillas. Top with cheese. Bake uncovered at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Top with green onion dip and serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion, parsley, mint, and dillcook until onion is translucent, 3 minutes. Add garliccook until fragrant, 30 seconds. Add green beanstoss well to coat with oil mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until just tender, 5 minutes more. Stir in tomatoes.
In a blender, combine all ingredients. Blend for 5 seconds or so. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Add a little more brandy or kahlua to taste.

In a small bowl combine sour cream, cucumber, tarragon, lemon juice and salt. Set aside. In a small sauce pan bring fish stock to simmer. Add wine and simmer for an additional three minutes. Place salmon in simmering fish stock for about 4-5 minutes, until fish begins to flake easily with a fork. Remove fish from stock with slotted spoon and place on serving plate. Pour stock over salmon. Drizzle salmon with olive oil. Place potatoes around salmon and spoon cucumber sauce over salmon.

Melt the butter over low heatstir in brown sugar. Add honey graham crackers and stir until crackers are completely coated with the sugar mixturetransfer to a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutesstir. Press walnut halves into cracker mixturebake for 5 minutes longerstir. Remove from ovensprinkle with chocolate chips and nuts. Let stand until chocolate is setbreak into bite-size pieces.

Trim the mushroom caps by removing the tough stems, leaving only the caps. Cut each cap into 4 wedges. Thread the mushroom wedges onto wooden skewers, alternating with the bell pepper pieces. In a small bowl combine the lemon juice, garlic, rosemary, thyme, oil, pepper and salt. Stir until well blended. Pour half of the marinade over the skewers. Refrigerate the kabobs for at least 2 hours or overnight. Heat the remaining marinade to a boil over medium-high heat in a medium frying pan or skillet. Add the kabobs and saute until the mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat, transfer the kabobs to a serving platter and drizzle with the remaining marinade. Serve immediately.

In a large frying pan, cook the sausages for 5 minutes. Add the onion and cook for another minute. Pour off most of the fat. Add the stock or water to the frying pan along with the potatoes, soup mix, chili powder, breadcrumbs, sausages and butter. Mix well. Cover with lid or foil. Transfer to an oven-proof dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Stir to check if the liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for another 15 minutes. Serve hot.

In a skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon, set aside and crumble when cool. In the same skillet, add the olive oil to the skillet and saute the garlic until just browned. Add the cabbage and cook until crisp-tender, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Stir in the bacon, Rotel, vinegar, and seasonings to taste. Serve hot or cold.

Separate biscuits and place into bottom of 9 x 13 baking dish. Cook beef according to package directionsdrain and add cream cheese. Combine soup, milk, catsup & seasonings. Pour over beef & top with biscuits. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until biscuits are browned & mixture is bubbling.

In a double boiler over hot water heat chocolate and cream cheese until chocolate is melted. Stir until mixture is smooth. Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla. Stir until smooth. Refrigerate until firm. Form into 1-inch balls and roll in ground nuts. Store in refrigerator until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine the brown sugar, maraschino cherries, cherry syrup, nuts. Place the mixture into a 9 x 13 baking dish. In a large bowl beat together the cake mix, eggs, water, and 1 tsp vanilla. Beat for 2 minutes on high. Spoon the batter over the cherry mixture. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool completely. Spread frosting over the cake. Chill for 4 hours.

Preheat oven to 190°C/gas mark 5. Beat together the mustard and syrup. Put the chicken in a shallow dish. Season with salt and pepper. Dip chicken in the beaten egg and then in the plain flour. Fry in batches in a frying pan for about 4 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Place in a large roasting tin and cover with the syrup mixture. Roast for about 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with orange zest just before serving. Serve with brown rice and steamed greens.

Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees. Put a large non-stick frying pan over medium-low heat. Add sunflower oil to pan. Place salmon fillets in pan, skin side up. Cook for 4 minutes on one side, then turn over and cook for 2 minutes. Set aside in a warm place. Put the spinach in a large bowl. Add lemon juice, 2 tablespoons of creme fraiche, a sprinkling of salt and pepper and mix well. Add capers to spinach mixture and mix well. Top salmon fillets with spinach mixture. Serve with remaining creme fraiche on the side.
Drain the chickpeas. Add all remaining ingredients. Form into 36 small balls. Fry in canola oil until brown. Remove from pan. Serve with tahini.

Remove the outer leaves of the cabbage and rinse under running water. Shred the cabbage and place in a large saucepan along with the caraway seed and sea salt. Add just enough whey so that the cabbage is completely submerged in the whey and the whey is completely covering the cabbage (about a cup of whey). Cover and bring to a boil over high heat, then immediately reduce the heat and simmer until the cabbage is tender, about 30 minutes (the time varies depending upon the cabbage and the size of the pieces). Add the carrot and continue simmering until tender, another 30 minutes. Remove the sauerkraut from the heat and allow it to cool naturally for at least a few hours (the longer it cools the better). Transfer the sauerkraut to a clean glass jar and keep refrigerated for up to a week.

Wash and scrub the baby beets. Place the beets and enough cold water in a saucepan to cover the beets by about 2 cm and cook over medium heat for 20-25 mins or until tender when pierced with a knife. When beets are cooked and cool enough to handle, slice into thin rounds and place in a bowl. Blend cashews and lemon juice in a food processor until smooth and add garlic and a little salt and pepper and blend again. Pour cashew mixture over beets and stir well. Serve with crusty bread and a sprinkling of parmesan cheese.
Combine cheese, milk and salt in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir until smooth. Serve warm with tortilla chips. Add more milk if needed to get to desired consistency.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook the flour in the melted butter until it forms a paste. Slowly stir in the milk to make a smooth sauce. Add the macaroni to the sauce and stir. Add the shredded cheese to the pasta mixture. Stir in the bread crumbs. Spoon the mixture into a greased 13-in-x-9-in-x-2-in-deep pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
Muddle lime wedge in a shaker. Add ice, tequila, lime juice, pineapple juice, cointreau liqueur and hot sauce. Shake well. Strain into salt-rimmed glasses. Garnish with lime wedge.

Brush french bread lightly with butter. Combine salad dressing, parmesan cheese, and green onions. Spread mixture on top of bread. Sprinkle more parmesan on top. Bake in a 450f oven for 10 minutes. Turn the bread and bake another 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Peel and cube potatoes. In a large frying pan heat oil over medium heat. Add potatoes. Cook until potatoes are crisp and golden brown. Add turmeric. Stir until well mixed. Add garlic. Continue cooking until potatoes are tender. Makes 1 serving. Double the recipe for 2.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large bowl beat egg. Add yogurt, brown sugar, vanilla, and oil. Sift flour, baking powder and natural bran into a second bowl. Add to yogurt mixture. Mix well. Add blueberries. Fill greased muffin cups two thirds full. Bake for about 20 minutes or until done. Cool for a few minutes and serve.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. In large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium high heat. Add pork chops and cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side until browned. Sprinkle with sweet paprika. Transfer pork chops to shallow baking dish. In same skillet combine 1 tablespoon olive oil with garlic powder and salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat 1 minute stirring constantly until fragrant and golden. Add orange juice and brown sugar and cook over medium high heat 3 minutes until thickened and syrupy. Stir in marmalade and vinegar and stir well until blended. Pour over pork chops and bake 10 minutes until pork is cooked through.

Heat olive oil in a pan. Sauté shallot and garlic for about 1 minute. Add vodka and bring to a boil. Add parma rosa sauce mix and milk. Simmer uncovered for 8 minutes. Stir in cream. Cook for 2 minutes. Add pasta and toss to coat. Serve with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter and flour a loaf pan. In a mixing bowl combine the melted butter and sugar and beat until well combined. Add the rum and beat for about 1 minute. Add the sour cream and almond extract and beat until smooth. In a separate bowl combine the all-purpose flour and baking soda. Add to the butter mixture and beat until smooth. Fold in the mashed banana. Spoon the batter into the prepared loaf pan. Bake for 65-70 minutes. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Run a knife around the edge of the loaf pan and remove the banana bread from the pan. Cool on a wire rack.
Place all of the ingredients in a crockpot. Stir together thoroughly until well mixed and heated through. Serve with warm tortillas and sour cream. Serves four.

Cook the onion and green beans in butter until tender. Drain the corn niblets and set aside. In a casserole, layer half the onion/green beans mixture followed by half the Ritz crackers, half the sliced almonds and half the cheddar cheese. Repeat the layers. In a small bowl combine the condensed soup and sour creampour over casserole. Bake at 375 degrees for one hour or until bubbly. Serve with the remaining sliced almonds sprinkled on top and garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Thaw frozen hash brown potatoes according to package directions. Grease a 9×13 inch baking dish with shortening. Place hash browns in the prepared baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the soup, ham, thyme, milk and sour cream. Pour over hash browns. Sprinkle with cheese, onion and french fried onion rings. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 30 minutes.

Boil potatoes and carrots until tender. Drain and set aside. In a saucepan, combine cream of mushroom soup, milk and cheese until melted. Pour over the potatoes and carrots. Add the corn and mix well. Pour into an 8-inch square pan and sprinkle with bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Chop tomato, basil, and garlic and combine in a bowl with balsamic vinegar and oil. Let sit for 10 minutes before using. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Sprinkle both sides of chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned on both sides, about 6 minutes total. Transfer chicken to a baking pan. Combine broccoli and water in the pan and cover tightly with foil. Roast for 10 minutesremove foil and roast until broccoli is tender and chicken is cooked through, about 10 more minutes. Combine tomato mixture and salsa in a small bowl and spoon over chicken and broccolisprinkle with cheese and serve with couscous on the side.

In large saucepan over low heat combine milk and sugar and stir until sugar is dissolved. Add pumpkin, salt, cinnamon, and allspice. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Beat margarine until fluffy. Add to pumpkin mixture and stir until smooth. Stir in vanilla. Pour into 9x13x2 inch pan. Let cool. Cut into squares. Makes about 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 400f. Toss broccoli with cauliflower florets in a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine matzo meal, reduced-calorie butter, dry parsley flakes, lemon zest, thyme, salt and black peppertoss with broccoli mixture just until coated. Spread evenly in an 11x7-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake uncovered at 400f for 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 4 servings (2 cups).

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Thread brats, onion wedges and peppers on skewers and place in a large roasting pan or dish. Combine soy sauce, apple juice concentrate and hot mustard in a small bowl. Pour over brats and vegetables in roasting pan. Bake in oven for 30 minutes or until brats are done.

Preheat oven to 350 F degrees (175 C). Grease 6 cups (150 mL) of a 12-cup muffin pan with vegetable oil or butter or cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar and baking powder and stir with a whisk to combine. Make a well in the center of the bowl and add the milk and butter and stir with a wooden spoon or your hands to form a soft dough. Divide the batter between the muffin cups and bake for about 15 - 18 minutes, or until the tops are golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. When the cupcakes have cooled, top each with a few blueberries and a dollop of whipped topping or ice cream. Serve immediately. Makes 6 cupcakes.

Grease and flour 10 inch tube pan. In medium bowl combine sugar and butter. Beat with electric mixer on medium speed for 2 minutes. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Combine sour cream and vanilla and beat until well blended. Combine baking powder, flour and salt in small bowl. Gradually add dry mixture to beaten mixture, beating well after each addition. Spread in pan. Sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon. Bake at 325 for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until golden brown and top is springy when touched lightly. Cool in pan for 10 minutes then turn onto wire rack. Cool completely before removing from pan. Store in an air tight container.

In the bowl of an electric mixer, cream butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Blend in xanthan gum, rice flour and vanilla. Divide dough in half and shape into 2 discs. Wrap each in plastic wrap and refrigerate until firm enough to roll out. On a lightly floured surface with a floured rolling pin, roll each disc into a 12 inch circle. Transfer to a 9 inch pie pan. Refrigerate while preparing the filling.

Cut each chicken breast in half horizontally. Mix together oregano and garlic salt. Place the chicken in a plastic bag and add marinade. Marinate in the refrigerator for a few hours. Drain the marinade from the bag and grill the chicken over medium heat until cooked through. Dice the feta cheese and sprinkle over the chicken. Drizzle with olive oil and squeeze lemon juice over the top. Garnish with a few kalamata olives. Serve with tzatziki sauce for dipping.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cut the chicken breasts into 2 inch strips. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add the onion and garlic. Saute for 1 minute. Add the chicken breasts and cook for 4 minutes on each side. Add the chilies, broth and salsa. Cover the skillet. Cook for 20 minutes or until chicken is tender. Divide the chicken mixture between 4 serving plates. Spoon the cooked rice over each portion. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake the dish for 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Cook shrimp in boiling water for 2 minutesdrain and cool in cold water. In a saucepan, combine soup, mayonnaise, pimentos and garlicheat through. Combine shrimp and soup mixture. Fold in eggs and breadcrumbs and sprinkle with almonds. Spread in a greased 2-quart casserole dish. Bake at 425 degrees for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Serves 6.

In a 5 or 6 quart crock pot (or any size pot), combine sweet potatoes, onion and 1/2 cup of water. Cover and cook on high 5 hours or low 7-8 hours. Add the remaining ingredients and cook another hour or so on high or low.

Place beef in large skillet over medium heat. Add tomato soup, salsa and watercook, stirring occasionally until well blended. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Heat until cheese is melted. Serve with tortillas. Serves 4.

In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the potatoes, fennel and celery and cook stirring occasionally until the potatoes are crisp and tender 6-8 minutes. Add the cooked chicken, olives and season with kosher salt and ground black pepper. Turn off the heat and stir in the dill and chives. Serve the hash warm or at room temperature. Serve the hash warm or at room temperature.
Mix together the first three ingredients. Pour over the black beans and corn. Mix well. Serve at room temperature or refrigerated.
Mix all of the above together. Chill for at least one hour prior to serving.

Preheat broiler to high. Remove the stems from the ancho chiliescut each chili in half crosswise, then seed the chilies by pulling out the seeds with your finger tips. Place the garlic, onion, ancho chilies, light brown sugar, cider vinegar and cilantro in a blender containerpuree until smooth. Pat the salmon dry with paper towelssprinkle with salt and pepper on both sides. Place the salmon on a broiler pan coated with cooking spraybrush with half the glaze. Broil for 8 minutes or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork when tested. Turn the salmon overbrush with the remaining glazebroil 4-5 minutes or until the fish just flakes easily when tested with a fork. Garnish with the cilantro sprigs if desired.

Brown the roast in a large skillet in a little vegetable oil. When the meat is browned all over, add the soup mix and bouillon cube. Pour in the water and stir well. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about an hour. Stir in the mushrooms and cook for an additional five minutes. Serve on rolls with mayonnaise, lettuce and tomatoes.

Boil the small red potatoes in salted water for 15 minutes or until tender. Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise. While the potatoes are boiling heat the bacon in a skillet. Once crispy remove from the heat. Set aside. After the potatoes have been boiled add the green beans and boil for another 5 minutes. Drain the beans and add to the potatoes. Heat the olive oil in a pan. Add the garlic and saute for one minute. Add the potatoes, bacon and beans. Heat through for one minute. Add the fresh lemon juice and mix well. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400f. Dip each chicken breast first into the beaten egg, then coat with the seasoning. Place on an oiled baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes. After 25 minutes turn the chicken over and bake another 15 minutes or until no longer pink inside. Serve with sliced tomatoes.

Combine soy sauce, honey and garlic in small saucepan. Bring to a simmer. Whisk in rosemary and pepper. Cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside. Preheat a grill for medium-high heat. Drizzle steaks with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper on both sides. Grill 4-5 minutes per side for medium rare. Remove from heat and brush each side of steak with sauce. Cook 2 more minutes per side. Serve on a bed of arugula dressed with balsamic vinegar and oil. Sprinkle with toasted pine nuts.
Brown the fish in a large casserole. Add the onion, paprika, tomato puree, vinegar, and water. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add the potatoes. Cook another 15 minutes.

Remove skin and fat from ham. Cut a slit through the center of ham from the top to bottom. Peel and segment the oranges. In a small bowl, combine brown sugar, orange segments and olive oil. In a small bowl, combine dry mustard and pepper. Squeeze the grape juice into a small bowl. Heat oven to 350. Put the orange segments and brown sugar mixture in the slit of the ham. Sprinkle with mustard and pepper mixture. Add the grape juice to the bottom of the ham. Insert whole cloves around the ham. Place ham in a shallow roasting pan. Cover with foil and bake for 35 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 2 hours longer. Let ham stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

Heat oil in a large wok over high heat. Add prawns and saute until they turn pink. Add garlic and ginger and continue to saute until prawns are cooked. Remove from heat. Add hoisin and teriyaki sauces. Add lime juice and sesame oil. Mix well and serve with cilantro.

Cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in the white corn syrup and egg until well blended. Combine the dry ingredients in a small bowl and mix well. Stir into the butter mixture until well blended. Stir in chocolate chips and mint chips. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 325 degrees fahrenheit for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on cookie sheets for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove to wire racks to cool completely. Yields about 4 dozen cookies.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Cook asparagus in boiling water for 4 to 6 minutes or until crisp-tender, stirring once or twice. Drain asparagus and rinse with cold water to stop cooking. Drain and pat dry with paper towels. Heat oven to 400f. Line a baking sheet with foil. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook onion and garlic in 1 tablespoon olive oil until softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in rice-a-roni and cook, stirring frequently, until rice is lightly toasted, about 1 minute. Stir in 1 cup broth, asparagus, turkey, parsley, thyme and 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Simmer over medium-low heat until mixture thickens, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove from heat and add eggs. Stir gently just until eggs are blended. Spoon rice mixture into an 8 by 10 inch baking dish coated

Boil noodles according to package. Drain and set aside. In a saucepan melt the velveeta cheese. Add the butter. Mix in the flour. Stir in the milk. Continue stirring until it boils. Add the cream cheese. Stir until creamy. Add the sharp cheddar cheese. Stir until it melts. Combine the velveeta cheese mixture with the macaroni noodles. Add salt and white pepper. Pour into a 9×13 inch casserole dish. Bake for 30 minutes.

Mix cream cheese and sugar. Add vanilla and eggs. Mix in 1/2 cup whipped topping and caramels. Spread over bottom of crust. Top with whipped topping and mini chocolate chips. Refrigerate at least 3 hours before serving.

Mix together cherry pie filling and milk in a bowl until smooth. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Mix Bisquick, 1/4 cup sugar and butter together in a bowl. Press mixture into an ungreased 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and spread cherry mixture evenly over crust. Bake for 20 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

Brown the pork in a large skillet. Remove and drain. Add the onions and celery and saute until translucent. Return the meat and stir until heated through. Add the bean sprouts and the soy sauce. Add the cornstarch and stir until it thickens. Add the beef broth and the rice. Cook until heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat grill or broiler. Lightly brush tortillas on both sides with butter. Spread about a 1/2 cup salsa on each tortilla. Place one burger on one tortilla and top with sliced bell pepper, cheese, and taco seasoning. Top with remaining burger, cheese, and seasoning. Place tortilla on grill or broiler and cook until cheese melts and tortilla is slightly toasted on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Remove from heat and add lettuce to top of burger. Fold up the sides of the tortilla and wrap in foil. Repeat with remaining tortillas and burgers.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Cut the tomatoes in half crosswise. Toss the tomatoes and green peppers with the olive oil in a baking pan. Sprinkle with the basil. Roast the tomatoes and green peppers for 30 minutes, or until they are well-browned. Toss the pasta in the tomato mixture, then add the remaining ingredients. Toss until well-combined. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving. Serve chilled. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and shaved Parmesan cheese. Serves 4-6.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a small bowl, combine the cumin and garlic powderrub the mixture all over the chicken breasts. Place the chicken breasts into a shallow baking dish. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heatcook and stir the garlic until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the refried beans, salsa, water, cumin powder, garlic powder, oregano, and cumin. Stir until well-blended, then pour the mixture over the chicken breasts. Bake for about 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the chicken is no longer pink inside. Serve immediately.

In a large pot over medium high heat, heat the butter until melted. Add the green onion and fresh garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the quinoa and stir to coat. Add the vegetable stock and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes until all the liquid is absorbed. Fluff the quinoa with a fork. Add the mushrooms and cook for 2-3 minutes. Season with the ground black pepper and stir to combine. Remove from the heat and stir in the fresh parsley. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve warm or cold.

In a medium bowl combine ground lamb, parsley, onion, feta, eggs and seasoning. Shape into meatballs. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add meatballs to pan and cook for 5 to 6 minutes. Serve over rice or in pita.

In a small saucepan over low heat melt margarine and brown sugar, stir until blended. Add eggs and vanilla stirring constantly until well blended. Pour into a 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees f, 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes on wire rack. Sprinkle with chocolate-covered toffee bits and chocolate chips. Let stand 1 hour before cutting into 2 inch squares.

Beat eggs and sugar together until fluffy. Add flour and baking soda and mix well. Stir in oil and frozen strawberries. Pour into greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 for approximately 1 hour. Let cool and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large mixing bowl, cream shortening and sugar together. Beat in eggs. Stir in raisins and nuts. Sift together baking soda and flour and add to mixture. Stir in vanilla. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto greased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheets to wire racks. Cool for a few minutes. Store in airtight container.

In a large bowl, beat together the eggs, half-and-half, sour cream and flouradd the baking soda and powder and beat well. Set aside. Combine the butter and flour in a skillet over medium-high heatstir constantly for about 1 minute or until butter is melted and mixture is lightly browned (make sure not to burn). Remove from heatadd the corn. Stir in the egg mixturestir well. Drop by heaping teaspoons onto a greased griddlebrown on both sides. Serve warm.

Hard boil eggs. Remove yolk from whites. Combine yolks and ranch dressing. Mash yolks and mix well. Add cream cheese. Spread yolk mixture on white halves. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve with ranch salad dressing for dipping.

To prepare sauce, combine mustard and next four ingredients in a small bowlset aside. To prepare steak, rub spray on steak. Sprinkle steak with celery seeds. Place steak on a greased grill rack coated with cooking spray. Grill 10 to 12 minutes on each side or until meat thermometer reads 135 degrees f. Brush steak with half of the sauce mixturegrill 5 minutes longer. Turn steak, brush with remaining sauce mixturegrill 5 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut steak against the grain into 1/2 inch strips. Serve with remaining sauce mixture.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Peel the pawpaw with a knife, remove seeds and cut into bite-sized chunks. Toss with raspberries, vinegar, mint leaves. In another bowl mix palm sugar, lime juice and zest. Set aside. Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a fry pan over medium heat. Add the chilli and cook for 1 minute. Add the fish and cook until just done. Remove from heat and set aside. Place the fish on 4 individual plates. Spoon the raspberry mixture over the top. Drizzle with lime syrup. Serve with steamed rice.

Preheat the oven to 200c. Cut the potatoes into wedges, drizzle with oil and sprinkle with paprika. Season the fish with salt and pepper and set aside. Heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Cook the potatoes in the oil until crispy. Add the fish fillets and cook for 2 minutes on each side until cooked through. Serve with the potatoes and garnish with coriander leaves.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix the crumbs, butter, cocoa and sugar together in a bowl. Press into an ungreased 9-inch pie plate. Freeze for 30 minutes. Spread ice cream in bottom of pie crust. Cover with chocolate bars. Freeze for 1 hour before cutting.

Peel and cut potatoes into small chunks. Put into saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until potatoes are tender. Drain and return potatoes to pan. Add milk and butter. Mash with potato masher until smooth. Add cheese and beat until smooth and creamy. Mix in pesto and beat until well blended.

Melt butter over low heat. Mix dry cider with cornstarchadd to melted butter. Cook over medium heat until thickened and bubblyremove from heat. Stir in cheese, mustard, worcestershire sauce and cayenne pepper. Serve with sliced baguette or pumpernickel.

In a saucepan, combine oil with pepper and salt. Heat over medium heat until oil is bubbly. Add almonds and stir until almonds are coated with oil and seasonings are blended well. Cool completely and store in an airtight container.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pork chopscook for 5 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove pork from skilletadd onion to skillet. Cook onion in hot drippings 5 minutes or until tender, stirring frequently. Stir in broth, grape jelly, ginger, cornstarch and watercook until mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Stir in porkheat through. Sprinkle with parsley if desired.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 8x8 inch square baking pans. Combine the flour, white sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Stir in the cinnamon and vanilla. Beat the soymilk and vegetable oil together in a separate bowl. Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and stir until smooth. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pans. Bake in the preheated oven until the brownies begin to pull away from the sides of the pan and the top springs back when pressed, 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool in the pan on a wire rack. Spread with your favorite frosting and top with chopped walnuts. Makes 16 squares.

In a large bowl combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl combine butter and sugar. Beat until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Alternately beat in flour mixture and milk. Pour batter into 24 paper-lined muffin cups. Sprinkle each muffin cup with 1 cherry. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar before serving. Makes 24.

Cook the noodles as directed on the package. Rinse under cold water and drain. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and stir-fry until golden, about 1 minute. Add the noodles and toss until evenly coated with garlic. Add the green onions and toss until coated. Add the sherry and stir-fry until the liquid is almost completely evaporated. Add the sauce mixture and stir-fry until heated through. Add the peanuts and toss until combined. Taste and adjust seasonings. Serve hot. Serves 4-6.
Combine all the dry ingredients in bowl. Mix in eggs and vanilla. Blend in butter. Stir in dates. Form into 3 balls. Dip in chopped nuts. Bake in 325 oven for 40 minutes.

mix white cake mix according to package directions using only egg whites, water, oil and mix well. Pour batter into 9x13" greased baking dish. Sprinkle top with 1/2 c shredded coconut (or crushed pineapple). Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. While cake is baking prepare frosting by mixing 1/2 c cream of coconut with 1/2 c milk, 1/2 tsp vanilla and 2 cups cool whip. When cake is cool, pour frosting over cake and spread to cover completely. Refrigerate to firm up frosting. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 c coconut (or crushed pineapple) and refrigerate for about 1/2 hour before serving. This also makes an excellent dessert for luau or other tropical themed parties.

Cook macaroni in boiling salted water for 10 minutes or until tender. Drainset aside. In large pot, saute onion and broccoli in butter until onion is transparent. In small bowl, combine soup and milk. Add to pot. Add cooked macaroniheat through. Stir in ham. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350. In a 4-quart crock pot combine beef roast, potatoes, carrots and onion. In a bowl combine the horseradish, salt and pepper. Sprinkle over roast. Add enough water to cover roast. Cover and cook on low 5-6 hours. In a small bowl combine the cornstarch and water. Stir into crock pot. Cook another 15 minutes. Serve roast and vegetables.

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. 2. Beat together oats, sugar, cocoa, butter. Stir in coffee. Spread onto a greased 9 x 13 pan. Bake 10-15 minutes. Cool. 3. Beat together cream cheese, vanilla sugar. Spread over bottom of pan. Cover with flaked coconut. Refrigerate overnight. Cut into squares. Store in refrigerator.

In a medium size bowl add lettuce, beans, chicken and taco seasoning mix and toss well. Divide mixture into three bowls or plates and sprinkle each with a layer of cheese, then cherry tomatoes and chips. Serve with Ranch salad dressing on the side if desired.

Cook the pasta. In a large skillet brown the hot dog. Remove from skillet and cut into 1/2 inch pieces. Drain the pasta. In the same skillet cook the onions and celery until tender. Add the hot dog pieces and tomato soup. Add the pasta. Mix well. Season with the chili powder. Serve.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add curry paste and cook for 2 minutes. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. Add remaining ingredients. Add meat and cook until meat is cooked through. Serve with rice.

Cook turkey according to package directionsshred. Cook broccoli according to package directionsdrain. Combine soup and milkset aside. Cook rice according to package directionsset aside. Combine turkey with soup mixturespread half of mixture on bottom of 3-qt. baking dish. Top with broccolisprinkle with chicken broth. Spread rice mixture over broccolitop with remaining turkey mixturesprinkle with water chestnuts. Bake at 350° for 40 min. or until heated throughstir. Stir mayonnaise into remaining soup mixturespoon over top of casserole. Bake 2 min.serve immediately.

Heat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Put chicken in roasting pan. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with cream of chicken soup. Bake for 2 hours or until chicken is tender. Meanwhile cook noodles according to package directions. Drain noodles wellmix with chicken. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with lemon wedges, if desired.

Prepare pudding as directed on box. Pour pudding into trifle dish. Layer with cake and white chocolate baking square. Dot top with orange liqueur. Top with whipped topping and strawberries. Sprinkle with chocolate baking squares. Serves 8.

Heat a pot over medium-high heat. Add oil to pot. Add onions to pot. Sauté onions for approximately 5 minutes. Add garlic to pot. Continue sautéing for another minute or two. Add cumin. Continue cooking for another minute. Add black beans. Add salsa to pot. Continue cooking for approximately another minute. Stir in lime juice. Serve in bowls topped with yogurt. Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 350. In a small saucepan combine the milk and chicken bouillon cubes. Heat over medium heat until the bouillon cubes are dissolved and the mixture is smooth. Add the tater tots to the milk mixture and stir until they are all coated. In a small mixing bowl combine the Cheddar cheese and the bacon bits. In a 13 x 9 baking dish spread the tater tots out into a single layer. Sprinkle the cheese/bacon mixture over the tater tots. Bake for 20 minutes or until the tater tots are golden brown. Serve topped with sour cream and chopped chives.

Heat olive oil in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant. Add butter and continue to sauté until melted and bubbly. Add rice and cook until toasted. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until rice is tender and has absorbed most of the liquid. Remove from heat and stir in shrimp and dill. Season with salt and pepper to serve.

Soak dried apricots in orange juice for 30 minutes. Drain apricots and place in food processor. Add apricot preserves, brown sugar and curry powder. Process until smooth. Rub pork chops with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill pork chops until done. To serve, pour apricot mixture over pork. Top with green onions.

Season pork chops with the seasoning mix and garlic powder. Let chops marinate for 15 minutes. Place pork chops in a lightly oiled casserole dish. Heat ketchup and honey mustard in a small sauce pan. Pour over chops and bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 160f degrees. For pork chops, you can use a meat thermometer to check the temperature. For ribs you can use your finger to check if the meat is falling off the bone. If it is falling off the bone then it is done. Serve and enjoy.

Preheat grill to high. Whisk together the tomato sauce and beer in a large bowl. Mix in the garlic cloves. Rub the seasonings onto the meat and place the ribs on the grill. Baste the ribs with the sauce and grill until cooked through. Serve with additional sauce on the side.
Cut green and red cabbage into bite-sized pieces. Combine all other ingredients and mix well. Toss in cabbage. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate. Toss again before serving.

Cut onion into 1/4 inch slices. Add ice water just to cover onion slices. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Drain onion slices, reserving liquid. In a large bowl combine the onion slices, vinegar, salt, and cayenne. Mix well, then add the tomatoes. Add enough of the reserved liquid to moisten the mixture, then fold in the oil & cilantro. Cover and chill 4 hours. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.

In a large skillet, saute onion in butter until golden. Stir in mustard, worcestershire sauce. In a bowl combine poppy seeds with water. Mix well. Spread 1/4 of mixture over each roll. Top with ham. Divide swiss among rolls. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into wedges.

Whisk together honey mustard, dijon mustard, orange juice, and lemon pepper. Rub all over the boneless pork loin and let marinade at least 30 minutes. Grill 3 inches from direct heat for 5 minutes on each side. Remove from grill and brush with lemon pepper and sprinkle with cajun seasoning. Let rest 5 minutes before slicing. Serve with baked sweet potatoes with brown sugar glaze.
