Peel the red chicory and cut it in fine strips. Cut the calamari rings in 4 pieces each. Peel the yellow pepper, cut it in fine strips and cut it in fine strips. Place the calamari in a bowl with the pepper, the basil and the coriander. Add the garlic clove, the salt and pepper and mix everything well with your hands. Add the olive oil and the lime juice. Mix again carefully until the calamari is covered with the dressing. Serve in a salad bowl sprinkle some basil on top and drizzle some extra virgin olive oil over the salad.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook steak in oil until browned and cooked through. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook 2 to 4 minutes. Add peanut sauce and broccolicook 1 to 2 minutes more. Serve with egg noodles and chopped green onions.

Combine egg and milk in a shallow bowl. Dip fish in the milk mixture, then dip in the flour, coating both sides of fish with flour. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Fry fish until it is golden brown on both sides. Top with parmesan cheese. Cook in oven for about 3 minutes or until the fish is fully cooked.
Boil pasta in salted water for 5 minutes. Drain pasta, and put in a large bowl. Add butter, then tomatoes with their liquid. Salt and pepper. Sprinkle with sharp cheddar cheese. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).In a large skillet heat olive oil over high heat. Season steaks with salt and pepper. Sear steaks in hot oil until brown. Place steaks in a 9x13 inch baking dish.In a bowl combine vinegar and mustard. Pour over steaks. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In medium saucepan over medium heat, bring stock to a boil. Remove from heat. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and rosemary. Saute until garlic is lightly browned. Add onion. Saute until translucent. Add stock to skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until sauce is thick. Strain. Serve with meat.

Heat oil in large pot, add onion & cook until soft. Add garlic & cook a few more minutes. Add curry powder & cook a few minutes more. Add the chickpeas, cook a few minutes more. Add the rest of the vegetables & cook until they are soft. Add ketchup & tabasco sauce. Stir & add salt to taste. Serve with brown rice.
Heat olive oil and add red onions and celery, saute until softened. Add frozen peas and celery leaves and saute 1 minute more. Season with salt and pepper before serving.

Cook macaroni according to package directions (omit salt). Stir chili into cooked macaroni and then add the rest of the ingredients. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 30 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 12 servings.

In a nonstick skillet saut the onion and zucchini in olive oil for 5 minutes or until crisp tender. Add the mushrooms, garlic and crushed red pepper and saut until mushrooms are tender. Stir in the pasta and spaghetti sauce. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over low heat for 5 minutes or until pasta is tender. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and broil 3 inches from the heat for 2 to 4 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Peel and dice avocados. Mince garlic. Peel onions. Chop jalapeno pepper. Dice avocados. Mix all in a bowl. Add lime juice and salt. Mix well. Serve as a dip with chips or as a side for tacos, nachos or burritos.

Place florets in boiling salted water for 3 minutes or until bright green and crisp tender. Drain well and set aside to cool slightly. Combine garlic, pesto, broccoli florets, pine nuts, parmesan cheese and pepper. Serve immediately with olive oil drizzled on top.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine banana with egg and milk in small bowl. Combine dry ingredients in a larger bowl. Mix wet and dry ingredients together just until combined. Spoon batter into a lightly greased muffin tin. Top each muffin with a few blueberries. Bake for 12-14 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for a few minutes in pan then remove and cool completely on wire rack.

Spread mayonnaise on bread and place on lightly oiled grill. Broil until browned and top with tuna mixture. Add onion, lemon juice and old bay seasoning. Top with tomatoes and provolone cheese and broil until cheese is melted.

In a small saucepan cook butter and vinegar over medium heat until melted and reduced. Set aside to cool. Place asparagus spears on a baking sheet. Brush with butter mixture and sprinkle with soy sauce. Bake at 350 until just tender about 15 minutes. Cut spears into bite sized pieces. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Scrub carrots and pat dry with paper towels. Cut carrots in half lengthwise, then crosswise into 1/4-inch slices. Combine carrots in a bowl and toss them with 2 tablespoons olive oil and 1/4 teaspoon each cayenne and coarse salt. Spread carrot slices evenly on the prepared baking sheet and roast until tender, about 20 minutes. Toss carrots in a bowl with 1/4 cup olive oil and 1/4 teaspoon each cayenne and coarse salt. Add remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 cup honey. Toss to combine. Transfer carrots to a serving bowl and drizzle with any remaining dressing. Makes 4 servings.

Brown ground beef and drain off fat. In large saucepan combine beef, tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, rice, green peppers and tomatoes and green chilies. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer 30 minutes. Stir in beef bouillon cubes and brown sugar. Add salt and pepper to taste. Makes 6 servings.

Cook onion in skillet until tender. Drain. Add cabbage and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Mix ground beef, salt and pepper. Add cooked onion and cabbage mixture. In 9x13 inch pan spread 2 cups tomato soup. Spread beef mixture over top. Sprinkle with remaining soup. Bake 30 minutes. Serve with long-grain rice. Makes 8-10 servings.
Saute the corn and the butter in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly for about 1 minute. Remove from heat and add the cream cheesestir well and serve.

Dissolve yeast in water. Stir in 2 cups flour, sugar, salt and oil. Beat with electric mixer until smooth. Add 2 beaten eggs. Stir in enough remaining flour to make a soft dough. Knead until smooth and elastic, adding more flour as necessary. Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in bulk. Punch dough down. Divide into 8 pieces. Knead each piece into a ball. Place balls in well-greased 9x13-inch baking pan. Coverlet rise in a warm place for 2 hours or until doubled in bulk. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Brush tops with melted buttersprinkle with garlic salt to taste. Serve warm with butter.

Combine all of the ingredients into a bowl and mix well. Transfer the mixture into an air-tight container or jar and store in a cool place for up to two weeks. You can use the nuts as an appetizer on their own or tossed with your favorite salad.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and saute until softened. Add curry paste and cook for 1 minute. Add potatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add fish sauce and coconut milk. Cook for 10 minutes. Add chicken and cook until just done. Season with brown sugar to taste. Serve with rice or noodles.
Place all in a blender and blend until smooth.

Pour boiling water over lemon and orange. Let steep until cool. Strain into a 2 cup glass. Combine cream of tartar and crystallized ginger. Add to glass. Add Tabasco and honey. Stir. Sprinkle with ground cloves. Serve.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl, mix the flour, baking soda and salt until blended. Beat the butter in a separate bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until smooth. Beat in the sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time on low speed until blended. Beat the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture on low speed until just blended. Stir in the vanilla. Stir in the chocolate chips until just blended. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake one sheet at a time for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned on the edges. Cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. The cookies will be very soft when removed from the oven. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Mix milk, sugar and cocoa in a medium saucepan. Stir until smooth. Add cornstarch, salt and egg yolk. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract. Cool. Chill at least 3 hours or overnight. Pour mixture into 8 paper cupcake liners. Freeze at least 8 hours or overnight. Remove liner. Serve immediately or wrap each in plastic wrap. Freeze for up to 1 week. To serve, microwave on high for 15 seconds. Unwrap and serve.

In large pot over medium heat combine cornmeal and water. Whisk constantly until thick and smooth. Remove from heat. Add butter. Stir until butter melts. Add scallions. Stir until butter melts. Stir until smooth. Stir in cheese. Stir until smooth. Add chipotles. Stir until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Cook broccoli in microwave according to package directions. Drain and let cool. In saucepan combine soup and butter. Heat until hot and bubbly. Stir in broccoli. In another pan cook potatoes until done. Add broccoli mixture to potatoes. Combine remaining ingredients and sprinkle over mixture. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Serve immediately.

melt butter. saute onion and garlic until tender. add celery. saute until crisp-tender. add broth. bring to a boil. add broccoli and cook for 5 minutes. stir in flour. cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. add milk. stir until heated through. stir in pepper. remove from heat. stir in velveeta until melted.

In large heavy pot over medium high heat brown chicken and garlic in olive oil. When chicken is lightly browned, add onions and cook until onions are soft and slightly browned. Add wine and stir well. Cook until the wine is reduced by half. Add the tomatoes, parsley and pepper and simmer over low heat for about 40 minutes. Remove chicken and shred it with two forks. Return chicken to pot and simmer for another 10 minutes. Serve with pasta.

In a small bowl combine the butter, cracker crumbs, cheese, oregano and basil. Place the fish in a shallow dish with the herb mixture. Chill for several hours. Remove from refrigerator 20 minutes before baking. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place the cod in an ovenproof baking dish and bake 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges

Use a sharp knife to cut off the top and bottom of the orange, making sure not to cut through the fruit. Hold the orange over a bowl. Insert cloves with a sharp knife into the orange flesh at equal distances all around the fruit. Once all the cloves are in, stuff the orange with the ground cinnamon. Secure the top with a small piece of ribbon. Tie a big ribbon around the orange and hang it on the tree.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Peel and core applescut into 1/2-inch slices. Place in a large bowl and mix in lemon juice and sugar to prevent discoloration. In a small bowl, combine cinnamon and raisinsmix well. Lightly grease a large shallow baking dish or casserole dish with cooking spray. Layer half the apples in the dish and top with half the cinnamon and raisin mixture, then the rest of the apples and the remaining cinnamon and raisin mixture. Mix the All Bran and orange juice in a bowl until well combinedpour over apples and spread out evenly. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Stir the crisp mixture and pour over applesspread out evenly. Bake for an additional 30 minutes in the preheated oven.

Boil eggs for 20 minutes in enough water to cover. Peel the cooled eggs under cold running water to ensure that no shells remain in the egg whites. Cut the eggs into bite-sized pieces and combine them with the other ingredients in a medium-sized mixing bowl. Blend the mixture well with a hand mixer or whisk until the salad is thoroughly combined. Serve on toast or crackers or in a pita pocket for a sandwich. Serves about four.
Brown hash browns and saute onions until tender. Combine all remaining ingredients and spoon over hash browns. Bake 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until the onion is soft. Add the spinach and cook until the liquid evaporates. Stir in the cream cheese and cook until melted. Remove from heat. In a small bowl combine the Parmesan cheese and bread crumbs. Sprinkle over the top of the spinach. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Place mincemeat in large bowl. Add cranberry sauce. Stir until well blended. Add orange zest and orange liqueur. Pour mixture into tart shells. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until set. Cool for 1 hour before serving.

Place the cheese on the bread. Top each slice of bread with a generous portion of artichoke hearts. Top the artichokes with the mayonnaise. Sprinkle on the garlic. Bake for 10 minutes or until the bread is toasted. Serve.

Cut the pork shoulder into 4 inch cubes. Marinate with 2 tablespoon soy sauce, 2 tablespoon vinegar, 1/4 teaspoon bay leaf and 1/8 teaspoon of black pepper. Let marinate overnight in refrigerator. Cook pork in a skillet with 2 cups water and 1/4 cup sugar. When the pork is done, add 1/2 cup vinegar and 2 tablespoon soy sauce. Let boil for 5 minutes.
Assemble sandwich by spreading mustard on the insides of both rolls. Layer the sandwich with turkey, roast beef, salami and Swiss cheese. Serve with lettuce.

Prepare rice according to package directions. While rice cooks, heat walnuts in a small nonstick skillet over medium heat 3 minutes or until lightly browned and fragrant, stirring frequently. Cut onion into thin half-moonsadd to skillet and cook 2 minutes or until softened. Combine onion mixture with 1/4 cup teriyaki sauce in a small bowl. Mix broccoli florets, carrots, snow peas, and remaining 1/4 cup teriyaki sauce in a medium bowltoss well. Add rice and onion mixture to vegetable mixturetoss well. In each tortilla, place about 1/2 cup vegetable mixture and 3 ounces chickenroll up. Cut each wrap crosswise into 2 piecesserve immediately.

Slice up the sausage and brown it in a non-stick skillet. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the dough with the five cheese blend and knead until well combined. Drizzle in the pizza sauce and mix well. Combine the barbecue sauce with the barbecue seasoning. Add the sausage and the cheese to the dough mixture. Stir together. Spoon mixture into a greased 12 inch cast iron skillet or cake pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until the dough is golden brown. Remove from the oven. Brush with the barbecue mixture. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Bake for another 5 minutes. Cool slightly before cutting. Drizzle with a little barbecue mixture if desired.

Mix french dressing with lemon juice. Soak fish in mixture for about 15 minutes. Drain off excess liquid. Spread french fried onions in bottom of baking dish. Place fish fillets on top of onions. Sprinkle parmesan cheese over the top. Bake at 400 for about 20 minutes. Serve with rice and vegetables.

Wash and peel potatoes. Cut them in half lengthwise. Parboil potatoes in boiling water about 10 minutes. Drain. Blend flour and butter. Add onion and celery leaves. Heat over low heat until onion is soft. Add parsley flakes and seasonings. Mix well. Add milk and mix. Pour over potatoes. Place in 9×13 pan. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over potatoes. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender and cheese is bubbly. Serve hot.

In a large kettle cook onion in oil until tender. Add carrots and celery. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add dried split peas and chicken broth. Cook uncovered for 2 to 2 1/2 hours. Stir occasionally. Add cold water and cook covered for 1 to 1 1/2 hours longer. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
Cut ducks up into pieces. Rinse sauerkraut in boiling water. Drain well. Add to duck & celery seed. Add pepper, sugar, lemon juice & sherry wine. Cook well & serve hot with hot biscuits.

Lay corn tortillas on cookie sheet. Sprinkle monterey jack cheese on top of tortillas. Lay another layer of tortillas. Layer corn on top of this. Top with monterey jack cheese. Mix eggs, buttermilk and green chilies together. Pour over top of cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until set. Top with green onions.

Remove seeds from eggplants. Boil them in water until soft. Mash them well. Add kashk, tomato paste, onions, dried mint, salt and pepper. Cook on low heat until the mixture is well blended. Remove from heat. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease bottoms only of muffin cups, or line with paper baking cups.In a medium bowl, combine the flour, graham cracker crumbs and brown sugarmix well. In a large bowl, combine the egg, buttermilk, vegetable oil, baking soda and saltmix well. Stir in the flour mixture just until moistened. Fold in the chocolate chips and marshmallows. Spoon the batter into prepared muffin cups.Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.

Cut spaghetti squash into halves lengthwise. Place halves face down in shallow baking pan filled with hot water to about one third of squashes diameter. Bake at 400f degrees for about one hour or until tender when pierced with knife. Remove from oven and allow to cool enough to handle. Use fork to scrape strands of squash out of squash halves. In large bowl combine strands of squash with mushrooms, onions, red peppers, salt& pepper to taste. Add dressing and toss. Serve over lettuce leaves garnished with cherry tomatoes.
Brown steaks in butter. Add onion and stir. Cover and simmer 1 hour. Add the rest of the ingredients and simmer 10-15 minutes. Serve over egg noodles or potatoes. Garnish with mushrooms.

Mix together crabmeat, onion, mayonnaise, cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, chili powder and pepper. Spoon into muffin halves. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until melted and browned. Top with sour cream if desired.

Combine tomato sauce with onions and garlic. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Add basil and oregano. Cook another minute. Add sugar and olive oil. Cook another 5 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with pasta.

Place the orange peel, wine, dried fruit and cranberries in a saucepan with the broth, orange juice, cornstarch and water. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, then simmer for 5-8 minutes or until it thickens into a sauce consistency. Slice the chicken breasts horizontally into four equal pieces. Place each piece on the grill, then brush with the orange sauce, basting often for about 5 minutes each side or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink. Serve immediately with the orange sauce drizzled over the top.

Sift together flour and baking powder. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add milk and stir until a soft dough forms. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate. Melt butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Whisk together eggs and milk. Pour egg mixture into hot skillet. Cook for 3 minutes or until edges begin to set. Spread 1/2 cup cottage cheese on bottom of skillet. Fold in half and cook for 2 more minutes. Flip onto plate. Repeat with remaining blintz mixture. Pour remaining cottage cheese over casserole. Beat together eggs and milk. Sprinkle with sour cream and salt. Bake for 15 minutes or until set.

Pour the milk into a small saucepan. Add the chocolate syrup and almond extract. Bring to a boil and let cool. While the milk mixture is cooling, combine the coffee and nutmeg in a mug. Stir until well mixed. Add the chocolate milk mixture and stir. Serve and enjoy.

Sift together the self raising flour and salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the centre of the flour and add the sun-dried tomato and the parsley. Make a well in the centre of the mixture and add the milk. Using a large metal spoon gradually work the flour into the liquid until you have a soft dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 minutes or until the dough is smooth. Roll out the dough into 20cm circles. Place the circles of dough onto a baking tray lined with baking paper. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into wedges for serving.

Saute the onion and garlic until softened. Add potato and stock. Bring to a boil. Simmer until the potato is tender. Add frozen peas and cook until the peas are heated through. Puree the soup in batches in a blender. Return to the pot. Stir in the olive oil. Ladle into bowls. Sprinkle with the cheese and garnish with chopped parsley.

Crush crackers and mix with sugar and butter. Press into greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes. Remove from pan while warm. Combine chocolate chips and walnuts. Spread over crust. Cool completely. Cut into bars.

Combine ground beef, salsa, oatmeal and egg in large bowl. Add carrot and mix until well blended. Shape into oval loaf on foil-lined pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes. Top with tomatoes and mushrooms. Bake for an additional 15 minutes. Let stand for five minutes before slicing.

Cook the bacon in a large Dutch oven until crisp and brown, then remove and set aside for later use. In the same Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until translucent. Add the potato and cook for 2 minutes, stirring. Add the broth and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat and cook for 10 minutes. Add the bacon and herbs and simmer for 5 minutes more. Serve with parmesan.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add meat and seasoning and cook until no longer pink. Add onions and continue to cook about 5 more minutes. Reduce heat to medium and add remaining ingredients. Heat through, stirring occasionally. Serve on hamburger buns.

Heat grill to high heat. Combine mustard, garlic and vinegar. Brush each lamb chop with olive oil on both sides. Rub mustard mixture on both sides of each lamb chop. Grill over high heat 5-7 minutes on each side for medium. Let rest 10 minutes. Place lamb on plates. Top with fresh basil. Serve with wild rice.

Drain tofu. Crush tofu with a potato masher until it resembles cottage cheese. In a bowl, combine the tofu with the mayonnaise. Add the umeboshi paste and the herbs. Season with pepper and rosemary. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Dice bacon and fry until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and save grease. Add hamburger and cook until browned. Add celery and onion and cook until tender. Add green peppers and cook for a few minutes longer. Add tomato soup and enough water to cover hamburger mixture and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about an hour or until all ingredients are tender. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve on buns or rolls with sliced tomato and lettuce.
Cook fries according to package directions until crisp & tender. Rinse w/cold water. Toss with soup until coated & top with salsa & sour cream. Top w/jalapenos & serve with salsa.

Prepare stuffing according to directions on box but do not add water. Dip each chicken breast in soup mixture and then in stuffing mixtureplace in ungreased 13×9 inch baking dish. Pour remaining soup over chickensprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 375 for 45 minutes or until chicken is done.

Preheat the oven to 400 degree f. Heat the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic salt and saute until tender about 6 minutes. Stir in the worcestershire sauce and cook for another minute. Cool to room temperature and add the crabmeat and mayonnaise stirring to combine. Stuff the mushrooms with the mixture and place them on a baking sheet. Bake for about 10 to 12 minutes or until the cheese is golden brown and the mushrooms are tender.

Preheat your oven to 425 degrees F. In a large bowl mix together the flour, salt, baking powder and soda. Make a well in the center of this mixture and pour in your wet ingredients. Mix until a soft dough forms. On a lightly floured surface knead for about two minutes until smooth. Roll out dough about half an inch thick and cut into scone shapes. Place scones on a greased cookie sheet and bake for about 12 minutes or until they are a light brown color. Mix together cinnamon and sugar and sprinkle over scones. Let cool and enjoy!

In a food processor, pulse macadamia nuts until finely ground. Stir in cheese until well combined. Add dried pineapple and mint and pulse until well combined and pineapple is finely chopped. Spread mixture evenly into a small serving dish and refrigerate until set. Serve with crackers or as an appetizer with carrot sticks or celery sticks.

In a shallow dish combine the soup and sour cream, dip chicken into mixture and coat both sides of each piece with mixture. Place in a greased baking dish and bake at 375 for 1 hour. In a small bowl combine the cracker crumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle evenly over chicken and bake for 10 minutes more. Top with almonds and cheese and bake until cheese is golden brown, about 5 minutes longer.

Bring water to boil. Add the fava beans. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until beans are tender. Drain the beans and squeeze them to remove excess moisture. In a medium mixing bowl, combine beans with spinach and garlic. Add the olive oil, salt and pepper and mix well. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a 12 cup souffle dish with cooking spray. Combine eggs, milk, simply potatoes, and bacon in a bowl. Stir to combine. Add cheese and mix well. Spread mixture evenly into souffle dish. Bake for 45 minutes, or until firm. In another bowl, combine honey, chipotle, and vinegarmix well. Serve souffles warm with honey glaze drizzled on top.

Heat oven to 325 degrees. Season duck breasts with salt and pepper. Spread flour on a plate. Season flour with salt and pepper. Dust duck in flour. Heat butter and oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook duck until browned. Flip and cook for 2-3 minutes. Transfer duck to a plate and set aside. Add honey to skillet and bring to a boil. Stir in cooked rice and buttermilk. Return duck to skilletcook until rice is heated through, 2-3 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.
Toast the bread and cut into fingers. Spread the toast with the cream cheese and lay the smoked salmon on top. Garnish with fresh dill. Serve with tea.

Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat. Drain the bacon on paper towel. In a crock pot, brown chicken breasts with onion, carrot and garlic. Add the soup and the drained bacon. Add potatoes. Cook on high for 4 hours. Add the swiss cheese during the last 20 minutes of cooking. Serve with green beans.

Remove seeds from chili peppers and rinse with water to remove any remaining seeds. Pat dry. Lay on paper towel lined plate and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat and saute chilis on both sides until tender. Remove chilis from skillet and lay on paper towel lined plate to drain excess grease. In a large bowl, beat eggs with milk and flour until smooth. Fill chilies with cheese mixture and place in egg mixture and cover with remaining egg mixture. Place chilis in skillet and cook until brown and crisp on both sides. Serve with salsa or chili sauce.

Cook noodles and drain. Add frozen vegetables and cook for 2 more minutes. Drain and set aside. In a small pan, mix soup and milk together. Heat over low heat until it just begins to boil. Add the tuna and heat for about 3 minutes. Drain the liquid from the noodles and vegetables and combine all in a 9x13 casserole dish. Add soup mixture and stir. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes.

Combine all ingredients in a large pot, stirring constantly until sugar is dissolved. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Continue stirring until mixture reaches a dark amber color. Remove from heat. Add butter, vanilla and baking soda. Stir until well combined. Pour mixture onto a lightly greased cookie sheet. Spread with spatula or back of spoon. When mixture is completely cool, break into pieces.

In a large skillet cook asparagus in boiling water for 3 minutes or until crisp tender. Drain. In a small bowl combine tomatoes, green onions and oregano. Toss with asparagus. In a small bowl combine butter and thyme. Toss with asparagus mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve warm.

Combine vinegar, mustard, and salt in a small bowl and whisk to make a dressing. Drain the edamame beans into a colander and add them to the bowl of the dressing. Add the parsley to the dressing mixture. Toss to mix well. Add the beans back to the bowl. Add the onion and celery to the dressing mixture. Toss to mix well and add back to the bowl of the beans. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for about an hour. Serve on a platter as an appetizer or side dish.
Defrost the peas. Mix everything else together. Let the flavors blend together. Chill for several hours or overnight. Serve on salad greens.

Trim tough ends from asparagus. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add asparagus and gingerroot, if using. Cook, turning occasionally, until asparagus is lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a platter. Add lemon curd to skillet and stir until smoothspoon sauce over asparagus. Drizzle with oilsprinkle with salt and pepper.

Combine milk and peanut butter in a bowl. Microwave 1 min. Stir. Microwave another 2 min. or until thick and smooth. Stir. Add cool whip and fold until mixed. Refrigerate until firm. Garnish with peanuts if desired.

Cut zucchini into 1-inch slices and place in a heavy saucepan with water to cover. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until tender. Drain. In a skillet cook onion and mushrooms in oil until onion is tender. Add zucchini and cook until heated through. In a separate saucepan cook tomatoes and garlic powder until thickened. Add to zucchini mixture. Season with cumin. Serve over rice.

Beat eggs and light corn syrup until well blended. Add vanilla and sugar and mix well. Add butter and mix until creamy and light brown. Add pecans and mix until thoroughly combined and coated. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Reduce heat to 325 degrees and bake until filling is set when center is gently shaken and top is golden brown, about 30 minutes longer. Cool at least 2 hours before serving.

Combine ground turkey, evaporated milk, and garlic in a medium-size mixing bowl. Mix well and set aside. Mix the breadcrumbs and the cheese together in a small bowl. Divide the turkey mixture into twelve equal portions and shape each portion into a ball about an inch in diameter. Roll each ball in the breadcrumb-cheese mixture to coat completely. In a large skillet cook the meatballs in the olive oil over medium heat for about 10 minutes, turning them occasionally until all sides are golden brown. Meanwhile in a small bowl mix the onion and parsley with the egg and seasoning salt and pepper to taste. Remove the meatballs from the skillet and cover with the egg mixture while you finish cooking the meatballs in the skillet. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally for about 5 minutes until the egg is set and the meatballs are cooked through. Serve immediately sprinkled with fresh parsley. Makes 12 meatballs.

Slice prosciutto into small pieces and wrap around the figs. Place on a baking tray and roast for about 10 minutes. Place figs on a plate and drizzle with oil and a sprinkle of sea salt and cracked pepper. Add rocket and serve immediately.

Cut salami crosswise into 16 slicesthread one salami slice onto each of 16 skewers. Bring broth to boil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add tortellinicook for 4 minutes or until tortellini is tender, stirring often. Drain pastarinse under cold running water. Drain wellstir in broccoli, artichoke hearts, tomatoes, and olives. Divide pasta mixture evenly among skewersserve immediately or chill until ready to serve. Makes 16 kabobs.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, salt. In separate bowl combine milk, egg and sour cream. Add to dry mixture. Add vanilla. Beat well. In a 9x13 greased pan, spread batter. Mix 1/2 cup sugar with 1/2 cup cinnamon. Sprinkle over batter. Bake 45 minutes.

In a small bowl combine mustard and molasses until smooth. Set aside. Preheat the oven to 225 degrees. Cut 2 1/2 pounds salmon fillets into 3-inch portions. Lightly coat the portions with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Place the fillets on the grill over medium heat, skin side down. Cook until the skin is crisp and the fillets are firm to the touch (about 10 minutes). Brush the fillets with the mustard-molasses glaze and grill for 3 more minutes or until cooked to desired doneness. Serve warm or at room temperature with steamed vegetables and lemon wedges.

Grease a 20cm square baking tin. Put the condensed milk and the soft brown sugar into a heavy based pan. Heat gently until the mixture comes to the boil. Do not stir the mixture. Pour into the baking tin. Scatter the white chocolate over the mixture. Heat the golden syrup until it boils. Pour over the chocolate. Put the tin into a bain marie. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees celcius for 40 minutes. Do not stir the mixture. Cool for 2 hours. Cut into squares. Store in an airtight container.

Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook according to package directions. Drain and return noodles to pot. Beat eggs together with 1/2 cup water. Add parsley and cheese and season with salt and black pepper. Pour over noodles. Add butter and toss until coated. Serve immediately.

In a bowl combine the beef with the onion, parsley, mint, marjoram, salt and pepper and form into 1 inch balls. In a second bowl combine the cumin, cinnamon and allspice. Roll the beef balls into the spice mixture to coat them. Soak the bamboo skewers in water for about 30 minutes or until soft. Thread the beef balls on the skewers, leaving about 1/2 inch between the balls on each skewer. Grill the kebabs for 6 to 8 minutes on each side over medium heat until they are no longer pink inside. Serve with tzatziki sauce.

Bring hot water to boil in small saucepot and dissolve stuffing mix. Cook on medium-high heat for about 3-5 minutes or until thick and bubbly. Cut sausage into small pieces and add to stuffing mix and stir until well combined. Add peppers, onion and tomato sauce and stir until well blended. Pour mixture into a 9 x 13 pan that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes. Serve warm with crusty bread or crackers.

Boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain and mash the potatoes. Add eggs, cream, butter, salt to taste. Mix well. Mound on baking dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake in 350 degree oven for 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine whole wheat flour, white flour, baking soda, salt and raisins in a bowl. Combine molasses, buttermilk, and canola oil in another bowlstir into flour mixture until well moistened. Pour batter into a greased loaf pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. Remove from pan and cool on a wire rack.
In a small bowl, mash avocado and tofu together until well blended. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Season to taste and serve immediately.

Sift flour into a bowl, add baking powder. Cut butter into small pieces add to flour, mix until fine crumbs form. Stir in honey and milk. Tip onto a floured board or table. Knead lightly, only to bring it together. Form into a ball. Roll out to about 3/4 of an inch thick. Cut out with a pastry cutter. Brush scones with beaten egg. Bake at 400 for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.

Remove yolks from eggs and place in blender or food processor. Add mayonnaise, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, old bay seasoning and vinegar and blend until smooth. Add pepper and salt to taste and blend until mixed. Place in serving dishes or piping bag and pipe into egg whites. Top with paprika.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a tube pan. Cream the butter and sugar. Add the condensed milk and beat until creamy. Add the cocoa powder and beat. Add the flour, baking powder and baking soda and beat until just blended. Add the egg and beat well. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until the cake springs back to the touch. Invert cake onto a plate. Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.

Peel the calamari, then cut the body in half lengthwise, then across into strips. Place the strips of calamari into a bowl with the capers, then sprinkle over the plain flour, salt, then gently toss together. Heat the oil in a deep heavy-based pan until very hot, then add the calamari in batches (carefully, so as not to over-crowd the pan) and cook for about 2-3 minutes until lightly browned. Lift the calamari from the pan, place on kitchen paper to drain and serve immediately.

Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil. Cook pasta until al dente. Meanwhile, heat spray in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until golden brown. Stir in garlic and bacon and cook 2 minutes longer or until bacon is browned. Stir in zucchini and cook 5 minutes. Stir in egg yolks and cook until egg mixture is thick and lightly browned. Stir in egg and ricotta cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. Drain pastareturn to pot. Pour sauce over pastatoss well. Serve immediately with Parmesan cheese.

To prepare crust combine granulated sugar, cornstarch, and vanilla extract in small saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat and add blueberries. Cool. Peel nectarines and slice. Place slices of nectarines into crust-lined pie pan. Pour blueberry mixture over nectarine slices. Bake at 425 for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 for another 25 minutes or until juices run clear. Cool completely. Serve with whipped cream. Makes one pie.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add the garlic and cook for a further minute. Add the mushrooms and cook for a further minute or until lightly browned. Add the silverbeet and cook for a further minute. Transfer to a bowl. Season with nutmeg and pepper. Beat the eggs and cream together until well combined. Add the mushroom mixture and the cheese and stir until well combined. Pour into a greased pie dish. Bake in the pre-heated oven for 25 minutes or until set.

Mix together rice, 2 teaspoons garlic salt, ground cumin and taco seasoning. Add chicken broth to rice mixture. Cook over medium heat 5 minutes. Stir in onion and tomato sauce. Cook another 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Brown hamburger and onions. Drain fat. Add tomatoes, tomato juice, italian seasoning and water. Heat to boiling and then simmer for 1/2 hour or longer. Add mixed vegetables and cook for 10 minutes. Add rice and cook for 10 minutes longer. Serve hot. Serves 4 to 6.

In a large pan heat oil add eggs and cook on low until eggs are set. Layer the tortillas in a casserole dish. Top with eggs. Next add the tomatoes and green chilies. Top with the cheese. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Garnish with the sour cream.

Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Add sugarstir well. In large bowl combine quick oats, eggs and milkbeat well. Add flour mixturebeat just until moistened. Heat skillet or griddle over medium heat. Pour about 1/3 cup batter onto hot surface for each cake. Turn after bubbles form on top. Brown on both sides. Serve with butter. Makes 12 to 16 cakes.

Preheat the grill for direct cooking and a medium high heat. Brush the salmon with the oil and sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Place the fish skin side down on the grill and cook for about 5 minutes. Turn the fish and cook for about another 5 minutes or until it has a firm flesh. In a small bowl add the water and the spreadable cheese. Cook until the mixture is smooth. Spoon a little cheese mixture on each salmon fillet and garnish with the tomato and dill. Serve with baked potatoes.

Soak almonds in milk overnight. Drain almonds and grind to fine paste. Add sugar and ghee. Knead till mixture is smooth. Roll out between 2 sheets of parchment paper. Spread some ghee and cut into 1" pieces. Press the pieces to form squares. Bake in a preheated oven at 375 degrees for 12-15 minutes.

In a large pot over medium heat, add oil, chicken and onion. Cook until the chicken is browned and the onion is tender. Add the flour. Cook for about 2 minutes. Add the broth and the beans. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 20 minutes. Add the dressing mix and cook for another minute or two. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with garlic bread.

In a 3-quart saucepan combine the chicken broth with the roasted garlic. Bring to a boil. Add the couscous. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Stir in the green onion and cilantro. Stir in the saffron.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8×8-inch pan. In a medium bowl mix brown sugar, butter and eggs. Mix until creamy. Add vanilla extract. In a medium bowl mix flour, baking powder and salt. Add to egg mixture. Mix until just blended. Spread in prepared pan. Bake 15 minutes. Mix together peanut butter and heavy cream. Spread evenly on baked bar. Bake another 15 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9x13x2-inch pan. In pan melt butter. Add sugar. Stir in cherries. Arrange pineapple slices on top. Combine cake mix, vegetable oil, eggs. Spread evenly on top of fruit. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes. Cool in pan. Run knife around edges. Turn upside down on serving platter. Serve warm or cold.

Cover a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Wash fish and pat dry. Season fish with salt and pepper and place onto a foil-lined baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Prepare sauce by combining cream of mushroom soup, onion soup mix, milk and lemon juice. Pour sauce evenly over fish and bake for another 15 minutes, until sauce has set and fish is flaky. Top with shredded cheese and bake for another minute or so until cheese is melted.

Pour boiling water over the vegetables and place in the bottom of your slow cooker. Season salmon with salt and pepper and place in the vegetables. Pour white wine over the salmon and top with lemon slices and bay leaves. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours or on high for 3 hours. When ready to serve remove the salmon and keep warm. Spoon the broth over the salmon and garnish with the parsley. Serve with the lemon slices on the side.

Preheat the oven to 350F/175C/Gas mark 4. Butter and flour a 1-pint pudding mould. Melt the butter in a small saucepan. Add the syrup and the golden syrup and the sugar. Bring to the boil. When it comes to the boil take it off the heat and add the eggs one at a time. When all the eggs are in the mixture beat with an electric mixer for 10 minutes or until the mixture is thick and creamy. Sift the flour and the baking powder together. Add to the mixture. Beat well. Spoon the mixture into the mould. Put a small piece of buttered greaseproof paper on the top. Wet the paper and the rim of the mould. Place a small saucepan of water in the bottom of the oven. Bake for 1 hour. When the pudding has been in the oven for 45 minutes add a little warm water to a clean tea-towel and place it in the oven for the last 15 minutes. When the pudding is cooked turn it

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 10-inch pie plate. Roll out phyllo dough to fit in bottom of pie plate. Sprinkle dough evenly with 3 tablespoons cinnamon. Layer 1 cup blueberries and 1 cup sliced peaches over cinnamon. Dot with 2 tablespoons Splenda sugar substitute. Roll out another sheet of phyllo dough. Brush edges of pie plate with melted margarine. Layer phyllo sheet over fruit. Brush with melted margarine. Roll out remaining phyllo sheet. Cut into strips. Use strips to make an X over top of cobbler. Brush strips with melted margarine. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon cinnamon. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until top is golden brown. Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes. Serve with 2 tablespoons nonfat vanilla yogurt.

Pierce zucchini all over. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with lemon zest. Roast at 350 for 30 minutes until zucchini is tender. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and sprinkle with pepper and more lemon zest. Serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan bring sweetened condensed milk to a boil. Add peppermint extract and green food coloring and stir well to combine. Add water and stir well again. Pour into your freezer container and freeze until solid. About an hour before you want to serve it, whip the cream until soft peaks form and fold into the ice cream. Fold in the mini chocolate chips and freeze until ready to serve.

Soak dried mushrooms in 1/4 cup beef broth overnight. In a heavy soup pot over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion and cook until softened. Add mushrooms and cook until they've given up their liquid and the onion is browned. Add the remaining beef broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in cornstarch and cook until thickened. Remove from heat and add sour cream. Serve immediately, garnished with parsley.

Cook beans in water and chicken bouillon cubes until tender. Drain beans and reserve the liquid. In large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until tender. Add carrots and cook 2 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce and cook until sauce thickens. Add the cooked beans and spinach. Heat through. Stir in garlic and thyme. Add the beans and spinach. Heat through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with sausages. Serves 6.

Pre-heat grill. In a bowl combine ketchup, honey, soy sauce and garlic. In another bowl, combine pork chops with honey mixture. Place pork chops on the grill. Grill until done to your liking. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve.

Cut chicken breasts into 1 inch cubes and set aside in a bowl. Melt 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat in a large pot and cook onion until soft and translucent. Stir in chicken and continue cooking until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Drain off excess grease. Stir in mushroom soup, chicken soup and rotel. Heat through and stir in doritos and cheese. Serve.
Place wings in crock pot and pour in remaining ingredients. Cook on high for 2 hours or on low for 4 hours. Serve with blue cheese dressing and celery.

Poke a small hole in each waffle-shaped french fry. Fill each hole with a black olive. Top each french fry with a spoonful of refried beans. Top each bean-covered french fry with a spoonful of mexican cheese. Top each cheese-covered french fry with a spoonful of chunky salsa. Top each salsa-covered french fry with a spoonful of sour cream. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a baking dish with butter. Sprinkle steaks with salt and pepper on both sides. Place the steaks in the dish. Pour over 1/2 cup lemon juice and 1/2 cup water. Cover with a tight fitting lid. Bake for 1 hour. Remove lid. Pour over onion and tomato ketchup mixture and bake for another hour. Serves 6.

Season turkey with salt and pepper, then dredge with flour. In a large skillet heat oil until hot but not smokingcook turkey about 4 minutes per side until golden brown. Transfer to a platecover to keep warm. In the same skillet combine marmalade, ginger and worcestershire sauceheat to boiling. Add stockstir to combine. Return turkey to skilletcover and simmer until meat is tender, about 10 minutes longer. Serve with rice or mashed potatoes.

Melt butter in a large frying pan. Add onion and green pepper and saute until onion is translucent. Add cream of celery soup and water and heat through. Add ham and swiss cheese and blend together. Add noodles and mix well. Pour into a lightly buttered 9x13 casserole dish. Top with sour cream. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes. Serve with a green salad and garlic bread.
Mix cream cheese and mayonnaise. Add heavy cream. Mix well. Fold in peaches and pecans. Chill. Garnish with slices of lemon.

Dissolve brown sugar in a medium bowl with hot tap water. Combine the remaining ingredients except chicken breast in a saucepan. Add chicken breasts and bring to a boil. Turn heat down and simmer 10 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Serve with hot rice.

Cut the bacon into 1 inch pieces. Fry the bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from the pan and set aside. Add the onions and cook until softened. Add the sprouts and stir-fry for about 3 minutes. Add the bacon and the seasonings and toss. Serve immediately.

In a small saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Stir in chocolate chips and corn syrup until smooth. Add vanilla. Spread about half of the chocolate mixture over crispy rice cereal layer, using a spoon or spatula to spread evenly. Sprinkle with pecans. Spread the other half of the chocolate mixture over top of pecans. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Place in refrigerator for several hours to harden chocolate. Slice into bars.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the olive oil with the onion and garlic. Cook for about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the crock pot. Add the beans and the salsa. Next add the low sodium chicken broth and the sausage links. Cook on low for about 10 hours. Check the seasonings and add more salt and pepper if desired. Top with cilantro before serving.

Preheat oven to 350. Unroll crescent roll dough and separate. Separate each triangle into 3 pieces and press each piece into an 1 1/2-inch strip. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Sprinkle with sugar. Beat together egg and vanilla. Brush tops of rolls with egg mixture. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 2 minutes and sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar. Cut into 1 inch pieces and serve.

Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Slowly stir in half-and-half. Add the grits, reduce the heat to low, cover and cook until the liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes. Add the cheese, salt and pepperstir until the cheese melts. Remove from heatstir in the butter. Serve hot.

Cut squash in half and scrape out seeds. Cut squash into cubes and place in a large pot with water. Bring water to a boil and simmer for 20 minutes until squash is tender. Drain the squash and place in a food processor or blender with the onion and remaining ingredients except for the yogurt and milk. Process until smooth and return to pot. Add yogurt and milk and reheat on the stove or in a microwave.
Beat cool whip until fluffy. Add pudding mix. Fold in apples, marshmallows, and chopped nuts. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 12-16 servings.

Cut the steaks into bite-sized pieces. In a small bowl combine the thyme, oregano, rosemary, salt, pepper and cayenne pepperset aside. Thread the steak, onions and peppers onto the skewers. Grill over medium high heat for 1-2 minutes on each side or until the steak is no longer pink in the center.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Rub pork chops with dijon mustard. Sprinkle chops liberally with rosemary and seasoned bread crumbs. Drizzle pork chops with olive oil. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until done. Serve chops with steamed broccoli.

In a large frying pan fry the lardons for a few minutes until they become crispy. Remove with a slotted spoon and put aside. Cut the chicken into small cubes. In a large saucepan or deep pan, heat the oil and saut the chicken, the onions and garlic for a few minutes. Add the stock and the thyme and parsley. Cook for about 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Put the potatoes in a pot of boiling water and cook for about 10 minutes. Drain the potatoes and add them to the pan with the chicken and stock. Season with freshly ground black pepper and check for seasoning. Sprinkle the lardons over and serve.

Heat canola oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic to oil. Cook for 2 minutes or until onion is soft. Add beets to pan and cook until beets are softened. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook for about 15 minutes or until beets are tender. Stir in 1 tablespoon of chopped parsley. Season with salt if desired.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F . In a small bowl, combine the soup, barbecue sauce and water. Spread the sauce mixture evenly over both sides of the steaks. Place the steaks in a lightly greased baking dish. Bake uncovered 40-45 minutes or until beef is tender. Stirring occasionally. Turn the steaks over once during baking. Remove from the oven and keep warm until serving.

Mix shortening and sugar. Add molasses, egg and soda. Beat well. Sift together flour, ginger, cloves and cinnamon. Gradually add to mixture. Chill several hours or overnight. Roll out 1/4 inch thick and cut out with shaped cookie cutter. Place on greased baking sheet. Bake at 375f for 8-10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Makes about 5 dozen.

Slice the tomatoes into quarters. Cut the green beans into 1 inch pieces. Heat ghee over medium high heat. Add ginger and garlic. Saut for 1 minute. Add the tomatoes. Cook until soft. Add the spices and cook for 1 minute. Add the stock. Add the green beans and cook until tender. Serve over rice.

Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the broccoli and cover. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the peppers and sausage. Cook until the sausage is no longer pink. Drain the spaghetti and add to the sausage mixture. Add evaporated milk and butter and stir to combine. Add the Italian seasoning and parmesan cheese. Taste and adjust seasonings to your liking. Cook for 2 minutes more. Serve hot.
Combine the tuna, celery, onion, cheese, olives, mayonnaise, pepper to taste in a medium bowl. Divide among hamburger buns. Makes 12 sandwiches.

In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. In a small bowl, combine sugar and shortening. Stir sugar-shortening mixture into flour mixture just until moistened. Stir in milk. Pour batter into a greased 15 x 10 x 1-in. baking pan. Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Beat the egg yolks, sugar and vanilla essence together until creamy and pale. Melt the butter over a low heat, add it to the egg mix a little at a time whilst beating constantly (the mixture will become thick). Spoon onto the white bread (I like to toast the bread first). Spread jam on top of the egg mixture and put the other half of the bread on top. Grill until the egg mixture is browned and cooked through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray an 8 x 8 glass baking dish with cooking spray. Cut zucchini into 1/2-inch strips. Toss with 2 tablespoons oilspread in prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with salt & pepper. Roast 30 minutes. Combine remaining 2 tablespoons oil, onions & garlic. Cook 5 minutes. Add zucchini & toss to combine. Transfer to a food processor. Add yogurt & parsley. Process until smooth. Stir in lemon juice. Serve warm or cold. Makes 3 1/2 cups.

Bring a pot of water to a boil and cook the macaroni until tender but firm to the bite. Drain pasta and set aside. In a small saute pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the flour and stir until lightly browned. Slowly add the milk and cook until smooth. Stir in the mustard, cayenne pepper, and 2 cups of the cheese. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to coat. Transfer to a baking dish and sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake for 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Separate eggs, beating whites until stiff. Fold yolks into whites. Melt butter in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add eggs. Cook until almost set. Stir in orange zest and cream. Continue cooking just until eggs are set. Serve immediately.

Place all the ingredients except the beans in a 6 quart crock pot. Stir. Cook on low for 4-6 hours. After the time is up add the beans and stir well. Continue to cook on low for 2-3 hours. Serve with cornbread.

In a medium sauce pan heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the leeks and cook until softened. Add the broth and potato and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the potato is cooked through. Add the frozen corn and cook for 1 minute. Add the soy milk and mushrooms and heat through. Taste and adjust the seasoning. Serve garnished with chopped parsley. Serves 4.

In a small saucepan, combine cherry preserves and liquid honey. Cook over medium heat to melt the preserves. Once melted, add red wine vinegar, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg and ground cloves. Whisk well to combine. Cool for 15 to 20 minutes. Pour glaze over ham. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Let cool for 20 minutes.
Spread pizza sauce over crusts. Sprinkle cheeses over pizza crusts. Arrange pepperoni slices over cheese. Roll up each crust and wrap in plastic wrap. Cut into slices and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spread corn on one or two rimmed baking sheets and toss with 2 tablespoons olive oil. Roast in the oven for about 20 minutes, stirring once or twice while cooking, until lightly browned and tender. In a bowl, combine the corn with the tomato halves and bell pepper slices and toss well. In another bowl, combine the remaining olive oil with the red onion and thyme and toss well. Pour the onion-and-thyme mixture over the corn and toss well. Let the relish cool at room temperature for at least an hour before serving. Makes about 5 cups.

Preheat oven to 375f. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook until golden, about 2 minutes. Add lemon juice and stir for 1 minute. Add tomato puree and cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in cumin and caraway and season with salt. Cool to room temperature. Stir in fish and pour into a 10-inch gratin dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika before serving. Serve with rice.

Crush the crackers to fine crumbs and mix well with the flour, seasoning salt and pepper. In a shallow bowl or plate beat the egg and dredge the chicken in the egg, then in the crumb mixture, pressing well to adhere. Fill a deep fryer or a large heavy skillet with oil and heat over medium high heat until it reaches 350f. Fry the chicken pieces 3 to 4 minutes or until golden brown and crisp. Turn the chicken and fry an additional 3 minutes. Drain on a rack or on paper towels. Serve warm.

Slice zucchini into thin slices. Sprinkle with salt and let stand for 10 minutes. Mix cornmeal with enough water to make thick batter. Dip zucchini in batter and deep fry in peanut oil until golden brown on both sides. Serve hot with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Dip artichoke heart in beaten egg and then in breadcrumbs. Place on greased baking sheet. Repeat with remaining artichokes. Bake for 5 minutes. Turn and bake for 5 minutes longer or until golden. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Makes 6 servings.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the onion and cook until soft and translucent. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the mushrooms and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the bell pepper and cook until softened. Stir in the bean sprouts and cook for about 1 minute. Pour in the egg whites and cook until the eggs are just cooked through. Add the soy sauce, white pepper and cook for another minute or so. Remove from the heat and let cool for 10 minutes. Serve.

In a mixing bowl, beat the eggs until frothy. Add the milk and cream cheese and stir until smooth. Grind the bread in a food processor. Add to the egg mixture. Stir until well blended. Fold in the spinach. Grease a souffle dish with the butter. Pour the mixture into the dish. Sprinkle with the asparagus and salmon. Dot with the chives. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until firm. Remove from the oven and serve. Serves 1.

Cook pasta as directed. Drain and rinse. In a large bowl combine pasta, ham, cheese, peas and mayonnaise. Mix well. Add the dressing and seasoning. Chill for at least 4 hours. Serve chilled. Serve with lettuce leaves and bread.

Combine flour and cornmeal in a shallow dish. In another shallow dish, beat egg and milk. Dip oysters in egg mixture, then in flour mixture to coat. In large skillet over medium heat, heat oil and margarine. Add oysters and cook until browned and edges are curled up. Serve with lemon wedges.

Soak the beans overnight. Rinse and drain them. Heat the oil in a heavy skillet and saute the cumin and mustard seeds until they crackle. Add the turmeric and stir for 30 seconds. Add the beans and stir fry for about 3 minutes. Add the chopped vegetables and stir fry for another 4 minutes. Add salt to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, combine the yellow cake mix and eggs. Add the oil and beaten. Stir in the coffee. Spoon the mixture into the pan and bake for 20 minutes. In a small bowl, mix the brown sugar, coffee and cinnamon until well blended. Spread over the batter. Sprinkle with the coconut and the walnuts. Bake for 20 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Cut into bars.

In blender or food processor add 2 cups of ice and 1 cup of milk. Blend until smooth. Pour into 4 glasses. Add one scoop of chocolate ice cream in each glass. Add about 2 teaspoons of chocolate syrup to each glass. Add one drop of peppermint extract to each glass. Add one miniature peppermint patty to each glass. Sprinkle a few crushed mini peppermint patties on top of each glass. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). In a small bowl, combine italian dressing and old bay seasoning. Cut each cracker in half, then place 1 shrimp on each half cracker. Lay shrimp-topped crackers in a single layer in a shallow baking pan, spooning dressing mixture over top of each shrimp. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until shrimp are opaque. Sprinkle with fresh dill before serving.

Beat sugar and butter with a mixer until well blended. Add salt and beat until light. Beat in cocoa powder 1 cup at a time. Add the vanilla and beat until light and fluffy. Stir in the milk 1 tablespoon at a time until icing reaches spreading consistency. Spread frosting on the cake.

Combine coconut and flour in a large bowl. Stir in condensed milk. Stir in chocolate. Refrigerate about 2 hours or until firm. Roll mixture into 1-inch balls. Roll in toasted coconut. Place 2 inches apart on a baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Makes 25 to 30.

In a large pan over medium-high heat, stir together sugar and condensed milk until smooth. Continue stirring until mixture begins to boil. Once boiling, continue stirring mixture until it turns a deep brown color. Remove from heat. Stir in marshmallow cream and chocolate chips. Stir until completely melted. Add in nuts if desired. Pour into greased cake pan or 9X13 pan. Cool and cut into squares.

Dice the meat into small cubes, and saute in the oil until browned and cooked through. Add the onions and saute until transparent. Add the bell pepper and saute for about 2 minutes. Add the garlic and saute for a minute or two, stirring constantly. Add the tomatoes, breaking them up with a fork, and simmer for 10 minutes or until thickened. Add the meat stock and thyme and simmer for another 10 minutes or until the sauce is thickened to your liking. Serve with rice.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet with a slotted spoon to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Pour off all but 1 tablespoon of the fat from skillet. Add mushrooms, onions, garlic, and cook until softened but not browned, about 10 minutes. Add livers and cook 3 to 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Stir in broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until livers are tender. Stir in wine, vinegar, and butter. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve over hot cooked rice. Top each serving with bacon.

Combine the vinegar and oil in a small bowl and set aside to marinate the beef. In a small bowl, combine the tamari and brown sugar until dissolved. Set aside to make the glaze. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Slice the beef into thin strips across the grain of the meat. Place in a shallow glass or ceramic dish. Pour the marinade over the meat and turn to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and allow to marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Remove the beef from the marinade and arrange in a single layer on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for about 40 minutes in the preheated oven, turning once halfway through baking time. Remove from the oven and brush with the glaze. Continue cooking in the oven until the beef is done to your liking, about 10 minutes longer. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Sweat the onion, leek, celery & capsicum in the oil until tender. Add zucchini & pumpkin & cook until soft. Add tomato paste & stock. Simmer for 10 minutes or until thickened. Season with thyme, basil & parsley. Stir through the tomato sauce.

Cut the chicken breasts in half and sprinkle each with the mayonnaise, basil and garlic. Place 1/2 chicken breast in the center of the foil square and sprinkle with the pepper and carrot. Fold the foil over the chicken and seal the edges. Fold over the edges again to double seal the packet. Place in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Heat olive oil in pan over medium heat. Add garlicsaut for one minute. Add butter and fettuccinestir until butter is melted. Add evaporated milkbring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to lowcook until sauce thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Stir in parmesan cheesestir until cheese is melted. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with italian parsleyserve immediately.

Cook rice in 3 cups of water for 15 minutes or until done. Add 3 tablespoons butter to cooked rice. Cut up 1 red pepper and 1 green pepper. Cook and add to rice. Add 2 cups of chicken bouillon and mix. Let sit. Serve with sliced almonds.

Grill the baby eggplants cut side up for about 12 minutes on each side, or until tender but still a little firm. Tear off the top of the rolls and stuff with tomato and mozzarella. Spread the bottom half of the roll with dressing and top with the grilled eggplant and basil. Top with the cheese and tomato. Replace the top of the roll.

In a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, combine butter, sugar and corn syrup. Cook, stirring constantly until mixture reaches hard ball stage (270 degrees F.) on a candy thermometer or forms a small ball when dropped into a cup of cold water that then flattens back to a ball when removed from the water and gently squeezed back together with your finger and thumb (approximately 25 minutes). Remove from heat and stir in nuts until evenly coated. Pour onto a greased cookie sheet or other nonstick surface and spread evenly with a spoon or spatula until about 1/2 inch thick. Cool completely and break into pieces. Store in airtight container up to two weeks.

Place a knob of butter in a frying pan with the crushed garlic and sauté mushrooms until they are cooked but not too dry. Toss in the ketjap manis (available at Asian grocers) to taste, sprinkle with salt & pepper. Dress toasted ciabatta with chives or parsley & mushroom mixture.

In a large skillet over medium heat, warm the oil. Add the orzo and cook until the orzo is golden brown, about 8 to 10 minutes. Add the chicken broth, cover, and simmer until tender and the liquid is absorbed. Add the broccoli florets and the seasonings to the orzo. Toss until the broccoli is bright green. Cook for 5 minutes more, until heated through. Serve hot.

In a shallow dish combine barbecue sauce and marmalade. Pat pork chops dry with paper towels and then coat both sides with the barbecue mixture. Let marinate 1 hour at room temperature or overnight in the refrigerator. Preheat grill to medium-high. Remove pork chops from marinade and grill 5 minutes per side or until done to your taste. Garnish with orange slices if desired.
Combine all the marinade ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Add in the lamb chops and mix well. Leave to marinade overnight in the fridge.
Combine all the marinade ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Add the pork chops to the marinade and marinate for 2 hours in the fridge. Grill the chops on a barbecue grill until cooked through.

Melt butter in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Saute shallots and garlic until golden. Add lemon juice, parsley and 2 tsp lemon juice and stir to blend. Add shrimp. Cook until shrimp are pink throughout and juices run clear. Remove from heat. Spoon shrimp over pasta or rice and serve with lemon wedge.

Heat olive oil in medium skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic, crushed red pepper flakes and paprika and saute for about 1 minute. Add shrimp and cook for 2 minutes. Add the sherry and cook for 2 minutes longer or until the shrimp are cooked through and the liquid has evaporated. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve warm.
Whisk together all ingredients until well mixed. Refrigerate for several hours. Serve with fresh fruit or vegetables.

Wash beets. Cut off greens. Cut beets in half. Place in large saucepan with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender, about 40 minutes. Drain beets and rinse under cold water. When cool enough to handle. Cut beets into quarters. Heat a small skillet. Add oil and garlic. Heat until garlic is fragrant and oil is hot. Add beets. Cook, turning beets occasionally, until beets are lightly browned in spots. Serve hot or at room temperature. Garnish with lime wedges.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add coriander and onionsaute until lightly browned. Add trout and cook until no longer pink in center. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle fish and onions with lemon juice. Add parsley. Serve over rice.

Mix together bread crumbs and cheddar cheese. Add milk and eggs. Beat well. Spread half the mixture in bottom of 8 inch square pan. Spread frozen broccoli over mixture. Spread remaining mixture over broccoli. Sprinkle with sugar, salt, and pepper. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve warm.

In a small heavy skillet cook strawberries and balsamic vinegar over medium heat until strawberries are soft. Allow to cool. In another bowl combine strawberries and balsamic mixture and the butter. Stir together. Spoon into parfait glasses. Top with vanilla ice cream and freshly ground pepper.
Combine milk and pudding mix. Microwave 2 minutes. Add vanilla ice cream and pumpkin pie spice. Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add oil and garlic. Cook until garlic is golden brown about 2 minutes. Add onion and sausage and cook until browned about 5 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and tomato juice. Season with red pepper flakes and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook for about 5 minutes or until liquid has reduced and tomatoes are very soft. Transfer mixture to a 13 by 9 by 2-inch baking dish and top with mozzarella. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Meanwhile boil water for pasta and cook for 6-8 minutes until tender. Drain and toss with sausage and tomato mixture and parsley and parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Butter a 9x13-inch casserole dish and sprinkle in a thin layer of flour. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat and add flour and curry powder, whisking together until smooth and bubbly, about 2 minutes. Slowly whisk in milk and salt and pepper, cooking for about 3 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. Place shrimp and rice in a large mixing bowl and toss together. Add the cooled sauce and stir until combined well and creamy. Transfer mixture to prepared casserole dish and sprinkle evenly with cheese and paprika. Bake for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted and golden brown on top. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serves 6.

In skillet saute carrot, celery ribs and onion until tender. In mixing bowl combine vegetables, lentils, eggs, ketchup, ground sirloin and seasonings. Press mixture into a 2 quart casserole dish and bake for 45 minutes at 350f.

In a large bowl, combine bread cubes, vinegar and oiltoss well to coat. Season with salt and pepperlet stand for 1 hour at room temperature. Stir in beans, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and basil. Cut provolone into small cubes. Add to salad and toss wellserve immediately.
In a medium bowl, mix mayonnaise, sour cream, chutney, curry powder, cayenne pepper and salt. Slice eggs in half lengthwisefill with mixture. Sprinkle with paprikaserve.

Wash cranberries. Pour water in a pot over medium heat. Add cranberries and sugar. Boil for 10 minutes. Strain berries, keep juice. Whisk starch in cold water. Add to the juice. Cook over medium heat until thick. Serve cold.

In a large bowl combine sweetened condensed milk, sugar and cocoa. Mix well. Add the milk and vanilla. Stir well. Pour into 9x9-inch pan. Freeze until solid. Use a knife or spatula to cut into cubes. Makes 24 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add chicken thighs in a single layer and cook until browned, 5-7 minutes per side. Add remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, onions, garlic cloves and diced tomatoes to the skillet and stir until softened, 5-10 minutes. Add lemon juice and zest, brown sugar and oregano, stirring to combine. Add chicken thighs to the mixture along with kalamata olives, cover with lid and cook until chicken is no longer pink in center, 10-15 minutes. Serve over rice or pasta.

Cook the ramen noodles according to package directions. Heat the broth and water to a boil in a large pan. Add the noodles and return to a boil. Add the ginger and garlic and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add the beef and cook for 2 minutes or until the beef is no longer pink. Add the vinegar, soy sauce and vegetables. Cook for 1 minute. Divide among 4 bowls.

Heat a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and butter. Cook until butter is melted and garlic is lightly browned. Add vinegar and water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Cook 10 minutes or until liquid is reduced by half. Add asparagus. Cover and cook 3 minutes or until asparagus is crisp-tender. Add tofu. Stir in pepper. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with thyme.

Scrub potatoes and pierce with fork. Microwave on high 12 minutes. In medium bowl combine milk, butter, egg. Mash together until smooth. Salt and pepper. Set aside. Split potatoes lengthwise. Spoon filling evenly onto each potato half. Sprinkle with green onions. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake in oven until cheese is melted and potatoes are heated through.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Unroll the pastry and use a sharp knife to cut the dough into four rectangles. Place two rectangles on each baking sheet. Spread each rectangle with the light brown sugar mixture and top with the pecan pieces. Roll up each rectangle jellyroll fashion (tightly) and twist each roll once or twice to seal it. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until the pastry is light golden brown. Cool completely on wire racks. Makes 48 cookies. Serving size 1 cookie.

Combine 1 1/2 cups flour, yeast, sugar and salt in a large mixing bowl. Heat water to 110 degrees. Add to dry mixture. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup flour. Beat 2 minutes at medium speed of an electric mixer scraping bowl constantly. Add white chocolate chips. Beat on medium speed 2 minutes. Stir in enough remaining flour to make a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until dough is smooth and elastic. Shape dough into a ball. Place in a lightly oiled bowlturn once to grease top. Coverlet rise in a warm place until doubled in size about 1 hour. Punch dough down. Divide dough in half. Shape each half into a 12 inch round. Place on greased baking sheets. Coverlet rise until doubled 25 to 30 minutes. Bake at 375f for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Cut bread into 1/2 inch slices.

Grease 9x13 pan. In a large saucepan combine sugar and butter and mix well. Boil over medium high heat until mixture reaches 240f. Stir occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter until well blended. Stir in vanilla and salt. Mix until smooth. Pour into pan. Press the corn flakes and rice krispies into the top. Let cool and harden. Melt the chocolate and pour over bars. Spread evenly. Cool in refrigerator. Cut into bars.

Grill steaks for 10-15 minutes turning once or until desired doneness. In a small bowl combine garlic, oil and garlic salt and pepper. Place steaks on a platter and drizzle with garlic sauce. Top with tomato and bread slices.
Soak beans in water overnight. Drain and rinse. In a food processor combine beans, pesto, lime juice and garlic clove. Blend until smooth. Stir in cumin and salt. Serve on baguette slices.
Cook tortellini according to package directions. In another skillet combine peas, vegetables and milk. Cook until peas are tender. Serve over tortellini. Sprinkle chicken over all.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. In large bowl, cream sugar and oil together until smooth. Beat in baking soda and soured milk until well mixed. Stir in bananas and walnuts. In small bowl combine flour and salt and stir into banana mixture just until combined. Pour into loaf pan and bake for 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool in pan 5 minutesremove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Wrap loaf in plastic wrap and store at room temperature.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, cook the pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile heat oil in another pan over medium heat. Saute garlic until lightly browned. Add tomatoes. Cook until thickened. Stir in vodka. Reduce heat. Stir in fish bouillon cube, heavy cream, butter and tarragon. Stir in cooked pasta. Toss in parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Heat water to boiling. Add onions. Cook 5 minutes or until they are crisp tender. Drain. In a medium saucepan, combine honey and butter. Heat over medium heat until butter is melted. Cook 20 minutes or until onions are glazed. Remove from heat. Stir in paprika. Serve warm.

Spray a 12 inch round glass baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Cut muffins into quarters and place in baking dish. Sprinkle with half the asparagus. Add ham and the remaining asparagus. In medium bowl, whisk egg substitute with milk until smooth. Stir in onion, mustard, black pepper, and cheese. Pour over asparagus mixture. Cover and refrigerate overnight or at least 8 hours. Bake 45 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.

Place collards in 2 quart pan with 2 quarts water. Add 1 tbsp salt and 1 tbsp baking soda. Bring to boil and cover. Cook 10 minutes. Add neck bones and cook until collards are tender about 30 minutes. Add onions, garlic, chicken broth, pepperoncini peppers and juice. Cook 15 minutes longer. Add pepper. Serve with hot cornbread muffins or corn bread sticks.

Mix margarine with flour until well blended. Add milk and mix until smooth. Add salt. Place over medium heat and stir constantly until mixture thickens. Add turkey and cook for 1 minute. Stir in peas. Pour into baking dish. Top with pimiento. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Spray a frying pan with cooking spray and heat over medium heat. Place one croissant in pan and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of sugar and pinch of nutmeg. Cook until golden brown on both sides.
