In a large saucepan combine rice mix and 4 cups water. Cook 40 minutes, until tender. Combine cooked chicken, chicken broth, soy sauce, stuffing mix, butter, and 4 cups water. Stir well. Heat to boiling. Remove from heat. Combine rice mixture with sauce. Spread into a greased 9×13 casserole dish. Top with the rest of the stuffing mix. Bake 45 minutes at 350. Garnish with water chestnuts.

Mix together eggs, half-and-half, sugar and nutmeg in a large bowl. Refrigerate overnight. When ready to cook, preheat skillet over medium heat. Spray with cooking spray. Dip slices of french bread into egg mixture. Place in skillet. Cook 2-3 minutes per side or until lightly browned. Remove from skillet. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve with maple syrup.

In a large bowl, beat eggs until foamy. Gradually add sugar, salt and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Stir in corn syrup and melted butter. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 325 degrees. Bake for 1 hour. Sprinkle top of pie with pecans. Bake for an additional 15 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack.

Mix soup and milk together. Add frozen broccoli and mix thoroughly. In a greased 9 by 13 inch pan add half of the mixture. Spread cheddar cheese over the top of the broccoli. Add the remaining broccoli mixture and top with cheddar cheese. Combine remaining soup mix and water to make a thick paste. Spread over the casserole. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. In the last 3 minutes of cooking add water chestnuts. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In a saucepan melt the butter. Add the celery and onion and saute until tender but not brown. Add the turkey and stir until heated through. Add the water and the turkey gravy mix and stir well. Heat through and stir occasionally until the mixture is thickened and bubbly. Add the milk and stir until thickened. Add the flour and salt and stir until the mixture is thickened and bubbly.

In a small saucepan heat the butter over medium heat until it melts. Stir in the flour and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat add cheese stirring constantly until melted. Transfer to a small bowl. Stir in the cayenne pepper. Add the rice krispies stirring until coated. Shape into small balls. Place on a wax paper covered cookie sheet. Refrigerate 30 minutes or until firm.

Combine all ingredients except peanut oil in large bowl. Mix well. Add water 1 tbsp at time, adding just enough to make a workable mixture that will stick to beef. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Heat peanut oil in deep fryer to 350 degrees f. Form beef strips into 1/4 inch thick steaks. Drop in hot oil for 3-5 minutes or until golden brown and crisp. Serve immediately with barbecue sauce.

Dry fish fillets with paper towel. Heat oil in nonstick skillet. Sprinkle flour on fishdredge both sides in flour, shaking off excess. Place fish in skillet and cook about 3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Remove fish from pan and drain well. Mix lemon rind with dried thymesprinkle fillets with mixture. Place fish on a baking sheetbrush both sides with lemon juice. Bake uncovered in 400-degree oven for 5 to 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork.

Spread each side of bread with mayonnaise. Top the bottom half of the bread with roast beef, pesto sauce, and roasted red peppers. Sprinkle a bit of the red pepper mixture over top of sandwich. Place lettuce and greens on top of the sandwich. Sprinkle feta cheese on top of the lettuce and greens. Add the top slice of bread and cut diagonally into 4 triangles. Serve immediately.

Mix wine, coriander seeds and bay leaf in a large glass dish. Add in meat in an even layer, then cover with plastic wrap. Marinate in refrigerator 24 hours. Remove meat from marinade, reserving marinade in a large saucepan. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook meat 3 to 5 minutes per side until lightly browned all over. Transfer to slow cooker and add reserved marinade. Cook on high 6 to 7 hours until meat is tender enough to be pulled apart using two forks. Serve in flour tortillas with fresh lime wedges if desired.

Prepare rice according to directions on package. Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add green onions. Add garlic flakes, garlic salt and pepper to taste. Add rice to saucepan. Toss rice mixture. Remove from heat.

Preheat grill to medium high heat. Slice garlic clove and place on grill for 1-2 minutes. Grill salmon for about 4 minutes per side or until done to your liking. Once salmon is cooked through remove from grill and place on a plate. Slice a lime into wedges and squeeze over the cooked salmon. Place garlic on top of salmon. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mix 4 tbsp butter with 1 tbsp lime zest and 1 tbsp cilantro. Spread mixture over the salmon and serve with grilled asparagus and salad.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Drizzle salmon with olive oil and place in an oven safe dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until done and flake. Place baby spinach in a serving dish. Top with tomatoes, goat cheese and pecans. Drizzle with vinaigrette. Serve salmon over spinach and enjoy!

Heat milk and herbs in saucepan over medium heat until bubbly and steaming. Remove from heat and add flour a little at a time stirring until smooth and thickened. Add cheese and stir until melted. Pour into sauce boat and garnish with parsley. Serve with vegetables, pasta or bread.

Preheat oven to 400f. Combine olive oil and garlic in a large bowl. Add spaghetti and mix well. Spread spaghetti mixture on a foil-lined baking sheet. Sprinkle with cheese and bake 10-15 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Serves 8.

Place beef roast into slow cooker. Pour onion and vegetable juice over top of beef. Add gravy mix and garlic. Cook on low for 8-10 hours or on high for 6-7 hours. Add pepper and thyme and continue cooking for an additional hour. Carve beef into slices and serve.

In a Dutch oven, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and set aside. Add the yellow onion to bacon drippings in pan. Saute for 2 minutes or until the onions are tender. Stir in the black beans and chicken broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until the flavors blend. In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese and milk. Stir into the black bean mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle the soup into bowls. Top with the low-fat sour cream and the chives. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, mix 3 cups water and 1 cup sugar. Slowly stir in cream of tartar. Pour into a 2 quart greased baking dish. Set aside. Crush crackers in a blender. In a large bowl, combine crumb crumbs and 1/4 cup butter. Press crumb mixture over the top of the water mixture. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until crust is lightly browned. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup water with the lemon juice and cinnamon. Pour over hot crust. Bake for an additional 5 minutes. Cool slightly and cut into slices. Top with whipped topping or ice cream. Makes 8 servings.
In a large skillet, melt butter with apple slices. Add honey and cook for 5 minutes. Add yogurt and cook over low heat for 2-3 minutes more. Serve warm.

Toast 2 slices of bread. Spread cream cheese on each slice. Top with 1/4 avocado and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle with 1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil and 1 tsp hot sauce. Melt in microwave until cheese is warm and avocado is soft. Serve immediately.

Place chicken thighs in a single layer on the bottom of a 5-quart slow cooker. In a small bowl combine lime juice and chicken broth. Add garlic cloves and thyme. Bring to boil. Pour over chicken. Cook on high for 3 hours. In another saucepan saute garlic and butter over medium heat. Stir constantly until garlic is golden. Spoon over chicken. Cook 2 hours longer on high. Add rice. Cook an additional 30 minutes. Serve with lime.

Cut up chicken breast into small cubes. Chop up bell pepper and onion. Heat barbecue sauce in a pan. Add chicken and bell pepper and onion. Add cooked rice. Heat until hot. Spread out a little bit on a tortilla. Sprinkle some cheddar cheese on top. Roll up and cut into small pieces. Serve hot.

In a bowl combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press mixture into 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Meanwhile in a blender combine applesauce, sweetened condensed milk, eggs and lemon juice. Beat until smooth. Pour mixture over crust. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool. Chill.
Cook ground beef with taco seasoning and tomato sauce. Add egg noodles and heat through. Top with sharp cheddar cheese and bake until cheese is melted.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish, and sprinkle with the salt, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, oregano and thyme. Sprinkle with chili powder and pepper. Pour the chicken broth into the bottom of a roasting pan. Arrange the chicken breasts in the pan. Bake until the juices run clear when the meat is pierced with a fork, about 1 hour. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with rice and vegetables.

Rinse chicken quarters. Coat each quarter with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Combine rosemary, garlic, and lemon juice to make rub. Rub chicken quarters with rub. Place the quarters on a baking sheet. Bake 20 minutes. Meanwhile, combine jam and mustard. Remove chicken from oven. Brush with glaze. Return to oven. Cook 15-20 minutes longer or until done. Serve with more glaze.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and cool in a strainer. Add tomatoes, cucumber, olives, basil leaves, and crab boil. Add dressing mix to 2 cups of boiling water in a bowl. Let stand for 1 minute. Stir until smooth. Add to pasta mixture and toss until well blended. Chill until ready to serve. Just before serving add shrimp. Toss to coat.

Cook pasta in boiling water for 8-10 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside. In a skillet saute the sloppy joe meat in a little olive oil until browned and drain. Add the pasta and the rest of the ingredients. Heat through and serve.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees F. In a large bowl add sun dried tomatoes and water and soak for 15 minutes. Drain tomatoes. Heat a large dutch oven over medium heat. Add olive oil and diced onions. Cook 5 minutes or until onions are translucent. Add garlic and cook 1 minute longer. Add rice and cook until the grains are coated in the oil and garlic. Add wine and cook until it evaporates. Stir in 1 cup stock. Cook until liquid is absorbed. Repeat until rice is cooked through. Add tomatoes and remaining stock. Add parmesan and stir until cheese melts. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with fresh parmesan.

In a large mixing bowl combine ground beef, pepper and onions. Mix with your hands until thoroughly combined. Divide beef mixture into 8 equal portions (about 1/2 cup each). Shape each portion into a round ball and place on a plate. In a small bowl combine egg with milk. In another small bowl combine breadcrumbs with salt and pepper. Working with one portion at a time, dip beef ball into egg mixture, then coat with breadcrumbs. Place beef ball on a plate or on waxed paper. Repeat with remaining beef balls. In an ovenproof skillet or saucepan heat oil over medium-high heat. Add beef ballscook 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until no longer pink inside. Remove from heatpour off fat. Stir together ketchup and cornstarchadd to skillet with beef balls. Heat to boilingcook and stir 1 minute or until thickened. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles.

Preheat grill or broiler. Cut salmon fillets into quarters. Wrap each quarter in bacon and secure with toothpicks. Place in a shallow dish and pour dressing over. Place on grill or in broiler until salmon is done and bacon is crisp. Serve warm on a bed of lettuce with tomato slices.

Place flour in a large bowl. Add salt and baking soda. In a smaller bowl combine milk and vanilla extract. Stir milk mixture into flour mixture until smooth. Heat a griddle or large skillet over medium heat. Coat with cooking spray. Ladle about 1/4 cup batter onto griddle. Cook until small bubbles appear on top and edges look dry. Carefully flip and cook until second side is brown. Serve with butter and syrup if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spread raisins into bottom crust. Mix mincemeat and apple together. Pour mixture over raisins and cover with top crust. Crimp edges with fork and cut slits in top crust for steam to escape. Brush top crust with beaten egg and sprinkle with walnuts. Bake pie for about 40 minutes in the preheated oven, until crust is golden brown. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with foil. In a small bowl combine seasoning, oil and ground black pepper. Rub onto roast. Place roast on baking sheet. Bake roast 2 hours or until a meat thermometer registers 145 degrees F. Let stand 10 minutes before carving. Serve.
Combine the first three soups. Add the pork tenderloin. Cook on low for 10 hours or high for 6 hours. Remove pork tenderloin and cut into slices. Serve with the mashed potatoes.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes. Add kale and saute for 4 minutes. Add crushed pineapple to skillet and stir gently for 2 minutes. Stir in peanut butter. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Stir in tabasco sauce. Garnish with cilantro. Serve over cooked rice.

Cook beef and onion in skillet until cooked through. Drain fat. Add rice and water and cook until rice is tender. Add salsa and cook another 2 to 3 minutes. In separate bowl combine chilies and eggs. Heat oil in large skillet and dip each slice of bread into egg and then into bread crumbs. Fry in hot oil until golden brown on both sides. Cut bread into 4 squares. Fill each square with meat and rice mixture. Place cheese in microwave for 45 seconds. Top each square with cheese. Bake in 375 oven for 15 minutes.

Brown the chicken breast in a little olive oil and a little chicken broth until cooked through (about 15 minutes). Cut into small bite sized pieces. Meanwhile saute the bell pepper, onion and garlic clove in a little olive oil. Add the salsa, taco seasoning, and cooked chicken pieces and simmer for a few more minutes. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Place a tortilla on the skillet (one at a time) and spread a little refried beans over it. Spoon some of the chicken mixture into a line down the center of each tortilla and sprinkle with a little cheese. Top with another tortilla and press down. Cook about 1 minute per side until golden brown (or longer if using a thick tortilla). Serve with salsa, guacamole or sour cream if desired. Makes 12 quesadillas.

Soak the skewers for about 15 minutes. Thread shrimp, pineapple, bacon, red peppers, cherry tomatoes and mushroom caps onto the skewers. Grill over a medium heat for about 10 minutes or until the shrimp is cooked through. Serve with sweet and sour sauce.

Prepare veggies as directed on package. Melt butter in microwave safe bowl or cup. Add seasonings of choice (lemon-pepper is best) and stir well. Add veggies and stir to coat well. Cover and microwave on high for about 4-5 minutes until veggies are tender-crisp. Serve over steamed rice or as a side dish to any main meal.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, stir-fry the broccoli in 2 tablespoons vegetable oil until crisp-tender. Stir in yellow pepper, green onions and pork. Cook until no longer pink. Stir in stir-fry sauce. Cook and stir until heated through. Serve over cooked rice. Sprinkle with orange.

Cut the ham in half lengthwise. Top with the swiss cheese. Cut the swiss cheese in half lengthwise. Cut each half into 4 pieces. Place a piece of ham on each crescent roll. Place a piece of swiss on each crescent roll. Roll up. Cut each roll in half. Place the rolls on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with the onions. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes. Slice each roll into 6 slices. Serve with lettuce. Makes 36 pinwheels.

Boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain and let cool. Meanwhile dice onions. Mix mayonnaise, relish, vinegar, mustard and salt. Add potatoes and onions and toss well. Refrigerate. Before serving sprinkle with celery seeds and egg.

Slice the peppers into 1/4-inch pieces, leaving seeds intact. Combine the peppers, vinegar, and 1 cup of water in a large bowl and soak for 30 minutes. Drain the peppers, reserving the liquid. Pack the peppers into 1-quart canning jars leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Ladle the reserved liquid over the peppers, filling the jar to the headspace line. Cover the jars with canning lids, screw the rings on just until finger-tight. Process the jars in a boiling-water bath canner for 20 minutes. Remove the jars from the canner and let cool completely before uncovering the jars. Check for seal after 24 hours by pressing the center of the lid. If the lid moves up and down, the jar is not sealed. Store the unsealed jars in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks or freeze up to 1 year.

Preheat oven to 400. Cut sausage in half lengthwise and brown in a skillet. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. In a saucepan, combine chicken broth and pasta. Cook until tender. Stir in roasted peppers, sausage and basil. Season with salt. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large stockpot over medium-high heat, saute squash and onions in olive oil and butter until tender. Add carrots and saute 2 more minutes. Stir in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 10 minutes. In a blender, puree soup and return to stockpot. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in cream and sour cream.

Bring water to boil. Add pasta and cook according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, cook chicken according to package directions. Drain pasta and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, add butter. Add broccoli florets to the skillet. Cook for about 3-4 minutes or until florets are tender. Remove from heat and set aside. In another skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add garlic, cook for about 1 minute. Add chicken broth and milk. Stir. Add cream of mushroom soup. Stir to combine. Add pasta, chicken, broccoli florets, parmesan cheese, and fresh ground pepper. Heat for another minute or two. Serve immediately.

Combine first three ingredients in saucepan over medium heatbring mixture to a boil. Cook for one minute until the brown sugar is dissolved. Stir in the butterremove from heatcool completely. Whisk cream with vanilla until soft peaks formfold one cup of the whipped cream into the syrup mixturethen fold the remaining whipped cream into the syrup mixture. Chill thoroughly before serving with vanilla ice cream and pecans if desired.

Wash potatoes and cut into wedges. Place wedges into a bowl of ice water for 20 minutes. Preheat oven to 400. Remove potatoes from water and pat dry. Place potatoes into a bowl of dry breadcrumbs. Mix together oil and spices. Drizzle over potatoes and toss to coat. Place potatoes onto a baking sheet and bake for 40 minutes or until potatoes are golden brown and crispy. Serve with lime wedges.

In a heavy saucepan, combine the first six ingredients. Cook over medium heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and add the peanut butter and vanilla extract. Stir until smooth. Pour into an ungreased 9 x 13 pan and cool until room temperature or firm enough to cut with a knife. Cut into 36 squares. Cut again into thirds and wrap each piece of fudge in waxed paper or plastic wrap. Refrigerate or freeze until ready to serve or wrap individually for gifts. Makes about 36 servings.
Put 1 marshmallow in each cup of a 4-cup microwave-safe mug. Stir together milk, peanut butter and honey. Microwave on high 1 to 2 minutes or until heated through. Serve with mugs.

Mix together apples, butterscotch chips, cornstarch and quick-cooking oats. Add cake mix. Mix until well blended. Pat into a greased 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes. Cool on rack. Spread with brown sugar icing. Makes 24 squares.

Cook the ham and cheddar cheese separately. Cook the potatoes. In a large bowl combine the potatoes, bell pepper, mushrooms, ham, cheddar, eggs, cottage cheese. Add pepper to taste. Pour into a baking dish. Bake at 375 for 35-45 minutes.

Cut beef into 1/2 inch cubes. Beat egg white until frothy. Combine egg white and oyster sauce. Place beef in a bowl. Mix egg mixture and beef together. Add remaining ingredients. Heat oil in wok or skillet. Place meat mixture in wok or skillet. Cook until beef is browned. Remove from heat. Add green onions and ginger. Toss until well blended. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place chicken in a single layer in skilletcook for 3 to 5 minutes per side or until browned. Combine broth, brown sugar and cornstarch in a bowlmix until smooth. Add chicken to the broth mixturecover and bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until chicken is tender. In a separate bowl, mix the remaining 1/3 cup of cornstarch with 1 tablespoon of waterstir until smooth. Add the vinegar, peppers and pineapple to the skilletbring to a boil. Stir in the cornstarch mixtureboil and stir for 1 minute or until thickened. Place rice in a large bowltop with the pineapple mixturetoss to coat. Serve with chicken.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut sandwich bread into 3/4 inch cubes. Toss with parmesan, parsley and oil. Spread in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Bake for 10 minutes. Stir in garlic, salt and pepper. Add tomatoes and bake another 10 minutes or until tomatoes are lightly browned. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a baking pan with cooking spray. Season the chicken breasts with salt. Place the chicken in the oven. After 10 minutes, turn the chicken breasts over. Bake until the chicken is cooked through. Take the chicken breasts out of the oven. In the meantime, slice the apple into very thin slices. Grill the bread. To make the sandwiches, spread the bread with butter. Place one slice of cheddar cheese, 2 slices of apple, and a chicken breast on each slice of bread. Place the sandwiches under the broiler for 30 seconds. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Season lamb racks all over with salt and pepper. Rub each rack all over with oil. Arrange in a shallow roasting pan. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Rub the mixture all over the lamb racks, coating well. Roast lamb for about 1-1/2 hours for medium-rare (about 2 hours for medium). Remove racks from oven, cover loosely with foil and allow to rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving.

Salsa Fresca:In a large bowl combine tomato, onion, cilantro, jalapeno, cucumber, lime juice, and salt. Allow mixture to marinate for 30 minutes. To Serve:Place a piece of cabbage on each tortilla. Spread each with guacamole. Add a generous amount of lobster meat. Top with Salsa Fresca. Garnish with lime wedges. Yogurt Sauce:Combine yogurt, mayonnaise and salsa in a bowl. Refrigerate. Serve with tacos.

Prepare a grill for high heat or preheat broiler. Toss asparagus with oil and sprinkle with pepper. Grill asparagus 3 minutes on each side or until tender when pierced with a sharp knife. Remove from grillsprinkle with vinegar and toss with tongs. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Melt the butter in a small saucepan or in a double boiler. In a blender or food processor bowl, combine the egg yolks, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Blend on high speed until the mixture is frothy. With the motor running, gradually add the melted butter in a slow steady stream. Continue blending until the mixture thickens and becomes light in color, about 2 minutes. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

In a large bowl with an electric mixer beat together the brown sugar and granulated sugar until blended. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. Add the flour, baking soda and salt. Beat on low speed just until combined. Add the chocolate chips and walnutsbeat just until mixed. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges are set. Cool for 1 minute before removing from the baking sheets to wire racks. Makes 4 dozen cookies.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil and place a wire rack on top of the foil. Prick the potatoes with a fork all over the potatoes and place on the baking sheet. Bake for 45-60 minutes until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool. Once the potatoes are cool enough to handle, smash them with a fork to desired consistency. Add the olive oil, salt, pepper, and rosemary to a small bowl. Stir to combine well. Place the smashed potatoes back on the wire rack and toss with the herb-oil mixture. Bake for 10 minutes until the potatoes are golden brown. Serve with Parmesan Basil Butter (see below).

Combine first five ingredients in crockpot. Cook for 15 minutes. Stir in tomato paste and madras curry powder. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cook on low for 8 hours. Serve over white rice. Garnish with chopped green onions.

Combine instant espresso powder and liqueur in a small bowl and stir to dissolve powder. Microwave for about 20 seconds or until hot. In a medium bowl stir together sugar, butter, vanilla extract and egg. Mix flour and baking powder together in a small bowl. Stir into wet mixture until combined. Divide batter into 6 cupcake liners in muffin tin. Bake for 18 minutes or until done. Cool in tin for a few minutes then remove and cool completely on a wire rack. Combine powdered sugar and cocoa in a small bowldrizzle over cooled cupcakes or spread over cupcakes with a knife. Makes 12 cups.
In saucepan, heat 1/4 cup milk. Stir in beef and mix until smooth. Add salt and pepper. Add the rest of the milk. Cook over low heat until thickened. Pour over hot buttered toast.

In a large saucepan, melt butter. Add sweet onion and saute until tender. Add apple and saute for 5 minutes. Add wine and bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer for 10 minutes or until apple is tender. Place apple mixture in a blender or food processor with chicken stock. Blend until smooth. Pour into a saucepan. Cook over low heat until slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in cream. Garnish with bleu cheese crumbles and apple slices to serve.

Place carrots in a 15-in. x 10-in. baking dish. Add butter and sugar. Stir to coat. Bake at 400 for 20-25 minutes or until carrots are tender. While carrots bake, in a small bowl, mix lemon juice and parsley. Drain carrots and place in a serving bowl. Add lemon mixture. Toss. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Makes 6 servings.

Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain and set aside. Add diced onions and garlic to skillet with reserved bacon fat and cook until soft and tender. Add tomatoes and red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add whipping cream and simmer until sauce is thick and creamy. Season with salt and pepper. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and add to sauce. Stir well to coat and serve immediately. Top with parmesan cheese and fresh parsley.
Spread baguette slices with mayonnaise, top with tomatoes and artichoke hearts and a sprig of fresh basil. Season with seasoning salt and pepper and drizzle with olive oil before serving
Mix together first three ingredients. Cut chicken into strips and marinate overnight. Grill on skewers or kabobs.

Sprinkle sesame seeds onto the bottom of a medium-sized serving dish. Peel the bananas and slice them crosswise into 1/2 inch thick pieces. Place the banana slices in the serving dish. In a small bowl combine the coconut milk, sugar, and salt. Pour the coconut milk mixture over the banana slices. Chill in the refrigerator for 1-2 hours before serving. Garnish with more sesame seeds before serving.
Puree the chipotle chiles with the cooking oil. Add the parmesan cheese, pine nuts and garlic cloves and pulse until smooth.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees f. In small bowl combine pretzels with garlic powder, dill weed, lemon pepper and chili powder. Spread pretzels on cookie sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 20 minutes or until crisp. Sprinkle with seasoning mix. Bake 5 more minutes.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add egg whites and cook until no longer runny. Add tomato and spinach. Cook until spinach wilts. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve over whole grain toast.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Clean and dry cauliflower. In a large bowl toss together cauliflower with oil. Place cauliflower on a rimmed baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and toss again. Continue to roast 15-20 minutes longer or until cauliflower is tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with lemon wedge.

In a saucepan combine peaches in juice and sugar. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add flour and cinnamon. Cook 1 minute. Transfer to a shallow 2-quart baking dish. Combine oats and butter. Sprinkle over peaches. Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes.

In a 6-quart slow cooker combine onions, apples, chicken and next 3 ingredients. Cover and cook on low setting for 6 hours. Remove chicken from slow cooker. In a small bowl combine soup and stock. Stir into slow cooker. Cook on high setting 20 minutes or until heated through. Serve with rice.

Melt butter in small saucepan over medium-low heat until it begins to foam. Add chipotles and adobo sauce and cook until butter is completely melted and mixture is smooth. Season with black and red pepper blend and seasoning salt. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Spread butter mixture over steaks or chops and grill as desired.

Melt butter in a 2-quart saucepan. Add rice, chicken broth, garlic powder and parsley flakes. Bring to a boil. Cover pan with a tight fitting lid. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 25 minutes or until rice is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in parmesan cheese. Top with almonds. Makes 4 servings.

Place the blackberries in a blender and purée them with 1/4 cup of the sugar until very smooth. Strain the purée through a fine-mesh sieve into a medium bowl. In a large bowl whisk the sour cream with the remaining 3/4 cup sugar, the flour, and the salt until smooth. Fold the purée into the cream mixture until incorporated. Stir in the bread crumbs. Pour the filling into the unbaked pie shell and bake the pie until the filling is set but still slightly wobbly in the center and the crust is golden brown and crisp, about 1 hour. Let the pie cool on a wire rack and refrigerate until it is chilled through before serving it with whipped cream or ice cream.

Boil chicken for 15 minutes or more until meat is tender. Remove chicken from pot with a slotted spoon and set aside. In a saucepan, combine mustard, honey, curry powder, milk and butter. Bring to a boil. Add chicken and heat through.

In a Dutch oven or other heavy large pot with a tight-fitting lid, heat oil over med-high heat. Add chourico and brown, stirring and turning to brown evenly. Reduce heat to med-low. Add bell peppers, onions, garlic and water. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add paste. Stir well. Add wine and water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered until thickened and reduced by half, about 30-40 minutes. Taste and add more water if needed. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Beat 2 eggs lightly with 1/4 cup sugar (use 1/3 cup sugar if you want a thicker eggnog) Beat the egg/sugar mixture into heavy creamgradually beat in bourbon or brandy to taste (I use a 3/4 cup). Stir in 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg. Chill thoroughly before serving. Serve from a punch bowl or a decorative pitcher with a sprinkling of freshly grated nutmeg.

Place water and apple juice in a large bowl. Stir in cornstarch until dissolved. Set aside to cool slightly. Trim ends off carrots and peel if desired. Cut into 2-inch lengths. Toss with mint leaves and cinnamon in a large bowl. Pour liquid mixture over carrotstoss well to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 1-2 hours before serving. Serve as an appetizer or as a side dish.

Preheat oven to 325. Grease and flour a 9x13x2-inch pan. Beat cake mix, pineapple and pineapple juice with a mixer until blended. Stir in cherry pie filling. Spoon into pan. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool cake completely. Beat cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Spread over top of cooled cake. Sprinkle with nuts. Chill.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, margarine, milk, chocolate chips and vanilla. Cook until the mixture begins to thicken. Remove from heat. Stir in marshmallow creme and nuts until well blended. Spread into a greased 11 x 15 baking dish. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Heat the oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened. Add garlic, salt, pepper, bay leaf, parsley and red pepper flakes. Cook 3-4 minutes longer. Add scallops and cook until golden brown and just opaque, about 1-2 minutes per side. Remove from heat. Squeeze the juice of the lemon over the scallops. Serve immediately.

Mix together all the ingredients except the chicken. Add the chicken to the crock pot. Cook on low 4 to 5 hours. Check occasionally to make sure there is enough liquid to cover the top of the chicken.

Slice courgettes 1 cm thick and arrange in layers in a deep serving dish. Add a little salt to the sliced courgettes and leave for 10 minutes to extract the juice. Place a layer of courgettes on the bottom of the dish and season with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Add the next layer of courgettes on top and continue to layer until all of the vegetables are used up. Sprinkle with the capers and parsley. Add a little lemon juice to taste. Serve warm or cold.

In a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add celery and onioncook for about 5 minutes or until softened. Add cornbread cubes and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the stuffing mix. Stir until well coated. In a medium bowl, combine the eggs, chicken broth and pepper. Stir into the stuffing mixture until combined. Pour into a greased 9"x 13" baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 45 to 55 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool slightly before serving.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Season both sides of beef with garlic powder and pepper. Add to pan and cook for 10 minutes per side. Remove from pan to plate. In the same pan, saute onion and green pepper for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes. Add wine and cook for 5 minutes. Add potatoes to the pan and cook for 5 minutes. Add beef and vegetables. Transfer mixture to casserole dish. Bake for 1 hour. Add dressing and bake for 30 minutes. Serve.

Soak cucumbers in water for 15 minutes. Drain. Combine all other ingredients. Add cucumbers and mix well. Season to taste. Divide among 4 salmon fillets. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake salmon fillets at 375 degrees f for 20 minutes. Serve with salad and rice.

Combine lean ground beef, low-fat refried beans, taco seasoning, garlic powder, salt and pepper in a large bowl until well mixed. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to blend the flavors of the seasoning. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spread the beef mixture into each taco shell, then top each with shredded cheese, lettuce, sour cream, and tomato slices (if desired). Bake for 5 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

In a 3 quart saucepan, combine chocolate and hot water. Stir constantly over low heat. Cool. In a large bowl beat egg whites and vanilla until foamy. Gradually beat in sugar, 1/2 cup at a time. Beat in flour, baking powder and salt. Add cooled chocolate mixture and stir until well combined. Spread into 13x9x2 inch pan coated with non-stick spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until firm to the touch. Cool. In a small bowl combine powdered sugar and enough milk to achieve desired spreading consistency. Drizzle over top. Cut into bars.

Mix together the buttermilk, egg and melted butter. Add the flour, buckwheat flour, granulated sugar and salt. Mix together well. Add the baking soda and mix quickly. Pour a few spoonfuls of canola oil into a frying pan. Place 1/3 cup measure on pan and spoon the batter in the center. Flip the pancake and fry until lightly browned on the other side. Serve with butter and syrup.

Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion. Saute until tender. Stir in curry powder. Cook 2 minutes more. Add ketchup, paprika, and water. Cook 2 minutes more. Serve over brats. Serve with mustard.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease 8x8x2 inch baking pan. Layer in chicken pieces, cream of chicken soup and mayonnaise. Top with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered 35-40 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in the center. Let stand 10 minutes. Sprinkle with lemon juice and serve.

Bake pie crust shell according to directions. Remove from oven and set aside to cool. Combine cheeses, roasted red bell pepper and mayonnaise in a mixing bowl. Fold in green chilies and fresh cilantro. Pour mixture into the cooled pie crust shell. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until lightly brown. Allow to cool before cutting. Cut into wedges and serve. Serves 12.

Sift dry ingredients into large mixing bowl. Set aside. Heat sunflower oil in saucepan until melted. Add water, sugar and yeast to oil mixture and stir until yeast dissolves. Add to dry ingredients and mix well to form dough. Knead on lightly floured surface for 10 minutes. Place dough in large greased mixing bowlcover with greased plastic wraplet rise in warm place for 30 minutes or until doubled in bulk. Turn dough out onto lightly floured surfaceknead lightly for 30 seconds. Place in greased 9x5 loaf pan. Cover with greased plastic wraplet rise in warm place for 30 minutes or until doubled in bulk. Preheat oven to 375f. Bake for 1 hour or until golden brown. Remove from ovenbrush with melted butter. Cool in pan on wire rack for 10 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack to cool completely.

In a large heavy skillet over high heat, cook shallot in butter until browned but not burned, about 5 minutes. Stir in sage and cook about 30 seconds. Add wine and boil until liquid is reduced to about 1/4 cup, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low and add mushrooms. Cover and cook 3 to 4 minutes or until tender. Stir in salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400. Prepare steak by trimming off all fat and silver skin. Place steak in a small bowl and sprinkle with seasoning. Marinate steak for at least 1 hour. Remove steak from marinade. Place steak in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Pour remaining marinade over steak. Bake for 30 minutes or until done. Serve steak with pineapple slices and a drizzle of teriyaki sauce.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Unroll cookie dough on baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, or until lightly browned. Remove from oven, let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes. Remove from baking sheet, and cool completely. Using wooden popsicle stick, insert into the center of each cookie. Pipe frosting on popsicle stick, then decorate with decorative candies. Tie on a piece of ribbon to finish off your cookie pop.

Preheat oven to 425f. Mix together the cracker crumbs and salt. Dip each cube steak in the beaten egg substitute. Then dip in the cracker mixture and press on both sides. Place in a greased pan and bake in a 425f. oven until done. Serve over mashed potatoes.

Preheat oven to 375f. Lightly grease an 8x8-inch square baking pan. Combine butter and white chocolate chips in a medium saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring often, until melted. Remove from heat. Beat in sugar, eggs and vanilla. Stir in flour. Pour into pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until set. Cool on rack. Melt milk chocolate and dark chocolate in top of double boiler over medium heat. Spread over blondie. Cool completely. Cut into squares. Makes 16 pieces.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine rhubarb, sugar, and flour in a 9x13 inch pan. In a separate bowl, combine butter, shortening and oatmeal. Sprinkle over rhubarb mixture. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 40 to 45 minutes or until golden. Let stand for 15 minutes before cutting. Serve warm with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Slice eggplant lengthwise into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Place in colander. Sprinkle with salt. Let stand for 30 minutes. Rinse eggplant. Pat dry. Whisk together yogurt with spices, lemon zest. Pour into shallow dish. In another shallow dish, combine panko breadcrumbs with seasoning. Dip eggplant slices into yogurt mixture, then coat with breadcrumb mixture. Heat oil in frying pan over medium-high heat. Brown eggplant slices in hot oil, in batches. Transfer to baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven until eggplant is tender when pierced with knife. Makes 2 to 3 servings. Serve with your favorite vegetable, or with pasta, or with your favorite steak.

Bring 1 1/2 quarts of salted water to a boil in a large pot. Add spaghetti and cook until tender, about 9 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile in a large skillet over medium heat, combine oil with garlic and onion. Add bay scallops and saute until just cooked through, about 2 minutes per side. Add lemon juice and parsley and toss. Divide spaghetti among four plates. Top with scallops and serve immediately.

Cut carrots lengthwise into 1/8 inch strips. Put in bowl and toss with 1 teaspoon olive oil and a pinch each of salt and paprika. Spread evenly in a single layer in a large skillet. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Stir and cook until just tender. Meanwhile whisk together lemon juice and 1 tablespoon olive oil. Season with salt and cayenne. Add carrots to sauce and stir to coat. Garnish with parsley and cilantro.

Toast the whole wheat bread. Spread with hummus. Cut the tofu into 1 inch squares. Spread the squares on the bread. Top with plum tomato slices and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately or chill.

Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the rice and cumin and saute for 2 minutes. Add the lime juice and water, cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 15 minutes or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Stir in the cilantro. Serve with lime slices.

Cook pasta according to directions on package. Combine spaghetti sauce and vegetarian chili. Add mushrooms and onion. Add chili powder and garlic powder to taste. Remove from heat and stir in shredded cheese. Serve over spaghetti.

Place strawberries and sugar in saucepan and cook on medium heat for ten minutes stirring constantly. Cool completely and add gelatin and boiling water and blend well. When the cream has reached stiff peaks add the strawberry mixture and blend well. Do not over mix or the cream will become runny.

Mix the eggs with flour and salt and pepper to taste. Preheat olive oil over medium heat. When hot, add the mixture and cook until golden on both sides. Remove from pan and let sit for a few minutes. Cut omelet into wedges and garnish with edible flowers.

Beat eggs with sugar. Add milk and vanilla. Stir in 2 cups of melted chocolate and set aside. In a separate bowl combine remaining melted chocolate with the graham crumbs. Press into the bottom and sides of a 9-inch pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees until set. Cool slightly. Spread filling over crust. Bake at 350 degrees until filling is set and sides are bubbly. Let cool before topping with whipped cream and sliced almonds.

Soak fruit in water overnight. Drain well. Blend cornstarch and water and add to fruit mixture. Cook over medium-high heat until thickened. Cool and refrigerate. Whip cream until soft peaks form. Fold in vanilla and sugar. Top salad with walnuts.

To make the pesto, pulse basil leaves, pine nuts and garlic in a food processor. Add olive oil, and process until smooth. Season with lemon juice and salt and pepper. Toss zucchini and tomatoes in the pesto. Garnish with feta cheese. Serve.

Heat oil in a skillet. Sauté garlic and sun-dried tomatoes until garlic is golden. Add cream and brandy and bring to a boil. Add black pepper and basil. Cook until desired consistency. Drain pasta and toss with sauce. Serve with grated parmesan cheese and crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bring 3 cups of water to a boil. Add the peas and cook for 2-3 minutes. Drain peas and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the peas, onion, eggs and soy sauce and mix well. Coat a 13x9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Place the chicken thighs in a single layer in the baking dish. Pour the pea mixture over the chicken. Sprinkle the top with the sugar and mirin. Bake for 20-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with sake. Serve hot.

In a large skillet, heat the oil. Brown the steaks well on each side. Remove from the skillet. Add the onions and saute until tender. Stir the onions into the soup and mix well. Place the steaks into a 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Pour the soup mixture over the steaks. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Yum.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and cornmeal. Cut in the butter with a pastry blender or 2 knives until the mixture resembles course crumbs. Stir in the baking powder and soda. Add the buttermilk and stir just until the dough comes together. Turn the dough onto a lightly floured board and knead until smooth. Roll out the dough 1/2-inch thick. Cut out with a biscuit cutter. Place on a baking sheet and bake at 400 for 12 minutes. Makes 8.

Cook pasta shells according to package directions. Brown ground beef in a large skillet. Add salt, onion and bell pepper and cook until tender. Add tomato paste and tomatoes and stir until combined and heated through. Add the pasta and stir until well combined. Serve in individual bowls garnished with cheddar cheese and parsley.

In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook for 2-3 minutes or until soft. Add the kielbasa and cook for 4-5 minutes or until browned. Add the pierogi and the frozen green peas. Stir in the broth. Cover and cook for 10 minutes or until the pierogi are tender. Remove from the heat and stir in the sour cream.

Preheat oven to 325f. Grease and line a 9 inch round baking pan. Beat together sugar and eggs for 5 minutes until light and creamy. Add milk and beat together for 1-2 minutes until smooth. Sift flour and baking powder together and add to mixture. Fold in raspberry jam and cocoa powder. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes then remove from pan and cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place crust on pizza pan or foil lined baking sheet. Spread prepared pizza sauce evenly over the crust, leaving about 1/4 inch free from edge of the crust. Arrange sausage and peppers in center of pizza and top with mushrooms and cheese. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until cheese is melted and pizza is crisp and browned. Cut into wedges and serve hot.

Brown ground beef in a large pan. Drain fat from pan. Add cream of mushroom soup, milk, sour cream and tater tots. Stir until mixture is well combined. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Top with cheddar cheese and mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In a medium bowl mix together sour cream, prepared horseradish, lemon juice, horseradish and Tabasco sauces. Cover and refrigerate for up to 2 hours. Place 1 tablespoon sauce into a small bowl. Add 1 teaspoon Tabasco and mix. To serve, arrange oyster on half shells and drizzle with lemon juice. Spoon a portion of the prepared horseradish sauce over the oyster. Sprinkle with lemon zest and chopped chives. Serve with the spicy sauce on the side.

In a large sauce pan bring the water and salt to a boil. Stir in the rice and reduce the heat so the water is simmering. Cover the pot and let the rice cook until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender. about 20 minutes.Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. When the oil is hot add the cumin and cook, stirring constantly until fragrant about 2 minutes. Add the rice and cook until the rice is heated through and coated with the oil and spices about 2 minutes. Sprinkle with the cilantro before serving.

Mix together beef, cabbage, celery, onion, and pepper. Form into patties. Sprinkle each patty with garlic salt. Place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 425 for 15 minutes. Split each roll open. Top each split roll with beef patty. Bake about 4-5 minutes longer. Serve hot.

Beat eggs and sugar until well blended. Add the salt and nutmeg. Beat well. Add the vanilla and the milk. Beat until smooth. Place custard cups into a shallow pan that has water to about halfway up the side of the cups. Bake for 1 hour at 275-300 degrees f. Remove and let cool completely before serving. Top with fruit or whipped cream and sprinkle with nutmeg or cinnamon.

Bring broth to a boil. Add olive oil, thyme and bay leaf and simmer 30 minutes. Add beans and simmer 10 minutes. Blend soup and return to pot. Add egg and cook 2 minutes. Add parsley and serve with croutons.
In a 4 quart crock pot, combine beef and fajita seasoning. Add vegetables and beer. Cook on high for 5-6 hours. Serve on warm tortillas with shredded cheddar cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease baking dish with butter or margarine. To prepare filling, combine ham, cheddar cheese, parsley, basil, rosemary and breadcrumbs in a medium sized bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Place the ham mixture in the center of each chicken breast half. Roll up chicken breasts to enclose filling. Place the stuffed chicken breasts in the baking dish. Sprinkle tops of chicken breasts with parmesan cheese and drizzle the top with butter or margarine. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, until chicken is no longer pink.

Cut chicken into serving size pieces. Mix all marinade ingredients and pour over the chicken. Cover and marinate for 4 hours. Cook over a medium heat in a skillet or in the broiler in the oven. Turn occasionally until cooked through. Serve.

Cut up the sausage into small pieces and place at the bottom of the crock pot. Add the onion and garlic and saute until the onion is soft and translucent. Add the sauerkraut and potatoes and carrots and stir to mix well. Add the broth and the rest of the seasonings and stir to mix well. Cover and set the crock pot on low and let cook for about 8 hours or until the potatoes are tender. Serve with a side of rye bread or crackers.

In a large bowl, combine ricotta cheese with 1 cup milk and eggs and mix well. In another bowl, combine flour with baking powder and a pinch of saltstir in the remaining 3/4 cup of milk to make a batter the consistency of heavy cream. Using an electric mixer, beat butter in a separate bowl with honey and beat until light and fluffy. Add honeycomb candy pieces and beat well. Spread 1/2 of the batter in a buttered 9-inch round cake pan, spread half the cheese mixture over the batter, then top with half the honeycomb butter mixture and remaining batter. Bake in a preheated 350f oven for 45 minutes or until golden brown and puffy. Cool for 5 minutes in the pan before turning out on a wire rack. Drizzle with honey before serving.

Mix all the marinade ingredients in a plastic bag or a glass bowl. Add the steak and marinade for several hours at room temperature or overnight in the refrigerator. Remove steak from marinade and grill over medium heat until desired doneness. Slice steak across the grain against the meat's fibers for a more tender cut. Serve with cooked rice and sprinkle with parsley.
Wash and hull strawberries. Set aside. Combine sweetened condensed milk and lemon juice. Pour mixture into a baking dish. Arrange strawberries on top. Refrigerate for 3 hours. Serve.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the sugar, corn syrup, baking soda, and saltstir until the mixture boils. Continue boiling until mixture turns a deep amber color (about 6 minutes). Pour over popcorn in a large bowl and stir until evenly coated. Store in an airtight container in a cool dry place.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease a baking sheet with olive oil. Trim the asparagus stalks to about 3 inches long. Toss with salt and pepper. Place on baking sheet. Roast for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Combine lemon juice and zest and dill. Toss asparagus with the sauce. Serve immediately.

Mix olive oil, vinegar, and seasonings together. Place pork medallions into a shallow glass dish or baking dish. Pour marinade over pork and marinate 30 minutes to overnight. Grill medallions over medium high heat. Cook for 4 minutes per side or until done. Brush with butter and serve.

Cut oranges into slices, then slice each slice into very thin half-moons. Set aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9-inch tube pan or 9-inch round cake pan. In a medium bowl whisk together the oranges with the sugar, 1/3 cup of the olive oil, the juice of 3 of the oranges, the zest from all 4 oranges, the flour, baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Beat the remaining 1/3 cup of olive oil with the eggs until light and frothyfold into the batter, add the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, and mix well. Pour into the pan and bake for 45 to 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes, then invert onto a plate or serving platterthe cake should slide out easily. Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar before serving. Serves 10 to 12.

Combine ground turkey with bread crumbs, mustard, egg, salt and pepper until well mixed. Form into patties. In a large skillet, brown the turkey burgers on all sides. Place on a plate. In the same skillet add the sliced bell peppers. Cook until tender. Place the turkey burgers on a bun. Top with lettuce, sliced bell peppers and jack cheese. Serve immediately.

Combine cream cheese, dry ranch mix and chicken meat together by hand or with an electric mixer until thoroughly blended. Divide into 10 evenly sized balls, about 2 tablespoons each. Roll balls into chopped pecans. Chill for 1 hour or more. Makes 10 balls.

Heat cooked rice in saucepan over low heat. Stir in shrimp and green onions. Heat through. Heat water and stir-fry sauce in small skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir until sauce comes to a boil. Stir sauce over rice and shrimp mixture. Cook and stir until sauce is thickened. Serve immediately.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallot and cook for 3 minutes. Add the asparagus and cook, covered for 10 minutes. Stir in the broth, bring to a boil and reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the creme fraiche and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Top with lemon peel and serve hot.
Melt cream cheese and mayonnaise together. Add the paprika and green pepper. Add the frozen vegetables. Mix well. Pour into a 9×13 pan. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 for 1 hour.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Place 8 slices of mozzarella cheese in a greased 9-inch pie dish. In a small bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour the mixture evenly over the mozzarella. Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella slices on top of the egg mixture. Bake until the quiche is puffed, golden brown around the edges and the center is set, about 40 minutes. Let the quiche cool in the pie dish for 10 minutes. Slice into wedges with a sharp knife.

Mix together first 5 ingredients until well blended. Rub spice mixture all over the chicken pieces. Let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Thread chicken pieces onto skewers. Heat grill to high. Grill skewers for 10 minutes, turning once and brushing with marinade. Repeat until all pieces are cooked. Serve with rice.

Soften onion in oil in large skillet. Combine with crumbs. Add tomato sauce, brown sugar and vinegar. Simmer 5 minutes. Combine in medium bowl with mustard, egg, beef, salt substitute and pepper. Mix lightly. Form into loaf in 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat a 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray. Cook egg noodles according to package directions. Drain well. Mix tuna, celery soup, peas, pepper and dill weed in a large bowl. Stir in noodles. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle with paprika if desired.

In a small skillet, saute the chopped onion in the butter until soft. Add the pork chops and cook until brown and cooked through. In the meantime, boil the spinach and drain the liquid. Then add the pork chops back into the skillet and add the spinach and tomatoes and heat through. Serve on top of cooked rice or noodles.
Mix the eggs, butter and milk. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Place in a greased casserole dish and sprinkle cheese on top. Steam for approximately 45 minutes or until set. Serve hot or cold.

Cook pasta in boiling water according to package directions. Drain. Beat whipping cream and milk until stiff peaks form. Add dill, green onion, capers and lemon peel. Fold in smoked salmon. Toss with hot pasta. Serve immediately.

Steam broccoli until just tender. Cut into bite sized pieces. Toss with red bell pepper, purple onion, oil, sesame oil, salt & cracked pepper. Place endive in a single layer. Top with broccoli mixture. Sprinkle with feta. Serve immediately.

Bring 3 cups hot water to boil. Add chicken bouillon cubes and onion powder. Stir until dissolved. Add turmeric and stir until dissolved. Add rice. Cover, reduce heat to low heat, and simmer for 10 minutes or until rice is tender. Remove from heat. Add cashews, golden raisins, candied ginger and chives.

1/2 c. milk 2 tablespoons sugar 1 teaspoon yeast 1/4 c. butter 2 1/4 cups flour 1 1/2 tsp. salt Combine milk, sugar and yeast in 1-quart measuring cup. Set aside until yeast dissolves and starts to foam (about 10 minutes). In a large bowl combine flour, butter and salt. Beat together until flour resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk mixture with yeast until dough comes together. Turn out on lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth, adding additional flour if needed. Place in a large bowl coated with cooking spray, turning once to coat top. Cover with plastic wrap or a clean kitchen towel. Let rise in warm place until doubled in volume (about 1 hour). Punch down dough with fiststurn out onto lightly floured surface again. Divide into 4 equal portionsroll each portion into 8-inch log. Place 1 inch apart on 2 greased baking sheets. Cover with plastic wrap or
Place all in blender. Blend until smooth. Serve with fresh fruit.

Bring chicken broth to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir in cornstarch until smooth. Add mustard, dill weed, butter and onionbring mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heatcover and simmer 5 minutes. Add chickencover and simmer 5 minutes longer or until chicken is done. Serve over wide egg noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook chicken breasts according to package directions. Cool slightly and cut into small pieces. Saute garlic and chicken together in a skillet over medium heat until well blended. In another skillet heat artichoke hearts and 1 tablespoon butter until heated through. In a large bowl combine chicken mixture with artichoke mixture, mayonnaise, soup and curry powder. Stir in lemon juice and soft bread cubes. Pour into a shallow 2 quart baking dish and top with the cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until top is golden brown and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375. Unroll the rollsseparate into four rectangles. Spread each rectangle with 1 1/2 tablespoons salad dressing. Top with 1/4 cup of the crumbled bacon and 1/4 cup of the cheese. Roll up and place seam side down on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden. Sprinkle with green onion. Makes 4 servings.

Combine first three ingredients in small bowl. Place halibut in glass baking dish just large enough for halibut in one layer. Brush with glaze, cover and refrigerate at least one hour or up to three hours. Preheat oven broiler. Brush halibut again with glaze and broil about 4 inches from heat until opaque and flaky when tested with fork, about four minutes. Serve with lemon wedges and parsley sprigs if desired.

Slice oranges into quarters. Remove seeds from avocadoes. Cut the avocadoes into cubes. Cut the onion into small cubes. Sprinkle salt on the cubes of onion. In a bowl mix the cubes of onion with the cubes of avocadoes. Slice the oranges into small cubes. Toss all of the salad together. In a small bowl mix the light olive oil and the dried italian seasoning. Drizzle the dressing over the salad. Serve.

Peel the potatoes and slice into thin slices. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine butter, oil, rosemary, and garlic. Stir constantly until butter is melted and fragrant. Place 3-4 slices in a single layer in each baking sheet. Pour butter mixture over potatoes. Bake at 450 degrees for 12-15 minutes.

Remove stems from mushrooms and set aside. Mix all remaining ingredients together. Fill mushroom caps with cheese mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Turn broiler on for 2-3 minutes. Serve hot.
Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut plantains in half lengthwise. Spread on baking sheet. Spray with cooking spray. Bake 15 minutes on each side at 200 c. Cool and serve.

Cut bread into cubes. Melt margarine in 9 x 13 pan. In a large bowl combine bread cubes with sugar and eggs. Add pineapple. Stir well. Pour into the margarine. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with toasted pecans. Serves 12-16.

Prepare pastry as directed on package for a double-crust pie. Combine brown sugar, white sugar, cornstarch, ginger and cinnamon in a small bowl. Mix well. Peel and slice peaches. Combine peaches, remaining ingredients and sugar mixture in a large bowltoss lightly. Arrange the peaches in pastry shell. Pour any liquid from bowl over fruit. Fold back edge of pastry to form a vent. Bake at 450 degrees F for 10 minutes. Reduce heat and continue baking until fruit is tender and syrup is thick and bubbly, about 30 to 40 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Rinse quinoa. Place the rinsed quinoa into a large saucepan or pot. Add the water, bay leaf, cinnamon sticks and salt. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to low. Cover the pot and cook for 10-15 minutes. When the quinoa has absorbed the liquid and is softened, remove the pot from the heat. Remove the bay leaf and the cinnamon sticks. Fluff with a fork. Toss the quinoa with the almonds and dried cranberries.

Preheat oven to 350F. Place potatoes and carrots into the bottom of a roasting pan. Place pork chops on top of potatoes and carrots and season with Cajun spice and garlic salt. Peel clove of elephant garlic and insert into the center of pork chop and place the lemon quarters into the center of the garlic clove. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat. Sear the chops on both sides and place back into the roasting pan. Drizzle the remaining olive oil over the vegetables and sprinkle with the Cajun spice and garlic salt. Bake uncovered until the center of the pork reaches an internal temperature of 145F, about 50-60 minutes. When done, remove the pork chops from the pan and let rest for 10 minutes. Place the roasting pan directly over the heat source of the smoker and add wood chips and water. Continue cooking for 10 more minutes. Serve chops with roasted vegetables and
Combine tuna with a dash of soy sauce or lemon juice. Cook rice according to package directions. Stir in spinach and almonds. Combine tuna mixture with rice, then serve in a bowl. Serves one.
Heat butter and add flour. Stir constantly for 1 minute and then add beef stock, cream, soy sauce and salt. Simmer for 5 minutes.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan over med heat and saute the onion and garlic clove for 5 minutes until softened and golden. Add the mushrooms and cook for another minute or two, then add the leek and cook for another minute or two. Add the beans and tomatoes and cook for another 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and pour over the parmesan cheese and parsnip cubes and mix well together. Bake in an ungreased shallow casserole dish for about 25 minutes or until parsnip cubes are tender. Serve hot or cold.

Combine the cream cheese and minced garlic in a small bowl. Stir until creamy. Add the bell peppers and mix together. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with fresh parsley if desired. Serve with crackers.

Sift flour with baking powder. Add butter and mix to fine breadcrumbs. Add the egg and mix to soft dough. Knead lightly. Roll out to 1/4-inch thick. Cut out with 4-inch cutter. Place raisins on half the cakes. Bake in a moderate oven (180c/350f/gas mark 4) for 10-12 minutes. Whisk together milk with vanilla essence. Spread over cakes. Bake for 10 minutes more. Leave to cool on wire racks.

Combine oats and sugar in a large bowl and stir until well blended. Pour oat mixture into the bottom of a 13x9x2 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. In a medium bowl combine egg whites, vanilla and almond extracts, and milkbeat until smooth. Pour over the oat mixture and spread evenly. Top with the peachescover and chill 8 hours or overnight. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente, about 12 minutesdrain and set aside. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heatcook sausage until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Add chili flakes and cook for 1 more minutetransfer to a bowl, discarding oil. Return skillet to stove over medium heatadd cream cheesecook until melted. Add pasta, sausage, sauce and Parmesan cheesetoss to combine. Top with parsley.

Pour vinegar over onions in non-metal bowl. Add sugar and stir to mix. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours. Stir in mustard seeds and turmeric. Makes 1 1/2 quarts. Serve on lettuce with sandwiches. Or use as dip for potato wedges, French fries or vegetables.

Heat oil in large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray. Add ginger, pepper and coconut milk. Bring to boil and cook 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Reduce heat to low. Add peanut butter and stir until melted and smooth. Add chicken and simmer 1 minute. Sprinkle with green onions and peanuts. Serve on rice.

Melt butter in a saute pan over medium heat. Add the shrimp and cook until just opaque. Add garlic and shallots and stir briefly. Add the flour and stir to mix with shrimp and vegetables. Add the wine and cook until the liquid has evaporated. Add the broth and mustard. Bring to a boil and add the shrimp. Simmer until the shrimp are pink and tender. Stir in the parsley and serve over cooked pasta or rice.

Cook spinach in boiling water until tender. Drain and rinse under cold running water until cool enough to handle. Squeeze out excess water and set aside to cool completely. Heat oil in a large frying pan or pot and fry onions till softened and light brown in colour. Add the tomatoes and pepper and cook until softened and lightly browned, stirring constantly. Add spinach and cook for a further 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add the bouillon cubes and stir until they have dissolved completely and the mixture is hot. Serve garnished with cucumber slices or lettuce leaves if desired. Season with salt and white pepper to taste. Serves 6.

Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the mushrooms, onion, jalapenos, and garlic. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the onion is softened and mushrooms are browned. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer, cover the pot, and cook for about 30 minutes or until the mushrooms are very tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot sprinkled with cilantro.

Fry onion and bacon until bacon is crispy. Remove from pan. Add butter and oil to the pan and saute the artichokes until lightly brown. Add stock and simmer for 10 minutes. Add bacon and season to taste. Serve with crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Rinse tilapia fillets. Sprinkle with oregano, chili powder & cayenne pepper. Rub butter on top of tilapia fillets. Place on baking sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a heavy large skillet over medium heat, combine butter, vegetable oil, cashews and cayenne pepper. Cook and stir until cashews are lightly browned. Stir in chili powder. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Store in airtight container at room temperature.

In a large saucepan over medium heat add the chicken broth, water, vegetables and ramen noodles. Cook for 10 minutes until vegetables are tender. Add the baby shrimp and cook for an additional five minutes or until shrimp is pink.

In a medium bowl, whisk together tomato sauce, ancho chiles, salt and pepper. In a skillet heat 1 tablespoon oil. Sprinkle 2 of the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Brown on both sides. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining 2 breasts. To assemble quesadillas, heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place 1 tortilla on work surface. Sprinkle 3/4 cup cheese over tortilla. Top with 2 chicken breasts. Sprinkle remaining 1/4 cup cheese over breasts. Top with 1/4 of red pepper, 1/4 of green onion and 1/4 of mango salsa. Top with remaining tortilla. Cook over medium heat until cheese is melted. Fold each quesadilla in half. Cut into wedges. Serve topped with more salsa.

Cook sausage in water until done. Brown sugar is mixed with ketchup. Brown sugar mixture is heated in skillet and then added to cooked sausage. Add onion, liquid smoke, and garlic powder. Cook until thick.

Preheat oven to 500 degrees. Preheat grill. Roll dough into thin round pizza crust. Brush crust with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt. Grill crust until browned. Remove from heat. Place eggplant slices on crust. Sprinkle with tomato slices. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake until cheese is browned. Drizzle with pesto sauce.

Cook pasta according to directions. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add roasted red peppers and cook another 2 minutes. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Add pasta. Stir in feta cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large pan, melt butter and sugar. Add evaporated milk and stir constantly until mixture boils. Reduce heat and cook until mixture thickens, stirring constantly. Stir in marshmallows and vanilla. Pour mixture into a buttered 9 x 12 x 2-inch pan. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and walnuts. Cool until firm and cut into squares. Makes about 40 squares.

Wash carrots thoroughly. Peel if desired. Cut into 1/2-inch pieces. Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add carrotssprinkle with sugar, salt and a pinch of cinnamon. Cover and cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Add beer and cook for 10 minutes longer. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Preheat grill or broiler. Rinse and pat dry fish fillets and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place fillets on grill and cook 5 minutes per side or until fish is just cooked through. Combine remaining ingredients in a medium-sized bowl and serve with fish.
Soak red beans overnight. Rinse. Combine all ingredients except sunflower seeds. Form into patties. Roll in sunflower seeds. Grill. Serve with lettuce, tomato, and mustard.
Steep tea bags in hot water for about five minutes. Remove tea bags and add sugar and lemon juice. Cool and refrigerate. Serve over ice.

In a large bowl, cream together the butter and peanut butter. Add the powdered sugar and vanillabeat until well blended. Add the Rice Krispiesbeat until well blended. Chill until firm. Divide the mixture into 24 balls. Roll in wax paper. Dip each ball in the melted chocolate. Place on wax paper to set. Makes 2 dozen.

In a small bowl combine mustard, soy sauce, garlic and gingerroot. Rub mustard mixture all over lamb. Place lamb in a shallow roasting pan with 2 inch water. Cover tightly with foil. Bake in a 325 degree oven for 2 hours. Uncover. Roast 1 hour. Increase heat to 400 degrees. Baste lamb with pan juices. Roast 15 to 20 minutes longer or until a meat thermometer reaches 160 degrees. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing. Drain fat from pan juices. Combine 2 t. pan juices with remaining mustard mixture. Heat through. Pour over lamb. Makes 10 servings.

Cut the eggs in half lengthwise. Scoop out the yolks and place in a mixing bowl. Add the mayonnaise and honey mustard and blend well. Add the bacon and 1 tablespoon of the cheddar cheese. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Spoon the egg mixture into the egg whites and sprinkle the remaining 1 tablespoon of cheddar cheese over the top. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

In a heavy-bottomed skillet over medium heat, saute onion and mushrooms until golden and tender, 6-7 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds more. Add vermouth and cook 1 minute more. Add scallops and saute 3-4 minutes on each side until cooked through but still tender. Add heavy cream and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 2-3 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Spoon over scallops. Garnish with shavings of sharp cheddar cheese. Serve with rice.

Heat up the broiler. Cut the tomato into 2 thick slices. Cut the mozzarella into 2 thick slices as well. On top of one slice of tomato place a slice of mozzarella. Place the tomato and mozzarella under the broiler for about 5 minutes. The tomato should be nice and charred. Take it out and place on the toast. Top with basil and drizzle with some oil. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).In a medium bowl, combine the cherry pie filling with the cornstarch. Set aside.In a large bowl, combine the granulated sugar, brown sugar, flour and oats. Add the butter and work into mixture with a pastry blender until crumbly.Press the mixture onto the bottom and up the sides of the pie crusts. Sprinkle with the cherry pie filling.Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven.Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake 10 to 25 minutes longer, or until filling is bubbly.Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

Core apples and carefully scoop out seeds. Mix the butterscotch chips and peanut butter chips together in a microwave safe bowl. Microwave on high for 30 seconds and stir well. Continue heating in 30 second increments, stirring after each heating, until the chips are completely melted. Dip apples in the butterscotch and sprinkle with coconut and chocolate chips and sprinkles. Let sit for 10 minutes or until apples are set. Chill until ready to eat.

Place rice in medium size pot or heavy-bottomed pot. Add salt to taste to rice. Add water to rice until it is almost level with rice. Bring to a boil over high heat then reduce heat to low. Place lid on pot. Cook for 15 minutes or until rice is tender and water has been absorbed. Fluff with fork before serving.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute until translucent, about 6 minutes. Add tomatoes and saute until slightly wilted, about 3 minutes. Pour eggs into skillet and sprinkle with parsley. Cook until eggs are just set but still wet in the center. Remove from heat. Top with cheese. Cover skillet and let stand 5 minutes to allow eggs to set. Serve hot.

Blend butter and cheeses until smooth. Add the flour. Mix until dough is soft. Add the red pepper. Shape dough into a log and wrap in plastic wrap. Chill until firm. Unwrap and slice into 1/4 inch slices. Bake on greased baking sheet for 20 minutes. Makes 5 dozen straws.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Melt butter in a small saucepan. Saute chicken in butter in a heavy skillet until lightly browned. Combine melted butter and paprika. Press 1/4 of the butter mixture into each chicken breast. Bake for 10 minutes. Pour remaining butter mixture over chicken. Bake an additional 20 to 25 minutes. Brush with lemon juice and sprinkle with parsley.

Brown beef in large skillet. Drain. Add Mac & Cheese, cream of mushroom soup, vegetables, sour cream, garlic powder. Cook over low heat until heated through. Pour into greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake in 350F oven for about 20 minutes.
Pour all the ingredients into a blender. Blend on high until smooth. Serve immediately. Makes 2 servings.

In a medium bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Stir in dressing and herbs until blended. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight. Stir in lemon peel before serving. Serve with crackers or baguette slices for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease muffin cups. Sift together flour, sugar, nuts, baking soda, and salt. In a separate bowl, mix together the eggs, mashed bananas, pineapple, vegetable oil, and vanilla. Add the dry ingredients all at once. Mix just until moistened. Spoon the batter into muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted near the center of the muffins comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing muffins from muffin cups.

Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium heat. Add sausage and cook until no longer pink. Add pepperoni and hamcook until no longer pink. Add green pepper, onion, and garliccook until softened slightly, about 5 minutes. Stir in tomatoes with their juice, chicken stock, and pasta. Cook until pasta is tender, about 8 minutes. Stir in cheeseseason with salt and pepper. Remove from heatstir in arugula. Serve with hot sauce.

Cut ribs into serving pieces. Toss with salt and pepper. In crockpot, combine ribs, onion, bay leaf, and 1/2 cup water. Cover and cook on low 8 hours or on high 4 hours. Combine remaining water and beer in a bowl. Sprinkle with seasoning. Add potatoes and turn to coat. Place potatoes over ribs in crockpot. Cover and cook on low 4-5 hours or on high 2 hours. Uncoverstir in parsley.

Preheat the oven to 375°F. Wash the chicken inside and out. Place the chicken in a roasting pan and stuff with the garlic and the peppercorns. Pour the madeira over the chicken and roast for about 1 1/2 hours or until the juices run clear when pierced with a knife and the meat is no longer pink. Baste the chicken every so often. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for about 10 minutes. Pour the juice from the pan into a measuring cup and set aside. Skim any excess fat from the juice and add the juice to the pan. Add the olive oil and the salt and pepper to taste. Place the chicken back in the pan and heat through.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Slice steaks into thin strips across the grain. Put in a medium bowl. Stir together dressing, oil, onions, salt, pepper. Pour over steak strips. Stir gently. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Arrange steak strips in a single layer. Bake for 15 minutes or until steak is no longer pink. Spoon onions from marinade into bun bottoms. Top with steak strips. Cover with bun tops. Melt blue cheese in a skillet on top of stove. Drizzle over top of sandwiches. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Coarsely chop celery and red peppers and set aside. Mix crabmeat with celery and red peppers and set aside in a medium bowl.
