Mash cream cheese and nonfat sour cream together in a small bowl with a fork until well blended and smooth. Add butter-flavored sprinkles and mix well. Place a small amount of the cream cheese mixture in the center of each mushroom cap and top with a small amount of the crabmeat mixture. Bake for approximately 20 minutes or until caps are tender and filling is heated through. Serve warm.

Cook chicken in 250f oven 40 minutes. (No thighs or wings please) Let cool. Remove skin and cut into small cubes. In a large bowl combine Miracle Whip, lemon juice and salt & pepper to taste. Toss in chicken cubes and chill overnight. Before serving add celery, onion flakes and cheddar cheese. Serve with potato chips on the side.

Combine all ingredients except pork spareribs in a slow cookermix well. Add spareribscovercook on low for 8 hours. Remove spareribsplace in a large bowlcover with foil to keep warm. Stir soupcovercook on high for 30 minutes or until sauce is thick and glazedpour over spareribs. Yield : 6-8 servings

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pork chops to pan. Cook pork for 5 minutes on each side, or until cooked through (internal temperature should be 160f). Transfer pork to a platecover loosely with foil to keep warm. Add mustard, stock, honey, bourbon, and butter to pancook for 2 to 3 minutes or until heated through. Place pork back on top of pancook for 2 to 3 minutes or until glaze is thickened. Serve pork on top of ricespoon glaze over pork.

Spray a large cookie sheet with olive oil flavored cooking spray. Arrange the croutons in a single layer. Spray the croutons again with the spray. Sprinkle with paprika, chili powder and cumin. Bake in a preheated 375 degrees F. oven for about 10 minutes or until croutons are crisp. Cool on wire rack.

Heat a large frying pan over medium heat. Place one tortilla in the pan. Brush olive oil over the tortilla. Sprinkle with salt. Flip when edges are crispy. Remove from pan and top with sour cream. Add cheese. Sprinkle with more salt, pepper and cumin. Top with another tortilla. Flip. Cook until cheese is melted. Add a squeeze of lime. Top with fresh cilantro. Cut into wedges.

Preheat oven to 425. Steam cauliflower in a covered pot for 5 minutes. Drain and put into an ovenproof dish. Combine condensed milk, milk, and cheese in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook until melted. Stir in bread crumbs. Sprinkle over cauliflower. Bake, uncovered, until heated through. Top with bacon.

Mix the flour, cornmeal, salt, pepper and chili powder. Dredge the oysters in the mixture and fry in the peanut oil until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Combine the mayonnaise, lemon juice and Worcestershire sauce in a small bowl. Spread the mayonnaise mixture over each oyster. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes, or until softened. Add tomatoes and stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 30 minutes, or until soup thickens slightly and is bright red in color. Add cream and pesto and mix well. Serve with basil sprinkled on top. Serves 6 to 8.
Pour boiling water over tea bag. Steep for 10-20 minutes. Remove tea bag and stir in sugar and lemon juice. Refrigerate until cooled. Serve over ice.

Cream butter, sugar and eggs together. Add bananas and cranberries. Mix together and pour into greased 9 x 5 pan. Mix together flour, baking powder and salt and sprinkle over mixture. Bake at 350 for 1 hour.

Season the pieces of chicken with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Heat the oil & butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until foaming. Add the onions & saute until softened & translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the wine & scrape the browned bits from the bottom of the skillet with a wooden spoon. Add the stock & cook for 20 minutes, stirring often. Add the chicken pieces & cook until browned on all sides & cooked through, about 10 minutes. Stir in the oregano & peas & cook for 2 minutes more. Serve immediately with lemon wedges. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour one 8x4-inch loaf pan or two 8x4-inch round cake pans.In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and saltmix well and set aside. In another bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. Stir in the bananas and nuts. Add the flour mixture and stir until well-blended. Fold in the apples and pour the batter into the prepared pans.Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 40 to 45 minutes for the loaf pan or 20 to 25 minutes for the cake pans, or until the bread is golden brown and the juices start to bubble out of the pan and center is set. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan and cool completely on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Separate biscuits into halves. Place 1 half of biscuit on a baking sheet, top with 1 tablespoon jam, sprinkle with cinnamon sugar. Place second half of biscuit on top of jam. Brush with melted margarine and sprinkle with remaining cinnamon sugar. Bake 8 to 10 minutes until lightly browned. Cool slightly before eating.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line a 9×13″ baking pan with aluminum foil, extending foil over sides of pan by 2 inches. Grease foil and set aside. In a large bowl, combine cake mix and pudding mix, mixing well. Stir in egg substitute and water until blended. Spoon batter into prepared pan. Bake at 350f for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack. In a medium bowl, stir together powdered sugar and orange juice until smooth. Spread over top of cake. Garnish with orange sections and refrigerate until set, about an hour. Remove foil from sides and cut into bars. Makes 48 servings.

In a large frying pan melt butter over medium heat. Stir in curry powder and cook until fragrant. Add the onions, celery and garlic and saute for 5 minutes. Add the shrimp and saute until the shrimp are pink. Add the all purpose flour and stir to coat. Pour in the sour cream and whipping cream. Bring to a simmer and cook for 3-5 minutes. Serve over hot rice.

Cook bacon, drain on paper towels. Cut tomatoes into 1/4-inch dice. Cook chicken breasts on a greased griddle or skillet until no longer pink in the center (165 degrees F). Slice each breast crosswise into thin slices. Combine bacon and tomatoes in a bowl. Spread some of the tomato mixture on each of 4 slices of bread. Top with slices of cheese and a slice of chicken. Top with remaining bread. Broil 1 to 2 inches from the heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until the sandwiches are heated through. Makes 4 servings.

Cube potatoes into small pieces (about the size of a nickel). In a large pot boil the potatoes until tender. Drain. In a large bowl combine the potatoes with the butter, milk, salt. Mix together until well combined. Serve immediately.

In a nonstick pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add steaks and cook until they are golden brown on both sides. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are soft. Stir in the taco sauce and cook until the sauce is thick and the steaks are well coated. Sprinkle with the parsley and season with the salt and pepper.

In a wok or large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the green beans. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. Add the garlic, soy sauce, ginger root and honey. Stir-fry for about 3 minutes longer or until beans are tender-crisp. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serves 2-3.

Wash rice in a large colander under running water until water runs clear. Drain rice well. Place rice in a large saucepan or dutch oven with water or broth, cover, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 50 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir occasionally during the last 5 minutes of cooking to prevent rice from sticking to the bottom of the pan. Serve with a variety of vegetables, meat or tofu for a complete meal.

In a medium bowl, beat the shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg and mix well. Stir in the milk and vanilla. In a small bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and saltstir with a whisk. Stir into the shortening mixture just until moistened. Fold in the miniature semisweet chocolate chips. Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups three-fourths full. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 17 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks. Makes 3 dozen muffins.

Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium-low heat. Saute the onion and garlic until soft and translucent, about 10 minutes. Add the tomatoes with their juice and bring the mixture up to a boil. Reduce heat and add the basil, ground red pepper and chicken broth and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add the penne pasta and simmer for an additional 8 minutes. Stir in the cheeses and serve.

Prepare crescent roll dough according to package directions and press into a 9inch pie plate. Beat eggs and milk together. Arrange ham and bacon in a single layer over the dough. Sprinkle with cheese. Pour egg mixture over ham and cheese. Bake in a 350 degree f oven for 30 minutes. Let cool before cutting. Serves 4 to 6.

Heat large skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter and garlic. Cook 1 minute, stirring frequently. Add sugar snap peas. Cook 1 minute. Stir in pecans. Cook 1 minute. Add brown sugar. Cook 1 minute. Add lemon juice. Season with cracked black pepper and salt. Transfer to serving platter. Serve warm.

Place broccoli florets and water into a pot and cook for about 6 minutes. Drain broccoli and set aside. Melt butter and olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. When butter is melted add the peppers and lemon juice. Saute until peppers are tender. Add broccoli and toss until well coated. Add white pepper and serve immediately.

Place ricotta cheese, pecorino cheese, egg and parsley together. Combine well and then add dried breadcrumbs. Combine well again. Bring a large pan of water to the boil. Make a hole in the centre of the tomato sauce with your finger and place a teaspoon of water in this hole. Place one teaspoon of filling into the hole and close hole with sauce. Repeat until all of the filling is used up. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes then remove with slotted spoon and drain. Serve with fresh basil and tomato sauce.

Prepare rice krispy treats according to instructions. Add 1/2 banana to each batch. Divide mixture into 6 equal portions. Place a wooden popsicle stick in each portion. Microwave each portion for 40 seconds. Immediately turn out onto wax paper. Cut each portion into two halves. Top each half with 1/2 a banana sliced lengthwise and 1/4 of a piece of chocolate. Place halves together with chocolate on top. Freeze until ready to serve. Makes 12 pops.

Combine the potato, carrot, and beets in a bowl. Add the hard-boiled egg and onion. Stir in the oil and lemon juice. Add water to the mixture and season with salt and pepper. Combine the rice with the dressing and serve on top of the salad.

Combine 2 cups flour, butter and salt in a bowl. Add egg yolks and water. Mix well and work into crumbs. Chill at least one hour and up to 2 days. Roll out crust and fit into a 9-inch pie plate. Arrange sliced apples in a circle around edge of crust. Mix together remaining flour, sour cream, sugar and butter in a bowl and spoon into center of apples. Bake in a preheated 375-degree F. oven for 35 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cool completely before serving. Makes 6 servings.

Cook noodles in boiling water until tender but firm to the bite. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet melt butter over medium heat. Stir in flour and salt. Cook for 1 minute. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Stir in tuna. Add noodles, broccoli and peas. Heat through. Spread into a 9-inch square baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes.

In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine the sugar and evaporated milk. Cook until mixture is smooth and thickens slightly. Add the peanut butter and butter and continue stirring until melted. Remove from heat and add vanilla and marshmallow creme. Stir until well blended. Pour into a lightly greased 8 inch square pan. Cool and cut into squares.

Spread jam generously over one side of each slice of bread. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Arrange bread slices in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Broil 4 inches from heat until tops are golden brown, about 3 minutes. Cut each slice into 4 triangles. Serve warm.

Place cooked rice in a large bowl, add milk, sugar, cocoa and vanilla. Mix well. Add salt to taste. Butter a baking dishpour mixture into dish, cover tightly with foil or plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight. To serve, top each portion with a dollop of sweetened whipped cream and sprinkle with shredded coconut or chopped nuts.

Cut leeks into rounds about 1/2-inch thick. In a large skillet or saute pan heat butter over medium heat until melted. Add leeks and sprinkle with salt and pepper and saute until tender and lightly brown, about 5 minutes. Add eggs and sprinkle with cheese and stir until cheese is melted and mixture begins to thicken. Pour into an 8-inch square baking dish and sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake until bubbly, about 15 minutes. Remove from oven and drizzle with yogurt and sprinkle with more cheese. Bake until golden brown and cheese is melted, about 5 minutes more. Serve hot or warm with crusty bread or rolls.

Preheat the oven to 350f. In a food processor fitted with a metal blade pulse the figs, hazelnuts, orange zest, allspice and brown sugar to form a coarse paste. Transfer to a bowl. Peel the apples. Cut a slice from the bottom to make them stand upright. Place the apples in the bowl with the hazelnut mixture. Mix to cover. Spoon the apple filling into the apple halves. Place the apples in a shallow roasting pan. Bake uncovered for 1 hour. Remove from the oven. Brush the apples with the orange juice. Return to the oven. Bake for 30 minutes more. Remove from the oven. Spoon some of the liquid from the roasting pan around the apples.

Cook the ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion. Drain any excess grease. Add the barbecue sauce. Bring to a boil. Then reduce heat and cook until thickened. Add the macaroni. Stir until coated. Remove from heat and add the velveeta. Stir until melted. Serve with tomatoes and oscar mayer bacon bits.
In a large bowl combine the chicken meat with the mayonnaise, apricot jam, raisins, and chopped onion. Spoon onto white bread slices and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large bowl combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and saltset aside. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine the milk and butterbring to a boil and remove from heat. Pour the milk mixture over the flour mixturemix well. Stir in the eggs. Spoon into greased or paper-lined muffin cups. Sprinkle with fresh strawberries and macadamia nuts. Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 12 muffins.

Combine tomatoes, onion and bell pepper in a large bowltoss gently to coat. Add seasoningtoss to combine. Let stand 30 minutes at room temperature to allow flavors to blend. In a small bowl, combine cheese and balsamic vinegartoss gently to blend well. In another bowl, combine olive oil and basilset aside. Cut bread into 1/2-inch slicesbrush slices on both sides with olive oil mixture. Place bread on baking sheetbake at 350 degrees for 5 minutes or until toasted. Place bread on serving platter. Spoon tomato mixture over toastssprinkle with cheese mixture. Drizzle with remaining olive oil mixture. Yield: 4 servings

In a large pot, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Stir in the flour and cajun seasoning and cook for 1 minute. Add the clam juice and water and stir constantly until thickened and bubbly. Stir in the tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the spinach and cook until wilted. Remove from the heat. Stir in the crabmeat and the garlic. Ladle the soup into bowls and serve.
Mix pretzels with ranch dressing mix, oil, salt and seasonings. Spread onto baking sheet. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool completely. Store in sealed container.

Cook sausage and onion together in a medium skillet over medium heat for 5 minutes or until sausage is no longer pink. Add sauerkraut and apple. Stir in broth and caraway seeds. Bring to a boil and simmer 5 minutes. Add cheese. Serve immediately.

Combine peaches and raspberries in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in sugar and lemon juice. Mix pectin into 1/2 cup water and add to pan. Stir over medium heat for 1 minute. Remove from heat and skim off foam. Ladle jam into hot 8 oz. canning jars (sterilized in hot water), leaving 1/4-inch headspace. Wipe jar rims clean and seal tightly. Process in boiling water bath canner for 10 minutes. Remove from canner and let sit in water until cool enough to remove jar lids. Store jam in a cool dry place.

Heat olive oil in large frying pan. Add chicken, season with pepper. Cook until done. Transfer to plate. Wash courgette and cut into thick rounds. Place into pan with remaining oil. Add tomatoes and basil. Cook for 2 minutes. Place chicken in centre of each tortilla. Top with mozzarella cheese. Fold over tortillas. Heat in oven for 5 minutes. Serve with cooked pasta.

Place the chilies in a large pot of boiling water and boil until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain the chilies and let cool slightly. While the chilies are cooling, prepare the batter by beating together the eggs and water in a large bowl. Stir in the flour and salt and pepper to taste. Heat the oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches of three or four, dip the chilies in the batter and fry until golden brown on all sides, about 4 minutes. Transfer to paper towels and repeat with the remaining chilies. Stuff the chilies with the cheese and serve immediately with the tomato sauce and sour cream.

Mix together the vinegar, soy sauce, lime juice, sugar, and sesame oil. In a large bowl mix together the gingerroot, green onions, calamari and the marinade. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour. Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Lightly spray the grill grate. Thread calamari onto metal or wooden skewers. Place calamari on the grill. Grill for 2-3 minutes per side or until calamari is tender. Serve immediately. Serve with additional gingerroot and green onions.

Preheat oven to 425f. Place chickpeas in a medium bowl. Add garlic powder and pepper. Toss well to coat. Spray a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Spread chickpeas evenly over the sheet. Roast for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally.

In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce and gingerroot. Preheat oven to 450. Spray a baking dish with olive oil. Place salmon in the baking dish and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place garlic and green onion in the dish around the salmon. Pour soy mixture over the salmon. Bake in the oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and serve.

Peel the garlic cloves. Cut the potatoes into quarters. Cover the potatoes with cold water in a large pan. Bring to the boil. Boil the potatoes until tender. Drain the potatoes well. Mash the potatoes with the buttermilk. Season with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Stir through the garlic. Add the corn & chives. Garnish with chives.

Saute onion in olive oil until slightly browned and tender. Add dressing and broth and bring to a boil. Cook until reduced to 2 cups. Stir in worcestershire sauce. Add seasoned croutons to each bowl. Pour broth mixture over croutons. Top with cheese. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes.
Combine oranges, banana, walnut halves and coconut in a large bowl, tossing gently to combine. Refrigerate until ready to use. Serve over salad greens or as is.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees farenheit. Lightly spray 8-inch square baking pan with cooking spray. Mash bananas in a large bowl. Add remaining ingredients except chocolate chips. Beat at medium speed with an electric mixer until smooth. Spread evenly in pan. Sprinkle chocolate chips over batter. Bake 25 minutes. Cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar. Cut into 1-inch squares.

In a small bowl, combine margarine, bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, onion and spice. Press this mixture onto both sides of fish. Heat 1 tablespoon margarine in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook fish for about 4-5 minutes on each side. Serve with lemon wedges.

Mix together Dijon mustard, lemon juice, rosemary and garlic. Season the inside of the chicken thighs generously. Coat each thigh in bran flakes and parmesan. Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pan to 350 degrees. Add the thighs in batches, working in small batches, and fry for 10 minutes on each side. Remove thighs from pan to a paper towel-lined plate. Add mustard mixture to pan and bring to a boil. Simmer for 2 minutes. Stir in 3 tablespoons of water. Pour over fried chicken.

In a small bowl, mix together the oil, garlic, and sugar. In another bowl, combine the spices with the salt. Place the carrots in a single layer on a baking sheet. Pour the garlic-oil mixture over the carrots and toss to coat. Sprinkle with the spice mixture and bake for 40 minutes or until carrots are tender. Remove from the oven and garnish with parsley and raisins. Sprinkle with lemon juice just before serving.

Place the water in a 2 cup glass measure. Sprinkle the mochiko over the water and stir. Microwave for 1 minute. Remove the container from the microwave and stir. Microwave for 1 minute longer. Remove the container from the microwave and stir. Microwave for 1 minute longer. Remove the container from the microwave and stir. Microwave for 1 minute longer. Remove the container from the microwave and stir. Microwave for 1 minute longer. Remove the container from the microwave and stir. Microwave for 1 minute longer. Remove the container from the microwave and stir. Microwave for 1 minute longer. Remove the container from the microwave and stir. Microwave for 1 minute longer. Remove the container from the microwave and stir. Microwave for 1 minute longer. Remove the container from the microwave and stir. Microwave for 1 minute longer. Remove the container from the microwave and stir. Microwave for 1 minute longer. Remove the container from the microwave and stir. Microwave for 1 minute longer. Remove the container from

Brown the bacon. Cut into 1/2-inch pieces and set aside. Peel potatoes and cut into bite size pieces. Boil for 10 minutes or until tender. Cool and drain. In a bowl combine the potatoes and bacon and mix well. In another bowl combine eggs and milk and beat lightly. Add egg mixture to potatoes and mix well. Add onions, parsley and mustard and mix well. In a 9x13-inch baking pan spread potato mixture evenly. Sprinkle the cheese evenly on top of potato mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until the cheese has melted and lightly browned on top. Remove from oven and let stand for 10 minutes to set up before serving. Serve with sour cream.

Slice the zucchini into 1/4" slices. Mix the egg with 1/4 cup of milk. In a small bowl, mix the bread crumbs with 1/4 cup of parmesan cheese. Dip the zucchini slices into the egg mixture. Shake off the excess. Next dip the zucchini in the crumb mixture. Shake off the excess. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Turn over once during baking. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the chips with the remaining parmesan cheese and parsley.

In a 6-quart Dutch oven or other heavy pot, cook the ground beef over medium-high heat until browned. Drain fat and stir in tomato sauce, tomatoes and green chilies. Bring mixture to a simmer. Stir in buttermilk biscuits until well moistened. Spread into a 13 by 9 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Serve immediately. Serves 4.
Put all in food processor and puree. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Spray a nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Heat over medium heat. Cook carrot 4 minutes or until tender. Stir in rice and spinach. Add dressing and garliccook 1 minute more. Salt and pepper to taste.
Soak bread cubes in milk. Add eggs, sugar & salt. Cook over medium heat until pudding thickens. Stir in vanilla & chocolate chips. Serve warm or chilled.

Drain tofu and pat dry with a paper towel. Cut tofu into 1/2 inch slices and place in a shallow dish. In a plastic bag combine bread crumbs, cornmeal, salt, pepper and cayenne pepper. Remove tofu from bag and dip each slice into the bag. Place on a greased baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Flip tofu pieces over and continue to bake for another 5 minutes. Serve with dipping sauce.

Clean the mussels or oysters thoroughly. Combine the vinegar, water, spices, peppers and bay leaf in saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the vinegar is reduced by half. Add the mussels or oysters and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the lemon slice. Serve hot.

In a small sauce pan melt the butter over low heat. Add the onion and mushrooms and cook until tender. Remove from heat. In a large skillet cook the bacon until crisp. Add the onion mixture and beef to the skillet and mix thoroughly. Add the remaining ingredients except the bacon and cheese. Stir until well blended. Divide the mixture evenly into 4 burgers. Place the burgers on the grill or pan fry until done to taste (approx 5 min per side for medium). Add the bacon to the burgers just before serving. Top burgers with cheese just before serving. Serve on hamburger buns.

Line a 9x13 pan with foil. Set aside. Combine sugar and brown sugar in a heavy saucepan. Add water and bring to a boil. Cook over medium heat until mixture turns a deep brown. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Add crushed pineapple and juice. Stir well. Add butter. Stir in corn syrup and salt. Pour into prepared pan. Add marshmallows. Sprinkle with pecans. Let cool. Cut into squares. Makes approximately 30 pieces.

To make the coleslaw, combine all the salad ingredients and toss together. To make the dogs, thread the sausages onto the skewers and grill for about 2 minutes each side. Top each with a little of the coleslaw and serve in a bun.

In a large saucepan bring chicken broth and rice to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir in coconut milk and ginger and heat through. Add lemon rind and green onions and stir to combine. Sprinkle with coconut and top with lemon slice.

Bring water to boil in large pot or deep skillet. Cook pasta in boiling water according to directions on package. Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water. Meanwhile, heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add garlic and cook, stirring constantly, about 10 seconds or until garlic is fragrant. Add pasta and toss. Add reserved pasta water a little at a time until sauce is desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and gently fold in basil and cheese. Garnish with more basil. Makes about 4 servings.

Prepare sugar cookie dough according to directions. Roll out and cut into desired shapes and sizes. Spread with cool whip and top with vanilla yogurt and fruit of choice. Sprinkle with rainbow sprinkles. Cool and serve.

Preheat oven to 375. Lightly grease a 12 cup muffin pan. In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugar. Add the eggs and vanilla and beat well. Stir in the bananas and mix until combined. In a small bowl combine the baking powder and salt. Stir into the batter. Add the flour and cardamom and stir until just moistened. Spoon batter into the prepared pan. Bake for about 18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and allow to cool in pan for 5 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack.
Melt butterscotch chips and butter together. Stir in marshmallows. Add raisins and coconut. Stir. Drop by teaspoonful on wax paper to cool. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cut apples in half, core each half, and cut slices 3/4 inch thick. In a large bowl, combine apples, raisins, sugar substitute, apple pie spice, and apple juicetoss gently to blend. Spoon apple mixture into a 1-1/2 quart baking dish. In a small bowl, combine margarine, flour, sugar substitute, cinnamon, nutmeg, and saltmix well. Sprinkle over apples. Bake 45 minutes in the preheated oven, until apples are tender. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375. Spray a 1-1/2-qt. baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine bread crumbs and next 4 ingredients. In a small bowl whisk together egg white and next 2 ingredients. Add egg mixture to bread mixture and stir just until moistened. Fold in bananas and nuts. Transfer mixture to baking dish. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted near center comes out clean. Serve warm.

Preheat grill or broiler. In medium bowl combine lime zest, lime juice, 1 teaspoon thyme and the black pepper and salt to tastemix well. Place chicken in the bowlturn to coat both sides with the mixture. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the oilswirl the pan. Add the chickencook for about 4 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in the center. Place chicken on grill rack coated with cooking spraygrill 4-inches from the heat for 2 minutes on each side or until thoroughly cooked. Meanwhile combine the remaining teaspoon thyme with the salsamix well. To serve spoon salsa mixture over chicken. Sprinkle with the lime wedge. Makes 4 servings.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add pork tenderloin and saute over medium high heat until browned on all sides. Add roma tomatoes and saute until tender. Add green olives and saute until pork is cooked through. Add white wine and rosemary and saute until liquid is reduced by half. Remove pork from pan and set aside. Stir in the heavy cream and return the pork to the pan. Heat through. Serve over spaghetti and top with freshly ground black pepper and chopped rosemary.

Cut up chicken breasts into bite sized chunks. In a skillet, cook onions in a little bit of butter until just about transparent. Add chicken and cook. Pour soup into skillet and stir. Add green beans and french-fried onions. Add milk. Heat until bubbly. Add soy sauce and pepper. Serve over white rice.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Wash potatoes thoroughlypat dry with paper towel. Prick each potato 3 to 4 times with a fork all overrub with olive oil to prevent sticking. Place potatoes onto a baking sheetbake for 1 hour, or until fork tender. Remove from ovenlet cool for 15 minutes. While potatoes are baking, combine mayonnaise, sour cream, spinach and water chestnuts in a bowlstir in artichoke hearts. Set aside. When potatoes are cooled enough to handle, cut them lengthwise into quartersremove pulp from inside each potato half. Fill each potato half with spinach-mayonnaise mixturereplace potato topssprinkle each stuffed potato half with cheese and pepper. Return to the oven for about 10 minutes, or until cheese is melted. Remove from ovenlet cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine onion, zucchini, bell pepper and butternut squash with garlic and salt and pepper to taste. Toss well with olive oil until veggies are well-coated. Place vegetables on baking sheet and roast for 20 to 25 minutes. Add tomatoes and thyme and roast for an additional 10 minutes. Serve vegetables over pasta.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Cut the chicken into pieces and then add the sausage. Add the olive oil and red wine vinegar and toss. Add the garlic cloves and the remaining ingredients. Toss well. Thread onto skewers and place on the baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Garnish with parsley if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix pumpkin, milk, eggs and sugar blend. Add spice and mix well. Set aside. Make crust from corn muffin mix. Cream butter, oats and pecans together. Fold into corn muffin mixture. Spread into a 9-inch pie plate. Pour pumpkin mixture over crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

Mix together frozen broccoli, mayonnaise, sharp cheddar cheese and condensed cream of mushroom soup. Add eggs to mixture. Mix until well blended. Press into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with crushed crackers. Melt butter. Pour over crackers. Bake in preheated oven for 25-35 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.
Peel cucumbers. Cut into 1-inch-thick pieces. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Toss the cucumber pieces in the dressing. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

In a large bowl, beat the pudding mix and milk until thick and creamy. Stir in the peanut butter. Fold in the whipped topping. Place in a pie plate and refrigerate for 2 hours or until ready to serve.

In a heavy bottomed saucepan combine the coconut milk, sugar, and cornstarch. Heat over low heat until mixture thickens, stirring constantly. Cook for 1 minute more then remove from heat. Pour into a 9 inch round cake pan. Cover with plastic wrap directly onto the pudding. Refrigerate 6 hours or overnight. Remove plastic wrap and cut into 24 squares.

Preheat oven to 375f. Beat eggs and milk together. Fry bread until golden brown on both sides and set aside to drain. Cut bread into cubes and add to egg mixture. Add garlic, parsley, chili peppers, parmesan cheese and salt & pepper to egg mixture and stir well. Pour mixture into a greased casserole dish. Bake for 1 hour or until golden brown and set. Serve immediately or serve at room temperature. Serve with fresh parsley on top.

In a bowl, combine the kosher salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper, dried lavender flowers, fresh thyme leaves, fresh rosemary leaf, garlic cloves and fresh lemon juice. Add the extra virgin olive oil and whisk. Preheat the grill. Add the pork loin to the bowl of marinade and turn to coat. Place the marinated pork loin on the grill and cook for approximately 10 minutes per side or until cooked to your desired doneness. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Cook garlic in oil 1 minute. Add chicken, garlic, diced tomatoes, kalamata olives and seasonings. Cook 3 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet. Into same skillet add pasta. Toss with chicken mixture. Sprinkle with feta cheese. Serve immediately.

Peel potatoes and slice thin. Place in a skillet with 1/4 cup butter. Add seasoning salt to taste. Cook until tender. Stirring occasionally. When tender turn out onto paper towels to drain. Serve warm.

Butter the bread on one side. On the unbuttered side place a slice of cheese. Close the sandwich and fry in oil until golden brown. Serve the sandwiches on a plate lined with paper towels. Cut in half. Dress the sandwiches with tomatoes, lettuce, pickles and bacon.

Cut cucumbers into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Arrange on platter. Spread mayonnaise on each slice. Top each slice with tuna and then with cheese. Top each sandwich with hard-cooked eggs. Arrange celery and onion on platter. Serve immediately.

Cream butter and sugar. Add egg substitute and mix well. Add flour, 1 cup at a time. Beat well after each addition. Add crushed pineapple, vanilla and salt. Pour into 2 greased loaf pans. Bake at 350 degrees f for 1 hour. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pans. Cool completely. Drizzle with vanilla glaze.

Lightly grease a large skillet with cooking spray. Heat over medium heat for 2-3 minutes. Add egg, scramble and season with salt and pepper. Fold in salsa. Cook 2 minutes more. Top with cheese. Serve on a flour tortilla. Serve with sour cream and guacamole.

Boil a pot of water. Add the turnip greens. Cook for 1 minute. Drain and set aside. In a skillet, cook the bacon until crisp. Remove and drain on paper towels. Discard all but 2 tablespoons of the bacon drippings. Cook the turnip greens in the bacon drippings until tender. Stir in the sugar and seasoning salt. Cook until the liquid thickens and the greens are glazed. Stir in the garlic powder and red pepper. Serve hot with crumbled bacon on top.

Boil sugar and water for 4 to 5 minutes. Add the vanilla bean and cook for 1 minute. Cool to room temperature. Strain the syrup through a sieve into a bowl and discard the vanilla bean. Add lemon juice and stir to combine. Refrigerate and serve over ice. Makes 16 ounces.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl mix oil and honey together. Add egg, mix well. Add carrots and bananas. In a separate bowl mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon zest. Sift together. Add to carrot mixture. Add raisins. Bake on a greased baking sheet for 30 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes.

I use a crock pot. I put in the ham and cut it in slices. I cut up the cloves. I put in the ham, cloves and pineapple. I put in the crock pot. I put in the ham and cloves and the pineapple slices. I cover it and let it cook. I make sure to put in a little water. I let it cook over night. I take it out and put it in a bowl. I sprinkle it with parmesan cheese. I put it in the microwave for a few minutes. I let it cool. I put it in a bowl. I sprinkle it with the parmesan cheese. I put it in the microwave for a few minutes. I let it cool. I take it out and put it in a bowl. I sprinkle it with the parmesan cheese. I put it in the microwave for a few minutes. I let it cool. I put it in a bowl. I sprinkle it with the parmesan cheese. I put it in the microwave for a few minutes. I let it cool. I take it out and

Beat eggs in a bowl with a little vanilla essence and milk. Beat in the flour. Heat a pan over medium heat and add butter and the sourdough bread. Let the bread cook in the butter and then flip over. Once the bread is golden brown and cooked through. Spread with the nutella and sprinkle with the toasted almonds. Serve immediately. You can use any nutella spread. The key is to have the bread cooked through so you can spread the nutella without it dripping out.
Heat oil in wok. Add spinach. Add chili sauce. Stir-fry 2-3 minutes. Add tomato, garlic, and black bean sauce. Stir-fry for another minute. Add lemon juice. Serve over white rice.

Spray 9x13-inch pan with cooking spray. In saucepan combine steak sauce and jelly. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in worcestershire sauce and garlic powder. Place 2 chicken breasts in pan. Top with 1 cup sauce. Top with remaining chicken breasts. Pour remaining sauce over chicken. Cover and refrigerate 3 hours. Preheat oven to 350f. Bake uncovered 45-50 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve with rice.

In a Dutch oven over medium heat, saute onion, carrot and celery until crisp-tender. Add the water and cook until the vegetables are tender. Stir in the salt and pepper. Add the chicken broth and heat to simmer. Reduce the heat and cook, uncovered until the broth is reduced to about 4 cups. Add the half-and-half and bring to simmer. Cook over low heat until hot but not boiling. Taste and adjust the seasonings. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a loaf pan. In a medium bowl, stir together flours and baking powder. In a large bowl, beat together butter, sugar and eggs. Stir in flour mixture until just mixed. Add beer and mix until just combined. Pour batter into loaf pan. Bake for about one hour or until a wooden skewer inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean. Let stand for about five minutes before removing from pan to cool.

Preheat oven to 350. Peel the potatoes and place in a microwaveable dish with a little water to cover. Cook 5 minutes. Cut in half and remove the skins. Mash the potatoes with butter, curry powder and honey. Place in a buttered shallow baking dish and bake for 20 minutes or until browned and bubbly.

Season short ribs with salt and pepper. Heat oil in pressure cooker over medium heat and sear short ribs on all sides until nice and golden. Remove ribs from pressure cooker and set aside. Add wine to pressure cooker and stir in onion and garlic. Cook until wine has evaporated. Add beef broth to pressure cooker and deglaze the bottom of the pan. Add ribs back to pressure cooker and bring to a boil. Cover and cook for 15 minutes. Remove from pressure cooker and let the meat cool and set for 30 minutes. In a bowl, combine honey and bbq sauce and pour over ribs. Cook ribs for another 15 minutes in oven. Serve with mashed potatoes and steamed green beans.

Cook the chicken breasts in a 4-quart pot of boiling water over high heat until the chicken is tender and no longer pink inside. Drain. Cut the chicken into 1/2-inch cubes. Peel the hard-boiled eggs and cut them into small cubes. Cut the cucumber in half lengthwise and then into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Cut the potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, eggs, cucumber, potatoes, onions, sour cream, mayonnaise and tomatoes. Serve at room temperature or cover and chill up to 1 day.

In a large skillet cook the green beans with water until just tender. Drain. Cut into bite-size pieces. In a shallow dish, combine the mushrooms with the flour. Dip the fish into the mushroom mixtureshake off the excess. Cook in a large skillet with the butter over medium high heat until brown on both sides. Arrange fish on a baking dish. Arrange potatoes on top of fish. Top with green beans. Combine milk, breadcrumbs, salt and pepper in a bowl. Pour over fish. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes or until fish flakes with a fork.

In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the apple cider and vanilla extract and bring it to a gentle simmer. Peel the apples and cut them into wedges about 1/2 inch thick. Add the apples and cook for about 20-25 minutes (or until they're tender), stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. Remove from heat and add the caster sugar and brown sugar and stir until well-combined. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. To make the crumble topping, combine the brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and hazelnuts in the food processor or blender and pulse until the nuts are finely ground (or you can simply use your fingertips to mix everything in a large mixing bowl). Add the cold butter and pulse until the mixture resembles coarse meal (or stir the mixture in the mixing bowl until everything is evenly moistened). Spread the apple mixture in an even layer into an 8-inch square pan (or other shape). Sprinkle the crumble evenly over the apples and bake

Marinade ribs with salt & garlic. Place on rack in shallow dish. Mix in whole leaf oregano & cover with blended red chili sauce. Marinate 3-24 hours. Cook ribs on grill until fork-tender. Cut in small pieces. Serve with warm tortillas. Makes 8 servings.

Combine water, sugar and yeast. Let stand until frothy. Add salt. Beat in oil. Mix flour with a wooden spoon. Stir in yeast mixture. Beat with a dough hook. Knead until smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowl. Cover and let rise in a warm place for one hour. Punch dough down. Roll out into a rectangle. Roll up jelly-roll style. Pinch seam and ends. Place in a greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Cover and let rise until doubled. Bake at 350 f for about one hour. Remove from pan and cool. Makes one loaf.

In a small bowl, mash the cream cheese. Add the jalapenos, lime juice, hot sauce, and cilantro. Stir in the mashed smoked oysters. Spread the mixture onto the bread slices. Top with the slices of red onion.
Mix together the oregano and lemon juice in a bowl. Toss through the halloumi and olives. Thread onto skewers and drizzle with olive oil. Grill for 4-5 minutes on each side. Serve with pita bread.

Soak the mandarin oranges in the boiling water for 10 minutes. Drain well. Combine the mandarin oranges with the sherbet in a serving bowl. Let set in the refrigerator for one hour. When ready to serve, pour the orange gelatin over the mandarin orange/sherbet mixture and stir. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl combine venison, bacon, onion, salt& pepper. Divide mixture into 4 patties. Cook on a preheated grill over medium heat for about 6 minutes on each side or until no longer pink inside& juices run clear. Serve on whole wheat bun with desired condiments.

In a large bowl, combine turkey, cheese, egg white, mustard, bread crumbs, and seasonings. Shape into 4 patties. Spray baking sheet with cooking spray. Grill or broil burgers 6-8 minutes on each side or until done (160*F), basting with oil occasionally. Makes 4 servings.

Combine seasoning salt and water. Place beef tenderloin steaks in the mixture. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate 1 hour or more. Grill steaks to desired doneness. Slice thinly across the grain. Toss romaine lettuce with croutons. Add steak. Dress with caesar salad dressing. Top with parmigiano-reggiano cheese and tomatoes. Serve warm or cold.
Place meatloaf on hamburger bun, spread with barbecue sauce and top with cheese.

Heat butter in wok over high heat. Add egg. As egg begins to cook, add rice, stirring constantly. Add onion, shallot, garlic. Add star anise. Continue stirring until rice is cooked. Season with salt. Serve.

Melt butter in a large pot over medium-high heat. Stir in onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add potato and celerycook until tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute. Add clam juice and milk. Stir until mixture comes to a boil. Add clams and heat for about 1 minute. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with buttered bread.

Melt the butter in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Season the chicken breasts with the salt and pepper. Brown the chicken well on both sides. Add the green onions, garlic and parsley. Cook for a minute or two. Add the fresh tarragon, thyme, and drambuie. Simmer for about 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Trim the asparagus spears. Heat the oven to 400 degrees. On a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil place the asparagus on the sheet. Drizzle the asparagus with the apricot preserves, soy sauce & garlic powder. Sprinkle with the salt & pepper. Roast for 10 to 15 minutes until lightly browned & tender.

Drain water from artichokes and place in food processor. Add mayonnaise, cheese, garlic powder and seasonings. Pulse until smooth. Transfer to small bowl. Garnish with chopped parsley. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Heat a large cast iron skillet over high heat until hot. Add steak. Cook for 4 minutes per side for medium rare, turning once. Transfer to plate. Add wine to skillet and stir to deglaze. Pour half-and-half cream into skillet and cook, stirring occasionally until thickened. Stir in Boursin cheese and green onions. Spoon sauce over steak and sprinkle with parsley.

Cook the pasta shells according to the directions on the package. While the shells are cooking, melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat. Add the gorgonzola cheese and milk. Stir well. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook 3 to 4 minutes, stirring constantly until the cheese melts and the sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Add the heavy cream. Bring to a simmer. Remove the sauce from the heat. Stir in the parmesan cheese. Drain the cooked shells. Pour the gorgonzola cheese sauce over the shells. Sprinkle with more parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Boil water. Pour over tea bags. Let steep for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Add ginger. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add whole cloves, cardamom pods, nutmeg, and cinnamon sticks. Steep 1 minute. Add milk to taste. Serve hot.
Place potatoes in a 9x13 baking dish. Mix together soup and milk and pour over potatoes. Sprinkle with paprika and onion and bake at 350f for 1 1/2 hours. Stir once half way through baking time.

Mix together 2 cups of mesquite meal and 1 cup of whole wheat flour in a large bowl. Add 3 teaspoons of baking powder and 1 teaspoon of baking soda and stir. Add 2 1/2 cups of water and 1/4 cup of canola oil and stir until smooth and thick. Pour into greased loaf pan and bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for 45 minutes. Cool and slice.

In a large skillet brown the beef with the onion. Drain off any excess grease. Add the tomato soup. In a bowl combine the macaroni and milk. Pour the macaroni mixture into the skillet. Stir until well combined. Add the egg. Place in a greased 9x13x2 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Return to oven for 5 minutes more until cheese is melted.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan. Mix the cake mix with the water, vegetable oil, eggs, and butter. Blend well. Fold in the flour, cinnamon, and sugar. Spread into prepared baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the vanilla and powdered sugarset aside. In a medium bowl, combine the glaze ingredients. Spread over the warm cake. Sprinkle with the reserved powdered sugar. Cool before slicing.

Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat. When crispy remove from skillet and set aside. Add broccoli to skillet, stirring occasionally. Add 1/2 of a cup of water, cover, and cook until broccoli is bright green, about 5 minutes. Add peas, cover and continue cooking until tender. Add butter, 1/4 cup at a time until all of it is melted. Add cooked linguine. Toss to combine. Add ricotta cheese, basil, and bacon. Toss. Serve.

Combine mayonnaise, orange juice and lemon juice. Add celery and apples. Mix well. Place chicken in a bowl. Add apple jelly to dressing. Pour over chicken. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour. Sprinkle with nuts. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl, combine sausage and cream. Spread evenly in crust. In a medium bowl, combine eggs and cheese. Pour over sausage mixture. Bake for 40-45 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Cut into wedges.

In a saucepan combine the brown sugar and butter. Stir over medium heat until the mixture boils. Continue stirring until the mixture is golden brown. Remove from heat. Add the milk and stir until smooth. Allow to cool for a few minutes before adding powdered sugar and vanilla extract.

Combine the crabs with the margarine and 1/4 of the evaporated milk. Add the hot chili peppers. Add the curry leaves. Sprinkle over the salt. Add the sugar. Stir well. Pour the remaining evaporated milk. Stir well. Add the water. Add the cornflour. Stir well. Cook over a medium heat until the gravy thickens. Serve hot.

Cook chicken in boiling water until done. Remove from bone and cube. Combine all remaining ingredients except cheddar cheese. Mix well. Pour over chicken. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Top with cheese and bake for 5 minutes more or until melted. Serves 4.
In a large bowl, mix together carrots and frozen peas. Add mozzarella cheese and ranch salad dressing. Stir in bacon and green onions. Mix well. Serve in a lettuce leaf.

Cook chicken in boiling water 8 minutes or until no longer pink and firm. Drain and cool. Cut each chicken breast in half horizontally. Melt margarine in medium saucepan on low heat. Add water and cracker crumbs and stir until crumbs are coated. Remove from heat and stir in cheese. Place 1 piece chicken on each of 4 ungreased small shallow baking dishes. Top with 1/2 cracker mixture. Top with 1/2 cup soup and 1/4 cup sour cream. Spoon 1/2 cup sauce over top. Top with 1/2 cup mushrooms. Top with remaining cracker mixture. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until topping is crisp and golden.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Line a jelly roll pan with paper towels. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the bacon for 4-5 minutes or until cooked. Drain on paper towels. In the same skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the onion and garlic. Cook for 3 minutes or until the onion is translucent. Add the potatoes, thyme, chicken stock and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover, simmer for 15 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Remove from the heat. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher. Season with salt & pepper. Stir in the bacon. Ladle the soup into bowls. Top with cream.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Add scallions and garlic and saute until lightly browned. Add celery and saute until tender. Add seasoning mix and mix well. Stir in tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add olives and shrimp and cook until the shrimp are done. Stir in dill weed. Serve immediately.

Slice lebanese bread in half horizontally and lay flat on a pizza pan or cookie sheet. Spread tomato paste on top of bread and cover with cheese. Sprinkle with oregano and basil and salt and pepper to taste. Bake in a preheated oven at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until cheese melts and bread is crisp. Top with olives and serve immediately.

In a large pot or Dutch oven, boil pasta until tender. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, combine chicken, onion and tomatoes. Add dressing and cook over medium heat until heated. Stir in the lemon juice and garlic powder. Serve on top of the pasta. Garnish with bacon.

Blend the cocoa and semisweet chocolate in a food processor until smooth. Whisk in the sugar and spices. Store in an airtight container. To prepare hot chocolate, whisk 1 tablespoon of mix into 8 ounces boiling waterstir in milk to taste

Beat shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add molasses and egg and mix well. Sift together flour, soda, salt, cinnamon, cloves and ginger. Add to creamed mixture and mix well. Roll out dough on floured surface 1/4-inch thick. Cut into desired shapes. Bake on greased baking sheet at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack.

Soak the wheat for at least 8 hours. Put the whole wheat into a food processor and pulse to a course meal. Add the egg yolks and blend again. Add the rest of the dry ingredients. Then add the butter, egg whites, pure maple syrup and sea salt. Stir gently until combined. Cook in a waffle iron. Serve hot.

In a small bowl combine ricotta cheese and powdered sugar. Beat with a mixer until well blended. Add orange juice and vanillabeat well. Pour into serving dish and refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight. Garnish with orange slices just before serving. Serve dip with fresh fruit or as a dip for fruit tortilla rollups or fruit-filled crepes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel and quarter sweet potatoes. Add potatoes to a large saucepan. Cover with 2 inches of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender. Remove potatoes from heat. Let cool for 10 minutes. Mash potatoes with a potato masher. Add the milk and butter. Season with the salt and pepper. Stir in the cheese. Spoon into a 3 quart casserole. Bake 30 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with fresh parsley.

Mix together mustard, orange juice, scallions and salt and pepper to taste. Place salmon steaks in a glass dish or plastic bag with half of the marinade. Let marinate for 20 minutes. Reserve remaining marinade in a bowl. Grill fish on a heated grill or broiler rack over medium heat 6 to 8 minutes on each side or until fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork. Drizzle with reserved marinade or serve with reserved marinade as a dipping sauce.

Melt butter in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the shrimp and garlic. Sauté until just cooked through. Add chardonnay. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the rest of the ingredients. Cook until the shrimp are completely cooked through, about 5 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add salt to taste. Serve over cooked angel hair pasta.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Mix together flour, baking powder and salt. Cut in butter until crumbly. Mix in the cold water. Mix in the cornmeal. Turn onto a floured board. Knead 2 or 3 times. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into 8 equal pieces. Bake on greased baking sheets for 10 minutes.

Brown sausage in a skillet over medium heatdrain fat. In a large pot, combine broth, water, potato mix, mixed veggies, salt & pepper to taste. Bring to a boil over high heatreduce heat to medium-lowsimmer uncovered for 15 mins. Crumble sausage into chowderheat through. Stir in whole milkheat through. Garnish with chives. Serve with crackers or garlic bread.

Rinse rice well and soak in water for about 30 minutes or until all the starch is gone and rice is swollen. Drain and set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a wok or skillet. Add onions and celery and saute until tender and brown. Add green pepper and saute for a couple of minutes. Add soy sauce and beef bouillon cubes and stir well to combine. Add ground beef and rice and stir well to combine. Add 3 cups of boiling water and bring the rice mixture to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and cover and simmer for 30 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Serve hot garnished with green onions and shoyu or soy sauce.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place roast in a large roasting pan. In a small bowl combine onions, cloves and water. Brush half of onion mixture over roast. Bake uncovered 2 hours. Turn roast over. Brush remaining onion mixture over roast. Bake uncovered 2 hours more or until a meat thermometer reads 160f. Pour barbecue sauce over roast and bake 30 minutes more. Cut roast across grain into slices. Sprinkle with onions. Makes 8 servings.

Place dark brown sugar and unsalted butter in a microwave safe bowl. Microwave at high for 1 to 2 minutes or until butter is melted. Stir in half-and-half and light corn syrup. Microwave at high for 4 minutes or until mixture is boiling and thickened. Stir in brandy and walnuts. Microwave at high for 1 minute or until heated through.

Roll out your pizza dough to 1/4-inch thickness. Place it on a pizza stone or baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Spread the tomato puree evenly over the dough to within 1/4-inch of the edge. Sprinkle with the garlic and then the spinach. Top with the ricotta and mozzarella cheese and the fresh basil leaves. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and the crust is crisp and golden brown. Serve warm with more fresh basil leaves, if desired.

In a saucepan over medium heat add the olive oil butter and onion. When onion is soft add garlic and cook until garlic is translucent. Add tomatoes and cook until they are soft and start to break down. Add the vegetable stock and stir well. Add rice, stirring well to make sure that rice is coated well with the liquid. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and cover pan. Simmer until all liquid is absorbed about 20 minutes. Fluff with a fork and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with a sprinkling of fresh parsley or basil and grated cheese if desired.

Preheat oven to 400f. Combine apples and 1/4 cup water in a large skillet. Cook over medium heat until tender. Stir in the bread cubes. Set aside. Combine brown sugar and spices. Add the melted butter and stir to combine. Spread over the top of the apple mixture. Cover and bake for 15 minutes. Uncover and bake for another 5 minutes.

Cut tofu in half and place cut side up on a baking dish. Mix together the remaining ingredients in a bowl and pour over the tofu. Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes or until the marinade is absorbed. Cut the tofu into wedges and serve.
Mix all together and serve cold over ice cubes. Garnish with maraschino cherry. Serves 4 to 5.

Peel and dice the potato. Chop the turnip and onion. Place a heavy-based pan over a medium heat and add the diced potato. Cover with cold water and bring to the boil. Cook for 10-15 minutes or until potato is tender. Add the turnip, onion and chives and cook for a further 5-10 minutes. Drain well. Melt the butter in a large saucepan and stir in the flour. Gradually stir in the milk to form a smooth sauce. Season with salt and pepper and add the potato mixture. Cook gently for 1 minute. Serve immediately.
Slice focaccia bread into two pieces. Spread cream cheese on each piece. Sprinkle with sour cream and dill weed. Top with sardines and capers. Top with red onion. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 375F. Lay muffins on a baking sheet. Heat olive oil in a medium size nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 5 minutes until tomatoes start to burst. Turn heat to low and add garlic and cook another minute. Divide tomato mixture evenly among muffins. Top with basil leaves. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for about 5 minutes until cheese has melted. Serve with greek yogurt.

Melt butter in a 1-quart baking dish. Stir in corn niblets and creamed corn. In a medium bowl, combine sour cream, egg and flourstir until smooth. Stir in cornmeal and seasonings. Pour over corn mixture. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spread olive oil on both sides of the bread and lay out on a baking sheet. Sprinkle red onions over the focaccia. Place the turkey, cranberries, cheese on the focaccia and top with the other piece of focaccia. Bake at 400f until the cheese is melted. About 5 minutes. Serve on a plate or a platter with a bowl of salad or vegetables of your choice.

Preheat the oven to 175°C. Lightly grease and line the base of a 23cm cake tin. Using an electric mixer beat the butter until light and fluffy. Add the sugar and beat again. Sift over the flour, bicarb of soda and baking powder and mix well. Beat well. Add the hot water and puree and beat again. Fold through the walnuts and dates. Spoon into the cake tin. Smooth the top and bake for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and leave to cool for 10 minutes before turning out of the tin. Dust with icing sugar to serve.

Cook pasta according to directions on the package. In the meantime, chop and add cherry tomatoes to a bowl. Chop mozzarella cheese and add to the bowl with the tomatoes. Drizzle the tomatoes and mozzarella with pesto. Add drained pasta and stir to combine. Add a little olive oil to the mixture and season with parmesan cheese and pine nuts. Serve immediately.

Combine the flour, mayonnaise, and milk in a mixing bowl. Knead the dough a few times until it comes together into a ball. Divide the dough in half. Roll each half out into a 3-inch round. Place each on a lightly oiled baking sheet. Brush each with milk. Bake at 375 for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet with olive oil or spray with cooking spray. Unroll the nori sheets so that you have 2 long sheets of seaweed with a layer of paper between them. Sprinkle the seaweed with sesame oil and sea salt to taste, and place the baking sheet in the oven. Bake until crisp, about 15 to 20 minutes. Sprinkle the crispy sheets with sesame seeds, and break into pieces. Serve immediately.

In a bowl sift together the flour, cinnamon and baking soda. Cut the shortening into the flour mixture with a pastry blender until crumbly. Add the egg and extract and mix well. Refrigerate the dough at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 375. Roll dough into 1 inch balls. Place on a parchment lined cookie sheet. Bake for 6-8 minutes until lightly browned. Cool 1 minute before removing to a wire rack.

Spread garlic butter on french bread. Lay bacon slices on top of garlic butter on bread. Lay chicken breasts on top of bacon slices on bread. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Place under broiler until cheese is melted. Serve.

Slice the challah into 1/2-inch thick slices (about 6 to 8 slices). Place the slices into a shallow pan and pour the whole milk over the bread. Let soak for 5 to 10 minutes. In a small bowl combine the eggs, salt, honey, orange zest, and vanilla. Beat well to combine. Place a large skillet over medium-high heat and add the butter and olive oil. When the butter starts to brown (about 1 minute), pour in the egg mixture. Let the mixture cook for about 1 1/2 minutes until the mixture begins to thicken. Using a large spatula, gently stir the mixture until the egg mixture is about 1/4-inch thick all over the pan. Sprinkle the top of the french toast with more sugar. Place a piece of challah on top of the sugar, then repeat with the remaining pieces of bread. Cook for about 3 minutes until the bread is brown on the bottom. Flip the bread over with the spatula to brown the other side. Serve warm with additional honey drizzled on top.

Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover with cold water by about two inches. Cover pot and bring to a boil over high heat and cook until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes or so depending on size of potatoes. Drain potatoes and place in a large bowl. Add the butter, milk and seasonings and mix well. Add the cheese and the sour cream and mix well. Serve immediately or cover and store in the fridge until ready to serve.

Trim both ends off of cucumber. Peel off skin with potato peeler. Cut cucumber into 1 inch pieces. Mix together salt, sugar, rice vinegar, sesame oil and vegetable oil in a bowl. Pour over cut cucumber. Toss to coat. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Drain off liquid. Mix together rice vinegar, sugar, sesame oil, vegetable oil and gingerroot in a bowl. Add to cucumber. Mix to combine. Cover. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Garnish with red pepper flakes. Serve.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper and add to skillet, stirring occasionally and reducing heat if the oil starts to smoke. Cook until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink inside (140 degrees F on an instant read thermometer), about 10 minutes for small breasts and about 12 minutes for larger breasts. Transfer chicken to a plate and let rest for 1 minute. Pour broth into the skillet and bring the mixture to a boil, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet. Add ginger and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in basil and mint and cook until the herbs are wilted, about 1 minute. Stir the lime juice into the mixture and bring back to a boil. Toss the chicken in the sauce and serve over rice or quinoa.

Whisk together eggs and milk in a medium bowl. Place butter in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. When butter is melted and foaming, stir in the flour and cook for about 30 seconds. Whisk in the mustard. Add the eggs and milk mixture and stir constantly until the eggs are thickened. Add the salt and cayenne and continue cooking until the sauce is thickened and has the consistency of heavy cream. Serve with toasted English muffins.

In a Dutch oven combine beans and onion. Bring to a boil over medium heatcover and reduce heat to low. Cook until heated through. Add beef and barbecue saucecook until heated through and beef is no longer pink. Serve with toppings as desired.

Line 15x10x1-in. baking pan with waxed paperset aside. Beat butter and cream cheese until blendedbeat in vanilla. Gradually add powdered sugarbeat until smooth. Stir in pecans and chocolate chips. Spread into prepared pansmooth top. Chill 8 hours or overnight. Lift from pancut into 3x1-in. bars. Store in tightly covered container. Makes 16 bars.

Mix together soy sauce, honey, dark sesame oil, fresh lemon juice, fresh ginger, garlic cloves and five-spice powder. Stir in white pepper to taste. Toss chicken wings with sauce in a bowl and marinate for 4 to 24 hours in refrigerator. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Remove chicken wings from marinade and pat dry with paper towels. Place in a single layer on a cookie sheet. Bake for 40 minutes in preheated oven, or until browned and tender.

Beat pumpkin, egg beaters, milk & pumpkin pie spice until smooth. Add flour, stirring until combined. Press into pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Mix cool whip free with apple butter. Top with apple butter mixture. Serves 8.

Grease and flour two 9-inch loaf pans. In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and mix well. Stir in bananas. Sift together flour, salt and soda. Stir into banana mixture. Fold in nuts. Pour into prepared pans. Bake in a 350f oven for 45 minutes or until bread tester comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes on wire racks. Remove from pans. Cool completely. Yields 2 loaves.

In a 12" skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add thyme and garlic. Stir in mushrooms and saute 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add brussels sprouts and saute 3 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and serve.

Add 1/2 cup water to rice cooker. Add frozen spinach, mushrooms and green onions. Steam over medium heat 10 minutes. In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, herbs, salt and pepper. Pour over spinach mixture. Cook over medium heat 5 minutes or until egg mixture is set. Sprinkle with cheese. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Garnish with green onions.

Place avocado, cream cheese and tomatoes in small bowl. Mix well. Spread about 1/2 cup on each tortilla. Divide sprouts, carrot and cucumber among wraps. Roll up each tortilla and cut in half. Arrange on serving platter. Sprinkle with havarti cheese. Serve with salt and pepper.

Mix chocolate chips and dark chocolate. Set aside. Beat sugar, eggs, milk, and white chocolate. Stir in the dark chocolate mixture. Pour into a pie crust. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until set. Cool, top with whipped cream and sprinkle with chocolate chips.

In medium saucepan, boil the broth, water and rice. Simmer, covered for about 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Drain pasta and add to rice mixture. Stir in butter and pepper. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes or until pasta is heated through. Serve with scallions on top.

Combine liqueur and oil in a bowl. Whisk in sugar and spices. Add nuts and toss to coat. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for about 25 minutes or until nuts are crisp and dry. Let stand for 30 minutes. Toss again and let stand for another 30 minutes. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8-inch square pan with shortening. In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. In a medium bowl combine the peanut butter, brown sugar and white sugar. Beat with electric mixer until well blended. Add eggs and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Add flour mixturebeat until blended. Spread in pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until firm. For topping: in a small bowl combine brown sugar, flour and coconut. Cut in shortening until crumbly. Sprinkle over the bars. Bake 10 more minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Cook pasta according to directions on package, drain and rinse with cold water. In large bowl combine pasta, soup, mayonnaise and milk. Spread half of mixture into 2-quart casserole. Top with half of the salmon and peas. Repeat layers. Cover casserole and bake for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes more until cheese is melted.

In a small saucepan over medium high heat, add the raisins, garlic and beet greens. Add the allspice and cook for one minute. Add the vinegar and water and cook until the greens are tender. Season with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine the bread crumbs and oil and toast until lightly brown. Sprinkle the raisin mixture with the toasted bread crumbs and serve.

Prepare cake according to package directions using only 1 egg. Cool completely in pan. Cut into small cubes. Place a small amount of frosting on the bottom of the sticks. Place a cube of the cake on the stick. Continue until all the cubes are used. Keep frozen until ready to serve. Makes 20.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. In a large bowl, mix together the oil, water, sugar, fish sauce, and salt to taste. Place the corn on a large baking sheet. Pour the marinade over the corn and toss to coat well with the marinade. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove the corn from the oven and add the green onions. Toss to mix well. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a 9x13 inch casserole dish. Add onion. Cook until tender. Stir in rice. Add sour cream and cottage cheese and stir until well mixed. Sprinkle in chilies and cheddar cheese. Mix well. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm.

Melt margarine in a large pot over medium-low heat. Saut the onions until soft. Stir in the sauerkraut, apple juice and water. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir in the caraway seed. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the sausage and simmer for an additional 10 minutes. Stir in the black pepper, brown sugar and salt. Simmer for an additional 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Rub chicken legs with vegetable oil, then sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook in a large skillet over medium high heat until browned on both sides. Place chicken in 13x9 inch baking dish. In a large bowl combine onion and chicken brothmix well. Bring to a boil over medium high heatstir in Cream of Chicken soup, paprika, lemon juice and dried dill weed. Pour over chicken in dishcover with foil. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. Uncoverstir in sour cream. Bake 30 minutes longer. Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Serves 4-6.

Combine water and soy sauce in a sauce pan over high heat until boiling. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add ginger root, garlic clove, green onions, sesame oil. Simmer until ginger is tender about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Pour over cooked rice. Garnish with green onions.

Place butter and spices into crock pot. Stir until melted. Stir in nuts. Cover and cook on high for 1 hour. Stir. Cook another 1 hour on high. Remove from crock pot. Cool. Store in an air tight container for several weeks.

Heat the butter in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until golden, 15-20 minutes. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Add the cream and reduce the heat to low. Add the thyme and season with salt and pepper. Slice the bread in half horizontally. Ladle the soup into the bowls and top with the cheese. Broil until the cheese is bubbly. Serve with the remaining bread.

Preheat oven to 425f. Grease muffin tray or use paper muffin cups. Combine bisquick mix and milk. Stir in cheese. Add garlic powder, dry mustard and cayenne. Stir to blend. Drop by spoonful on muffin tray. Bake 10-15 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes. Makes 16 muffins.

Preheat oven to 275 degrees. Brown pork roast in skillet with taco seasoning and water until done. Slice or shred pork roast. Add green chilies if you like. Warm tortillas on skillet or microwave. Spread pork on tortillas, add lettuce and sour cream or guacamole if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl combine sugar and cocoa. Add milk and vanilla. Stir until smooth. Stir in peanut butter and salt until combined. Stir in melted butter. Fold in oats. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Store in an airtight container.

In a small skillet cook the steak and onion in the canola oil until the steak is brown. Remove the steak and slice. In a large skillet cook the mushrooms in the remaining oil. Stir in the soup and simmer until thickened. Stir in the steak and heat through. Spoon onto hot cooked noodles and garnish with chopped parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch pan. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla. In a small bowl, combine the flour and baking powder. Stir into the creamed mixture. Stir in the chopped chocolate. Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Sprinkle the chopped cookies on top. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Do not overbake. Cool in the pan on a wire rack.

Cut potatoes into cubes, about 1/2 inch in size. Place in a large bowl. Add onion flakes, paprika, garlic, salt and pepper. Add water and toss gently to combine. Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours. Pour oil into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Place potatoes in pan. Bake, uncovered for 15 minutes. Turn potatoes over and bake for another 15 minutes.
In a large bowl, toss together all ingredients except parsley and feta cheese. Cover and chill for at least an hour. Garnish with parsley and feta cheese before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in large mixing bowl. Cut in shortening until crumbly. Add milk and vanilla to mixture and mix well. Add eggs and beat until smooth and well blended. Pour into cupcake cups to half full. Bake 15-20 minutes or until done. Cool before icing or serving.
In blender or food processor, process all the ingredients together. Makes about 4 cups. Store any leftovers in fridge for up to 5 days.

Microwave cauliflower until tender about 15-20 min. In medium saucepan combine butter and almonds and saute until lightly browned. Stir in water, cauliflower and cream of mushroom soup stir until well blended and thickened. Combine corn flake crumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle over cauliflower mixture and bake at 350 degrees for about 15 min or until browned lightly.

Brown ground beef, drain fat and add bread crumbs. Add milk to bread crumb mixture, stirring until evenly moistened. Add celery and onion, mix well. In a greased baking dish, spread half of mixture, sprinkle with half of beans. Spread remaining mixture over beans, top with remaining beans. Combine soup, mushrooms, sour cream and worcestershire saucemix well and pour over top of casserole. Bake uncovered for about 40-50 minutes or until bubbly. Makes 4 servings.

In mixing bowl of electric mixer beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in flour and baking soda. Beat in eggs and vanilla. In another bowl combine pecans and chocolate chips. Divide cookie dough in half. Wrap in wax paper and refrigerate. Preheat oven to 350f. On ungreased cookie sheet place 1 teaspoon of toasted pecans at one end of cookie sheet. Place 1 ball of cookie dough at other end. With palms of your hands press pecans into dough. Place 1/2 of chocolate chips at top of cookie dough. Place second cookie dough ball at other end of sheet. Repeat. Bake for 12 to 14 minutes or until golden brown around edges. Cool for 2 minutes. Cut into 12 bars. Serve warm.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add macaroni. Cook until macaroni is tender but still firm to the bite, about 5 minutes. Drain macaroni in a colander. Return macaroni to pot. Melt butter in same pot. Stir in flour until smooth. Add milk in a slow stream. Whisk constantly until thickened. Stir in cheese until melted. Remove from heat. Add macaroni and stir until well coated. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Place the cream in a large bowl and whisk to stiff peaks. In a separate bowl, combine the sugar with the mascarpone cheese. Whisk together until smooth. Add the double cream and mix again. Pour in the whiskey and liqueur and fold in. Pour into the ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacturer's instructions. Serve with crushed raspberries.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is translucent. Add chickpeas, chili flakes and stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Add kale and cook until tender. Remove from heat and add chorizo. Season with salt and pepper. Serve garnished with sour cream.
In a large pot combine broth, gingerroot and crushed red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil. Add noodles. Cook until noodles are tender. Add vegetables and pork. Simmer 5-8 minutes. Stir in green onion.
