Turn pork and bake 8 to 12 minutes or until pork is no longer pink in center. Combine remaining marinade in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 2 minutes or until sauce thickens. Pour sauce over pork. Serve immediately.

Trim broccoli and cauliflower into florets. Steam until tender. In a bowl combine broccoli and cauliflower with orange juice, shallots, orange peel, scallions, pepper and salt. Toss gently with olive oil. Cover with foil. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.

In a pitcher, combine wine, sprite, rum and brandy. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to let flavors blend. Add ice cubes. Serve in tall glasses over fruit slices. Garnish with a slice of lemon and lime. Makes 6-8 servings.

Brown ground beef in a Dutch oven with onions over medium heat for about 8 minutes or until meat is no longer pinkadd whole tomatoes with their juice, water, worcestershire sauce, creole seasoning, and pepper. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 20 minutes. Add okrasimmer uncovered for 5 minutes or until okra is tender. Serve over rice.

Slice the zucchini in half lengthwise. Cut out the seeds from the center. Dry the zucchini with paper towels. In a small bowl mix together the garlic and the flour. Beat the eggs and the soy sauce together in another bowl. Dip the zucchini in the flour mixture. Next dip in the eggs and then roll in the bread crumbs. Heat the olive oil in a skillet or frying pan. Fry the zucchini for about 3 minutes per side, until they are browned and cooked through. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine cottage cheese and spinach. Add soy sausage. Pour into a 1-1/2-quart baking dish. In a separate bowl, combine the eggs and milk. Beat until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Pour mixture over the cheese and vegetable mixture. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and green onions. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes.

Cook noodles as directed on package. Drain. Melt butter in a 2 quart casserole. Add noodles. In a separate bowl, beat eggs with sugar, salt, and black pepper. Pour over noodles. Bake at 350 for 35 to 45 minutes. Serves 8.

Combine water, sugar, bananas and ice cubes in blender. Blend until smooth. Strain through a fine sieve into large punch bowl. Add frozen orange juice, lemonade and pineapple juice. Blend well. Add ginger ale. Garnish with bananas and mint leaves.

Cook pasta according to package directions. In a large skillet, brown flank steak and add brown gravy mix, stirring. Add carrots and snow peascontinue stirring and add soy sauce and hot sauce. Add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover. Simmer about 10 minutes. Drain pasta and place in a bowl. Top with meat mixture and enjoy.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with foil. In large skillet, cook onion in bacon fat until tender, about 3 minutes. Add ground beef, breadcrumbs, onion, oregano, pepper and salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until beef is cooked through, about 15 minutes. Transfer beef mixture to a large bowladd egg yolks and tomatoes with juice. Stir until just combined. Shape mixture into 1 1/2-inch meatballs. Place meatballs on prepared baking sheets. Bake until cooked through and browned on all sides, about 25 minutes. Meanwhile make sour cream sauce in a saucepan. Cook onion and garlic in the butter until onion is translucent. Stir in tomato paste and cook until it has darkened slightly. Stir in beef stock. Bring just to a boil then pour the cream slowly while whisking the sauce. Cook until thickened about 5-7 minutes. Serve meatballs with the sauce poured around the

Combine dry ingredients. Add vanilla. Add milk & egg. Then add oil & chocolate chips. Bake at 350 for about 45 minutes or until knife comes out clean. Cool for 20 minutes then ice with chocolate frosting. Serve to family & friends. Serves 8.

Cook noodles in boiling water. Drain and cool. Lay turkey bacon strips flat on a microwave safe plate. Cook in the microwave 4 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Chop. Cook onion and turkey bacon together in a non-stick skillet over medium heat until onion is tender. Stir in noodles and sour cream. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve.

Heat olive oil in a large heavy based saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft but not coloured. Add carrots and saute for a further 2 minutes. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute or until golden. Stir in beef and brown well. Add all remaining ingredients except the honey and cook uncovered for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Add honey and cook for a further 5 minutes or until liquid is thick and syrupy. Serve with rice.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the rosemary and saute for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and cook over a medium heat for 5 minutes or until just cooked through. Stir in the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the honey and balsamic and cook for 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Pour cream into medium saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Remove from heat. Add maple syrup. Stir in egg yolks and vanilla. Pour into 8 ramekins. Bake until set about 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool. Refrigerate. Serve.

In a heavy 2 quart saucepan, combine 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup butter. Stir over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Raise heat to medium high and boil 1 minute. Remove from heat and add 1 1/2 cups heavy cream. Return to heat and stir over medium heat until mixture thickens enough to lightly coat back of a spoon. Add 1/2 teaspoon hazelnut extract and stir until blended. Cool.

Sprinkle mozzarella cheese evenly over muffin. Spread tomato sauce over muffin and top with tomatoes and basil. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut into 4 equal servings. Makes 4 servings. Serving size 1 muffin

Cook pasta according to package directions. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add carrot and broccolicook and stir until crisp-tender about 3 minutes. Add chicken broth and cook until almost evaporated about 2 minutes. Add ranch dressing and cook until heated through about 30 seconds. Add pasta to skillettoss to coat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and parsley.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash potatoes and prick with a fork. Place in a shallow baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with the oregano. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Roast until potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream butter and sugar together. Beat in egg. Add vanilla extract. Sift flour, baking soda and salt. Add to butter mixture. Stir in popcorn. Roll into small balls. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool. Combine melted chocolate and butterscotch topping. Dip cooled balls into topping. Let stand until set. Roll in pecans.

In a 9 x 13-inch baking dish, combine stuffing mix with condensed cream of chicken soup. Place chicken breasts in the stuffing mixture and turn to coat. Top with frozen mixed vegetables. In a small bowl, combine sour cream and milk. Pour over the chicken mixture. Bake for 45 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add butter, flour and seasonings. Cook until browned. Add milk and cheese. Heat to boiling. Add potatoes. Simmer, uncovered, until potatoes are tender. Add onion and pimientos. Cook until heated through. Serves 4.

Mix the flour and sugar in a bowl. Add the ghee and cardamom powder. Add the milk little by little and knead to a dough. Heat ghee in a pan. Add the sliced almonds and cashews. Fry till golden. Cool and set aside. Knead the dough well. Divide into 8 portions. Roll out each portion into a circle and spread a little ghee. Sprinkle the fried nuts and roll into a roth. Make a hole in the center. Heat ghee in a pan. Place the roth in it. Fry till it turns golden. Remove from ghee and drain on kitchen towels. Serve hot.

Boil potatoes whole in water until tender. Peel off skins and slice into small cubes. Fry bacon in skillet until crisp. Drain on paper towel. Drain onions in colander. Add water to bacon drippings. Bring to boil. Add sugar and vinegar. Heat until sugar dissolves. Add potatoes. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in bacon, onions, salt, pepper. Cool. Add parsley. Serve chilled. Serves 6.

In medium saucepan combine all ingredients except water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 2 minutes. Add water, bring to boil, then lower heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in water and return to low heat. Cook until thickened. Cool. Store in refrigerator in tightly closed jar. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.

In medium sauce pan, cover peaches with water. Add 1/2 teaspoon of the salt substitute. Bring to boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 5 minutes or until peaches are tender. Drain peaches. Set aside. In medium bowl, mix together the chicken, wine, onion, red bell pepper, 1/4 teaspoon of the salt substitute, the garlic, and the oregano. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken mixture. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Add the broth. Bring to boil. Add orzo. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 10 minutes or until orzo is tender. Stir in peaches. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until heated through.

Combine water, powdered milk, sugar, egg yolks & salt in heavy 2 quart saucepan. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly until thickened & mixture coats back of spoon (about 12 minutes). Strain into pitcherstir in whiskey & let cool to room temperature. Beat egg whites with mixer until soft peaks form. Fold egg whites into eggnog mixture. Refrigerate, covered, at least 4 hours or up to 2 days before serving. Add more milk if desired. Serve very cold with nutmeg sprinkled on top. Makes 6-8 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine the beans, onion, 2 teaspoons of the Tabasco and the cumin in an oven-safe dish. Bake until hot and bubbly, about 15 minutes. Heat the remaining Tabasco in the microwave for 10 seconds. Top the baked beans with the onion and tomatoes. Sprinkle with the cheese and drizzle with the Tabasco. Serve with the chips.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cut off the woody bottoms of the asparagus spears. Place the spears in the boiling water and cook for 2 minutes. Drain and cool. Melt the butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add the cream and bring to a gentle simmer. Add the asparagus spears and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the fontina and parmesan and remove from heat.

Sautee the garlic in the oil and butter until just starting to brown, about 1 minute. Add the lemon zest and juice and the pepper and let it cook for 2 more minutes. Add the capellini and let cook until tender and al dente, about 10 minutes. Add the parmesan cheese and basil just before serving. Drain the pasta and toss it with the lemon garlic mixture and the parmesan and basil. Serve immediately.

In a 12 inch saute pan over medium heat add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Add the garlic paste and rosemary needles. Saute until fragrant and lightly browned, about 1 minute. Add the beef and shallots and saute until browned and cooked through, about 4 minutes. Add the red wine and balsamic vinegars and cook until the liquid is reduced and slightly thickened. Transfer the beef mixture to a large bowl. Add the arugula and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray a 9×13 inch casserole dish with cooking spray. In a skillet over medium heat, add ground beef and cook until browned. Drain fat. Stir in pasta sauce, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper. In a separate bowl, prepare macaroni and cheese according to the package directions, substituting water for milk. Pour macaroni into the casserole dish and spread evenly. Sprinkle on the mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes, until macaroni is browned on top.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan. In a medium bowl, combine the butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, ground cinnamon, baking powder, and salt. Beat on low speed just until blended. Fold in the crunchy peanut butter. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack before cutting into squares. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for 3 days.

Place coffee and water in a saucepan and heat over medium heat until just boiling. Remove from heat and add the coriander, cardamom pods, and cinnamon. Cover and steep for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Remove the spices and strain the liquid through a fine-mesh strainer and discard the spices. Stir in the condensed milk and pour the mixture into a blender with the ice cubes and heavy cream. Blend until smooth and serve in tall glasses garnished with a sprig of mint if desired.

Sprinkle chickens with salt and pepper and place in shallow baking pan. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat and cook onion and garlic, stirring frequently for 3 minutes. Add green pepper and tomatoes and cook 4 minutes longer or until vegetables are tender. Cut ham into 1/2 inch dice and add with olives. Spoon vegetable mixture into cavities of chicken and spread over breast of each bird. Bake at 400f for 1 hour 40 minutes or until done. Remove from oven, transfer chickens to serving platter and keep warm while making sauce. Blend flour with 1/2 cup water until smooth. Stir into pan drippings and cook on medium heat for 3 minutes or until thickened and bubbly, stirring constantly. Spread sauce on chicken and sprinkle with parsley. Serve with rice if desired.

In a large bowl combine beef and all remaining ingredients except the parsley and bread. Mix well and then form into small meatballs. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add meatballs and brown well on all sides. Add water and bring to a boil then cover and simmer for 40 minutes. Remove cover and add parsley and bread and stir well to combine. Cover and simmer an additional 10 minutes or until liquid is evaporated and meatballs are well coated with sauce. Serve with pita bread and yogurt sauce if desired.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and saute 30 seconds or until golden. Remove from heat and stir in yogurt until smooth. Add chicken breasts and season with salt and pepper. Marinate 20 minutes to 2 hours. Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Pour oil into an ovenproof skillet or baking dish and arrange chicken in a single layer in the skillet. Bake in oven until golden brown and cooked through, about 1 hour. Let chicken rest 5 minutes before serving. Serve with lemon wedges and toast.

In a small saucepan mix the lemon-lime beverage and the hot sauce and bring to a boil. Add the crushed red pepper flakes and the black pepper and stir well. Add the turkey legs. Cover and simmer for 1 hour or until the meat is very tender. Remove the legs from the liquid and cool for 10 minutes. Remove the skin and the meat from the bones and cut the meat into bite size pieces. Combine the pieces with the remaining liquid and add the sweet onion and the honey. Mix well and refrigerate. Serve at room temp or chilled. To serve place the turkey and the liquid in a bowl and sprinkle with steak seasoning. Serve with crackers or chips.

Place the spinach in a colander over a bowlmicrowave on high for 1-1/2 to 2 minutes, until tenderdrain off the water. Let cool slightly. Beat together the ricotta cheese, spinach, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, 1/4 teaspoon tarragon, and the egg whiteset aside. Arrange 1/4 cup of the spinach mixture in the center of each chicken breast halftop with 1 tablespoon of the cheese mixturefold the sides of the chicken over the fillingroll up the chicken to enclose the filling. Wrap each stuffed chicken breast with 1 slice of the bacon, and secure with wooden toothpicks. In a small dish, mix the remaining 1 teaspoon of tarragon with the 1/4 teaspoon saltcoat the chicken with the mixture. Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Spray a 13- x 9-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking sprayplace
Mix all dressing ingredients. Refrigerate. In a salad bowl, combine greens, strawberries, watermelon. Pour dressing over top and toss.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut brie into quarters. Place brie cheese in an oven proof dish. Put sour cream on top of brie cheese. Sprinkle with brown sugar and pecans. Melt butter in a sauce pan. Pour over cheese. Bake for 8-9 minutes.

In a large bowl combine rhubarb, dates, vinegar, sugar, salt, ginger, cayenne pepper & garlic cloves. Cover and chill overnight. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Remove garlic. Stirring occasionally, cook until thick. Remove from heat. Cool. Store in refrigerator.

Cook sausage in skillet until browned. Add onion. Stir in water, milk and margarine. Bring to a boil. Add scalloped potatoes mix and cayenne pepper. Stir until heated through. Add frozen vegetables and heat through. Serve over hot rice. Makes 4 servings.

Heat the oil and the onion in a large saucepan and cook over a medium heat until soft and translucent. Add the steak and stir to coat in the oil and cook until browned. Add the pasta sauce and wine and stir to mix through. Bring to a simmer and add the mushrooms and seasoning to taste. Cook for 15 minutes or until the sauce has thickened and the pasta is tender. Serve with the small shell pasta or any pasta of your choice and top with chopped parsley.

In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg. Sift together the flour, salt, cinnamon and baking sodastir into the butter mixture. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes in the preheated oven. Makes 2 1/2 dozen cookies.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place the pizza crust on a pizza stone. In a small bowl combine the olive oil with the minced garlic. Drizzle the oil over the top of the pizza crust. Lay the mozzarella cheese slices over the oil. Sprinkle with the provolone cheese, parmigiano-reggiano cheese and parsley. Bake the pizza for 10-15 minutes.

Cream together butter and cocoa powder. Mix in cream cheese until well blended. Blend in powdered sugar. Mix in buttermilk and vanilla. Stir until smooth. Spread on cake. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a blender or food processor combine oat bran, cream cheese and strawberries until smooth. Divide evenly among six bowls. Add a few graham cracker squares to each bowl and drizzle with syrup, if desired. Sprinkle with a little more oat bran, if desired.

Brown ground beef with onion powder. Add condensed cream of mushroom soup, milk, and black peppercorns. Bring to a boil. Stir in frozen mixed vegetables. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook until done. Remove from heat. Spoon into 9 x 9 inch baking dish. Top with mashed potatoes. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until top is brown. Serving.
Spread tortilla with deli ham. Top with american cheese. Layer with the other ingredients. Fold ends under and roll up. Cut in half and serve.

Combine sugar, cornstarch and water in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk constantly until smooth and thickened. Add strawberries and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and lemon juice. Chill in refrigerator for about 1 hour before serving. Serve sauce over ice cream or whipped cream. Makes about one cup.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Stir in sugar and water until sugar dissolves. Stir in pecans and cook until sugar crystallizes around pecans. Remove from heat and pour onto a lightly greased baking sheet to cool. Store in an airtight container.

Combine lime juice, water, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, garlic clove and cumin in a medium bowl. Pour mixture into a resealable plastic bagadd steaks, seal bag and turn to coat meat evenly. Marinate in refrigerator at least 4 hours. Thread steaks onto metal or soaked wooden skewers, placing 4 or 5 steaks on each skewer. Grill over medium-high heat 10 minutes, turning once. Sprinkle with salt and pepperserve with lime wedges. Makes about 4 servings.

Preheat over to 400 degrees F. Peel eggplant. Cut into 1/2-inch slices. Combine eggplant, salt and pepper in an 8-inch square baking dish. Pour tomato sauce over eggplant slices and toss to coat. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes. Top with tomato slices and basil leaves. Bake until eggplant is tender and tomatoes are softened. In a small bowl, combine ricotta cheese and Italian seasoning. Spoon ricotta mixture over eggplant mixture. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Butter a shallow 2-quart baking dish. Place the blueberries in a large bowltoss with the sour cream and vanilla until coated well. Pour into the prepared dishsprinkle with the brown sugar.Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the blueberries are bubbling and the juice is thick. Serve immediately with vanilla ice cream or plain yogurt.

Boil potato 20 minutes or until tendercool. Peel potato and dice. Combine potato, hard-boiled egg, green onion, carrot, celery and radishes in a serving bowltoss to combine. In a small bowl, combine horseradish, mayonnaise, vinegar and peppermix well. Spoon 1/4 cup dressing over potato mixturetoss to coat. Refrigerate 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with frozen green pea if desired. Serve salad cold or at room temperature.

Boil potatoes until tender. Cut in half lengthwise. Melt margarine. Add onion and saute until golden. Add flour and cook until golden brown. Add sugar and cook until golden. Add wine and cook until slightly thickened. Add cream and heat thoroughly. Add potatoes and heat thoroughly. Serve over potatoes. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.

Carefully open the oysters and remove the top shell. Reserve shells for serving. Put oysters in a shallow baking pan and set aside. In another pan, cook bacon till crisp. Drain on paper towels. Discard all but 1 t. bacon fat. Saute onions in bacon fat until tender. Stir in spinach and cook until wilted. Cool mixture slightly and add to oysters in baking pan. Sprinkle with bread crumbs, parsley and tabasco to taste. Dot with small pieces of bacon. Bake at 400 degrees for about 10 minutes, or until oysters are hot. Serve on reserved shells with lemon wedges.

Boil 2 potatoes in a large pot of water until tender. Drain and let cool. Peel and mash potatoes. Add 1/4 c. flour and 1/4 c. egg and mix well. Add in 2 red onions. Add enough flour to make a sticky dough. Divide into 8 balls. Roll each ball into a circle using a rolling pin. Heat 1/4 c. oil in a heavy frying pan. Add latkes and fry until brown, turning once. Sprinkle with 1/2 tsp. each salt and pepper. Serve with sour cream.

Prepare pie crust as directed on box. Line pie pan with crust, crimp edges and flute. Mix rhubarb and blueberries in large bowl. Add sugar, nutmeg, and salt. Toss to coat. Pour into pie crust. Bake 40 to 45 minutes or until filling is bubbly and crust is lightly browned. Cool on rack. Serve warm or cold.

Drain and rinse the beans and then place them into a blender or food processor along with the Rotel tomatoes, chipotle peppers in adobo, adobo sauce, onions, oregano, cilantro and garlic cloves. Blend until smooth and then transfer to a large bowl. Add the lime juice and cumin and stir well to combine. Garnish with the feta cheese and chopped cilantro.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season chicken thighs with salt. Heat olive oil in a large oven proof skillet over medium heat. Add chicken thighs, skin side down. Cook until well browned on both sides, about 10 minutes total. Transfer to a plate. Add green onions to skillet and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add wine and cook until evaporated, about 2 minutes more. Pour in water to cover chicken thighs by 1 inch. Return chicken to skillet and nestle mushroom caps on top of chicken. Bake until chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes more. Transfer chicken to a cutting board and shred with two forks. Stir in artichoke hearts. Return shredded chicken to skillet with mushroom caps and toss well. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and parsley. Serve warm over cooked rice. Serves 4 to 6 people.

Combine teriyaki sauce, vermouth and garlic in a small bowl. Add chicken and coat thoroughly with the marinade. Let stand for 30 minutes. Preheat broiler. Line broiler pan with foil. In small saucepan, combine bacon and vegetable oil. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes, until bacon is browned. Remove bacon from pan, and reserve. Thread chicken on skewers. Place skewers on foil. Broil chicken for 5 minutes. Turn and broil for another 5 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from pan and place on baking sheet. Sprinkle with reserved bacon. Serves 4.

Drain tuna and mix with eggs and mushrooms. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in tomatoes. Spread mashed potatoes in a deep dish pie pan and put in tuna mixture. Sprinkle with American and Swiss Cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Cool slightly and serve. Serves 6.

Season the orange roughy fillets with salt and pepper. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the fish until it is browned on the bottom side. Turn and cook for 3 minutes or until the fish is cooked through. Transfer to a platter. Mix the dijon mustard and lemon juice in a small dish. Add the Worcestershire sauce and garlic clove. Mix well. Drizzle over the fish. Sprinkle with the fine dry bread crumbs.

In skillet, combine sausages and beer. Simmer uncovered for 10-15 minutes or until sausages are cooked through. Pour off most of the liquid from skillet. In a small bowl, combine the mustard and the onionblend well and add to sausages. In same skillet, heat the oil over med-low heat. Add sausages and onion mixture and saute for 5 minutes or until onions are tender and golden brown. Serve on hot buns or rolls.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut the squash in half and scoop out the seeds and pulp. Rub each half with butter and sprinkle with sea salt and fresh rosemary. Put the squash halves cut side down in a baking dish and roast for 30 minutes. When the squash is soft and cooked through, remove the skin and discard it. Cut the squash flesh into bite-size pieces and place in a bowl. Add the lime juice and butter and mix well. Adjust the seasoning with more lime juice or rosemary. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Coat a 9-inch cast-iron skillet with vegetable oil and set aside. In a bowl, whisk together the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt. In a separate bowl, mix together the maple syrup, soymilk, and vegetable oil. Stir the wet ingredients into the dry. Pour batter into the cast-iron skillet and bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

Cook pasta according to package directions. In a large skillet, cook garlic in oil over medium heat until lightly browned and aromatic, about 5 minutes. Add parsley and Italian seasonings and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in cooked pasta, prosciutto, and parmesan cheese. Toss until well coated. Serve immediately and garnish with parsley sprigs if desired.
Blend the milk and chocolate syrup until smooth. Fill a tall glass halfway with the milk mixture. Add 3 scoops of vanilla ice cream, then top off the glass with club soda. Garnish with whipped cream.

Combine all the dry ingredients. Add the maple syrup and oil. Add enough water to form a soft dough. Drop the dough from a spoon into hot oil and fry until golden brown. Serve warm or cold. Makes about 3 dozen 2-inch cakes.

Heat olive oil in a large saut pan over medium heat. Add butter to the pan. When butter starts to bubble, add the beans and saute for 3 minutes. Add the scallions and cilantro. Stir for 1 minute. Add the cumin and salt. Stir. Serve.

Slice the avocado lengthwise into 1/8th inch slices (I usually cut it into 6 wedges). Toss the avocado with the lime juice, soy sauce and sesame oil to make a dressing. Toss together the salad greens with the avocado and tomatoes and sprinkle with green onions and tofu before serving.

In a large skillet saute mushrooms in oil until tender. Add onioncook 2 minutesstir in pork and tomatoes. Mix in seasoning. Stuff mushrooms with meat mixtureplace in a 13 x 9 inch pan coated with cooking spray. Combine remaining ingredientspour over stuffed mushrooms. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until heated through. Serves 4 to 6.

In a medium saucepan, combine cranberries, sugar and 2/3 cup water. Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in grapes. Cook for 1 more minute and serve warm.

Prepare the marinade by stirring together paprika, brown sugar, garlic powder, cumin and cayenne in a medium bowl. Place tilapia fillets in a single layer in a large resealable plastic bag or glass baking dish. Add the marinade and turn the fillets to coat both sides. Refrigerate the fish for at least 1 hour and up to overnight, turning the bag occasionally. Preheat oven broiler with rack 6 inches from heat source. Arrange fillets in a single layer in a lightly greased baking dish and drizzle with remaining marinade. Broil until fish flakes easily with a fork and is lightly browned, about 6 minutes per side. Serve with lime wedges.

Spread mayonnaise on 1 side of bread. Spread mustard on other side of bread. Place basil leaves on bread. Top with tomato and swiss cheese. Top with aged cheddar. Grill until cheese is melty. Serve with honey.

Place bratwurst in a deep baking dish. Pour over condensed soup and onion. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for one hour. Remove cover and add tater tots. Bake uncovered another 30-35 minutes until brown. Sprinkle with cheese and bake an additional 5 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve with sour cream.

In large bowl combine popcorn, pretzels and cheese puffs. In small bowl combine margarine and seasoningsmix well. Spread over popcorn mixture and toss lightly. Spread on wax paper to cool. Store in tightly covered container. Makes 24 servings.

In a medium bowl mix the pudding and pie mixes with the evaporated skim milk until thickened. Stir in the vanilla extract and raspberries. Spread half of the pudding mixture into the bottom of the trifle dish. Layer the pound cake and preserves on top of the pudding mixture. Repeat these layers twice more. Spread the top of the trifle dish with the remaining pudding mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve. To assemble the trifle, spoon the grand marnier over the pudding mixture and drizzle with reduced calorie whipped topping and dust with the cocoa powder. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Beat butter and sugars with mixer until fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Blend in flour and baking soda. Mix in chocolate pieces and peanuts. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks.

Bring vinegar, sugar and water to boiling point. Add mustard, celery seed, mustard seeds and whole cloves. Simmer for a few minutes, then add onions and simmer for 20 minutes. Cool and pour into glass jars to cool completely. Add hard-boiled eggs and cover with brine. Keep in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add green beans and boil until bright green and tender. Drain well. Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add garlic and cook until soft and golden brown. Add green beans and bouillon. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Top with walnuts. Serve immediately.

Slice onion and garlic. Dry fry peanuts in pan until brown. Heat oil in pan and fry onion and garlic until onion is transparent. Add chicken and fry until almost cooked. Add remaining ingredients except peanuts. Simmer until sauce thickens. Add peanuts and serve over rice.
Mix mustard with brown sugar. Spread on both sides of thighs. Mix curry powder with crumbs. Spread mixture on mustard/sugar side. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Cut chicken into 1-inch cubes. Combine chicken, garlic and seasonings. Set aside to marinate at room temperature for 10 minutes. Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add chicken and cook for about 5 minutes or until browned. Stir in wine. Add water and cover. Cook for 30 minutes or until chicken is tender. Add lemon juice and seasonings. Garnish with parsley. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 350f degrees. In a small bowl, combine the rosemary, olive oil, black pepper and 2 tablespoons kosher salt. Rub the rosemary mixture over the pork loin. Arrange the rosemary sprigs on the pork loin and tie up with kitchen twine. Place the pork loin in a large roasting pan with the balsamic vinegar. Cover with aluminum foil. Roast for 1 hour. Remove the foil and baste with the balsamic vinegar juices. Roast an additional 1 hour or until a thermometer registers 155f for medium-well. Remove the pork loin from the oven. Let stand for 5 minutes before slicing.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. Beat margarine in large bowl. Gradually beat in sugar. Add eggsbeat well. Beat in flour, milk and vanilla. Stir in orange rind. Spoon batter into prepared cups. Sprinkle with blueberries. Bake 15 minutes or until golden. Remove from pan. Cool on rack.
Pour the goldschlager into a shot glass. Add the Irish Cream and coffee-flavored liqueur. Top with whipped cream. Garnish with a pumpkin pie spice pinch. Makes 1 serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Scrub potatoes and pierce several times with fork. Place in saucepan and cover with water and bring to boil. Boil 15 minutes or until knife can be inserted easily. Drain and cool slightly. Cut each potato in half lengthwise, then in half widthwise, creating quarters. Transfer potato quarters to large bowl and mash well with potato masher or fork. Stir in milk and butter and season with salt and pepper. Stir in spinach. Transfer to greased 1-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake 25 minutes or until heated through and golden brown. Makes 4 servings.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl or measuring cup. Whisk until blended. Yield: About 1/2 cup.

Cut beef into 1 1/2-inch cubes. Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add beefcook and stir until evenly browned. Stir in onion. Cook 5 minutes or until beef is no longer pink. Add thyme and wine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes. Stir in stock and carrots. Simmer uncovered 1 hour. Add flour. Stir and cook 5 minutes. Add chestnuts. Cook 5 minutes longer or until beef is tender. Serve over rice.

Season shoulder with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat olive oil in a heavy bottomed dutch oven over high heat. Add garlic and onion and cook until onions are soft and beginning to brown. Add tomatoes and stir in dried ancho chile powder, cayenne and cumin. Add bay leaves and bring to a boil. Add in the meat and reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and cook in oven for 2 hours. Remove meat and shred with two forks. Return to pot and cover and cook over low heat until shredded meat is very tender and falling apart. Serve with warmed tortillas and your favorite toppings.
Place thighs in baking dish. Combine all other ingredients to make sauce. Pour sauce over thighs. Bake uncovered 1 hour. Turn after 30 minutes. Serve with rice.

Beat eggs and milk. Add flour, baking powder, and salt. Add cooked ham, cottage cheese and monterey jack cheese. Pour into greased 13x9 pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Mix melted butter and green chilies. Brush on top of pancake and return to oven for 5 more minutes.

In a small bowl, combine the broth and the avocado. Mash gently with a fork until the mixture is smooth. Strain the mixture through a sieve into a small saucepan. Add the lemon juice. Place the saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until hot. Stir in the sherry. Garnish with the parsley. Serve immediately.

Cook the chorizo in a large skillet over medium heat until lightly browned and crumbled. Add onion and garlic and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the potatoes and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the green chilies and cook for another minute. Add the salsa and cook for another minute. Add the eggs and cook until set. Add the cilantro and cheddar cheese. Serve hot.

Heat 2 tbsp of the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and toast for 2 to 3 minutes or until they turn light brown. Stir constantly. Remove cumin from saucepan and set aside. Heat remaining oil and add rice. Fry for 3 to 4 minutes or until lightly golden brown. Stir constantly. Add 6 cups of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 10 minutes. Add cumin seeds and mix well. Cook for 5 minutes or until rice is tender. Drain excess water. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

In a large skillet, brown the ground beef over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until cooked through, drain fat. Add in diced tomatoes and taco seasoning and simmer until slightly thickened. Place half the ground beef mixture in the bottom of a 9×12 casserole dish. Layer in half of the cabbage mixture and half the cheese. Place in remaining ground beef mixture and top with remaining cabbage and cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for about 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve in flour tortillas.

In a medium bowl mix together the cream cheese and butter until well blended. Beat in the whipping cream. Season with the curry powder and garlic. Add the chutney and mix until combined. Spread the mixture on one side of each bread slice. Sprinkle with pecans. Top with the other bread slice. Cut the sandwiches into triangles. Makes 20 triangles.

Combine 2 cups sugar, baking chocolate and almonds in a saucepan over low heat. Stir until well combined and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in raisins. Cool to room temperature. In a bowl, cream together 1/2 cup sugar and eggs. Combine baking powder and flour. Add to creamed mixture alternately with milk. Stir in baking chocolate mixture. Spread into a lightly greased 9×13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes. Spread with powdered sugar. Cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Combine flour, sugars and spices in a medium bowl. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Press mixture into the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Arrange peach slices over top. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Combine butter, brown sugar, corn syrup, vanilla and nutmeg in a small bowldrizzle over peaches. Bake in the preheated oven for another 20 minutes. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Heat the oil over medium heat in a large saute pan or wok. Add the carrots and zucchini, stirring occasionally until they soften (5-8 minutes). Stir in the garlic and parmesan cheese. Heat until the sauce thickens (2-3 minutes). Toss with the cooked pasta. Sprinkle with chopped parsley if desired. Serves 4.

Mix ground beef with brown sugar and ketchup. Add milk and eggs and blend well. Add salt and pepper and mix well. Add onion and ground ginger and mix well. Add saltine crumbs and mix well. Form into loaf shape on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour or until done. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Makes one loaf.

Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onions and saute until soft and translucent. Add the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered for 15 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Thaw your bread dough and roll out on a floured surface. Cut into 4-6 inch circles and place on baking sheet. Top each circle with a dollop of taco meat and hamburger, top with beans and sprinkle with taco seasoning. Bake at 400 for about 15 minutes or until dough is cooked through. Serve with sour cream and salsa

Sprinkle frozen spinach with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and let stand until thawed. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs and milk. In a medium skillet, over medium heat, heat 2 teaspoons of the olive oil. Add bell pepper and onion and cook until tender-crisp. Add sausage and cook until browned. Stir in carrot and cook until soft. Remove from heat. Add spinach. Stir in 2 teaspoons of the hot pepper sauce. Add turkey and cook until heated through. Add cheese and stir. Pour egg mixture over top and bake until set. Top with remaining hot pepper sauce. Serve with a slice of whole wheat bread.
Mix cheese and mustard in a bowl. Add egg and milk. Spread the mixture on the bread. Heat the bread in the oven until brown. Cut into slices and serve.

Saute beef & onion until browned. Stir in tomato sauce & pepper. Cook & stir for 5 min. Remove from heat & stir in cottage cheese & cream cheese until blended. Spread on bottom of baking dish. Layer with noodles, bell pepper & onion. Cover & refrigerate until ready to serve. Top with sour cream. Bake at 350 for 30 min. Serves 4-6.

Place chicken in slow cooker. Add carrots and celery. In medium bowl, combine soup and broth. Add to slow cooker. Cook on low 8 to 10 hours. When ready to serve, add parsley and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with biscuit dough. Drop dough into a slow cooker and cover with cooking liquid. Cook 1 hour on high. Makes about 12 biscuits.

Soak dried soybeans overnight in cold water. Drain and rinse. Combine soybeans and onion in a 4 to 5 quart slow cooker. Pour in enough water to cover by 2 inches. Add sugar, molasses, salt and dry mustard. Cover and cook on low setting for 8 to 10 hours or on high setting for 4 to 6 hours. Remove lid, and stir in toasted sesame oil. Serve hot.

Hard boil eggs for 12 minutes. Peel eggs and cut in half lengthwise. Scoop out yolks and place into a medium bowl. Add mayonnaise, mustard, sweet pickle juice, worcestershire sauce, salt, and paprika. Stir well until combined. Spoon mixture into egg whites. Sprinkle a pinch of cayenne pepper on each egg half.

In a large mixing bowl combine cream cheese, ranch dressing mix and green onions. Add beer to form a soft dough. Form into a ball. In a shallow dish combine breadcrumbs and sharp cheddar cheese. Dip ball in breadcrumbs and place on a plate. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a skillet melt butter. Add squash and saute until tender. Add tomatoes and soy sauce and simmer until slightly thickened. Sprinkle with cheese and bake uncovered for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and slightly golden. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 400F/200C/gas mark 6. Grease and lightly flour two baking trays. Sift the flour and baking powder into a large mixing bowl and add the bran and sugar. Make a well in the center and add the butter. Using your fingertips or a fork mix the butter with the dry ingredients until you have coarse crumbs with little chunks of butter remaining. Add the milk and bring the mixture together to form a soft dough. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and knead lightly until smooth. Roll out to about 1/2 inch thickness and cut out using a circular cutter or glass to make rounds approx 4 inches in diameter. Place on prepared baking trays. Brush with beaten egg and bake in the preheated oven for 15 - 18 minutes until risen and golden brown. Remove from the oven and cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 425f degrees. Cook sausage according to package directions in a large skillet over medium heatdrain. Melt 2 Tbsp of the butter in the same skillet over medium heatstir in mushrooms, garlic, pizza sauce, dried oregano, and dried basil, and sausagecook for 2 to 3 minutes or until mixture is heated through. Increase heat to highadd spinachcook just until wilted. Remove from heatsprinkle with salt and pepper. Spread pizza sauce evenly over the crust. Layer with spinach mixture and mozzarella cheese. Bake for about 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cool for about 5 minutescut into wedges.

Beat together dream whip and milk until stiff peaks form. Fold in chocolate pudding and vanilla. Spread evenly in pie shell. Chill overnight in refrigerator. Topped with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

Beat eggs until light and fluffy. Add sugar gradually, beating well at low speed. Stir in peanuts and flour. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheet, making 24 cookies. Bake at 350 degrees F until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Remove from baking sheet to wire rack to cool completely. Makes 2 dozen cookies.

Bring 4 cups water to a boil in 2-quart saucepan. Add macaronicook 12 minutes or until macaroni is tender. Drain macaroni. Return macaroni to panstir in remaining 2 cups water. Add cheesestir until cheese is melted. Stir in salsa and taco seasoning. Heat through. Serve.

Rinse potatoes. Cut in half lengthwise. Place in a 9x13x2-inch pan. Dot with butter. Sprinkle with garlic and dried parsley. Cover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Uncover and bake for 15 minutes. Stir gently to combine. Serve immediately.

Spread russian dressing on both sides of bread. Place a layer of lettuce on the bottom layer of bread. Place tomatoes on top of lettuce. Place another layer of lettuce on top. Place watercress on top. Place top layer of bread on top. Cut into 4 pieces.

Combine flour, salt and baking soda in small bowl. Beat butter at medium speed with an electric mixer until creamy. Beat in granulated sugar and nestle nesquik powder until well mixed. Beat in eggs 1 at a time, beating until mixture is combined after each addition. Stir in vanilla extract. Gradually add flour mixture, beating just until blended. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls 2 inch apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Flatten slightly with fork. Bake at 375f for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from baking sheets to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Combine fish sauce, rice vinegar and caster sugar in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Add lime juice and a pinch of salt to taste and allow to cool. Heat the oil in a frying pan and add the prawns. Fry until they turn pink and then remove from the pan and set aside. Add the mint leaves to the frying pan and fry until crisp. Serve the prawns with the dipping sauce and some of the fried mint leaves.

In a large mixing bowl mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, margarine or butter and salt until crumbly. Add milk slowly while stirring until a soft ball forms. Remove from bowl and knead briefly in hands until smooth. Press into a 9 inch pie pan or 10 inch pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 5 minutes before spreading with preserves or jam (I use 3 heaping tablespoons of preserves). Cut into wedges and top each wedge with 3 or 4 halved fresh peaches, drizzled with juice from canned peaches.

In a medium bowl, combine the margarine with the mustard. Add the chicken stripscoat well. In a small bowl, combine the honey with the garlic salt. Pour the honey mixture over the chicken stripstoss to coat. Arrange chicken strips in a single layer in a 13" x 9" baking dish. Bake uncovered at 400 degrees F for 20 minutes. Stirbake an additional 20 minutes or until chicken is done. Stir in the curry powder. Spoon chicken mixture over rice or noodles. Garnish with parsley. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

Wash fiddleheads thoroughly under running water. Pat dry with paper towels or a clean cloth. In a large skillet heat the olive oil over medium high heat. Add fiddleheads, shallots, and garlic and saute until tender-crisp, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, add butter, and toss until melted. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat butter. Add leeks, potatoes and asparagus. Cook 5-10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add chicken stock, bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Add evaporated milk and simmer for 10 minutes more. Season with pepper and salt. Serve hot with croutons if desired.

Prepare 9 x 13 glass baking dish by coating lightly with butter. Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl combine brown sugar and butter and melt. Stir in rum and raisins and cook over medium heat until raisins are plump and liquid is syrupy. Remove from heat and stir in bananas. Spread bananas evenly in prepared dish. Sprinkle evenly with almonds. Bake until top is golden brown and bananas are tender. Dust lightly with cinnamon and nutmeg. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Cut the endive into small pieces. In a small bowl mix the vinegar, olive oil and garlic. Pour over the endive. Sprinkle with the salted anchovies and mix well.

Cook potatoes and milk in a small pot until potatoes are soft. Add soup and corn and heat through. Meanwhile brown beef and onion in a skillet. Drain any excess fat. Add potato mixture to the skillet and heat through. Pour into a casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place carrots into shallow roasting pan. Drizzle with olive oil and toss with herbs and seasoning. Roast for 30 minutes or until carrots are tender and browned. Let cool slightly before serving.

In a large mixing bowl mix the first four ingredients until smooth. Cover and let stand for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In another bowl combine the cinnamon and sugar. Roll out each piece of dough into a circle about 1/4 inch thick. Spread each circle with about 2 tablespoons of the cinnamon/sugar mixture. Starting at one end of the circle roll up each piece of dough tightly and pinch the ends together. Place in a greased baking dish. Bake for about 20 minutes or until rolls are golden brown. Mix the milk and egg together and brush over the top of the rolls. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350f. Beat butter and sugar together until creamy. Beat in the eggs and then the sifted dry ingredients. Stir in the raisins and dates and mix well. Spread evenly into a 13x9x2 inch baking pan lined with aluminum foil, extending the foil over the sides of the pan for easy removal. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with chocolate chips and walnuts. Let stand for about 5 minutes before cutting into bars with a sharp knife. Cool completely on a wire rack. These can be frozen in an airtight container for up to 3 months.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut the tomatoes, peppers, onion and serranos into small pieces and place them in a baking dish. Drizzle with the vinegar, orange juice and oil. Toss the vegetables to coat evenly. Sprinkle on the salt and sugar and toss again. Roast for about 40 minutes until the tomatoes are starting to brown on the edges. Add the cilantro when you remove the vegetables from the oven. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Preheat oven to 400. Heat olive oil in baking pan. Place fillets in pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove fish from pan. In small bowl, combine tomatoes, green chilies, lime juice. and cilantro. Spoon over fish and serve. Serves 4.

In a large skillet heat a teaspoon of oil. Add eggs and saute until scrambled. Add vegetables, ginger and garlic. Cook until crisp tender. Add mung bean sprouts. Add a dash each of soy sauce and rice vinegar. Add hoisin sauce to desired amount. Stir fry for a few minutes. Serve with pancakes.

Mix eggs and sugar together. Add the flour and salt. Heat the oil in a fry pan over moderate heat. Using a 1/4 cup measuring cup. Scoop up the batter and place in hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Let cool on a plate with paper towel. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve warm.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and saute until tender. Stir in green chiles, beans, sour cream and chorizo. Cook until heated through. Crack the eggs over the mixture, then sprinkle with salt and pepper. Let the eggs set for a minute or two until the whites start to cook. Sprinkle with cheese and serve with tortilla chips.

Bring 8 cups of water to a boil. Add the spaghetti and cook for 8 minutes. Drain. In a large bowl, combine the eggs and spaghetti. Beat until smooth. Season the mixture with salt and pepper and add the Parmesan cheese and pasta sauce. Divide the mixture into 18 muffin cups. Bake for 15 minutes. Turn off the oven and add the mozzarella cheese and melt it. Serve.

In a small bowl stir together sugar, cocoa powder, flour and salt. Add milk and stir until smooth. Pour into 4 1/2-cup ramekins. Place ramekins in a roasting pan and fill with enough water to reach halfway up side of ramekins. Bake at 350f. for 20 to 25 minutes or until set. Let cool and serve with whipped cream.

Preheat the grill to medium heat (350 degrees F.). While the grill is heating, prepare the butter mixture by combining the butter, lemon juice, and zest in a small bowl. To prepare the corn, brush the husks lightly with vegetable oil and then wrap the corn in the husks (this will help steam the corn). Grill the corn, turning several times for even cooking (approximately 15 minutes). Remove the corn from the grill and carefully peel back the husks and silks and brush the corn with the butter mixture and sprinkle with the zest of the lemon and the zest of the lime. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Sift together flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. Cream the canola oil, egg and banana together in a separate bowl. Add to the sifted ingredients alternating with the milk until well blended. Fold in the nuts and bananas. Spread into a well greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Let the bread sit for 5 minutes before removing from the pan and cooling on a rack.

Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil. Add a pinch of salt and 1 tablespoon olive oil. Add pasta and cook 8-9 minutes. Drain and add to a bowl. Add salami and mix. Preheat an 8-inch cast iron skillet. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil. Add onion and cook 5 minutes. Add zucchini and cook 3 minutes. Add carrot and cook 3 minutes. Add eggs and cook 4 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook 1 minute. Stir in pasta mixture. Bake 15 minutes until set. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut into wedges. Serves 4.

In a large mixing bowl combine the soup, water, and rice. Stir until well blended. Add seasonings to taste. Add the chicken breasts. Cover with foil. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes. Remove cover and sprinkle cheese over top. Return to oven for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Clean mushrooms by wiping them out with a damp paper towel and remove the stems if you are not going to use them. Mix together the feta and cream cheese and season with garlic and parsley. Stuff the mushrooms with the feta cheese mixture and place them in a greased shallow baking dish. Sprinkle the mushrooms and top of the dish with the bread crumbs and the parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until the mushrooms are soft and the cheese has browned on top. Serve with a side salad and croutons for dipping.

Bring milk to a boil in small saucepan. Add eggs. Season with salt and pepper. Add the chicken and ham. Melt margarine in a 9 inch pie plate. Stir the eggs and ham mixture into the margarine. Pour into pie plate. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes. Let cool slightly. Cut into wedges and serve.

Preheat the oven to 170C. Line a 20cm square cake tin with baking paper. Put the sugar, butter and hot water in a pan over a low heat and stir until the sugar dissolves. In a mixing bowl, put the flour, cocoa, eggs and cream. Beat to combine. Add the sugar mixture. Beat until smooth. Pour into the prepared tin. Bake for 1 hour, or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean. Leave to cool in the tin. Spread the icing over the top of the cake. Spread the chocolate sauce over the top of the icing. Dust with cocoa.

In a large bowl combine eggs and water. Whisk until thoroughly blended. Set aside. Melt butter and add crabmeat and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add eggs and cheese. In a large skillet melt butter. Add egg mixture and cook on low heat until golden brown. Serve hot.

Cut bacon into 1/4-inch stripscook over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from pandrain on paper towelscrumble baconset aside. In same pan, sauté onions in bacon drippings until softened. Add garliccook 30 secondsstir in crushed red pepper flakesstir 1 minute. Add cabbagesauté 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add chicken brothbring to a boilcoverreduce heatsimmer 25 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Add brown sugarcook 5 minutesstir occasionally. Stir in baconcook 5 minutes longer. Serve immediately or store covered in refrigerator for up to 48 hours before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Spread the pizza crusts with the ricotta cheese mixture. Sprinkle with the romano cheese, fontina cheese and prosciutto. Roll up the crusts loosely into a crescent shape. Place on a cookie sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Garnish with chopped basil sprinkled with freshly ground pepper. Serve with your favorite salad or vegetable dish.

Place black beans in a large pot with enough water to cover by two inches. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook, uncovered, until the beans are tender and have almost disintegrated, about 2 hours. Drain the beans. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the ham in a bit of the cooking liquid from the black beans until lightly browned. Remove the ham from the skillet and set aside. In a large pot over medium-high heat, heat the oil. Add the hot italian sausage and cook until lightly browned. Add the garlic and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the onion and red pepper flakes and cook until softened. Add the tomatoes and their liquid. Add the ham and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the reserved beans and enough of their liquid to make the mixture very moist. Add the pork loin and cook for about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Combine taco seasoning with lime juice. Brush fish with the seasoning mixture and place fish on a greased grill. Cover grill and cook 5 minutes. Turn fish over and cook an additional 5 to 8 minutes. Sprinkle with cilantro. To assemble tacos, place fish in a tortilla. Top with cabbage, avocado slices and sour cream. Serve with lime.
In a small bowl whisk together mayonnaise and sour cream. Add roasted red peppers and tomatoes. Fold in almonds and balsamic vinegar. Season with kosher salt. Serve with fresh baguette slices.

In a skillet heat the oil. Saute the onions and garlic until the onions are tender. Add the ground beef and cook until browned. Stir in the tomato sauce, chili powder and worcestershire sauce. Cook over low heat about 10 minutes. Serve over hot dogs or hamburgers. Makes 2-3 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 9×13-inch baking dish, combine the soup and stuffing mix. Add the butter and water. Stir until combined. Add the chicken tenderloins and pour the half and half over the top. Sprinkle with the pepper. Cover tightly and bake for 40 minutes. Uncover and continue baking 10 minutes longer until bubbly.

Bake potatoes in oven until done. Scoop potato flesh into a large bowl. Mash with a potato masher. Add cheese. Stir in milk. Add ham. Stir until ham is heated through. Add onion salt. Pepper. Spread potato mixture into a shallow 2 quart baking dish. Combine butter with paprika. Spread over potatoes. Bake in a 350 degree F. oven for about 20 minutes or until top is browned.

Melt butter in dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add cabbage and onion. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in caraway seed. Add corned beef. Pour 1/2 cup water over meat. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Cover tightly and simmer 35 minutes. Uncover. Add biscuits and remaining water. Bake uncovered 15 minutes. Top with cheese and remaining dressing. Bake 5 minutes longer. Serve with additional dressing.
Prepare batter by combining first six ingredients and shortening. Dip chickens in batter and deep fry at 375 until golden. Drain on paper towels. Makes 6 servings.

Cut the onion into thin slices. Slice garlic cloves. Chop ginger. Combine ginger, onion, garlic, honey, coriander, soy sauce, lime juice and pepper in a bowl. Rub the mixture into the pork. Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours. Grill until tender and cooked through.

Cut tomatoes in half horizontally, then cut in half again. Scoop out some of the inside of the tomato into a bowl. Place the tomatoes face down on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle a little salt on the tomato cut side of the tomatoes. Broil the tomatoes for 6-8 minutes, or until the tomato skin is nicely blistered and blackened. Remove tomatoes from oven and allow to cool slightly. In a small bowl add the artichoke hearts, red onion, tomato pulp from the bowl and the mayonnaise. Toss gently to mix well. Divide bruschetta evenly amongst the baguettes and top with mozzarella cheese. Broil for 1-2 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Place the oats, rice, barley, and bulgur into a large saucepan. Add the apricots, dates, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt. Add the water. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to medium. Stir. Cover the pot. Simmer the mixture for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Cool. Press into a pie pan. Refrigerate. Serve cold.

Pour milk into a heavy bottom pot. Stir in rice. Heat over medium heat until milk comes to a boil. Stir in sugar. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 40 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and brandy. Fold in sultanas. Spoon into serving bowls. Garnish with ground cinnamon.

Remove the giblets from the chicken cavity. Pat the chicken dry inside and out with paper towels. In a bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, orange juice, sherry, honey, ginger and garlic. Put 1/3 of the marinade in the cavity of the chicken. Rub the remaining marinade all over the outside of the chicken. Put the chicken on a rack set over a shallow pan. Roast until the chicken is cooked through, about 1 1/2 hours. Let the chicken rest 10 minutes before carving. If you prefer to serve the chicken as whole birds, slice off the wing tips and drumsticks to serve. Serve with the pan juices.

Brown the meat in a pan. Add the onion and saute until the meat is browned and the onion is tender. Add the other ingredients. Mix well and form into patties. Heat a little bit of vegetable oil in a frying pan and cook the patties to desired doneness. Turn once. Melt the cheese in the microwave. Serve the burgers topped with the melted cheese.
Heat ghee in pan and add garlic. Saute until golden. Add rice and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add chili powder and stir. Add cashews and almonds and stir well. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve hot.
Melt butter in a large saucepan. Add marshmallows and stir until melted. Remove from heat. Add cereal. Stir quickly. Press mixture into balls and roll in coconut. Chill until firm.
Combine first 6 ingredients in a small bowl. Coat a medium skillet with cooking spray. Add salmoncook 5 minutes on each side or until done. Top with chives. Serve with miso sauce.

Combine all of the ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Remove pineapple from pineapple juice to make room for chops. Pound pork chops to an even thickness. Dip pork chops into sauce, then place in baking dish. Bake at 350 for approximately 45 minutes or until chops are cooked through. Drizzle with sauce before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place potatoes on a baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes. Mix yogurt, 1/2 cup cheese and garlic in a small bowl. In another bowl, combine remaining cheese and spice. Remove potatoes from oven. Flip each potato over and fill the indentation with cheese mixture. Sprinkle with remaining cheese mixture. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until potatoes are heated through and topping is bubbly. Serve warm.

Melt the butter in a medium-size pot over medium heat. When the butter melts, add the onion and saute for 2-3 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes and add enough water to cover the tomatoes by about 3 inches. Bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 1 hour. Stirring occasionally. Add bay leaf and ground cloves. Season with salt and pepper. In a medium size mixing bowl, combine the flour and milk. Add to the tomato mixture and cook for an additional 20 minutes. Serve with toasted croutons.
Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl. Let stand for 30 minutes to blend flavors. Makes about 2 cups of sauce. Makes about 2 cups of sauce.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil and the butter. Add the brussels sprouts and cook until they turn a golden brown. Add the pancetta and cook until crisp and browned. Add the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fried onions and serve hot.

Combine strawberries and cornstarch in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat and stir in gelatin. Cool to room temperature. Fold in whipped topping. Pour into a prepared 9-inch pie plate. Chill for 3 hours or overnight. Serves 8.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook the penne according to the directions on the package. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat the olive oil and butter over medium heat until the butter melts. Add the chicken breast and cook for a few minutes until lightly browned. Stir in the basil pesto and cook until the chicken is cooked through. Drain the pasta and return it to the pot. Add the chicken and pesto mixture and toss until the pasta is evenly coated. Season the dish to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 200c/gas mark 6. Cut the bread into squares and place in a food processor. Blend until it resembles fine breadcrumbs. Stir in the prawn meat. Beat the egg in a bowl. Add the gingerroot and green chili and mix together. Add to the breadcrumb mixture and stir well. Lightly grease a baking tray and shape the mixture into cakes. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Serve with a spoonful of the coriander-ginger dip.
Combine mozzarella cheese and eggs. Blend well. Add flaxseed meal and baking powder. Mix well. Place mixture onto pizza pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until golden.

Place beans in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and boil for 3 to 5 minutes to remove any impurities. Drain and rinse beans well in a colander. Place beans in a blender and puree. Transfer puree to a large saucepan and stir in onions, garlic, and olive oil. Cook over medium heat until onions are softened, 5 to 7 minutes. Add cayenne pepper and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook for 2 minutes. Add green pepper and stir until softened, 3 to 5 minutes. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Soak gelatin in milk until dissolved. Add boiling water and stir until thickened. Fold in pineapple with juice, cream cheese, whipping cream and nuts. Chill until firm. Cut in cubes, garnish with walnuts and whipped cream. Serve with pineapple slices and lemon wedges.

Mix together the dry ingredients. Cut the butter into pieces and rub into the dry ingredients. Work in the pumpkin. Add the egg and beat until just combined. Beat in the milk. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead lightly. Roll out to about half an inch thick. Cut into shapes with a pastry cutter. Put onto a lightly greased tray. Brush with milk. Bake for about 15 minutes or until golden. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan, combine cranberries, sugar, marmalade and lemon juice. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook until cranberries are softened and almost all of the liquid has evaporated - about 20 minutes. Spoon into individual ramekins or small bowls. Top each serving with chopped walnuts.
Combine all the above. Form into patties. Brown in a pan with a little oil.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the onion and sugar until the onion is tender, about 5 minutes. Add the steak strips and cook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Add the worcestershire sauce and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the water and simmer until the steak is tender when pierced with a fork, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, toast the buns in the oven or on a griddle, topping the bottom bun with the cheese. Divide the steak mixture into 4 portions and place each portion on the bottom bun. Top with the top bun. Serves 4 (serving size 1 sandwich)

In a 3-4 quart slow cooker, combine tomatoes, water, kale and 1 can of condensed soup. Stir to combine. Cook on low for 4 hours or on high for 2 hours. Stir in the sausage and remaining can of soup. Cook on high for 1 hour more or until sausage is cooked through. Add the tortellini and cook for 10 minutes or until pasta is cooked through. Sprinkle with parmesan. Serve with additional parmesan if desired.
Blend all ingredients in blender until smooth, pour into glasses and serve immediately.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add pork chops and cook for 4 minutes or until browned all overtransfer to plate. Add apple and onioncook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add wine and scrape up any browned bits from bottom of pancook until mixture is slightly thickened, about 1 minute. Add sauerkraut and bring to a simmercover and cook for 10 minutes or until pork chops are cooked through. Transfer pork chops to serving platterspoon sauerkraut over them and serve.

Place brown sugar and cornstarch into a bowl and mix well. Gradually add lemon juice and water, stirring until smooth and well blended. Add soy sauce and stir thoroughly. Add green onion and garlic salt and garlic and stir well. Place margarine into a saucepan and heat until melted and bubbly. Remove from heat and add lemon pepper and stir well. Pour half the margarine mixture over chicken and half over potatoes. Let stand for at least 20 minutes before cooking. Bake, uncovered at 350 for 1 hour or until chicken and potatoes are tender and juices run clear when pierced with a skewer. Makes enough for a pound of chicken or potatoes.

Place the red snapper fillet and ginger slices into a plate. Season with the light soy sauce, sugar, ginger, garlic and seasonings. Leave aside for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, pour the 1/4 cup soy sauce and the sugar into a small saucepan. Heat over medium heat until the sugar dissolves and the mixture boils. Turn heat off and leave until cool. When cool, pour into a small bowl or a small measuring cup. Heat up a steamer. After 30 minutes, drain the fish and sprinkle with the sauce. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl combine the shallots with the olive oil. Set aside. In a 9 x 13-inch baking dish arrange the butternut squash and sweet potatoes. Drizzle with the shallot mixture. Season with salt and cumin. Toss to coat. Bake for 45 minutes. Add the bell peppers and toss to combine. Continue baking until tender and lightly browned, about 15 minutes longer. Season with cinnamon and butter.

Boil beets in water for 45-60 minutes. Drain water from beets. Cut off top and bottom, peel beets. Cut beets into small cubes. In a large bowl, combine beets, gherkins, apple, horseradish root and sour cream. Mix well. Serve beets cold.

Melt margarine in pot. Saute onion in margarine until tender. Stir in broccoli florets. Add flour. Mix well. Stir in broth, garlic powder, parsley flakes and bouillon. Heat until boiling. Reduce heat. Stir in water and milk. Cook and stir until broccoli is tender and sauce has thickened. Serve hot. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f.Peel and quarter the onions.Place in a roasting tray, season with the salt and pepper, and toss in the fresh thyme.Roast for 40-45 minutes until golden brown and caramelized.Remove from the oven and set aside to cool slightly.When ready to serve, pour over the melted butter and serve immediately.

Prepare dressing by combining the first 3 ingredients in a small bowl. Set aside. In a large bowl, toss together the spinach, cheese and dressing. Season to taste with coarse salt and pepper. Serves 4.

Cut chicken into bite size pieces. Spray crockpot with nonstick cooking spray. Combine sauce with bacon bits. Place chicken in bottom of crockpot. Add sauce and bacon. Top with colby and monterey jack. Cook on low 4 to 5 hours. Remove from crockpot and stir in onion and southwest seasoning. Serve over rice.
Bring cream cheese spread and milk to a boil in a small saucepan. Add parmesan cheese. Cook 1 minute or until melted and smooth. Stir in tortellini and frozen peas. Top with ham. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375. Place muffin cut side down on a foil lined baking sheet. Bake 5 minutes. Turn muffin over. Place on a clean cookie sheet. Cook egg in a non stick skillet over medium heat. Top with ham and cheese. Place on muffin. Cook in oven 10 minutes or until cheese melts.

Heat olive oil in large pot over medium high heat. Cook onion 3-5 minutes or until tender. Stir in cabbage and bay leaves. Add vinegar. Bring to a boil and cook 5-10 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Stir in apple and cloves. Reduce heat to low and cook 10 minutes or until apples are tender. Remove bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or cold.

Combine chocolate and coffee powder in a saucepan and stir over medium heat until the mixture is smooth and completely melted. Cool slightly. Beat egg whites and sugar together until stiff and glossy. Add chocolate mixture and beat until smooth. Fold in whipping cream. Pour into 6 small dessert dishes or custard cups and refrigerate until set. Top each serving with chocolate shavings.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Cut the squash in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and stringy pulp with a large spoon. Rub the flesh with a thin layer of olive oil and sprinkle the ground spices. Roast the squash for 45 minutes to an hour, until it is very tender and the flesh has caramelized and browned lightly. Meanwhile, make the greek yogurt. Whisk all the other ingredients together with the yogurt and salt. When the squash is done, allow to cool slightly and scoop out the flesh and put in a blender or food processor and blend until it becomes a silky puree. Add a squeeze of fresh lemon juice. Then add the yogurt dressing and blend until smooth. Spoon the puree evenly among the six ramekins and refrigerate until serving time.

Heat oven to 400f. Mix olive oil and Old Bay seasoning in large bowl. Place chicken thighs into bowl and toss with oil mixture until evenly coated. Wrap chicken tightly in bacon and place on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes per pound or until bacon is cooked and juices run clear when chicken is pierced at thickest part. Serve at room temperature.

Drain and rinse tomatoes. Heat the olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the tomatoes and garlic and cook, stirring frequently until tomatoes are softened. Lower the heat and simmer gently for another 1/2 hour, stirring occasionally. Season the mixture with a pinch of salt and freshly ground black pepper. Transfer the tomato mixture to a food processor or blender. Pulse the machine on and off until the mixture is the texture of a thick paste. Store in an airtight container for up to a month.

In a small bowl, combine Dijon and corn flakes. Sprinkle pork on both sides with salt and pepper. Drizzle with oil. Roll pork in Dijon mixture and place in a greased baking dish. Sprinkle with tarragon, basil and garlic powder. Cover and bake for 1 hour.

Peel the acorn squash. Cut into 1-inch wedges. Melt the butter in a small saucepan. Add the brown sugar and maple syrup. Bring to a boil, stirring. Remove from heat. Stir in the cinnamon. Arrange the squash in a shallow baking dish. Pour the syrup mixture over the squash. Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until the squash is tender.

Cook potatoes in a medium saucepan with 3 cups water until tender. Drain potatoes. Reserve 1/2 cup cooking water. In a Dutch oven over medium heat, saute onion in butter until tender. Stir in potatoes, allspice berries, reserved cooking water and fish. Cook, covered, about 3 minutes or until fish is opaque throughout. Stir in cream and milk. Simmer uncovered 5 minutes. Stir in dill. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet cook bacon until crisp and drain on paper towels. Set aside. In the same skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add the potato and onion and cook until golden. Add bacon and season with salt and pepper. Serve with an egg over easy.

Boil the water. Put one teaspoon of sugar and one tea bag into a cup. Pour the boiling water over it and let it steep for 1 minute. Add the orange juice and stir. Add cold water and ice cubes and stir. Add the orange slices and enjoy.

Combine all ingredients and mix well. Form into a loaf or patty. Wrap with plastic wrap and put into a sealed plastic bag. Refrigerate for 24 hours and then freeze for a week or more. (When you are ready to serve it, let it thaw in the refrigerator for a couple days.) Slice into rounds and serve on a bun. Makes about 1 pound. This can be used for sandwiches or cut into rounds and served as an appetizer.

In a large soup pot over medium heat, cook the onions in the fat until they are soft but not browned. Add the pork shoulder. Stir well to break up the meat. Add water to cover by 1 inch. Add the paprika and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the pork is very tender, about 1 hour. Stir in the sauerkraut and continue cooking until the pork is very tender, about 15 minutes. Serve with the sour cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Put pretzels in a large plastic bag and use a rolling pin to crush them into crumbs. Combine the crumbs with the butter in a small bowl. In another bowl combine the egg with the milk. Dip the fillets in the egg mixture then coat with the crumb mixture. Place on a baking sheet lightly greased with vegetable oil. Bake until lightly browned and just cooked through, about 10 minutes. Serve with lemon slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 10 x 10 inch baking pan or an equivalent dish that will hold the cabbage mixture without spilling over. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the cabbage, onion and garlic. Cook, stirring constantly until the cabbage is softened, about 5 minutes. Place the cabbage mixture in a colander to drain off excess oil. Heat the milk in a saucepan over medium heat until it comes to a boil. Reduce heat to low and whisk in the flour to make a smooth sauce. Add the cabbage mixture to the sauce and stir to blend well. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking pan. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top. Bake for about 30 minutes or until the mixture is bubbly and the cheese is golden brown. Serve hot with crackers or toast.

In a large pot or heavy bottomed pan heat the butter over medium heat until melted. Add the brown sugar and whisk until well combined. Stir in the corn syrup and baking soda. Once the mixture is boiling cook for 5 minutes over high heat until thick and bubbly. Remove from the heat and stir in the popcorn. Spread the mixture evenly on a sheet pan. Allow to cool until crispy. Store in an airtight container.

Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Stir in dry milk and hot water. Mix and knead lightly. Roll out on floured board until thin. Place on hot greased skillet or griddle and bake on both sides until lightly browned. Serve with butter or jam or honey.
