Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Combine macaroni, green onions, celery, tomatoes, mayonnaise, vinegar, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add bacon. Stir well. Chill several hours.

Preheat a gas grill to 450 degrees. Cut a 2-inch slit in the side of the peppers. In a small bowl combine butter and garlic. Lightly brush butter mixture over the peppers. Place peppers on grill. Cover and cook peppers until they are tender when pierced with a sharp knife. About 10 minutes. Grill steaks to desired doneness. Cook steaks about 5 minutes per side for rare. Season steaks with salt and pepper. To serve, cut peppers open, remove seeds and serve with steaks.

Pour the brewed coffee into a large glass mug and add the sugar cubes. Stir until the sugar is completely dissolved. Add the whiskey and stir gently until all the sugar cubes have dissolved. Top with the cream and sprinkle with a bit of nutmeg or grate a bit of nutmeg over the top.

Lightly beat the eggs and milk together in a large bowl and stir in sugar and vanilla and cinnamon and nutmeg. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and grease with butter or cooking spray. Soak 1 slice of bread in the egg mixture for 1-2 minutes per side and then place in the skillet and cook for 3 minutes per side or until light golden brown. Repeat with the remaining bread and butter or cooking spray the skillet in between batches as needed. Serve with butter and syrup.

Pre-heat oven to 180°C. Grease a 22cm pie tin. Melt butter and stir into a large bowl with the sugar. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Fold through the flour, baking powder and salt. Add the milk and vanilla essence and mix to a smooth batter. Pour into the pie tin and bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Allow to cool before serving.

Place the cranberries into a large nonstick pan and turn the heat to medium high. Add the water and sugar and bring to a boil, stirring often and breaking up the cranberries with a wooden spoon as the mixture boils. Once the cranberries have broken down into a thick sauce, remove from the heat. Strain through a fine sieve and into the container of an ice cream maker. Once the sorbet is almost done churning, add the vanilla seeds and lemon juice and continue to churn according to the manufacturer s instructions. Scrape into a container and freeze for at least one hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 450 deg. Toss together potatoes and vegetables until coated with olive oil. Place on baking sheet, sprinkle with red pepper flakes and season with salt and minced ginger. Roast 20 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Remove from oven and set aside. Spray baking sheet with cooking spray. Place fillets on baking sheetseason with lime juice and sesame oil. Roast 12 to 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. To serve, place 2 fillets on serving platetop with vegetables. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together ground beef, ketchup and brown sugar. Add eggs and bacon, mix well. In a separate bowl, mix together the cracker crumbs and mustard. Add to the meat mixture and mix well. Pour into greased loaf pan and bake for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. In a medium bowl combine all-bran, oat bran, flour, baking soda and salt. In a large bowl combine eggs, buttermilk and honeystir well. Stir in oil and prune until blended. Stir in all-bran mixture just until moistenedstir in raisins and nuts. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans. Makes 12 muffins.

Cook ground beef until done. Drain. Add tomato soup and italian seasoning and oregano. Simmer on low for 10 minutes. Add green beans, corn and mashed potatoes. Bake 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Add berries and vanilla. Return to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes or until berries break apart. Pour through a sieve into a bowl to remove seeds. Add lemon juice. Cover and store in refrigerator up to 2 weeks. Makes about 2 cups.

In blender or food processor combine first 4 ingredients. Heat over low heat until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and stir in next 4 ingredients. Brush over steak or chicken. Let stand for 15 minutes before cooking. Serve with grilled vegetables.
Heat milk to boiling. Mix together flour and salt. Add to milk. Cook until thick. Cool. Add butter and vanilla. Cream until smooth. Pour into bowl. Chill.

Preheat the oven to 400°F. In a large pot of boiling water, cook the potatoes until they are just tender when pierced with a knife. Drain and allow them to cool slightly. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes with the olive oil. Spread the potatoes into 2 large baking sheets. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle the potatoes with the balsamic, garlic, rosemary and coarse sea salt. Bake for 30 minutes more. The potatoes are done when they are lightly browned and crispy. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Beat cream cheese until soft. Add butter and powdered sugar. Beat on low speed for about 1 minute. Add vanilla extract and milk. Beat for 1 minute. Add chocolate chips. Pour into pie crust. Spread with whipped topping. Store in refrigerator for 1 hour. Serve chilled.

Place fish in baking dish. Combine bread crumbs, parsley, lemon juice, egg white and 1 tbsp water. Sprinkle over fish. Bake for 15 minutes. Combine tomato, oil, remaining water and lemon juice. Spoon over fish. Broil 3 to 4 inches from heat until crust is light brown and fish is done.

In a large bowl stir together cranberries, orange juice, sugar. Let stand for 30 minutes. Drain cranberries and place in a saucepan. Stir in remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool completely. Store in the refrigerator. Makes 3 1/2 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl combine cream cheese, seasonings, salt, pepper. Spread mixture on one side of each cracker. Place a little of the cream cheese mixture in the center of the cracker. Top with shredded cheddar. Place on a baking sheet lined with wax paper. Bake for 7-10 minutes or until warm. Makes 12 servings.
Brown steak in oil. Sprinkle onion soup mix and water over beef. Pour in mushroom soup and cook until bubbly. Add cornstarch and water mixture, and bring to a boil. Cook for 1 minute.

Wash kale in boiling water to remove grit. Drain in a colander or sieve and squeeze out excess moisture. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic, stirring occasionally until golden brown about 3 minutes. Add onion, stirring occasionally until softened about 5 minutes. Add kale and stir fry about 10 minutes until tender, adding soy sauce about 5 minutes before serving time. Stir in lemon juice just before serving.

Heat oil in skillet over med-high heat. Dip chicken in flour and shake off excess. Cook over med-high heat for 3 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in the center. Drain chicken. Toss with seasoning and cayenne. Serve with rice and vegetables.

In a large pot, combine the chicken broth and vegetables. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken bouillon cubes. Lower the heat to a simmer. Add the chicken, bay leaf and garlic. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove the chicken. Cut it into cubes. Add the egg noodles to the broth. Cook according to the package directions. Season the soup with kosher salt to taste. Add the chicken back into the pot. Ladle the soup into individual bowls. Garnish each serving with a sprig of parsley.

Preheat oven to 375. Place racks of lamb on baking sheetdrizzle with olive oil. Rub lamb with mustardsprinkle with butter, shallots, thyme and breadcrumbs, pressing breadcrumbs onto both sides of the racks of lamb. Season with salt and pepper to tastetransfer to oven and roast for 1 hour or until done to your liking. Sprinkle with parsley just before serving. Serve with rosemary potatoes.

Wash and core apples. Cut into 1/4 inch thick slices. Place in a large bowl. Combine sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger and apple cider. Toss apples in the mixture to coat. Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Place apple slices in dish. Pour butter over apples. Bake 45 minutes in a 350 degree F oven. Remove from oven. Add raisins. Stir. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Grease muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. Mix bran, buttermilk, raisins and applesauce in large bowl until well combined. Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition. Add molasses and mix until combined. Stir in flour, soda and salt. Fill muffin cups or paper baking cups three-fourths full. Bake 20 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes. Makes 16 muffins. Serving size 1 muffin. Nutrition information per serving: 123 calories, 3 g total fat (1 g saturated fat), 0 mg cholesterol, 189 mg sodium, 26 g carbohydrate (5 g dietary fiber, 11 g sugars), 4 g protein.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spray two large baking sheets with olive oil flavored cooking spray. On each sheet lay two sheets of phyllo dough diagonally and brush each sheet with olive oil. Fold each sheet over to cover the other sheet completely and spray both sides of the dough with cooking spray. Repeat with the remaining sheets of dough and stack all the dough sheets together. Cut the stacked dough into 8 equal pieces and place the pieces onto the baking sheets. Place the baking sheets into the oven and bake for about 10 minutes or until the dough is crisp and golden brown. To serve, arrange the dough cups onto a serving plate and fill with spinach souffle. Garnish with lemon wedges and feta cheese if desired.

Saute the onion in the butter until tender. Add the tomatoes and cook for a few minutes. Add the corn. Bring to a boil. Add the creamed corn and evaporated milk. Season to taste and cook for a few minutes longer. Stir in the chicken broth and heat through. Serves 4 to 6.

In a 3-1/2-quart slow cooker, mix turkey, lemon pepper seasoning, and flour. Add water. Cover and cook on low until turkey is tender, about 8 hours. Stir in onion. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in broth and cornstarch mixture. Cook on high until thickened. Stir in parsley. Cover and keep warm.

Prepare grill for direct grilling over medium heat. Lightly brush chops on both sides with canola oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill chops 4-6 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in center. Remove from grill and let stand for 5 minutes. Combine lime juice and garlic in a small bowl. Whisk in oil and red pepper flakes. Whisk in remaining 2 tablespoons lime juice. Season to taste. Toss remaining 1/2 cup cilantro with dressing. Serve chops with lime vinaigrette.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8-inch-square baking pan. Combine the first five ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in chips. Spread into prepared pan. Sprinkle with coconut and nuts. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes. Cool in pan on wire rack. Cut into 1-inch bars.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, tomatoes and basil and cook 5 minutes until softened. Add black beans and cook for 1 minute. Add penne pasta and cook 5 to 6 minutes more. Add mango and stir to combine. Add additional salt or pepper if needed. Serve warm.

In a medium skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and peppers and cook until the vegetables are tender crisp, about 7 to 10 minutes. Transfer to a plate. Beat the eggs and egg whites in a large bowl until the mixture is just combined and the eggs are lightened in color. Add the onion-pepper mixture to the eggs and mix well. Add the salt and pepper and the cheese and mix well to combine. Heat the olive oil in an oven-proof skillet over medium heat. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and let sit for a couple minutes until the bottom is set. Place the pan in the oven and cook until the frittata is set and lightly browned around the edges, about 20 to 30 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa and extra cheese if desired.

Preheat crock pot to low. Add water. Trim excess fat from turkey and cut into 6 pieces. Remove rind from lemons and finely chop pulp. Mix lemon pulp with Dijon mustard, white wine and garlic and spread over turkey. Sprinkle with herbs. Cover and cook 5 hours. Serve with cooking liquid.

Place the lamb in a baking dish, add the oregano, lemon rind and juice. Season with salt and pepper. Dot the top with small pieces of butter and cover with foil. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees f for 1 hour. Remove the foil and turn the lamb over. Add the onions, bay leaves and wine. Baste the lamb with the liquid in the dish. Turn the lamb again. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees f for another hour. Remove the lamb from the dish and keep warm. Blend the onions and juices to make a sauce. Pour over the lamb. Serve.

In a small saucepan, combine water and sugar and bring to boil over medium heat. Add gingerroot and boil until ginger is soft and mixture is reduced by 1/3, 15-20 minutes. Cool slightly. Cut off skin of the mango and cut into slices. Heat the butter in a skillet over medium heat until it foams. Add the ginger-sugar mixture and cook until slightly thickened, about 2 minutes. Add the mangos and cook until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Spray 11x7 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Place haddock in prepared baking dish. Combine butter and ritz crackerssprinkle over fish. Cover fish with crab meat. Bake uncovered in preheated oven for 20 minutes.

Pour orange juice and sweet and sour mix into a blender with the ice and blend until smooth. Strain mixture into a punch bowl or pitcher and stir in the tequila and triple sec. Chill until ready to serve. Serve the loaded lemonade over ice in a punch bowl or pitcher at your next party or gathering and serve with lemons and lime slices for garnish if desired.

In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, chipotle powder and lime juice and zest. Set aside. In another small bowl mix together orange zest and sugar. Sprinkle over salmon. Rub orange mixture into salmon. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add salmon and cook 3-4 minutes per side. Serve over warm tortilla with avocado and cabbage. Serve with lime wedges.

Heat the oil in a frying pan over a high heat. Add the ham. Turn the ham in the pan to brown on both sides. Beat the eggs with the cream until foamy. Add the ham to the egg mixture. Season. Spread the mixture on the puff pastry. Roll up the pastry around the mixture. Cut into 12 slices. Brush the egg wash over the pastry. Scatter with the tomatoes and chives. Sprinkle with the Parmesan. Bake for 15 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown.

Line a baking sheet with parchment paperset aside.Place nuts in a bowl with chocolate chips.Melt chocolate in a double boiler or microwave (in 30 second intervals).Stir chocolate until fully melted.Stir in vanilla extract and sea salt.Pour over nuts and stir to coat evenly.Spread nuts onto prepared baking sheet in an even layer.Let nuts cool in refrigerator until set.Transfer to an airtight container and store in refrigerator.
Brown meat. Add onion, salt and pepper. Stir to blend. Add chili peppers. Add celery salt. Add worcestershire sauce. Add ketchup. Add water. Add brown sugar. Simmer until thick.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Beat butter until creamy. Add sugars and beat until fluffy. Beat in flour and baking soda. Beat in egg and vanilla. Stir in peanut butter. Drop by rounded tablespoons on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 8 to 10 minutes or until set. Let cool for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool. Makes 3 dozen.

Combine the brown sugar, white sugar, water, light corn syrup, salt and maple extract into a heavy saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil over medium high heat, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon. Reduce to a simmer and boil for 20 minutes or until the syrup is a light caramel color. Remove from heat and strain through a fine mesh sieve into a measuring cup to remove any clumps that may have formed during boiling. Allow the syrup to cool to room temperature before serving. Use as you would regular pancake syrup.

Rinse the beans well under cold running water. Soak for 2 hours in enough water to cover them by about an inch. Drain the beans and place in the crockpot. Add the onion, turmeric powder, cumin, bouillon cubes, carrots, squash, celery, tamari soy sauce and coriander leaves. Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours or high for 3-4 hours. Stir and taste for seasoning before serving. Serves 4-6.

Fill a large pot with water and add carcasses. Bring water to a boilskim any impurities that float to the surface. Lower heat to a simmer, cover pot with lid or aluminum foil and cook for 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Strain stock through a fine sieve or strainer lined with cheesecloth or a double thickness of muslin (discard solids). Keep stock refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 3 days or freeze in an airtight container for up to 3 months.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil for cooking the pasta. Meanwhile, bring the vinegar to a boil over high heat in a medium saucepan. Reduce the heat to low, add the asparagus and simmer until just tender, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, cook the pasta according to package instructions. Drain and toss with the olive oilseason with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the asparagus and remaining ingredientstoss well to combine. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Mix mayonnaise with tuna, onion, celery, garlic powder, dill weed, basil, oregano and parsley. Spread mixture over bread slices, sprinkle with Swiss cheese. Place in a baking dish and pour over soup. Add half-and-half to top of mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for about 25 minutes until bread is crisp and soup is bubbling.
In a tall glass filled with ice, pour in the vodka. Top with the sweetened lime juice and fill the rest of the glass with seltzer water. Garnish with a lime wedge.

Spoon 1 tsp ranch dressing in the center of each tortilla. Place 2 - 3 mushrooms on the tortilla. Sprinkle 1 tsp of cheese on top. Fold the tortilla over to form a triangle. Place on cookie sheets. Bake at 450 degrees for 10 - 12 minutes or until cheese is melted and tortilla is crispy. Serves 4.

Melt chocolate over a double boiler. Remove from heat. Add margarine. Add coffee beans. Drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper. Let cool. Melt white chocolate in microwave. Pour over dark chocolate. Refrigerate until set.

Cream butter and sugar together. Mix flour and lemon myrtle together in a separate bowl. Add eggs into butter mixture and beat well. Add dry mixture and beat together well. Roll into small balls and press onto a lightly floured tray. Bake for about 25-30 minutes at 180 degrees or until golden brown. Remove from oven and cool completely before removing from trays and storing in air-tight containers.
Heat 1/4 cup margarine on medium heat. Add onion and mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms are soft. Add flour and mix well. Add water and soymilk. Season with salt and pepper. Cook 5 minutes.

In a medium bowl combine relish and mustard. In another bowl combine mayonnaise with tuna and celery. Spread mustard mixture on each roll. Top with tuna mixture and cheese. Cut rolls on an angle and serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown chicken breasts on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Remove from skillet to a plate. In a slow cooker combine chicken broth, seasoned salt, italian seasoning, onion & garlic powder. Cook on low for about 6 hours or until chicken is cooked through. In a large saucepan, combine chicken broth & soup. Bring to a boilcook & stir until thickened. Remove from heat & stir in cream cheese until smooth. Pour into slow cooker along with chicken, noodles & remaining ingredients. Cook on high for about an hour or until noodles are tender.

Soak lemon peel in cold water for 30 minutes. Juice lemon. Add strawberries to water. Sweeten to taste with sugar. Squeeze in lemon juice. Stir. Strain through cheesecloth to remove seeds. Chill in refrigerator for 2 hours. Mix with sparkling water, ice cubes and strawberry slices. Garnish with lemon peel and strawberry.

In large skillet or pot saute vegetables in butter until just tender. Add tomato sauce and continue cooking until hot. Divide sauce among 8x8-inch baking dishes. Sprinkle each dish with about 1/4 cup mozzarella cheese. Bake in preheated oven 5 minutes or until melted.
Slice tomatoes and jalapenos into quarters. Finely chop onion. Combine in a large bowl. Add lime juice, sugar, cumin and coriander. Add salt to taste. Chill and serve with tortilla chips.

Halve eggs lengthwise and remove yolks to a bowl. Mash yolks with sour cream and mayonnaise. Mix in dijon mustard and lemon peel and juice. Season with cayenne and salt and pepper. Stuff eggs with yolk mixture and sprinkle with parsley. Chill.

Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add flour, baking powder, milk and almond extract. Blend well. Roll into balls about 1 inch in diameter. Roll balls in anise seeds. Bake on ungreased sheet at 350f for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and zucchini. Cook 2 to 3 minutes longer or until zucchini is crisp-tender. Beat eggs and milk with remaining ingredients. Add vegetable mixture to eggs. Heat through. Spread mixture evenly into 9-inch pie plate. Bake 30 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes.
Prepare & bake cake according to directions. Cool. Layer in pan: cake, mandarin oranges in juice, pineapple in juice. Cover with whipped topping. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large mixing bowl combine the flour, cinnamon and nutmeg. In a medium size mixing bowl combine the peaches and lemon juice. Drain the peaches and combine with the brown sugar and almond extract. Spread the filling in the bottom of a 9 inch by 13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle the topping evenly over the filling. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until the topping is golden. Serve immediately with ice cream.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly coat two baking sheets with cooking spray. Place the crackers in a plastic bag and crush into fine crumbs. Melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and onion and saute for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Stir in the cracker crumbs and saute until the cracker crumbs are light brown. Mix the whipping cream and paprika in a bowl. Spoon the mushroom mixture into the bottoms of four 6-ounce ramekins. Spoon the whipping cream mixture over the mushrooms. Bake until the tops are light brown and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and saute 5 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally. Remove from heatstir in flour and bouillon cube. Return to heatstir in 1/2 cup beef brothcook 1 minute or until mixture boils and thickens. Stir in bouillon granules. Serve with meatloaf or pork chops.

Bring 4 quarts of salted water to a boil. Add the fettuccine and cook until al dente. Drain and place in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine the spinach and milk. Heat the butter and cornstarch until the mixture thickens. Add to the spinach mixture. Stir the mixture into the pasta. Season to taste with salt. Sprinkle with parsley and parmesan cheese. Garnish with blue cheese crumbles. Serve immediately.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until al dente. Drain. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add fresh mushrooms and bacon. Cook until browned and crisp. Toss together pasta, bacon mixture, heavy cream, parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Garnish with green onion.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a food processorprocess until smooth. Press into a 9-inch pie plate coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 12 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack. Combine corn syrup and next 6 ingredients in a medium saucepanbring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly. Boil, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Remove from heatcool slightly. Stir in toasted nuts and chocolate chips until chips melt. Spread evenly over piecrust. Chill at least 4 hours. To serve, cut into wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Beat 3/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons of granulated sugar with 1/4 cup of flour in a large bowl until smoothstir in 1/2 cup of whipping cream and 1/2 cup of half and half. Beat 4 egg whites until foamygradually add 1 tablespoon of granulated sugar and continue beating until soft peaks form. Gently fold the egg white mixture and 1 1/2 teaspoons of vanilla extract into the cream mixture until smooth.Pour filling into an unbaked 9 inch pie crust. Bake in preheated oven until set around edges but still has a slight jiggle in center, about 50 minutes. Cool completely before serving with whipped cream if desired.

Cook chicken breasts until done. Shred chicken with 2 forks. Combine soup with watercook until hot. Stir in chicken and dressing mix. Bring to boilstir until thickened. Stir in cream cheesestir until melted. Toss with cooked noodles. Serve warm.

In a large mixing bowl, cream together shortening and sugar. Add egg and beat thoroughly. Stir in baking powder and salt. Add vanilla and watermix well. Stir in cereal with a wooden spoon or spatula until well blended. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 7-9 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes about 2 dozen cookies. Store in an airtight container.

In a large saucepan bring chicken broth to boiling. Add rice and return to boilingcook and stir for 1 minute. Remove from heat and coverlet stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Combine rice and remaining ingredientstoss gently. Yield: 4 servings (serving size: about 1 cup)

In a small nonstick skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crisptransfer bacon to paper towels to drain. Pat fish dry with paper towels. Sprinkle the fish with the onion powder, and press 2 tablespoons of the parsley into the fish flesh. Wrap bacon around fish, overlapping strips as needed. Pat the remaining parsley over the fish. Season fish with pepper. In a small bowl, mix the bread crumbs with the herbs, and season with salt. Place fish in a lightly greased 9-inch square baking dish. Sprinkle with the bread-crumb mixture. Bake until the fish is just cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes. Serve fish with the bacon and remaining parsley.

Cook the noodles according to directions on package. Drain and set aside. In a 2 quart casserole dish pour the soup and milk and heat until hot. Add the tuna and onion and blend well. Pour into a 9 by 13 casserole dish and top with the potato chips. Sprinkle the cheese on top and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the chips are crispy. Serve hot.

Mix wine, soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger, paprika and garlic powder in small bowl. Place chicken in baking dish. Pour sauce over chicken. Cover and bake at 375 degrees F for about 40 minutes. Baste with pan juices every 10 minutes or so.

Pare pears leaving stems intact. Cut tops off pears at the stem end to form a small lid to cover opening. Cut out core and remove seeds with a small spoon or melon-baller. Reserve the stems for serving later with the pears. In a large bowl combine wine, brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger and saffron. Place pears in the bowl and turn to coat with the wine mixture. Cover and refrigerate 24 hours to marinate. Preheat oven to 375f. Place pears in a single layer in a baking pan and bake for 20 minutes, or until the pears are soft when pierced with a sharp knife. Remove from oven and serve pears in the baking pan with the reserved stems for serving.

Combine water and honey in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add the pear. Allow to cool slightly. In the bowl of an electric mixer combine 2 cups of the flour with the yeast. Add the honey mixture and 1 1/2 cups of the flour. Beat until smooth. Add the egg and 1 teaspoon of the salt. Beat until smooth. Add remaining flour gradually and beat until dough pulls away from sides of bowl. Knead dough on floured surface until smooth and elastic. Place dough in greased bowl and cover. Allow to rise in warm draft-free place until doubled in bulk. Punch down dough and turn onto lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth. Divide dough into 3 equal pieces. Roll each piece of dough into an 18-inch rope. Braid the ropes together and pinch ends together. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Cover with lightly greased plastic wrap. Allow to rise in warm draft-free place until doubled in bulk. Preheat the o
Place popped corn in bowl. Add cereal and nuts. Melt almond bark. Pour over mixture. Mix well. Let cool. Store in an airtight container.

Dry the pork chops and coat with flour. Add the mushroom soup and water to the french fried onion rings and heat. Add the onion rings to the pork chops and cook for 30 minutes in a 350 degree oven. Add the ginger and the rosemary and cook for 15 more minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Sauce:Melt margarine in a heavy saucepan. Add flour stirring well. Slowly stir in 1 cup of the soup. Add 1 cup of milk. Bring to a boil. Boil 1 minute. Stir in vegetables. Boil 5 more minutes. Add water chestnuts. Remove from heat. Filling:Mix the remaining soup and cream cheese. Spread half of mixture in a 2 quart casserole. Layer with vegetable mixture. Spread the remaining mixture. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 30 minutes.

Melt butter in a 2-quart microwave-safe bowl. Add flour and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add half-and-half cream and cook 4 minutes longer or until thickened. Stir in Tabasco and cheese until melted. Season with pepper. Serve immediately.

Cut up hamburger into bite size pieces. Cut up sausage into bite size pieces. Cook hot dogs cut into thirds. Cook bacon and cut into bite size pieces. Drain baked beans, add bacon, sausage, hamburger and hot dogs. Stir in cheddar cheese, ketchup and onion. Cook in 9 x 13 pan until bubbling.

Beat eggs well. Place green onions on paper towels and pat dry. Dip green onions in egg mixture. Dip in breadcrumb mixture and place on baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f for 40-45 minutes. Turn once. Cut into 1/2-inch slices. Serve with sour cream.

While the waffles are baking, combine cream cheese and brown sugar in a bowl. Stir until smooth and creamy. Serve immediately. Place a waffle on each plate. Spoon peach filling over the waffle. Top with a dollop of whipped cream and serve.

In a small bowl combine garlic, lemon juice and salt. Whisk in olive oil until well blended. Refrigerate and let marinate for an hour or more before using. Use as a salad dressing or a sauce for grilled meats or fish.

Preheat the broiler. Cut the chilies into 3/4 inch slices. Place 1 slice of cheese on each of 4 slices of bread. Top with chilies. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 1 minute or until the cheese melts. Top with sour cream and the remaining slices of bread. In a medium bowl, beat the eggs with the water and season with salt and pepper. Pour the mixture evenly into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Arrange the sandwiches on the egg mixture. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350. Place 1/2 cup water in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Sprinkle the ham over the water. Cover the saucepan with a lid. Microwave for 2 minutes. Carefully remove the lid. Using a slotted spoon, remove the ham from the water. When the ham is cool enough to handle, cut it into 1/4-inch pieces. Set aside. Coat a 9-inch pie plate or baking dish with cooking spray. Place 2 croissants in the pan. Top each with 1/3 cup ham. Spread evenly with 2 tablespoons cheese. Top each with 2 tomatoes. Repeat layers. Spray the tops with cooking spray. Cover the dish with foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, in a large nonstick skillet, heat the butter over medium heat until melted. Add the eggs. Stir constantly with a wooden spoon until the eggs are scrambled. Sprinkle with the remaining 2 tablespoons cheese. Place the croiss

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add chops. Cook 3 minutes per side or until browned. Remove from pan. Add wine to panboil over high heat until reduced by half. Add stockboil until reduced by half. Return chops to pan. Add sage, rosemary, and garlic. Coversimmer 5 minutes. Remove from heatstir in lemon juice. Serve over hot cooked egg noodles.

Season steak with flour, salt, and pepper. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add steak. Brown on both sides. Remove steak from skillet. Add onion to skillet. Cook until tender. Add soup, water, and steak. Heat through. Serve over cooked noodles.

Fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet and crumble. Saute onion in bacon fat until lightly browned. Add potato and cook until almost tender. Stir in creamed corn. Add milk and cook until thickened. Add salmon and bacon. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook until hot. Serve hot.

In a large sauce pan over medium heat, bring the milk to a simmer with the cinnamon stick and basil. Remove from the heat. Set aside and cool to room temperature. In a medium bowl, whisk the egg yolks and sugar until thick and pale yellow. Add the milk mixture. Pour into a 4-quart ice cream freezer. Freeze according to the manufacturer's instructions. Transfer to a container and freeze until firm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place brussels sprouts in a large bowl. Toss together sprouts, walnuts, cheese & olive oil. Place sprouts onto a cookie sheet & cook for 10 minutes or until lightly browned& tender. Mix together vinegar& mustard in small bowl & drizzle over sprouts. Sprinkle with salt& pepper. Makes 6 servings.

Heat a small nonstick fry pan over medium high heat until very hot. Add olive oil to pan and allow it to become very hot. Add garlic to pan and saute until golden brown. Remove garlic from pan and add basil, rosemary and sage to pan and saute for 1 minute. Add cannellini beans to pan and cook for 2 minutes or until warmed through. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice. Divide beans among 4 small bowls or plates. Top each serving with a few oil-cured black olives and serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 4.

In a medium bowl, combine dressing, mustard, wine, garlic powder and black pepper. Set aside. In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, heat oil. Cook and stir onion in the hot oil until tender. Add dressing mixture and bring to a boil. Cook and stir until thickened. Add pastatoss until well coated. Drain well. Sprinkle with cheese. Arrange cooked chicken on top. Serve immediately.

In a medium pot over medium-high heat, bring the rice, broth, water, onion, garlic cloves, lemon juice, oregano, spinach and salt to a boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in the feta cheese. Stir in the cooked ham. Serve warm.
Mix Miracle Whip with sour cream, add green onion and curry. Serve with raw vegetables.
Brown beef with onion. Drain. Stir in remaining ingredients. Pour into greased 13x9x2-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer. Serve with lettuce.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray an 8x8 baking pan with non-stick spray and line with parchment paper. Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a bowl and set aside. Beat together egg, coconut milk and butter in another bowl until smooth and creamy. Add vanilla and egg yolk and beat well. Add dry mixture to wet mixture and stir just until combined. Fold in coconut and currants. Spread batter evenly in pan. Bake 30 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes then remove and cool completely on a wire rack. Slice and serve with butter or margarine if desired.

Peel bananas. Cut in half lengthwise. Remove seeds. Cut into 1-inch slices. Squeeze lemon juice over bananas. Set aside. In a saucepan combine sugar, rind of lemon and orange. Heat to boiling over medium heat. Cook until sugar is dissolved. Add bananas and cook for 10 to 15 minutes longer or until a marmalade consistency is reached. Remove from heat and stir in butter. Pour into hot jars. Seal. Process in hot water bath. Makes 6 half-pint jars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 9×13 inch baking pan. In a large bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder and salt. In another bowl, cream together the butter and the egg. Stir the milk into the butter mixture just until blended. Add the butter mixture to the dry ingredients and stir just until blended. Spread half the batter into the prepared pan. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, saute the onion in 1/2 cup of vegetable stock for 2 minutes. Stir in the carrots, celery, tomatoes, and mushroomssaute for 5 minutes. Add the remaining vegetable stockcook 5 minutes more. Remove from the heat and stir in the parsley. Pour the vegetable mixture onto the batter in the pan. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top. Bake for 35 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the cake is golden brown on top and is firm to the touch. Allow to cool before cutting into
Mix dry curd cottage cheese, eggs, salt and black pepper in bowl. Chill for 2 hours or overnight. Cook as perogies or fill canned perogies.

Place star anise and cinnamon stick in a small pan. Add milk and bring just to a boil. Remove from heat and let stand 30 minutes. Strain into another pan. Heat until just hot. Whisk in palm sugar until smooth. Pour into 4 ramekins. Place ramekins into a steamer basket set over simmering water. Cover and steam about 15 minutes until custards are set. Serve hot.

Slice carrot into 1/2 inch circles. Peel and dice potato into 1/2 inch circles. Cut kielbasa into bite sized pieces and cut cabbage into quarters then sliced into strips. Heat oil in frying pan on medium low heat. Cook kielbasa for 3 to 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Add carrot and cook for 5 minutes more. Add cabbage and cook for 5 more minutes or until it just begins to wilt. Add onion and cook for 3 more minutes or until tender crisp. Add potato and cook 3 to 5 minutes or until just tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with hot mustard or sauerkraut or both.

Wash potatoes and allow them to dry. Pierce several times with a fork. Preheat oven to 350. While oven is pre-heating, brush the top of the potatoes with olive oil. Sprinkle with oregano, italian seasoning and fresh ground black pepper. Place in a baking dish. Bake for 1 hour. Turn the potatoes over after the first hour. Bake for an additional hour. Remove from oven. If you desire to have more juice in the potatoes, then pour the pan liquid over the potatoes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400. Grease a 1-quart casserole dish. Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Remove from skillet and drain. Cut carrots into 1/4-inch slices. Cook carrots and onion in skillet until tender. Add brown sugar and butter. Stir until sugar is melted. Add bacon and cook 1 minute. Pour into casserole dish. Combine milk and baking mix in a bowl. Add eggs, one at a time. Beat until smooth. Pour over carrots. Bake uncovered 30-35 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Peel 3 lbs potatoes. Cut into 1/2" slices. Boil until potatoes are tender, drain and return to pot. Melt 3 Tbsp butter in a saucepan. Add ham and onioncook until onion is clear. Add flour, dry mustard and pepper. Stir until well blended. Add milk gradually. Stir constantly until smooth. Add cheese, stir until cheese is melted. Stir potatoes. Pour mixture over potatoes. Cover and bake 45 minutes. Sprinkle with chives.

Place the roast into the crock pot, add 1/4 cup of water and sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper. Sprinkle onion on top of roast and pour remaining water over onion. Sprinkle with remaining salt and pepper. Pour barbecue sauce and worcestershire sauce on top of roast. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or until beef is tender.
Cook cauliflower florets in boiling water for about 5 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain well and toss with butter. Sprinkle with scallions. Serve hot.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the water, sugar and ginger root and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until the mixture is reduced by 1/3rd, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Strain through a sieve into a pitcher or bottle. Store in refrigerator until ready to use. To serve, place a few pieces of fruit in a small glass or bowl. Pour the syrup over the top of the fruit. Serve immediately. The syrup will keep refrigerated up to two weeks.

Slice zucchini into 1/4 inch thick slices. In a shallow bowl combine olive oil, cumin and salt and pepper to taste. Place zucchini in bowl and toss to coat well. Place zucchini in a single layer on a grill over medium heat and grill for 2 to 4 minutes per side or until tender and lightly browned.

Heat 2 T margarine in skillet over medium high heat. Add onion to skillet. Cook about 10 minutes until soft. Add canadian bacon to skillet. Continue cooking until the onions are caramelized. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place brie cheese on plain croissant. Spread one half of the caramelized onion canadian bacon mixture on the other half of the croissant. Place brie side down on a baking sheet. Bake until cheese begins to melt-about 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

In small bowl, combine tuna and egg. Add onion and green bell pepper. Pour salad dressing over mixture. Blend well. Add cheese. Spread onto bread. Broil 4 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Mix water and yeast. Let stand in warm place until frothy. Combine yeast mixture, eggs, and 2 cups of the flour. Add 1/2 cup butter. Mix until smooth. Add lemon zest and remaining 2 cups of flour. Beat until smooth. Let stand 30 minutes. Meanwhile melt remaining 4 tablespoons butter in a skillet. Heat to 375 degrees. Drop by tablespoons into butter. Fry until golden, about 3 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Roll in powered sugar or dust with confectioners sugar. Serve with jam.

Saute the onions in the butter until soft. Add the green peppers and the pimiento, cooking until tender. Mix the milk with the crabmeat and the breadcrumbs. Add the salt to taste and the eggs to bind the mixture together. Fold in the vegetables. Pour into a greased shallow baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes until the top is crispy brown. Sprinkle with the cheese and return to the oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Cut rolls in half and arrange on a baking sheet. In a medium bowl, combine pasta sauce and cutlets. Spoon half the chicken mixture on each half of each roll. Top with cheese. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 10 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease one 10-inch tube pan or one 12-cup muffin pan with vegetable oil. In a medium bowl combine sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, oil and flour. Stir until just combined. Stir in pecans. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 30 to 45 minutes for cake, or 25 minutes for muffins, until a wooden toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with honey butter.

Fill shaker halfway with ice. Pour in vodka and tomato juice. Add lemon juice and worcestershire sauce. Shake well. Pour into an ice-filled highball glass. Sprinkle with celery rib and garnish with a celery stalk and lemon wedge.

Cook cauliflower in a large pot until done but still firm to bite, about 5 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water and let cool. In a large bowl combine cauliflower, mayonnaise, lemon juice, sugar substitute, dried mustard, green onions, jalapeno peppers, salt and pepper. Mix well. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve over lettuce leaves or as a side with pork chops or pork tenderloin.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook potatoes until just tender, about 15 minutes. Cool and peel and cut into bite-size pieces. Combine the oil and garlic in a large bowl and let stand for 20 minutes. Add the potatoes and toss well. Add vinegar and toss well again. Season with salt and pepper and let stand for 30 minutes at room temperature. Add the salami and toss well again. Refrigerate until serving time. To serve, garnish with the green onions and parsley and serve with the pimentos.

Bake bread cubes in a 350 degree F oven for 5 minutes. Cut tomatoes in half lengthwisescoop out seeds and pulp. Fill tomatoes with bread cubestop with basil and thyme leaves. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a 2-quart baking disharrange tomatoes in dish. Combine remaining 2 tablespoons melted butter, Parmesan cheese, and milk in a small bowlpour over tomatoes. Cover and bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until tomatoes are tender. Uncoverbake 5-10 minutes longer or until lightly browned. Garnish with basil sprigs if desired.
Cut sandwiches in half. Fry in oil until crisp and golden. Remove from oil and drain. In a small bowl combine mustard and enough water to thin. Brush sandwiches with mustard and serve.
Mix together chicken, mayonnaise, and pineapple. Spoon into lettuce cupstop each serving with apple, grape, and cashew.

Brown the bacon in a skillet over medium-high heat. Remove bacon from skillet and place on paper towels. Reserve 1 tablespoons bacon fat. Add onion to the reserved bacon fat. Cook onion for 1 minute. Add beans. Cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Transfer to a casserole dish. Top with the bacon. Bake until bubbly. Sprinkle with cheese.

Place breadcrumbs and lemon rind in a food processor and blitz to a coarse crumb. Add the olive oil and pesto and blitz again until the mixture comes together. Divide the pesto crust mixture between the salmon fillets. Place each fillet on a non-stick baking sheet and bake in the oven for 15 minutes. Heat the creme fraiche and butter in a small pan until butter is melted. Take the salmon fillets out of the oven and spoon over the butter sauce. Serve hot.

Combine heavy cream, granulated sugar and corn syrup in a heavy bottomed saucepan and cook over medium heat until mixture reaches 238-240 degrees. Remove from heat. Stir in butter and vanilla extract. Stir until butter is completely melted and mixture is well combined. Pour into a parchment lined 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes and let cool completely. Once cooled, sprinkle the salt on top and chop the bittersweet chocolate into small pieces and sprinkle on top. Let cool again. Break into pieces and serve.

Mix stuffing mix, sesame seeds, paprika, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt in a medium bowl. Beat egg white in a small bowl. Coat each shrimp evenly with egg white. Dip shrimp in the stuffing mixture to coat. Place in a single layer in a large baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake 12 minutes. Turn shrimp. Bake 12 minutes longer or until shrimp turn pink. Makes 8 servings.

In a small saucepan, bring the rice, butter and cream to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to medium low and continue to cook, uncovered, until the rice is tender. Stir in the salt, brown sugar, vanilla and nutmeg. Continue cooking for an additional 5 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

Combine sugar and evaporated milk in heavy saucepan and stir over low heat until sugar is completely dissolved (don t boil). Add butter, salt and vanilla. Cook stirring constantly until mixture comes to a boil and bubbles gently. Remove from heat and stir in chocolate chips and candy bar until completely melted and mixture is shiny and smooth. Stir in marshmallow whip and walnuts (if using) and spread in buttered 8 x8 inch pan. Cut into small squares and let cool. Store at room temperature or in the refrigerator. Makes about 16 servings.

Beat eggs lightly and set aside. In a 1 quart saucepan whisk together milk and sugar. Stir in flour and mix well. Cook over medium heat until mixture starts to thicken. Remove from heat and add eggs. Continue whisking until pudding thickens. Add vanilla and butter and continue whisking until pudding thickens. Place in serving dish or bowls and refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight. Before serving top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream.

Combine all ingredients except the flour & eggs in a bowl. Whisk together the eggs & flour to make a thick batter. Pour the batter into the Instant Pot. Cook on high pressure for 12 minutes, then quick release pressure. Serve with syrup & fruit.

In a large saucepan bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the brussels sprouts and cook for about 5 minutes or until the brussels sprouts are bright green and crisp-tender. Drain the brussels sprouts and place them in the saucepan to cool. In a large nonstick skillet heat the butter over medium heat and stir in the blue cheese until melted and smooth. Remove from the heat and add the brussels sprouts, the milk, the mustard, salt, and pepper stirring to mix well. Divide the brussels sprouts among four ovenproof bowls or ramekins. Sprinkle each serving with the parmesan cheese. Bake the gratin for about 20 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown.

Pour cooking oil into skillet and add the garlic cloves. Saute until soft. Add tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add water, celery, bell peppers, onions, Creole seasoning, salt, pepper & chicken. Cook on low heat for about 1 hour. Taste & adjust seasoning if needed. Serve over cooked rice.

Cook escarole in boiling water until crisp-tender. Drain and set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet. Add onion and saute until tender. Add ground turkey and saute until browned. Add carrots and saute for 1 minute. Drain off any fat. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add escarole and heat through. Transfer 3 cups of soup to a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Return puree to the pot. Stir in eggs and breadcrumbs. Cook over low heat until mixture is thickened and heated through. Season with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Serve with grated parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350. Heat 1 tbsp oil in skillet and sprinkle 1 tbsp of each salt and pepper over pork chops. Add to skillet. Cook 3 minutes per side. Remove from heat and place chops in glass baking dish. In same skillet, saute pears in remaining oil for 3 minutes. Add butter and cook 1 minute longer. Place pears over pork chops. In small saucepan, combine water and cornstarch. Bring to a boil. Add green peppercorns and stir until thickened. Pour over pork and pears. Top with blue cheese crumbles. Bake 10 minutes or until pork is done.

In a large skillet heat oil and butter over medium heat. Add chicken thighs and cook for 5 minutes per side. Remove chicken and set aside. Add curry paste and turmeric and cook until fragrant. Add coconut milk and fish sauce and bring to a boil. Add chicken thighs back into the pan and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in lime juice and brown sugar. Serve over rice.

In a medium size bowl add the pudding mix to 1 cup milk. Whisk until smooth. Add the remaining 2 cups milk. Add the extract and stir well. Chill at least 3 hours or until thickened. Beat with whisk until frothy. Pour into glasses. Top with whipped topping or vanilla ice cream. Garnish with ground nutmeg and cinnamon. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven 350 degrees. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out the center. In a large bowl mix the potato pulp with the onions, green pepper, and bacon. Spoon mixture into the potato skins. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a large mixing bowl combine the mayonnaise and hard-boiled eggsmix well. Add the spinach and radishesmix well. Stir in the raisins and cheese. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. Serve with crackers or bread slices. Serves 4.

Bring 4 quarts of water to boiling in large pot. Add noodles and cook for 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain and rinse thoroughly under cold water. Drain. Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in garlic and crushed red pepper flakes and cook for about 30 seconds or until garlic is lightly browned. Add noodles and toss to coat. Stir in parmesan cheese and green onions. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately.

Cream shortening and sugar in bowl. Add molasses, egg and beat until smooth. Add baking soda and mix well. Add flour, ground ginger and cinnamon and stir until mixed. Divide dough into thirds and wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Remove dough from refrigerator and roll into balls and place on baking sheets that have been covered with parchment paper. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes and then lower heat to 350 degrees and bake for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool and store in airtight container. Makes approximately 8 dozen cookies

In a wok or large skillet, heat oil over high heat. Add vegetables and cook until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Add shrimp and pineapple and cook until pink and shrimp is opaque, about 5 minutes more. Add sauce and cook until thickened. Sprinkle with cornstarch and water mixture and stir until sauce thickens slightly, about 1 minute more. Serve over cooked rice.

Cut apples in half lengthwiseremove cores and place in a medium saucepan with juice, liqueur and sugar. Bring to a boilcover and reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until apples are tender, about 10 minutesstir occasionally. Combine flour, cinnamon and nutmeg in a bowladd melted butter, stirring well with a fork until a crumbly dough forms. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Pour apples into a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dishtop with crumbly dough. Bake 40 minutes or until topping is golden brown. Cool for 10 minutescut into 2 inch squares. Serve warm or cool.

Combine oatmeal and milk in saucepan. Bring to boil and simmer for 3 minutes. Add honey and almonds. Remove from heat. Beat cream with whisk until stiff. Fold into oatmeal mixture. Chill. Garnish with shaved almonds and honey. Drizzle with whiskey irish cream. Serve cold.
Using a food processor or blender, combine olive tapenade ingredients. Blend until smooth. Store in refrigerator. Serve as an appetizer spread on crusty bread.

Mix together the apricot jam and chipotle chili sauce. Place in a small saucepan over low heat. Cook until mixture is thickened to a glaze. Remove from heat. Slice tuna into 1/4" thick pieces. Drizzle with the glaze. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve with lime wedges. Garnish with a few lime wedges.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Coat a baking pan with cooking spray. Place fish on the pan. Spread breadcrumb mixture evenly over fish. Sprinkle with parsley and onion. Bake 10 minutes. Turn fish over and bake for 10 minutes longer. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cayenne. Drizzle with oil. Serve.

Cook pasta according to package directionsdrain. In 13x9-inch pan, combine pasta, cream cheese, cheddar cheese, milk, and garlicmix well. Spread evenly in pan. Top with tunasprinkle with parsley. Bake 25 minutes at 350 degrees f or until thoroughly heated.

Place prepared pizza dough on a lightly floured surface and roll or stretch into a 12 inch round. Spread with Bolognese sauce leaving a 1 inch border. Top with red capsicum, mushrooms and cheese. Bake for 10 minutes at 180c until the edges of the pizza are lightly browned and the cheese has melted. Allow the pizza to cool slightly before slicing.

Rinse nopalitos well. Mix first three ingredients in a large bowl. Set aside. In another bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold in flour mixture. Dip nopalitos into batter. Place in hot oil. Fry 3 or 4 at a time for 4 minutes. Remove with slotted spoon and place in paper towel. Sprinkle with salt to taste.

In a large stock pot or dutch oven over medium heat saut the carrots and celery in the oil until tender. Stir in the bouillon and cook until the liquid has evaporated. Add the almonds and water. Bring to a boil and then turn the heat down to a simmer. Cook until the carrots are tender. Use an immersion blender to puree the soup. If you do not have an immersion blender, use a regular blender. Blend until completely smooth. Add the cilantro and parsley and cook for 1-2 minutes. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Serve hot.

Place all vegetables and spices into a large pot and add enough water to just cover. Bring to boil and reduce to low heat. Simmer for 2-3 hours until vegetables are tender but not mushy. Remove bay leaf and spices and allow broth to cool slightly before using to avoid scalding. Use immediately or store covered in refrigerator up to 2 weeks or freeze up to 3 months.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add pasta. Cook according to package directions. Drain pasta. Mix pasta with remaining ingredients. Season with red wine vinegar, olive oil, sugar and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve.

Combine milk, egg and vanilla. Sift together biscuit mix and 1 cup of sugar. Add dry to milk mixture and stir until dough forms. Press into 9x13 inch pan. Bake in 350 degree oven for 10-12 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with 1/2 cup sugar. Cut pineapple rings into 1/2 inch pieces and arrange on top of sugar. Bake in 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes longer. Cool. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Rinse the baby carrots and cut into thirds. Cut the potatoes into wedges. Toss the potatoes and carrots together in a bowl with the olive oil. Roast for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and stir. Roast for another 20 minutes. Sprinkle with coarse salt and fresh ground black pepper. Serve hot.
Slice cabbage and onion thinly. Place cabbage in hot pan with butter. Let cook until softened. Add sweet onion and grape jelly. Cook until heated through. Add apples and serve.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Whisk together almond flour, baking powder and eggs in a bowl. Stir in cream and water. Add the melted butter and Splendastir just until moistened. Spray a 9-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. Pour in batter and bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven.

Make the dough: Combine flour, salt and sugar in food processor. Add butter and pulse until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. With motor running, add egg and process until dough just comes together. Flatten into disk and wrap tightly in plastic wrap. Chill for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 400f. In a large bowl, toss apples with lemon juice and zest, sugar and cinnamon. Turn out pastry onto a floured work surface and roll out to a 13-inch round. Transfer to a 9-inch pie pan. Place apple mixture in center, spread to edges. Fold edges over apple mixture and crimp. Cut a few slits in top crust. Brush top crust with egg and sprinkle with sugar. Bake until apples are tender and crust is golden brown, about 45 minutes. Serve warm with whipped cream.

Cut the deli meat into slices. In a bowl, toss together the lettuce and tomatoes. Add the tortillas to the bowl and toss to combine. Layer the tortillas with the meat, lettuce and tomato mixture, and cheese. Drizzle with salsa and guacamole and sprinkle with bacon bits. Serve with french onion dip for dipping.

Spread 1 tablespoon thousand island dressing over each bread slice. Top each slice with a strip of swiss cheese and a strip of corned beef. Top each sandwich with a tablespoon of sauerkraut. Bake at 350 for 8 to 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve hot.

In a shallow dish mix together flour, cumin, chili powder, salt and pepper. Beat egg white with a fork until frothy and set aside. Dip each fish fillet into flour mixture to coat both sides then into the egg white to coat both sides again. Place on a plate. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Carefully add fish to the pan in a single layer without crowding the pan. Cook until golden brown on each side about 2 to 3 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

Mix milk, cream cheese, egg, sugar. Add flour, mix well. Spoon mixture into pie crusts. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until set. Cool. Top with strawberries and jelly. Chill for 1 hour. Cut into wedges. Serves 12.

Peel the apples and cut in half lengthwise. Remove the cores. Place apples in a greased baking dish. Toss the apples in the honey mixture to coat evenly. Sprinkle the apples with raisins and bake uncovered at 400 degrees F for 30 minutes or until tender. Serve warm sprinkled with the cinnamon.

In a saucepan, bring water and salt to a boil. Add potatoes and cook for 15 minutes. Remove potatoes from water and allow to cool slightly. Peel potatoes and cut into small cubes. In a large bowl add potatoes and mayonnaise. Season with smoked paprika, onion, garlic powder and pepper to taste. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add red pepper flakes and cook for 1 minute. Add whole canned tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Add sugar and cook for 5 minutes. Add tomato sauce and cook for 10 minutes. Add wine and cook for 10 minutes. Add oregano and basil. Add pasta and cook for 10 minutes or until pasta is cooked. Toss the pasta with sauce until well mixed. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Cut fish fillet into pieces about 2 inches by 3 inches. Combine margarine, dill weed, onion and parsley in a small bowl. Rub mixture over fish fillet and sprinkle with paprika and salt and pepper. Wrap each piece of fish in foil, and place on a preheated grill for 5 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.
Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Bake in 9-inch square pan. Cool completely. Spread with frosting. Sprinkle with chopped heath candy bar. Store refrigerated.

In a heavy skillet over medium heat, melt the butter with the canola oil. Add the sole and saute for 2 minutes. Add the white wine, cover and cook for 3 minutes or until fish is cooked through. Add the lemon juice, salt and pepper and stir gently to combine. Top with the slivered almonds and serve immediately.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and place noodles in a large mixing bowl. Add peas, onion, bean sprouts, carrots and soy sauce. Add balsamic vinegar and fire oil and toss well. Toss again and add sesame oil and ginger. Refrigerate until serving time. Garnish with green onion. Serve immediately.

Place sweet potatoes in boiling water for 15-20 minutes until tender. Drain water, add egg whites & spices, mash & let cool. Spray cookie sheets & spoon mixture evenly onto cookie sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake for 25 minutes in preheated oven 350 degrees. Turn over, bake for additional 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool & enjoy!

Heat oil and butter over medium high heat. Season both sides of the chicken pieces with salt and pepper. Dust with flour and shake off the excess. Saute for a few minutes on each side until lightly browned. Add egg to the skillet. Saute until cooked through, about another 2 minutes per side. Divide the cheese over the top of each piece of chicken. Transfer to an ovenproof plate. Bake until the cheese melts, about 8 minutes.

In a large ziploc bag, mix oil, soy sauce, lemon juice, smoke flavoring, mustard, pepper, garlic powder. Add chicken to the bag. Close bag securely and turn to coat chicken evenly. Refrigerate chicken for 2 hours or longer to marinate. Preheat grill to medium high heat. Discard marinade. Grill chicken 12-15 minutes per side or until a thermometer reads 165 degrees. Remove chicken from grill to a plate to rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl combine flour, sugar and buttermix well. Add milk and mix just until moistenedstir in vanilla. Spoon over bottom of 2 quart casserole dish (I used an aluminum pie pan) spreading evenly with the back of a spoon. Arrange peach slices over the batter. Mix the cinnamon with the sugarsprinkle over the top of the cobbler. Bake for 25 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serves 6 to 8.
Combine all ingredients in a medium size bowl. Mix well. Chill 1 hour before serving.

Melt butter in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add flour. Cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add milk. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in cheeses. Add mustard and pepper. Pour over macaroni. Top with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered 30 minutes.

In a large bowl combine the berries, 1/2 cup of the sugar and lemon juice. Pour into the pie shell and bake for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan combine the remaining sugar and water. Bring to a boil and cook until the mixture is thick. Remove from heat and stir in the cornstarch. Let cool and pour over the raspberries. Bake for an additional 10 minutes. Serve warm with whipped topping.

Combine the black bean garlic sauce, rice vinegar, cornstarch, and water in a bowl. Stir to blend. Add more water if necessary to make the mixture thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the halibut fillets and cook for 4-5 minutes per side, or until the fish is cooked through. Drain the excess oil from the fish. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil to the pan. Add the ginger and scallions and cook for 30 seconds. Stir the black bean garlic mixture into the pan. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Stir in the cilantro. Serve the fish over the black bean garlic mixture.

Preheat grill. Blend turkey, applesauce, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, toasted sesame oil, gingerroot, garlic cloves, salt & freshly ground black pepper. Form into 4 patties. Grill 4-5 min. per side. Serve on toasted rolls with scallions, mayonnaise, lettuce & tomato. Makes 4.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add mushrooms. Saut until they are lightly browned. Add garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Add broth. Bring to a boil. Add tortellini. Cook until tortellini are tender. Add the remaining ingredients. Cook for 2 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

In food processor puree butter, garlic clove, mustard, and cheese until smooth. Spread on one side of the bread. Lay out the turkey slices on the cheese mixture. Cut into strips and roll up like an egg roll or jelly roll. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes or until lightly browned and heated through. Serve warm or at room temperature with tomato sauce or tomato slices as desired.

Place halibut fillets in shallow glass baking dish or zip-top plastic bag. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over halibut. Turn to coat fish with marinade. Let stand at room temperature for 15 minutes. Turn halibut fillets over and let marinate 15 minutes longer. Preheat grill to medium-high heat or preheat broiler. Grill halibut 8-10 minutes on each side or broil 4-5 inches from heat until fish flakes easily with fork, about 5 minutes per side. Serve with picante cilantro mayo. Yields 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease two 9-inch round cake pans. In a large bowl combine cake mix and eggs. Beat at low speed until moistened. Beat at medium speed for 2 minutes. Stir in oil. Spread evenly in pans. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool 15 minutes. In a large bowl beat cream cheese until fluffy. Beat in pudding mix. Stir in milk. Spread between layers and sides of cake. Spread top and sides of cake with Cool Whip. Garnish with crushed pineapple. Chill 1 hour. Sprinkle with coconut.

Preheat the oven to 400f. Wash and trim the beets and place them on a baking tray lined with aluminum foil. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast in the oven for 40-45 minutes or until tender. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Once cool, slice the beets into 1/4-inch-thick rounds. In a medium bowl, whisk together the vinegar and 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. In a food processor or blender, process the garlic with the cilantro and chives. Add the dressing and 1 tablespoon of the parsley and process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper and set aside. Toss the beets with the dressing. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve at room temperature.

Prepare bread pan by greasing it with shortening or oil and flouring it lightly. In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar and yeast until they are well blended. Stir in the milk and water, then add the salt and the shortening or oil. Stir in the cornmeal and beat well for 2 minutes at medium speed of an electric mixer. Pour the batter into the bread pan and place the pan in the warm place for 25 to 30 minutes or until it is light and doubled in bulk. Bake in 350f oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped. Cool in pan for 10 minutes and then turn out onto a wire rack to finish cooling. Makes 1 loaf.
Peel and dice fennel bulb and apples. Toss in bowl with vinegar, oil, garlic and caraway. Season with pepper and salt to taste. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

Combine butter, syrup and sugar in small saucepan over medium heat until butter is melted. Stir in oats. Add flour and coconutstir until well combined. Drop by level teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 400 for 12 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring once. Cool completely. Store tightly covered at room temperature. Yield 120 cookies.

Slice the bread into 1/2 inch thick slices. In a shallow dish add the chips, eggs, milk, sugar, sherry wine and vanilla. Mix well. Dip bread into mixture to coat both sides. Place in a greased 9 inch square pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar before serving.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix all ingredients except oats and butter. Press into a greased 13x9-inch pan. Sprinkle top with oats and butter. Bake 15 minutes. Cool. Cut into bars.

Mix the pudding with the milk in a medium size mixing bowl. Mix the pie filling and the cooled whip in another medium size mixing bowl. Put 1/2 of the pie filling in the bottom of the pie crust then put the pudding over the pie filling. Top with the other 1/2 of the pie filling. Put in the fridge to set up. You can keep in the fridge for 2 days or you can freeze it for later. If you do freeze it you can leave it for a month in the freezer or longer if you have an extra freezer to keep it in.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine potatoes, olive oil, garlic cloves, mayonnaise, mustard, parsley, scallions and lemon juiceseason with salt and pepper. Transfer to a greased 1-quart baking dish. Bake at 400 for 25 minutes or until potatoes are tender and browned on top. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat the grill to medium heat. Clean mushroom caps with water, or scrub if you prefer, but leave them uncut. Brush the mushrooms with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper on both sides. Cook on both sides until tender. Remove from grill and let cool slightly. Slice mushrooms into thin slices and set aside. Cut tomatoes into thin slices or bite sized pieces, depending on how you like them. Spread mozzarella cheese onto slices of mushrooms. Top mushroom slices with sliced tomatoes and basil. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a 9 x 13 pan with foil and spray lightly with pam. Mix together whole wheat flour, oatmeal, brown sugar, and salt. Stir in baking soda, apple pie spice, apples, eggs, honey, and vegetable oil. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until the center is set. Cool completely on a rack before cutting into 12 bars. Cut in half diagonally to make 24 squares. Store in an airtight container. You may freeze these bars as well. Makes about 24 bars.

Preheat oven to 425. Place a pie crust in a deep dish pie plate. Cook potatoes in boiling water 10 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool. Place potatoes in a bowl with soup and beat until smooth. Mix in the rest of the ingredients. Pour into pie crust. Cover with remaining crust. Crimp edges and prick several holes in the top to allow steam to escape. Bake 20 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the spaghetti according to directions. Cook the chicken according to directions. Mix italian salad dressing and olive oil together. Put spaghetti in a large bowl. Top with tomatoes and chicken. Pour dressing over. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

Mix together soy sauce, sugar, cooking sherry and sesame oil. Marinate the beef for 10 hours in the mixture in the refrigerator. Preheat oven to 325f. Place marinated beef in a baking dish and cook for 1 hour. Drizzle a little sesame oil over top. Serve with green onions and bell peppers.

Dissolve lime jello gelatin in boiling wateradd ice cubes and cool for 20 minutes. In a mixing bowl beat cream cheese until smoothgradually add jello gelatin mixmix well. Blend in remaining ingredientspour into a 9x13x2 inch panrefrigerate until firmly set. Cut into small piecesgarnish with whipped cream and a cherry.
Preheat oven to 325. Mix together all ingredients except for pecans. Add the pecans to the mixture. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 45 to 60 minutes. Cool before cutting.

Mix first 4 ingredients in the bottom of the pressure cooker. Add chicken. Place the top on the pressure cooker. Lock in place. Bring to pressure and let cook for 20 minutes. After the pressure is released, remove the chicken from the pot. Shred the chicken. Put the shredded chicken back into the cooker. Mix together the raspberry jam, soy sauce, dijon mustard, and garlic. Add to the pot along with the orange zest. Lock the pressure cooker in place. Bring to pressure and let cook for 10 minutes. After the pressure is released, stir the chicken and sauce. Serve.

Place the cherry tomatoes in a blender or food processor and pulse until smooth. Add the eggs and egg yolk and whisk until well combined. In a large saucepan bring the milk and whipping cream to a simmer over medium heat. Add the cornstarch and whisk until dissolved. Whisk the egg mixture into the milk mixture. Stir in the nutmeg and cook over medium heat until thickened and just starting to bubble around the edges of the pan. Remove from the heat and add the chorizo sausage. Stir until well combined. Pour the mixture into an 8x8 pan and sprinkle the top with the parsley. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until lightly golden on top. Serve warm.

Beat egg and egg white together in a large bowl. Mix in cottage cheese and cream cheese. Mix in powdered milk. Add sugar substitute and beat until well blended. Beat in the vanilla. Pour into the graham cracker crust. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until the center is set. Cool on a wire rack. Spread the pie filling over the top. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.
Blend cheese with butter in food processor until smooth. Add port wine. Blend until smooth. Transfer to bowl. Add pepper and nuts. Stir to combine. Makes 1/2 cup. Serve with crackers.

In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the dough hook, combine yeast and water. Let stand until yeast is dissolved. Add flour, oats, sugar, salt and butter. Beat at medium speed until combined. Add buttermilk. Beat at medium speed for 5 minutes. Place dough into an oiled bowl. Turn to coat top of dough. Cover bowl with plastic wrap. Let rise until doubled. Punch down dough. Shape into a loaf. Place loaf into greased loaf pan. Cover with plastic wrap. Let rise until doubled. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely.

Place top sirloin steaks on a baking sheet. In a small bowl combine garlic, olive oil, worcestershire sauce, cider vinegar, sherry wine, brown sugar and thyme. Using a brush or spoon, brush steaks all over and rub on both sides. Sprinkle with pepper and salt. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Preheat grill or broiler. Cook steaks 4 to 5 minutes each side for medium doneness. Do not over cook. Serve immediately.

Preheat grill to 450 degrees F. On a small plate mix together all spices except black pepper. In another small plate mix together olive oil and Worcestershire sauce. Brush oil-and-sauce mixture on both sides of each chop. Rub both sides of each chop with seasoning mixture. Place chops on grill over mesquite chips. Grill chops for 3 to 4 minutes per side for medium-rare doneness. Remove chops from grill and let rest for 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.In a large bowl, cream together the butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, and salt until smooth. Beat in the flour, baking soda, and cocoa powder until smooth. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop tablespoonfuls of the cookie dough onto the prepared baking sheets.Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove the cookies from the oven and allow to cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.Store the cookies in airtight containers.

Cook pasta according to package directions. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the vegetables by slicing the summer squash and red peppers. Drain the pasta. Rinse the peas. Add the squash, red pepper, peas, olives, tomatoes, red onion, and fresh oregano to the pasta. Add the dressing. Toss until well coated. Garnish with shredded Cheddar cheese. Serves 6-8.

Mix together the first six ingredients until smooth. Pour into unbaked pie shell and bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Beat the egg and light corn syrup together and pour over the hot pie. Sprinkle with pecans and bake for 15 more minutes. Cool completely before serving.

In a medium skillet, add canola oil and heat to high. Cut cabbage in half and add to oil. Cook 2 minutes or until bright green. Drain excess liquid from cabbage and set aside. In a small bowl, combine ginger, cinnamon, and cloves. In a small skillet, heat canola oil to medium high. Add apple to skillet and fry for 1 minute or until lightly browned. Remove apples from pan. Cut apples in half lengthwise and remove core. Toss apple halves with ginger mixture and add to cabbage mixture. In a small saucepan, add maple syrup, vinegar, and cider vinegar. Bring to a simmer and pour over cabbage mixture. Mix well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with pumpkin seeds. Serve warm or chilled.

Line a 13 x 9 baking pan with aluminum foil. Melt caramels and milk in a saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heat. Stir in nuts and chips until well coated. Pour into foil lined pan. Let set. Cut into squares.

Brown frankfurter in a skillet. Add soup and milk, bring to a boil. Pour into greased 1-1/2 quart casserole. Add mustard and caraway seed to taste. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Mix jello and creamer well. Add boiling water until just dissolved. Add cold water and stir until fully dissolved. Pour into cups or molds. Chill at least 1 hour before serving.
Mix all ingredients together and rub on meat. Let stand for 1-2 hours. Can be stored in a tightly sealed container for up to 2 months.

Spread both sides of bread with butter. Spread each with 1 tablespoon spicy mustard. Top one piece of bread with 1/4 pound sliced corned beef, 1/4 pound sliced fontina cheese and 1/4 sliced pickles. Top with other piece of bread. Wrap sandwich in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour. Preheat a griddle or large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Place sandwich on griddle.
