Let it sit for 30 minutes or so while you heat your oil to 350 degrees F in a large frying pan or deep fryer. Dip your fillets in batter and fry for 5 minutes or until brown and flaky. Remove from oil, place on paper towel lined plate or platter. Sprinkle with old bay seasoning before serving. Enjoy your fried perch with a nice salad or french fries and your favorite tarter sauce.

To prepare the starter, put the milk in a jar or container and add the active starter. Cover the jar and let it sit for several hours or overnight until it is very frothy. Stir the pancake mix into the milk-starter mixture until you have a smooth batter. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium high heat and drop spoonfuls of batter into the pan. Flip the pancakes when the edges are lightly brown. Drizzle the pancakes with syrup or honey before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine brown sugar, vanilla, egg and beat until smooth. Add flour, baking soda and salt. Add nuts. Drop by teaspoon fulls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8 to 10 minutes. Do not brown. Remove from cookie sheet immediately. Cool completely. Makes about 1 1/2 dozen.

Drizzle pork chops on both sides with honey. Coat chops evenly with lemon juice and soy sauce. Press garlic clove onto each pork chop. Let stand at room temperature for about 15 minutes. Preheat broiler. Place pork chops in a shallow baking dish or baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Broil for about 6 minutes or until a thermometer inserted in the thickest part of pork chop reads 155 to 160 degrees f. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400. Cut squash into 1/2 inch slices. Toss with garlic cloves and oil. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Bake until tender when pierced with a fork, about 25 minutes. Sprinkle with gomashio.

Mix mayonnaise and honey mustard together. Mix in turkey and celery. Season with pepper to taste. Fill phyllo cups with turkey mixture. Top with cranberries. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until heated through. Top with cheese and nuts. Serve warm.

Prepare an ice ring by pouring boiling water over lemon balm leaves, strain the liquid into a bowl and set aside for at least half an hour. Put the lemon balm liquid and sugar into a saucepan and heat until the sugar dissolves. Let cool then pour into glasses and top up with chilled water and ice. Garnish with lemon balm leaves or flowers.

Cut off top of tomatoes to make them stand up. Set tomatoes aside. Place remaining salsa ingredients in blender. Puree until smooth. Pour mixture into tomatoes. Bake for 1 hour at 300. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour 12 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. In a medium bowl combine breadcrumbs and 2 tablespoons butter. Add sugar, cinnamon and apple. Mix well. Divide mixture evenly among prepared cups. Bake 12 minutes or until golden. In a small bowl combine brown sugar and lemon juice. Brush over warm apples. Cool. Combine remaining 1 tablespoon butter, cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Spread on cooled apples. Serve.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, milk and light corn syrup. Stirring occasionally until boiling. Add pumpkin and stir until smooth. Add salt, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla and butter. Reduce heat to low. Stir until butter is melted. Remove from heat. Add nuts. Stir until well combined. Pour mixture into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Cool and cut into 16 bars.

Cut each breast half in half. Combine the barbecue sauce and mustard in a small bowl. Spray a cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Place the chicken halves on the cookie sheet. Brush each half with half of the barbecue sauce mixture. Top with half of the bacon and half of the cheese. Bake in a 350 degree f oven for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink and the bacon is crisp. Sprinkle with scallions and tomatoes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Bake pie crust for 6 to 8 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. In a medium bowl, beat together the eggs and milk until well blended. Add the green onion, salt and pepper, nutmeg and flour. Blend together well. Add the zucchini and cheese. Pour into cooled pie shell. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes or until set. Let cool before cutting into wedges to serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Beat together butter and vanilla until creamy. Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time beating until blended. Mix in flour mixture. Spread batter in baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and stir in chocolate chips and pecans. Spread evenly over batter. Sprinkle with additional chocolate chips. Bake an additional 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Cut into bars.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add mushrooms and cook until softened. Remove from heat and cool slightly. In a medium bowl, mix gouda with breadcrumbs and parsley. Stir in almonds and sun-dried tomatoes. Fill each mushroom with mixture. Garnish with chives and serve.

Combine onion and butter and saute over medium heat until onion is clear and tender. Cool onion mixture and then combine with beaten eggs. Blend in cheese and cream, then season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour into unbaked pie shells and top with sliced chives. Bake at 400 degrees until set or about 40 minutes. Cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease 2 (9-inch) loaf pans. In a large bowl, beat together sugar and butter until light. Add banana and vanillabeat until smooth. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Beat in soda. In a small bowl, stir together the buttermilk and baking soda. Alternately add flour and buttermilk mixture to batter until combined. Fold in walnuts. Divide batter between the pans. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bread comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pancool completely. Wrap in foilstore at room temperature up to 3 days or freeze up to 2 months. Makes 2 loaves.

In a large bowl, combine cream cheese and butter and blend well. Beat in the pumpkin and the spices until smooth. Gradually add the sugar and beat until smooth. Spread into a baking dish. In a medium bowl, combine the gingersnap crumbs and melted butter. Spread over the top of the dip. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes or until dip is set.

Combine butter, sugar and pecans in food processor or blender until finely ground. Press mixture into ungreased 9-inch pie plate. Bake at 375 for 8 minutes or until lightly browned. Beat powdered sugar, milk and extract until smoothspread over crust. Bake for 3-5 minutes or until glaze is set. Cool completely on wire rack. Cut into wedges.

In a large bowl combine garlic, rosemary, salt, pepper and red wine. Add lamb to bowl and toss to coat. Place in slow cooker. Cover and cook on high for 4 hours. Add potatoes and olives. Cover and continue cooking on high for 1 hour or until potatoes are done. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Spray 8-inch nonstick skillet with cooking spray. In skillet, beat eggs, water, salt, pepper and milk until well blended. Heat over medium heat until thickened, stirring constantly. Turn heat to low. Sprinkle 1/3 of beans on half of egg mixture. Top with 1/3 of cheese. Spread 1/3 of salsa over cheese. Sprinkle with remaining 1/3 of cheese. Top with remaining 1/3 of beans. Top with remaining 1/3 of salsa. Spread remaining egg mixture over salsa. Sprinkle with remaining 1/3 of cheese. Bake at 425 for 10 minutes or until center is set. Cut into wedges. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Heat the oil over medium heat in a large stock pot. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add the onions & saute for about 5 minutes. Add the peppers and continue to cook until the onions are translucent. Add the tomatoes & simmer for another 5 minutes. Add the beef stock & bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from the heat. Mash up the bread & add to the soup. Add the salt & pepper. Serve hot.

Place kielbasa in bottom of slow cooker. Add pineapple chunks and pineapple juice. Mix cornstarch, lemon juice, and brown sugar in a small bowl until smooth and pour over meat and fruit mixture. Add onion and green pepper. Cook on high setting for 4 hours or on low setting for 6 hours. Add maraschino cherries and serve.

Cook rice according to package directions. In 2-quart saucepan, combine rice, soup mix and water. Heat to boiling. Stir in pork chops. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve with vegetable or salad.

Mix stuffing mix and hot water in bowl. Line pie pan with pastry and pour in stuffing mixture. Cook for 40 minutes at 350 degrees. Remove from oven and add turkey and gravy and mix together. Return to oven and continue cooking for 15 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with fresh fruit or salad.

Cook ground beef in fry pan until browned. Break up into smaller pieces as it cooks. Brown sausage in same pan. Remove from pan and set aside. Add onions to pan, saute until translucent. Add tomato paste and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes, basil, oregano, crushed red pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Simmer sauce for 20-30 minutes. Add meat back in and stir well to combine.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until they are very tender. Drainreturn them to the pot with enough cold skim milk to cover them by an inch or so. Let them soak for at least 30 minutes. Drain potatoes and place them in a food processor fitted with the steel blade. Pulse to mash themcontinue pulsing while gradually adding the garlic and shallot until they are completely incorporated. Transfer potatoes to a large bowladd tuna and mix well. Season with vinegar, oil, and dill.

Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Stir together condensed soup and milk until smooth. Stir in chicken, vegetables and thyme. Spread into baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees f for 25 to 30 minutes or until heated through. Top with biscuits. Bake 5 to 7 minutes or until golden. Sprinkle with pepper. Serve with additional soup and biscuits.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet. Combine oats, pecans, apple pie spice, cranberries, blueberries, cherries, and egg whites in a large bowl. Stir in applesauce, honey, and vanilla extractmix until combined. Spread mixture onto prepared baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven until toasted, about 30 minutes. Store in an airtight container.

Beat eggs and brown sugar until light and frothy. Beat in flour, cinnamon and salt. Chop walnuts and add to batter. Turn into greased and floured tube pan. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Cool slightly and remove from pan. Drizzle with creamy fudge topping and sprinkle with additional chopped walnuts if desired. Store in fridge.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking pan. Combine graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press crumbs evenly onto bottom of pan. Combine sweetened condensed milk with chocolate chips. Spread evenly over crust. Combine peanut butter chips and sweetened condensed milk. Drop by teaspoons on top of chocolate layer. Bake 30 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into bars.

Heat tortillas in microwave just until they are soft. Spread each tortilla with black beans. Sprinkle with cheese. Heat in microwave until cheese is melted. Top each quesadilla with salsa. Serve warm.

In a large skillet heat the oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add the onions and peppers, cover and cook over low heat for 1 hour or until softened and very dark brown. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly. Remove the garlic cloves from the skillet, discard the skins. In a food processor with the motor running, slowly add the vegetables. Process until smooth. Transfer the confit to a bowl and stir in the white pepper and salt to taste. Store the confit in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week or in the freezer for up to three months. Use this condiment as a spread for sandwiches or as a dip for chips or vegetable sticks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly spray a 12x8x2-inch baking pan with cooking spray and set aside. Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Whisk to combine and set aside. Cream the brown sugar and light butter in a large mixer bowl until light and fluffy. Add the egg whites and vanilla extract and beat until well combined. Add the flour mixture to the creamed mixture and beat on low just until combined. Pour batter into prepared pan and spread evenly. Sprinkle with mini chocolate chips and bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes or until the top springs back when lightly touched. Remove from oven and let cool in pan for 10 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to let cool completely. Cut into 12 bars.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray a 9x13 pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl, mix together cake mix, margarine and eggs. Spread evenly in the 9x13 pan. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes. Allow to cool completely. Beat together chocolate frosting and powdered sugar. Spread on top of cake. Cut into squares.

Whisk together the rice flour, guar gum, sugar, and salt in a bowlset aside. Beat together the eggs, butter, and milk in another bowlstir in the cinnamon. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredientsmix until just combined. Heat your waffle iron and spray with Pam, or butter if you’re like me. Pour about 1/3 cup of batter into the waffle ironcook until the iron tells you it’s done! Flip waffle overrepeat with the remaining batter. Serve with your favorite fruit topping!

Combine 1 cup water and 1 cup vodka in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 30 minutes. Turn off heat and add 1/2 cup white sugar. Let steep overnight. Pour into a container and add blackberries. Let steep for at least a week before drinking. Strain out the blackberries and store in a refrigerator until ready to use.

Mix all ingredients together except oil in bowl until well blended. Spoon batter into greased 10-inch square pan or 12-muffin pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 12 muffins or 1 loaf.

Mix sugar, cocoa and butter in a sauce pan. Add milk and mix well. Cook over low heat until smooth. Add oats and mix well. Cook 3 minutes. Add peanut butter and vanilla. Mix well and pour into an 8 by 12 pan. Cool and cut into squares.
Mix dry ingredients. Mix together creamed corn and eggs. Stir the two together. Add the oil and the sour cream. Bake 600 degrees for 25 minutes.

Combine cream cheese, yogurt, orange zest and powdered sugar. Beat until smooth. Fold in chocolate. Spread on bottom of 8 inch square baking dish. Top with cookies. Spread fruit on top. Refrigerate to set. Garnish with whipped cream to serve.

Boil the crabs for about 15 minutes. Cool them off. Open the shells of the crabs. Cut the bulb of garlic. Squeeze the lemon. Add the onion, butter, garlic, salt, chili pepper flakes. Cook for about 4-5 minutes. Add the crabs and parsley. Stir for 1 minute. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silpat.In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugars together. Beat in egg and vanilla. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. Stir into butter mixture until well blended.Stir in oats and chocolate. Chill dough 1 hour. Roll into 1 inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on prepared baking sheets. Bake 10 minutes. Cool on pans 10 minutes. Remove to wire racks to cool completely.
Combine all of the ingredients in a large pot over medium heat. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Simmer for 20 minutes. Strain the mixture through a fine mesh sieve. Cool. Bottle.

Soak carrots and cabbage in icy water for 20 minutes, then drain and squeeze dry. Toss cabbage and carrots with onion and mayonnaise, vinegar and mustard. Add salt and pepper to taste and mix well. Serve with pasta and chicken breast.

Cook quinoa according to package directions. Add tomatoes during last 5 minutes of cooking time. In a small bowl combine tomatoes, olives, cheese, pine nuts, and basil. Toss together with quinoa. Serve warm.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook potatoes until just fork-tender. Drain and let cool. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion flakes and cook until softened. Add the remaining ingredients except the hot dogs. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a greased 9-inch pie plate, layer the potatoes and hot dogs in alternating layers, ending with the potatoes on top. Pour the sauerkraut mixture over top of potatoes. Sprinkle with black pepper to taste. Bake for 45 minutes or until potatoes are cooked through and sauerkraut is bubbly.

Cut the block of extra firm tofu into 1 inch cubes and set aside. In a large saute pan heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil over medium high heat. Add the cubed tofu and fry until browned on all sides. Add the green onions and fry for another minute or two. Add the vegetable stock and soy sauce. Cook for about 10 minutes stirring frequently. Add the garlic, jalapeno peppers and the remaining tablespoon of peanut oil. Stir for another minute or two. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Serve over rice.

In a small bowl, mix brown sugar, apple juice, soy sauce and ginger. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Combine cornstarch and water in a small bowl and stir until smooth. Dip pork chops into mixture and place into skillet. Cook for 3 minutes on each side or until done. Brush pork chops with glaze and continue cooking until glaze is caramelized. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degree f. In a large mixing bowl combine applesauce and sugar. Stir in vanilla and melted chocolate. Combine flour, cocoa and baking powder and soda. Add to applesauce mixture and stir just until moistened. Spread half of the batter in an 8 inch square pan. Arrange blueberries in rows and cover with remaining batter. Bake for 40 minutes or until top is dry and set. Cool completely. Cut into 18 squares. Drizzle each square with glaze and sprinkle with walnuts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a medium bowl combine walnuts, coffee liqueur and brown sugar. Toss to combine well. Spread the walnut mixture over the brie, cover and bake for 15 minutes, or until walnut mixture is bubbling. Serve warm or at room temperature with crackers and fresh sliced pear.

Slice 2 loaves bread about 1/2 inch thick. Combine eggs, half-and-half, sugar and nutmeg in bowl. Dip bread in egg mixture. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Place bread in skillet. Cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side until toast is golden brown. Remove from heat. Spread 1 tablespoon cream cheese on toast. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon sugar. Roll up. Arrange in baking dish. Beat remaining cream cheese with 2 cups half-and-half until blended. Stir in vanilla. Pour cream cheese mixture over toast. Bake in 350f oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Serve warm.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot and cook the pasta according to the package directions until tender, stirring occasionally. Meanwhile, cook sausage in a large skillet over medium-high heat until it starts to brown on the outside and is no longer pink in the middle, about 6 minutesset aside. Drain the pasta and set aside in a large bowl. Add the sausage, sweet pepper, and broth to the bowl and toss until well combined. Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

Rinse the green beans under running water. Pat dry with paper towels. Peel the garlic cloves. In a large bowl, combine the beans, onion, garlic, mint leaves, lemon juice and zest, dijon mustard, olive oil, sour cream, tabasco sauce, salt and black pepper. Toss to combine. Cover the bowl and refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. Serves 4.
Use to spice any food that has been cooked in oil or ghee. Used especially for lamb or meat. Store in a tightly sealed jar. This recipe is for 1/2 cup.

In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium-low heat until crisp. Remove bacon and drain on paper towels. Add onion to the skillet and cook over medium-low heat until soft and golden. Add green cabbage and caraway seeds. Cook and stir until cabbage is tender-crisp. Add beer and bring to a boil. Simmer until most of the liquid has evaporated, about 10 minutes. Season with mustard, sugar and salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl and stir in bacon. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan of boiling water, cook rice for about 20 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter in a saucepan and saute onion until tender, about 10 minutes. Add bay leaf and cayenne, then cook for about 2 minutes more. Add lemon zest, juice and lemon peel. Pour rice into the skillet and stir to combine. Cover and set aside for about 15 minutes. Add salt and stir well to combine. Serves 4.

Pound fish to 1/2 inch thickness with a mallet or rolling pin. Combine five-spice powder, soy sauce, brown sugar, and oil in a shallow bowl, whisking until smooth. Add fishturn to coat evenly. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or overnight. Drain fishsprinkle with scallions and serve with rice.

Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Remove from skillet and place in paper bag. Drain bacon fat from skillet and set aside. Combine first six ingredients and set aside. Cut chicken breast halves in half crosswise and place in skillet. Cover and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes or until done and juices run clear. Combine sauce and reserved bacon fat and pour over chicken. Sprinkle with cheese and top with reserved bacon. Serve over rice or noodles.

Place potatoes in crock pot. Sprinkle with ham. Add onions. In a bowl, combine soup and water. Pour over potatoes. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours or until potatoes are tender. Stir in cheese. Serve immediately.
Mix together dry ingredients in a bowl, then mix in oil and yogurt. Fold in banana and stir only until combined. Spoon into greased muffin cups and bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes. Makes 12.

In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the rice with the chicken broth and wine. Bring just to a boil and then reduce the heat and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the rosemary and parmesan cheese and cook for another minute or two or until the rice is tender and the cheese is thoroughly melted and absorbed into the rice. Season with salt and pepper as desired.

Combine rhubarb, water and gelatin in a saucepan. Cook over low heat until gelatin dissolves. Add sugar. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir 1 minute. Remove from heat. Cool slightly. Stir in strawberries. Pour into 9x13 inch pan. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. Cut into 1 inch cubes. Serve in dishes. Top with whipped cream and ice cream. Store any remaining dessert in the refrigerator.

Cut apples into wedges. Place in a large bowl and toss with brown sugar and spices. Mix flour and oats in a small bowl. Melt butter in a skillet over low heat. Add peanut butter and stir until melted. Pour over apples and toss. Spread into a lightly greased 13-by-9-inch (3-quart) baking dish. Top with crumble. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. Cool.

In a large pot over medium heat, melt butter. Add onions and saute for about 30 minutes until golden brown and soft. Add beef broth, water, sherry, worcestershire sauce and thyme. Simmer 30 minutes or until reduced by half. Divide onions between four bowls and top each with 2 slices of mozzarella cheese. Broil in oven until cheese has melted. Serve with croutons.

In a large Dutch oven or pot, cook egg noodles according to package directions. Drain, reserving 1/4 cup of the liquid. In a separate skillet, melt butter. In a large bowl, mix noodles, reserved liquid from noodles, soup base, chicken broth, milk, onion and celery. In a 3-quart casserole dish, layer half of the noodle mixture. Layer chicken on top. Top with remaining noodle mixture. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Serves 8.

Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and place in large serving dish. In a skillet heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add salami and cook until heated through. Remove with slotted spoon to pasta. Drizzle with ketchup and sprinkle with cheese.
Combine cream cheese and cookies until crumbly. Shape into small balls. Dip balls in melted chocolate. Top with decorating icing, such as white icing.

In a large bowl, whisk together eggs and milk until smooth. Stir in vanilla extract. In a second large bowl, mix together flour, salt and baking powder. Slowly add flour mixture to egg mixture and stir to make a smooth batter. Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat and add 1 tablespoon of butter to the pan. Dip each slice of thick bread into the batter coating both sides of the bread and place it into the pan. Cook for 2 minutes on each side, or until golden brown. Serve with maple syrup and powdered sugar if desired.

Preheat the oven to 200C. Sift flour, caster sugar, salt into a bowl. Add milk and cream. Stir until just combined. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Roll out 1cm thick. Cut with a 5.5cm cutter. Brush with milk and place on a baking tray. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce to 180C. Brush with milk again. Bake for a further 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. To make the jam, place mangoes, white sugar and 2 tablespoons water into a saucepan. Cover with a lid. Simmer for 20-30 minutes until mangoes are very soft. Puree until smooth. Strain through a sieve to remove seeds. Place jam back into saucepan. Stir over a low heat until jam thickens. Add lemon juice. Transfer to a sterilised jar. To serve, spread jam on scones. Serve warm.

In a sauté pan, saute the onions & tomatoes in 3 tbsp olive oil until softened & translucent. Set aside to cool. Place the cooked rice & buckwheat flour into a mixing bowl. Add the tomato mixture & enough water to form a dough. Knead until combined & smooth. Place the dough back into the sauté pan & cook for a few minutes until firm to the touch & no longer sticky. Remove from pan & cut into slices to serve.

Cook rice in broth according to package directions. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heatadd garlic, parsley and cook 30 seconds. Stir in rice and cook 2 minutes. Remove from heatstir in eggs and 1/2 cup parmesan cheese until combined. Cool slightly. Divide into 12 equal portions. Shape each portion into a ballplace on a baking sheet. Melt butterbrush over rice balls. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup parmesan cheesebake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
Place asparagus in a baking dish. Top with bacon and balsamic vinegar. Cook in a 350 degree F oven for 15-20 minutes. Remove from the oven and drizzle with the glaze. Serve immediately.
Combine olive oil, onion and garlic in a saute pan. Add broccoli and cook until tender. Sprinkle with pepper and cheese. Serve warm.

Heat butter in a 9-inch non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add eggs and cheese. Sprinkle with pepper and cook until just set. Turn and cook other side to just set. Remove from heat and cut into wedges. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven 180c Grease and line the base of an 18cm loose bottomed round cake tin. Beat together the ground almonds, eggs and sugar. Fold in the flour and baking powder with a spatula. Spoon the mixture into the cake tin. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until cooked through. Allow the cake to cool in the tin for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack. Spread the mango puree over the top of the cooled cake. Leave the cake to set for 30 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine the butter, sugar and flour. Add the baking powder and mix well. Press into a 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. In a large bowl combine the pudding mix and milk. Add the eggs and stir well. Pour over the cooled crust. Bake for 25 minutes or until set. Cool. In a small bowl combine the syrup and powdered sugar. Drizzle over the cooled torte. Garnish with whipped cream if desired.

In a food processor, combine garbanzo beans with garlic, chili, cilantro, lime juice, olive oil, and salt. Process until smooth. Add parsley and process until blended. Transfer to a serving bowl. Cover and chill 1 hour or overnight. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 400. Spread pita breads with olive oil. Sprinkle with garlic. Bake until pita breads are crisp, 6-8 minutes. Serve with hummus.

Heat oven to 425f. Butter one side of each piece of bread. Layer one piece of bread buttered side down on baking sheet. Place thinly sliced onions on top of bread. Drizzle the onions with olive oil or vegetable oil. Sprinkle lightly with brown sugar. Place another piece of bread buttered side up over top of slices of onion. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Spread one side of the bread with stone ground mustard. Top mustard side of bread with slices of cheese. Place sandwich back in oven until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

In a 3-quart saucepan melt the butter. Add the onion, garlic cloves, tomatoes and saute for 10 minutes. Add the cream. Simmer for 5 minutes. Season with the basil, salt and pepper. Arrange the salmon fillets on a greased baking sheet. Spoon the tomato mixture over the salmon. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Mix brown sugar and oil. Add eggs and beat until light and fluffy. Add banana and beat. Add flour, baking powder and baking soda. Mix well. Roll out to 3/4 inch thickness. Use baby food jar as cutter. Bake in preheated oven for about 10 to 15 minutes. Do not over bake. Cool on racks. Yields about 60 teething biscuits.

Preheat barbeque. Brush the scallops lightly with olive oil. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Thread the scallops with the bay leaves and lemon slices. Place the skewers in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over the scallops. Marinate 4 hours or overnight. Turn the skewers to make sure all the scallops are coated with marinade. Brush the scallops with marinade. Barbeque 5 minutes per side or until the scallops are opaque. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, saute the onion, carrots, celery and garlic in the oil until tender over medium-low heat. Add the chili paste, water, soy sauce, lime juice and sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the carrots are soft (about 15 minutes). Mash the mixture slightly with a fork or puree it in a food processor or blender until smooth. Stir in the peanut butter until smooth. Serve hot or cold with toasted baguettes or bread cubes. Yields about 4 servings.

Combine couscous and 3 cups water in large bowl. Microwave 1 1/2 minutes. Stir. Microwave 3-5 minutes or until water has been absorbed. Stir in tomatoes, cucumber and garbanzo beans. Combine oil, lemon juice and garlic powder in small bowl. Mix into couscous mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Bring water to a boil, add tea bags and cook for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags and discard. Add vinegar and bring mixture to a boil, remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Stir in oil and dill. Store in refrigerator until ready to use. Will keep for several weeks. This can be used for salad dressings or marinades for meat.

In a large pot or kettle, combine 3 cups of popped popcorn with 1/2 cup butter. Stir over low heat until butter is melted. Stir in 1/2 cup honey and 2 cups sugar. Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Pour mixture into a lightly greased 15x10x1 inch jellyroll pan. Bake at 250 degrees for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes. Sprinkle evenly with roasted almonds. Cool completely. Makes 25 servings.

Cut the red peppers in half and remove seeds and white pith. Slice into strips. Blanch in boiling water for 20 seconds. Drain. Combine peppers and remaining ingredients. Chill. Serve with tortilla chips.

Drain chicken and shred. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and heat through. Add salsa and seasoning. Heat through. Heat tortillas and spread each with 1 tablespoon sour cream. Spoon about 1/2 cup enchilada mixture in center of each tortilla. Roll up and arrange seam side down in large casserole or baking dish. Spoon remaining sour cream over top. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 until cheese melts. Serve with salsa and sour cream.

Add milk and flour to a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk until smooth and add nutmeg and pepper. Add paprika to taste and stir well. Let simmer for about 5 minutes until sauce thickens and is smooth. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and serve over your favorite pasta. This sauce is great served over a spaghetti squash for a healthier alternative to pasta!

Rub the rabbits with the flour and salt and black pepper. In a frypan heat the oil until hot. Place the rabbits in the pan and brown them on all sides. Add the garlic clove. Add the olives. Sprinkle with the thyme leaves. Continue cooking until the rabbits are cooked through. Serve hot.

Cook beef over medium-high heat in medium skillet until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in rice, tomato soup, chilies and taco seasoning mixheat through. Spoon into 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Top with tomatoes and cheesebake at 400 for 15 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve with corn chips.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. In a small skillet, saute garlic and margarine until garlic is golden brown, about 2 minutes. Cool slightly and then add shrimp and wine. Saute until shrimp turn pink and wine reduces by half, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside. Thread shrimp and vegetables on skewers and sprinkle with parsley, peel and salt and pepper to taste. Grill over medium-high heat until shrimp turn pink and vegetables are tender about 4 minutes per side. Serve with lemon wedges and additional lemon peel for garnish.
Combine all ingredients in blender until smooth. Pour into pan coated with cooking spray. Cook over medium heat until bubbles appear. Flip over and cook other side until bubbles appear. Cool.

Crush cookies into fine crumbs. Put crumbs in a freezer safe container and freeze. Melt Kahlua in a microwave safe bowl. Mix in Cool Whip. Stir in milk. Pour over cookie crumbs. Put lid on container and freeze. When ready to serve remove from freezer and let thaw for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Coat two 9x5-inch loaf pans with cooking spray. In a bowl, combine the light brown sugar, eggs, pumpkin, salt, pumpkin pie spice, all-purpose flour, quick oats, and baking soda. In another bowl, combine the butter, egg whites, milk, and vanillastir into the pumpkin mixture just until moistened. Pour into the prepared pans. Bake for 55 to 60 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to cool completely on wire racks. To freeze bread: wrap each loaf tightly in plastic wrapplace in zip-top plastic bagslabel and freeze up to 3 months. Thaw at room temperature before serving. Makes 2 loaves.

Preheat oven to 350f. In medium bowl combine first 5 ingredients with electric mixer on low speed until well blended. Add eggs and vanilla and beat until light and fluffy. In small bowl combine flour and baking soda and saltstir well with fork. Add flour mixture and peanut butter chips to peanut butter mixture and stir with fork until well combined. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 9 to 11 minutes or until edges are light brown and centers are set. Cool on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 400f. Mix all together in a large bowl with a wooden spoon. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto greased baking sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and brush with melted butter. Serve hot or cold.
In a large bowl combine pasta, tomatoes, zucchini, bell pepper, onion and chicken. Pour pesto over the top and toss until evenly coated. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 1 day.

In a large bowl melt margerine and add vanilla and rice krispies stirring to combine. Press mixture into a baking sheet and bake until hardened about 40 minutes. While cereal treats are baking melt chocolate chips in a double boiler or in the microwave in small increments until melted. Spread melted chocolate over krispies. While still hot place coins on top and let harden for a few hours or overnight.

Remove stems from olives and stuff with cheese. In a saucepan combine tomato puree, butter and flour. Heat until boiling. Boil one minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in parsley. Pour into a small casserole. Place olives on top. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes.

Wash and dry onions. Cut off the tops of the onions and save them for another use. Remove the core and membranes from the bottom of the onions. In a small bowl mix together 2 tablespoons of butter and 1/4 teaspoon of paprika. Scoop out some of the center of the onions and place the onions cut side down in a baking dish. Spoon the butter mixture into the center of each onion. Fill the center of each onion with chicken broth until the top of the liquid reaches the top of the onions. Sprinkle the remaining paprika over the top of the onions and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until the onions are very tender. After the onions are done remove the tops and spoon the mixture into the centers of the onions. Place the tops back on the onions and sprinkle with breadcrumbs and dot with remaining butter. Bake for 3 more minutes at 350 degrees and serve.

Heat oil and butter in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add shrimp and cook 4 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and cook for 1 minute. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. Add paprika and red pepper flakes. Cook 30 seconds more. Add the parsley and stir. Serve over cooked rice.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in skillet over medium heat. Add 4 garlic cloves. Cook until they begin to turn golden. Add 1/2 cup lemon juice. Stir in the pike fillets and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Turn the fillets and continue to cook for 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Drain off any excess liquid. Set the fillets aside. Melt the remaining 1/2 cup of butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the breadcrumbs and cook until they are golden brown. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice. Add the romano cheese and the green onions. Spoon the walleye onto warmed dinner plates. Top with the breadcrumb mixture and serve.

In a saucepan combine water, sugar and lemon juice. Cook over medium heat until sugar is completely dissolved. Stir in cherries and simmer for 1 minute. Stir in almond extract. Let cool completely. Puree in blender. Pour into molds and freeze until slushy. Insert sticks, then return to freezer.

Preheat the oven to 200 degrees C. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin. Sift the flour, parmesan cheese, basil and salt into a large bowl. Add the mushrooms and milk to the flour mixture. Stir well to combine. Beat the egg in a measuring jug. Add the egg to the flour mixture. Stir to combine. Divide the mixture evenly into the muffin cups. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Cool in the tin for 5 minutes before removing. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).Line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foilset aside.Spray pork chop evenly with olive oil flavored cooking spraysprinkle both sides of chop evenly with dried rosemary and salt and pepper to taste.Place chop onto prepared baking sheet.Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes per side or until done to taste.While pork is cooking, combine apple butter, prepared horseradish, and apple cider vinegar together in a saucepan over medium heat until smoothremove from heat and set aside.Slice pork chop into 4 chopsserve topped with apple butter sauce.

In a large bowl combine cake mix and pumpkin until well mixed. Add molasses, eggs and spices. Stir until well blended. Fold in pecans and raisins. Pour into 2 greased loaf pans. Bake at 350f for 55 minutes. Cool in pans 10 minutes. Remove from pans and cool completely on wire racks. Wrap airtight and store at room temperature. Yield 2 loaves.

Cut vegetables into 1/2 inch slices. Place in a large bowl. Add remaining ingredients and toss to coat. Spread vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Turn squash and bake 10 minutes more. Serve at once.

Halve avocados. Discard seeds. Place flesh in blender. Add tomatoes. Blend till smooth. Melt butter in medium pan. Stir in garlic. Cook till garlic is golden. Add double cream. Cook till smooth and thickened. Season with tabasco. Stir in parmesan. Cook till melted. Heat tagliatelle in large pot of boiling water till al dente. Drain and toss with avocado sauce. Serve with additional parmesan.
Blend egg yolks and yogurt together until smooth. Add dill and blend. Stir in lemon juice and blend. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Beat together egg, water and tabasco sauce in a bowl. Lay out fish fillets in shallow pan (I use a 13 x 9) spoon about half the egg mixture over each fillet. Sprinkle with corn flake crumbs, and dot with butter. Bake at 400 degrees for about 25 minutes, or until fillets are browned and crumbs are crunchy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Heat a large sauté pan over medium-high heat and add extra virgin olive oil and basil. Allow basil to crisp and garlic to begin to brown, about 4-5 minutes. Place tomatoes into sauté pan and roast until tomatoes are soft and begin to turn brown around the edges, about 45 minutes. Remove tomatoes from oven and allow to cool slightly. When cool enough to touch, remove and discard basil and garlic and place tomatoes into a food processor or blender and puree until smooth. Add balsamic vinegar, maple sugar and sea salt to taste and blend until incorporated and desired consistency is achieved. Serve over pasta or as a dipping sauce.

Preheat oven to 350f. Trim excess fat from lamb. Place the rack of lamb in a shallow roasting dish. Sprinkle generously with lemon juice. Rub with oil and herbs. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until medium rare about 30 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes. Remove any fat from surface of lamb. Carve lamb into individual chops and serve.

Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon with a slotted spoonset aside. Add garlic to drippings in skilletcook until tender. Stir in winecook until evaporated. Stir in crushed tomatoes, clam juice and bay leaf. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer until thickened. Discard bay leaf. Stir in linguinecook until tender. Stir in bacon and clams. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with hot crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 375. Toss chicken legs in lime juice and zest and coat with flour. Heat olive oil in a frying pan and brown chicken. Place chicken in a baking dish and bake for 30 minutes. Whisk together lime zest and juice and balsamic vinegar and spoon over chicken and bake for another 10 minutes. Serve hot.
Melt butter and marshmallows over low heat and stir into milk mixture. Spread into 9x13 pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool and top with chocolate chips and walnuts. Cut into squares and refrigerate.

Mix together flour, groats, baking soda and salt. Stir in milk, eggs and sugar. Add 1 tablespoon melted butter to pan. Drop mixture by spoonfuls onto griddle. Fry on both sides until brown. Serve immediately. Makes 20 4-inch cakes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In medium bowl, combine first six ingredients. In separate bowl, combine egg, buttermilk, oil and vanilla. Add liquid mixture to dry ingredientsstir just until moistened. Fold in raisins and walnuts. Spoon batter into greased 12-cup muffin pan. Bake 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan. Makes 12 muffins.

Mix together lean ground beef, 1 egg, 1 cup breadcrumbs and 1/2 cup milk in large bowl. Add 1/2 cup romano cheese and 2 tsp each dried basil and dried oregano and 1/8 tsp cayenne pepper. Mix well. Shape into 1-in.-diameter meatballs. Arrange meatballs in a single layer in a 13x9x2-in. baking dish. Bake in a 375-degrees oven 20 minutes. Remove from baking dish and set aside. Heat 1/2 cup spaghetti sauce in a 1-qt. saucepan. Add meatballs and toss to coat. Serve on spaghetti or over sandwiches.
Place the frozen spinach in a medium size bowl. Add sour cream, green onions, water chestnuts and soup mix. Add cayenne pepper to taste. Serve in a bowl or crock pot. Serve with chips or crackers.

In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Brown the pork tenderloin on all sides. Remove the pork from the skillet. Add the broccoli florets, green onions, water, soy sauce, ramen noodles and broccoli florets. Heat through for about 5 minutes. Return the pork to the skillet. Serve hot.

Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Slice onion and bell pepper into thin strips and add to pan. Cook until onions are translucent (about 5 minutes). Add rice to the pan and cook 1 minute more. Add chicken stock, tomatoes and chili powder to pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 15 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Season with garlic salt to taste and serve immediately.

In a large skillet cook asparagus spears and garlic in butter over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add chicken broth and cook for 2 minutes. Add sugar and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in almonds and cook for 1 minute. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In a 10-inch skillet over medium heat, saute onions in water for about 10 minutes or until tender. Add ketchup and barbecue sauce. Cook and stir 2 minutes longer. Stir in vinegar and cook over medium-high heat for 5 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve warm as a dip or with barbecue chicken or chicken sandwiches. Store in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Soak cashews and peanuts overnight with water. Drain cashews and set aside. Blend cashews and peanuts with red chili and lemongrass. Add coriander leaves and blend again till smooth. Add olive oil and lemon juice and blend again for another minute. Use immediately or store in refrigerator for up to two weeks. For salmon: Season salmon with salt and pepper on both sides. Place salmon on baking sheet and bake for 8 minutes on each side or until salmon flakes easily when tested with a fork. Drizzle salmon with fresh lemon grass pesto and serve immediately.

In a large skillet or saute pan heat the butter or oil over medium heat. Add pine nuts and cook until they are lightly browned. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the frozen spinach. Cook until the spinach is just defrosted. Add the tomatoes, crushing them with your fingers as you add them to the skillet. Add the penne pasta. Cook for 2 minutes or until the pasta is almost cooked through. Add the feta cheese and season with salt and pepper. Cook until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 9x5 inch loaf pan. Beat eggs until foamy. Add sugar and oil and beat well. Stir in milk and lemon juice and zest. Beat until smooth. Sift flour with baking powder and salt and stir into batter. Pour batter into pan and bake 50 minutes or until golden brown and toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan.
Slice oranges into thin slices. Add to tea bags. Steep tea bags for 3-4 minutes. Remove tea bags and pour tea into pitcher. Add ice cubes. Stir in honey. Serve.

Wash and trim zucchini and slice into thin matchsticks. Heat 2-3 tbsp. olive oil over medium-high heat in large saute pan. Add zucchini and cook until they begin to soften and brown at the edges, about 5 minutes. Season with 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add 1/2 cup of the water and cook until zucchini is tender. Add remaining 1/4 cup of water and bring to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook until al dente. Drain spaghetti, reserving 1/3 cup pasta water. Toss spaghetti with zucchini mixture. Sprinkle with Parmigiano and serve with extra Parmigiano and reserved pasta water. Makes 6 servings.

Place all the dough ingredients in bread machine in order suggested by manufacturer. Set on dough cycle and bread machine on medium speed. When cycle is complete remove dough from pan and let rise in warm place for 30 minutes. Punch down and knead dough briefly. Shape dough into a loaf and place in a greased loaf pan. Let rise in warm place until dough touches top of pan. Bake at 350f degrees for 30-35 minutes. Turn out on wire rack and cool.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Stir in flour until well-combined. Gradually add milk, whisking constantly until smooth. Add vegetables, salt and pepper. Reduce heat to medium-low. Stir in cream cheese until melted. Serve sprinkled with Parmesan cheese.
Heat canola oil in a skillet. Add garlic clove and red onion and saute until onion is tender. Add red potatoes. Saute until potatoes are tender and lightly browned. Stir in chives. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl mix cornstarch with broth until smooth. Stir in preserves and sherry. Add soy sauce, ginger, and sugar to taste. Pour over chicken pieces in a shallow baking dish. Bake in 350 oven for 1 hour. Turn chicken over and bake for another 45 min. Remove from oven and pour any sauce remaining in the pan over the meat. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla and almond extract. Add flour mixture and beat until blended. Stir in almonds and chocolate chips. Roll dough into tablespoon sized balls and roll in sugar. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet and press down with fork to flatten slightly. Bake at 425 for 8-10 minutes or until light golden. Cool on wire rack.

Soak the shiitake mushrooms in hot water until soft. Remove the mushrooms from the water and slice them into thin strips. Heat the vegetable oil and saut the onion and carrots. Add the garlic and the ginger and cook for a minute. Add the mushrooms and the bok choy and cook for 2 minutes. Add the soy sauce and the sugar and cook for another minute. Season with the sesame oil, the salt and the pepper and serve.
Cook carrot and asparagus in boiling water until tender crisp. Drain and place in a bowl. Add lemon juice and lemon pepper and toss lightly to coat. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Serves 4.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and ginger and saute until tender, about 3 minutes. Add rice and saute until golden, about 3 minutes. Add water and bring to a boil. Cover and cook until rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Remove rice from heat and stir in beans and coconut milk. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with scallions.

Peel the jalapeno and cut in half lengthwise. Scoop out the seeds and membranes and set aside. Fill the jalapeno halves with cream cheese and cheddar cheese and place in a baking dish. Top each with a strip of bacon and drizzle with barbecue sauce. Bake at 350 degrees until bubbly and browned, about 20 minutes. Serve with extra barbecue sauce and sour cream if desired.

Peel and mash the bananas. Beat the bananas with the sugar substitute and vanilla. In another bowl combine the flours, soda and powder. Combine the dry ingredients and the wet ingredients. Pour into 2 greased loaf pans and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Cool for 10 minutes then remove from pans and cool completely. Makes 2 loaves.

Combine brown rice and 4 cups of the broth in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered until rice is tender, about 40 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and butter. Simmer until sauce thickens slightly. Stir in asparagus and cook until done but still crisp, about 3 minutes. Stir in cream. Season with pepper and salt to taste. Serve.

Prepare cake according to directions on package. Add instant lemon pudding mix to prepared cake batter and stir well. Pour into greased 8-inch square pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan 10 minutes. In small bowl, combine water and sour cream. Stir in vegetable oil and white chocolate chips. Pour over cooled cake. Sprinkle with almonds. Store in refrigerator.

Place cabbage and carrots in a medium bowl. Set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil until very hot. Stir fry crabmeat until lightly browned. Remove and add to cabbage mixture. Stir ginger, soy sauce and sesame oil into crabmeat mixture. In another medium bowl, combine water and cornstarch and stir well to dissolve cornstarch. Place about 3 tablespoons crabmeat mixture in center of each wrapper. Fold over bottom end and tightly roll up as for a jellyroll. Place rolls seam side down in an ungreased 11 by 7 inch baking dish. Stir cornstarch mixture into remaining crabmeat mixture until thickened slightly. Pour over rolls, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 to 35 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned. Serve with soy sauce for dipping.

In a large pot of boiling salted water cook the beans for 1 minute. Drain and plunge the green beans into ice water to stop the cooking. Drain again and pat dry. In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add the green beans and cook over high heat for 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth and cook for 1 minute. Add the almonds and parmesan cheese and cook for 1 more minute. Season with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl, combine garlic and salt and mash together with a fork until a paste is formed. In a large bowl combine five spice and olive oil. Add chicken and coat with mixture. Lay chicken out flat on a plate and refrigerate for 1 hour. Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat and add chicken breasts. Cook for about 4 minutes on each side until cooked through and lightly browned on each side. Serve with onions if desired and serve over rice or noodles and a salad of your choice.
Fill glass with ice. Add pineapple juice and coconut syrup. Top with club soda and cream. Garnish with maraschino cherry.

Melt butter, brown sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg over medium heat until well blended. Remove from heat. Stir in flour. Press into a 9x9 pan. Top with apples. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees F. sprinkle with nuts.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut four 18 inch length of aluminum foil. Place each piece of fish on a piece of foil. Sprinkle each with lemon slices and season with dill. Sprinkle with rosemary. Top each piece of fish with a couple of tablespoons of olive oil. Fold foil over the fish and seal. Place in baking dish with dish of wine. Bake for about 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly oil a cookie sheet. Lay out the pizza crust and spread a thin layer of pizza sauce over it. Lay sliced onions over the sauce. Lay out the sun-dried tomatoes and sprinkle with goat cheese. Lay out the fresh basil. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a large pan, add the onion and cook until soft. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. Add the beans and cook for a few minutes. Add the stock and bring to a boil. Cover the pan, reduce the heat and simmer for 5-10 minutes until the beans are soft. Stir in the parsley and season to taste. Serve immediately.

Whisk together flour, salt and paprika. Add beer. Whisk until batter is smooth. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Dip fish into batter and cook until golden brown and crispy on each side, about 4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Serve with lemon wedges and tartar sauce.

In a small bowl, combine warm water and sugar and stir. Sprinkle in yeast and let sit for 5 minutes. In a large bowl, add yeast mixture and olive oil. Add flour 1/2 cup at a time and stir. Continue adding flour 1/2 cup at a time until dough is soft and no longer sticks to the sides of the bowl. Place dough in a greased bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap. Set in a warm place to rise for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, punch down dough and roll into 2 loaves. Place loaves in greased 9 x 5 loaf pans. Let rise for 10 minutes. Bake at 350 degrees f for 1 hour or until bread sounds hollow. Makes 2 loaves.

Pick over beans for stones and wash. Combine beans with stock in large kettle. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium, skimming occasionally until beans are tender, about 1 hour. Remove from heat. Add onion, celery ribs and beets. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in tomatoes. Remove from heat. Stir in butter. Cover and let stand for 1 hour. Stir in fresh mint. Serve hot.

Melt the butter with the graham cracker crumbs in an ungreased 13 x 9 pan. Press the mixture into the pan. Sprinkle with coconut and chocolate chips. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and spread the butterscotch chips over the crust. Bake an additional 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the pecans. In the meantime prepare the frosting by combining the sweetened condensed milk with the margarine and vanilla until well blended. Pour over the cooled bars. Cool. Cut into bars.

Cut top off green peppers. Remove seeds. In a large skillet cook beef and onion. Add tomatoes and water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Drain and place in a 2 quart casserole. Combine rice, chili powder and salt. Sprinkle over beef mixture. Top with corn. Place peppers over corn. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Remove from casserole and sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Serve.

Boil the potatoes with the skin on until they are soft and then mash them with a little milk and oil (if you want). Add the onions and mix well. In a separate bowl mix the eggs and seasonings and add to potato mixture. Place in greased baking dish and bake for approximately an hour and half at 350 degrees until a knife comes out clean when inserted in the middle of the kugel.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease an 8x8 square pan. In a large saucepan, combine cornmeal with salt and nutmeg. Slowly add milk. Bring to a boil stirring often. Reduce heat. Cook for 10 minutes until thickened stirring often. Remove from heat. Add pumpkin and butter stirring well. Transfer to prepared pan. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until set. Cool. Cut into bars. Makes 9 servings.

Combine honey, soy sauce, lime juice and water in a small bowl. Stir until honey has dissolved. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over mediumhigh heat. Combine mustard and salmon in a resealable plastic bagseal and turn to coat. Add salmon to the pancook for 5 minutes. Add glaze. Turn salmon and cook for 5 to 10 minutes longer. Top with green onions and sesame seeds. Serve with rice and vegetables.

Place chicken in a soup pot. Add enough water or chicken broth to cover chicken. Add carrots, celery, onion. Cook for 30 minutes. Add peas. Continue cooking 10 minutes. Remove chicken from pot. Tear chicken into bite sized pieces and return to pot. Add salt & pepper to taste. Serve with crackers.

Dissolve starch in water. Add sugar and boil until mixture thickens and leaves a clear film on a metal spoon. Add coconut and beans and stir to blend well. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Whip together egg yolks and sugar. Stir in lemon extract and vegetable oil. Add cooled mixture from first step. Fold in egg whites until batter is smooth and foamy. Drop by heaping spoonfuls onto wax paper or on a lightly greased baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes at 375 degrees. Cool on wire rack. Melt sugar syrup in saucepan until it bubbles and turns golden brown. Pour over cakes and sprinkle with flaked coconut. Serve immediately.

Cut spaghetti squash in half and microwave 10 minutes or until soft. Remove seeds and pulp with a fork. Add margarine to a pan and sauté navy beans until brown. Add corn and red bell pepper. Cook until heated through. Add squash and cook 2 minutes. Season with basil and parsley. Cook over low heat until hot. Garnish with mizithra cheese.

In a large bowl, cream together the margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. Combine the flour, cornstarch and salt and stir into the creamed mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoon onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Do not overcook. Remove from the baking sheet and cool on a wire rack. Makes 4 dozen.

Spray a 13x9-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Lay 1 breast in pan and spray top of breast with cooking spray. Place 2 cups rice around the breast. Repeat with remaining breast and rice. Combine the remaining rice with 1 1/2 cups water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until water is absorbed. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes per side or until browned. Add 2 tablespoons broth to skillet. Reduce heat to low. Cook 5 minutes or until liquid evaporates. Add bell pepper and garlic. Cook 2 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Stir in remaining broth, tomatoes and remaining rice. Spread evenly over chicken. Top with baked beans. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for 5 minutes. Garnish with par
Mix all ingredients together with electric mixer until smooth. Cover and refrigerate. Serve with apple slices.

Combine vinegar, brown sugar, soya sauce and spices in medium saucepan. Bring to boil. Add spareribs and simmer 30 minutes. Remove spareribs and reserve liquid. Cut spareribs into serving pieces and keep warm. Skim fat from liquid and bring to boil. Serve spareribs with sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small bowl combine graham cracker crumbs and 1 tablespoon sugar. Set aside. In another bowl combine butter, remaining sugar and lemon rind. Add lemon juice and mix well. Beat in eggs. Stir in condensed milk. Pour into an ungreased 10-in. Square baking pan. Sprinkle crumb mixture evenly over the top. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until firm to the touch. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. In another bowl combine all the topping ingredientsmix well. Cut into squares. Store in the refrigerator.

In a bowl combine ground beef with 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and black pepper. Divide in half. Form into 4 flat cakes about 1/2 inch thick. Sprinkle cheese over each burger. Top each burger with about 2 tablespoons sour cream. Sprinkle with black olives. Top each burger with green onions. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight. Makes 4 burgers. Preheat grill. Cook burgers for 5 minutes. Turn. Cook for 5 minutes. Top with remaining sour cream. Cook 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Serve burgers on onion rolls with lettuce and tomato. Makes 4 servings.

Heat the oil in a large skillet or saut pan. Add the onion and saut until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook for another 3 minutes. Add the zucchini and yellow squash and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the basil and season to taste with the salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and serve hot or cold.

Melt butter in heavy medium saucepan over low heat until melted. Add sugar and cook, stirring constantly, until smooth and golden brown. Remove from heat and beat in peanut butter and vanilla until smooth. Let cool for at least 1 hour. Beat in eggs and flour until combined and smooth. Spread into greased 11x17-inch pan. Sprinkle coconut and nuts over top. Bake at 325 for 20-25 minutes or until golden. Let cool completely before cutting into bars.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Place fillets in a single layer on a foil-lined baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Brush with maple mixturesprinkle with pecans. Bake at 400 for 12 to 15 minutes or until salmon flakes easily with a fork.

Heat oil & butter in a large Dutch oven over medium high heat. Add onions, & cook until soft & translucent about 5 minutes. Add brussels sprouts & garlic & cook 1 minute more. Season with ground allspice, sage & 1/4 teaspoon salt. Stir in chicken stock & radicchio & cover. Braise for about 30 minutes or until vegetables are very tender & stock has evaporated & is syrupy. Uncover & season with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt & black pepper. Serve hot.

Season chops with ground pepper. In a 9x13 pan, put broth and vinegar together and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Put chops in boiling mixture and cover. Bake for 20 minutes at 400 degrees. Turn chops over and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes. Glaze chops with mixture from pan. Garnish with parsley.

In a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat, heat oil until shimmering. Add beef stew meat in a single layercook until browned on all sides, 5 to 6 minutes. Transfer beef stew meat to a platereserve. Add garlic to potcook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add chili powder, cumin, and all-purpose flourcook for about a minute to toast the flourstirring constantly. Whisk in the beef brothbring mixture to a boil. Whisk in the reserved beef stew meatreduce heat to medium-lowsimmer until stew meat is tender, about 35 minutes, stirring occasionally. Transfer chili to a bowlstir in the lime juiceseason with salt and pepper. Serve warm with chopped fresh cilantro and lime wedges if desired.

Mix the milk and the pudding mix according to directions on the back of the box. Pour into a pie plate and let set for about 5-10 minutes. Take the ice cream out of the freezer and cut into small cubes. Take a spoonful of the ice cream and roll it into a ball. Then take a spoonful of the chocolate mix and roll into a ball as well. Take a marshmallow and smash it with the palm of your hand until it resembles the consistency of whipped cream. Then place a cube of ice cream in the center of the marshmallow, place a cube of chocolate mix on top of the ice cream, and then place a marshmallow ball on top of the chocolate mix. Repeat until all of the ice cream is used. Serve immediately.
Bring 6 cups of water to boil. Remove from heat. Add tea bags and steep for five minutes. Remove tea bags. Add honey and stir. Add apple juice. Sprinkle cinnamon over top. Serve hot or cold.

Beat condensed milk and lemon rind in large bowl until fluffy. Beat in flour and salt. Press half of the mixture into bottom of ungreased 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Combine brown sugar, butter and water in small saucepan. Cook until boiling. Spread evenly over baked crust. Sprinkle with remaining mixture. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes longer. Cool completely. Cut into bars. Drizzle with glaze if desired. Glaze ingredients: 1/2 cup powdered sugar, 1/4 cup milk. Combine and drizzle over bars. Yields 2 dozen bars.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Pierce each clove with the tip of a sharp knife. Place garlic in a small glass baking dish. Drizzle with oil. Roast in the oven until cloves are browned and soft when pressed with a fork. This will take approximately 30 minutes. Mash the garlic with a fork. Place the potatoes in a medium saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer until tender, about 10-12 minutes. Drain. Return to the pot. Add butter, cream, milk, and garlic. Mash until smooth. Season with salt and white pepper to taste.

In a medium pot, combine cider vinegar, sugar, raisins, apples, garlic, gingerroot, red chili peppers, pickling salt and cayenne. Bring just to a boil, stirring. Remove from heat, cool. Add pears. Refrigerate. Store up to 4 months. Makes about 3 cups.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees. Line a large cookie sheet with parchment paper. In a medium saucepan, combine water, corn syrup, vanilla and salt over low heat until the salt has dissolved. Add the popcorn and stir until well coated. Pour the popcorn onto the prepared cookie sheet and bake for 30 minutes. Add the raisins, apricots and nuts and continue baking for another 30 minutes. Stir every 10 minutes. Remove from oven and stir in the brown sugar. Cool completely before storing in an airtight container.
In small saucepan, combine margarine and brown sugar. Cook over low heat until melted. Pour over popcorn and stir. Cook over low heat until coated. Add salt to taste.

Cook pasta according to directions on package. Set aside. Heat olive oil on medium high heat. Saute green onions, mushrooms and garlic for about 3 minutes until softened. Add white wine, salt, pepper and cook for about 1 minute until wine reduces slightly. Remove from heat. Toss pasta with shrimp and vegetables. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serves 4-6.

Remove rib roast from packaging. Pat roast dry with paper towels. Season with salt and pepper. Rub roast with 3 garlic cloves. Sprinkle with mustard. Cover roast with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Remove roast from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. In a small bowl, combine 1/2 cup mayonnaise, 2 teaspoons horseradish sauce, 1/4 teaspoon dill weed, 1/4 teaspoon thyme. Spread mixture evenly over roast. Place roast on broiling pan. Place in oven. Bake for 20 minutes per pound of roast. Cook until internal temperature of roast reaches 125 degrees. Remove roast from oven. Let rest 15 minutes before slicing.

Preheat broiler to high. Slice tomatoes about 1/2 inch thick and place on a broiler-safe tray or cookie sheet. Drizzle tomato slices with olive oil. Sprinkle generously with herbes de provence. Broil about 2 minutes per side until lightly browned on both sides and a little wilted. Sprinkle parsley over tomatoes before serving. Serve immediately with grated parmesan cheese on the side.

In a large stock pot over medium heat add water and vegetables. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Strain the vegetables out and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients and bring back to a boil. Strain out and set aside again. Taste and add more salt and fresh parsley if needed.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Mix all the sauce ingredients together and set aside. Rub the thighs with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Place in a shallow baking dish and roast in the oven for 25 minutes. Turn and roast for another 10 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter. Pour the sauce over and toss to coat. Serve warm with steamed rice.
Wash corn. Rinse well. Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add corn and boil for 4 to 6 minutes or until tender. Drain corn and sprinkle with melted butter, salt, and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Whisk together the light cream, eggs, garlic, pecorino romano and mozzarella cheesesset aside. In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, add 1 tablespoon of oilcook the garlic for 30 seconds. Add artichoke heartscook for 2 to 3 minutes or just until heated through. Divide the artichokes among 2 unbaked pie crusts. Spread the cream mixture over the top of each piesprinkle with the black pepperbake for 30 to 35 minutes or until the custard is set. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Spread one side of each slice of bread with mayonnaise. Place a layer of ham and cheese on each piece of bread. Put the two together to form a sandwich. You can cut it in half, or into four pieces depending on how many you want to make.

Cook frozen cauliflower according to package directions. Set aside to cool slightly. Meanwhile in a small bowl combine the half and half and margarine. Add the cheese and bacon bits. Stir until cheese is completely melted. Add the cauliflower and toss to coat. Transfer the cauliflower to a 2-quart microwaveable dish. Sprinkle with chives. Bake for 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Bake the sweet potatoes at 375 degrees for one hour or until tender. In a saucepan combine the orange juice and the pineapple. Heat and let the mixture come to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for ten minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the brown sugar. Cut the sweet potatoes in half and place in a large bowl. Pour the pineapple mixture over the potatoes. Cut the oranges in half and squeeze the juice over the potatoes. Add the butter and stir. Add the coconut. In a small bowl combine the lemon juice and the cherry. Pour over the potatoes and stir. Serve warm. Serves six.

Spray a skillet with pam and heat over medium heat. Put milk in a shallow bowl or dish. Beat together cornstarch, sugar, salt and vanilla extract in a bowl until smooth. Dip bread into milk and then dip into the cornstarch mixture on both sides to coat well. Place the bread in the skillet. Cook each slice 2 to 3 minutes on each side until golden brown. Serve with syrup or jam.

Preheat oven to 425f. Combine egg, milk, flour, and baking powder. Blend with mixer until smooth. Fill a greased 13x9-inch pan with the sauerkraut. Pour the batter evenly over the sauerkraut. Bake uncovered for 40-45 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting into squares. Makes 24 squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 2 9-inch round cake pans. In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until fluffy. Beat in the applesauce and vanilla. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon and nutmeg. Stir into the applesauce mixture until just combined. Stir in the raisins. Pour evenly into the prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool in the pans for 5 minutes. Remove from the pans and allow to cool on a wire rack.
In large pot or Dutch oven, saute beef and onions over medium heat until beef is browned. Stir in green pepper. Add remaining ingredients and heat through. Serve with grated cheese.

In a medium saucepan, combine the clams with the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil over high heat. Coverreduce the heat to medium-low. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until the clams have opened. Stir in parsley. Serve hot with crusty bread.

In a medium sauce pan, combine 1/2 cup of milk, 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup turkey gravy mix. Bring to a boil. Stir frequently until thickened. In a medium frying pan, combine 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup turkey gravy mix. Bring to a boil. Stir frequently until thickened. In a medium sauce pan, combine 1/2 cup of milk, 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup turkey gravy mix. Bring to a boil. Stir frequently until thickened. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup of milk, 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup turkey gravy mix. Bring to a boil. Stir frequently until thickened. In a medium sauce pan, combine 1/2 cup of milk, 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup turkey gravy mix. Bring to a boil. Stir frequently until thickened. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup of milk, 1/2

Boil milk in small saucepan over medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes or until mixture is reduced to 1 1/2 cups. Stir in nonfat dry milk powderheat for 3 minutes. Stir in cottage cheese and remaining cheeses until cheese is melted. Stir in lemon juice. Place tortellini in an ungreased 13x9x2-inch (3-quart) glass baking dish. Top with cheese mixture. Sprinkle with rosemary. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncovertop with almonds. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Saute the onion in the butter until almost transparent. Add the green beans and mushrooms. Saute until beans are crisp-tender. Add the lemon pepper seasoning and pepper cheese. Cook until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in large pot over medium heat. Add onion and carrots and saute for 5 minutes. Add celery and continue sauteing until onion and celery are softened. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add corn and turkey and cook for 10 minutes. Add lemon juice and season with pepper and salt to taste. Serve hot.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat cook bacon until crisp. Remove to paper towels to drainreserve 2 tablespoons of drippings in the pan. Add onion, green pepper to drippings in pansaute until softened, about 5 minutes. Add beanspour in ketchup, worcestershire sauce, brown sugar and liquid smoke. Cook until heated throughstir in mustard and salsa. Serve on hamburger buns with bacon and cheese if desired.

Combine oatmeal, salt, sage, onion, and eggs until well mixed. Add cream soup and water. Mix well. Form into patties. Cook patties in skillet until brown on both sides. Serve on toasted buns with lettuce, tomato, and mustard.

Cut rolls in half and place on a large baking sheet. Mix together cream cheese and honey until well blended. Divide into crescents and spread on top of crescents. Sprinkle with almonds and cinnamon. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 12 servings.

Cook instant rice according to package directions. In another skillet, saute fresh mushrooms, green peppers, onion, garlic in butter until tender. Blend in ketchup, broth and water. Add cooked rice to skillet and toss together. Serve on grilled rolls topped with cheese, if desired.

Prepare graham cracker crust according to box directions. Place in 9 inch pie plate and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside. Cream together the cream cheese, sugar and milk until smooth. Add the flaked coconut and mix well. Pour into pie crust and refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. Top with whipped topping and sprinkle with almond extract.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease a 9-inch square baking pan. In a large bowl, combine the butter and cocoa powder and beat until well mixed. Add the sugar and eggs and beat until well combined. Add the vanilla and salt and beat until well mixed. Add the flour and xanthan gum and beat until just combined. Spread into the prepared pan and bake for 25-30 minutes. Cool in pan.

Prepare macaroni according to package directionsdrain and set aside. In large skillet brown beef over medium high heatdrain and set aside. In medium bowl combine beef, onion, and tomato saucemix well and set aside. In 13x9 inch baking dish spread 3 cups of the macaroni in bottom of dishtop evenly with meat mixture and 1 cup of the shredded cheeserepeat layers ending with cheesecover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutesuncover and sprinkle with the remaining cheese and bake an additional 5-10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Sprinkle with the pepperoni slices and bake an additional 3-5 minutes or until heated through and the cheese is bubblyserve immediately.

Wash rice several times in cold water. Cook rice in a double boiler in 4 cups of water until done. Drain rice in a colander. In a large frying pan, melt 1/4 cup of the butter over medium heat. Add the rice and stir for a few minutes. Add 3 cups of the parsley, the 1/2 cup of water and the remaining 1/4 cup of butter. Mix well and cook until the butter is melted. Remove from heat and let cool. Place in a covered jar in the refrigerator until ready to use. Use rice as a garnish for cooked meats.

In a large saucepan, combine the bananas and butter. Cook over medium heat until the bananas are very soft and the mixture is almost smooth. Stir in the sugar. Cook until the sugar has dissolved. Beat in the eggs, 1 at a time. Stir in the lemon juice. Remove from heat. Pour into an 8-inch square pan or dish. Chill until set. Makes 1-1/2 cups.

Cool potatoes until they are cool enough to handle. Peel and dice. Mix with remaining ingredients. Shape into patties and coat with flour. Fry patties until crisp and golden brown. Serve with ketchup, mustard or tartar sauce.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Remove from the heat. Combine the butter, flour, and ground red pepper. Stir with a whisk until smooth. Pour in the broth slowly while whisking constantly until well combined. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium.
