Place potatoes in blender container and add 1/2 cup milk and 1/4 cup sugar. Blend well and pour into 9-inch pie shells. Beat eggs slightlyadd remaining milk and sugar and vanilla and pour over potato filling. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray a small baking dish. Place fish in a shallow bowl. Combine the apricot nectar, french onion soup mix and the lemon juice in a medium bowl. Spoon sauce over each fish piece. Bake uncovered in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped mint just before serving.

Heat oven to 400F. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Tear spinach into large pieces. In a skillet or wok, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add spinach and stir-fry until wilted, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to baking sheet and bake until crisp and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Heat oil in a large skillet over moderately low heat. Add mustard seeds and cook until they pop. Stir in onion and cook until tender and golden brown. Add garlic and cook one minute. Stir in cumin, coriander, turmeric and cayennecook 1 minute. Add tomato, eggplant and potatocook over moderately high heat until vegetables are tender. Stir in cilantro and saltcook one minute. Serve with rice
In a large stockpot add all ingredients and bring to a boil and simmer for about 2-4 minutes or until beans are tender. Drain beans and set aside in a bowl. Add some butter and serve hot.

Cook the tortellini according to package directions. Meanwhile, slice the zucchini into thin strips on the diagonal. Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add zucchini and tomatosaute until tender-crisp. Add onionsaute for 2 minutes. Add cooked tortellinitoss to combine. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. Serves 2 to 3.

Place 4 apples in a microwave-safe bowl or dish. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Cover with plastic wrap and microwave at 50% power for 5-6 minutes or until apples are tender when pierced with a knife. Uncover and cool slightly. In a small bowl, combine juices, brown sugar and liqueur. Stir in strawberrieschill until serving. Cut the apples into wedges or slices and serve with strawberry sauce. Garnish with a sliced strawberry or a sliver of almond if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan, drain off fat and set aside. Sauté onion and garlic in bacon fat until transparent. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add flour and stir well. Add cream cheese and blend until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and heat through. Add bacon and heat for a few minutes. Serve with crackers.

Place tortillas directly on grill or heat in toaster oven. While tortillas are heating, make dressing. In a small bowl, combine all dressing ingredients and whisk. Spread dressing mixture over tortilla and top with blue cheese, walnuts, and pear. Place back under heat and serve.

Bring 1-1/2 quarts water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon baking soda. Add noodles. Cook 1-2 minutes until al dente. Drain noodles in a colander. Rinse noodles with cold water. In a small bowl combine ginger and vinegar. Add noodles and toss well. Add chives. Set aside. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium-high heat. Add tuna. Cook for 1 minute. Turn and continue cooking for 1 minute. Transfer tuna to a cutting board. With a sharp knife, cut tuna into thin slices. In a small bowl combine wasabi and remaining 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt. Spread wasabi mixture over tuna. In a small bowl combine remaining 1 teaspoon oil, lime juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, and chili paste. Add tuna. Toss well. Divide noodles among 4

In a sauce pan heat the butter over medium heat. Add the ginger, garlic and the black peppercorns. Fry for about 2 mins. Add the wine, soy sauce and sugar. Bring to the boil then simmer for 2 mins. Add the crabmeat into the pan and stir for a min. Remove from the heat. Serve with steamed rice.

Combine cereal with the parmesan cheese. Set aside. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Wash the chicken breasts. Combine the seasoning mixture in a small bowl. Place the seasoning mixture in a plastic bag. Add the prepared chicken breasts. Seal the bag. Shake until the chicken breasts are coated. Place the coated chicken breasts in a baking pan. Bake for about 40 minutes or until cooked through. Combine the honey and mustard. Place the cooked nuggets in a large bowl. Pour the honey mustard mixture over the nuggets. Toss until coated. Serve with the remaining honey mustard mixture.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions, carrots, celery and cook until tender. Add split peas, vegetable broth and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 1 hour stirring occasionally. Stir in sweet potatoes. Cook until potatoes are tender. Stir in swiss chardcook until chard wilts, about 1 minute.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut the figs in half lengthwise. Arrange the fig halves in a single layer. Drizzle with the maple syrup and rosemary. Sprinkle with the mustard powder. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes.

Mix flour and spices in a large bowl. Cut chicken into pieces. Coat the pieces in the flour mixture and shake off any excess. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the coated pieces and fry until golden and crispy on the outside. Remove the pieces from the skillet and place on a paper towel to absorb excess oil. Serve immediately.

Mix together sugar and light corn syrup in a saucepan over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil and bubbles around edges of pan. Add in vanilla and creamy peanut butter and stir until combined. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper. Let cool and store in an airtight container in refrigerator. These are best stored in refrigerator because they are very soft at room temperature.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, cocoa powder and butter. Stir continuously until the mixture is smooth and chocolaty. Remove from heat and stir in the salt. Stir in the vanilla. In a small bowl combine the evaporated milk and the half-and-half. Add to the chocolate mixture and stir until well blended. Chill until ready to use. Reheat in a saucepan until warm.

Combine 2 cups apple pie filling with 2 cups water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Lower heat and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes or until thickened. Drain tortillas to remove excess water. Sprinkle with 3 tablespoons cinnamon. Spoon apple mixture over tortillas. Sprinkle evenly with 3 tablespoons margarine. Bake in preheated 350f oven for 10 minutes. Top each serving with 1 teaspoon almond flavoring. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. In a large skillet cook sausage over medium heat 6 to 8 minutes or until no longer pink. Remove from skillet. In the same skillet cook chicken and bell pepper over medium-high heat 5 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Drain. Stir in salsa, corn and cream. Spread in a 13x9-inch baking dish. Cut sausage into 1/2-inch pieces. Top the chicken mixture with sausage. Bake uncovered 30 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with tortillas.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add squash and cook, stirring frequently, until tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the peanutscook until the mixture is fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the sugarstir until the mixture is syrupy and well coated with the sugar. Remove the pan from the heatseason with the salt. Transfer the squash to a serving bowl. Serve warm or at room temperature. Yield: 1-1/2 cups.

Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add garlic and curry and cook for a minute or two. Add beans and cook for another minute. Add rice and stir. Add the chicken stock and cook for 12 minutes, uncovered. Stir in the cilantro. Season with salt.

Place chickens in the slow cooker. In a large bowl combine the ketchup, onion soup mix, and coca-cola. Pour half the mixture over the chickens. Cover and cook on high for 2 1/2 - 3 hours. Stir in remaining mixturecover and cook on high for 1 hour longer.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cook the lasagna noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a food processor combine the cream cheese and the salmon. Process until smooth and set aside. In a saucepan over low heat combine the pasta sauce and the mushrooms. Heat until the sauce is warm. In a 13x9x2 inch baking pan spread 1/2 cup of pasta sauce. Layer 6 noodles over the pasta sauce. Spread 1/2 cup of the cream cheese mixture over the noodles. Sprinkle 1/3 of the cheese over the cream cheese mixture. Repeat with 6 more noodles, the remaining cream cheese mixture and cheese. Top with the remaining 6 noodles. Pour the remaining pasta sauce over the noodles. Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes until the cheese is bubbly. Garnish with the fresh dill sprigs and serve warm.

Make Jell-O according to package directions. Add hot water. Stir in pineapple tidbits. Refrigerate. Combine marshmallows, pineapple juice and pineapple tidbits in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook until marshmallows are melted and mixture is well blended. Remove from heat. Add cream cheese. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Add whipped topping. Mix well. Spread mixture on crust. Chill until ready to serve. Arrange oranges on top. Garnish with coconut.

In a frying pan, cook the bacon until crisp. Drain and set aside. Saute the onion and butternut squash until tender. Add the thyme and season to taste. Cook until the squash is tender. Add the spinach leaves and toss over heat. Serve topped with the bacon.

Combine buckwheat flour and all purpose flour in mixing bowl. Stir in egg, margarine, water. Stir in baking powder and sweetener. Beat well. Cook in hot greased griddle or on electric skillet over medium heat for 3 minutes or until browned on each side.

Slice oranges into 1/4 inch slices. In a medium bowl combine chicken, onion, oranges and the next 6 ingredients. Pour into a 9 inch x 13 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours. Garnish with fresh parsley.

In a small saute pan over medium-high heat add the olive oil and butter. When butter is melted add the asparagus spears. Cook for 5 minutes until asparagus is bright green. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add lemon juice before serving.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add pasta and cook until al dentedrain. Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook until translucent, about 5 minutesstir in garlic powder and salt. Stir in diced tomatoes with juicecook 5 minutes or until liquid is reduced by halfstir in tomato saucecook 10 minutes or until thickened. Stir in cooked pastatop with cheddar cheesecoverheat through. Serve with toasted garlic bread.
butter the top of each biscuit. place a frank in the middle. sprinkle with shredded american cheese. wrap up and eat.

Combine eggs, buttermilk, salt and sugar in a bowl and beat well. Combine flour and baking soda in another bowl. Add to the egg mixture all at once and mix well. Heat a griddle or large skillet over medium heat until a drop of water dances across the surface when flicked from a spoon. Lightly brush with oil and drop batter by spoonfuls onto hot griddle. Turn when bubbles form underneath and browned on bottom. Serve with butter and maple syrup.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut the sweet peppers in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membrane. Lay the halves face down on the baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, cook the linguine according to package directions. Combine the sweet peppers in a blender with 1/2 cup of water. Blend until smooth. Heat the oil and garlic in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the basil and cook for 1 minute. Add the sweet pepper puree and balsamic vinegar and simmer for 2 minutes. Stir in the linguine. Serve sprinkled with the basil sprig and parmesan cheese.
Pour all liquids into glass. Top with heavy cream and lemon zest.

Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Saute onion until golden brown. Add noodles and cook according to package directions. Drain noodles and set aside in a large bowl. In a separate bowl combine ham, cheese, milk, sour cream and soup until well mixed. Add noodle mixture and mix well. Pour into a 9x13 baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease three 9-inch cake pans. In a large bowl, mix eggs and vegetable oil. Beat until blended. Stir in sugar. Combine the dry ingredients in a separate bowladd the dry mixture to the wet mixture alternately with the carrots. Beat well after each addition. Pour batter evenly into the prepared cake pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before turning out onto wire racks to cool completely.

Sprinkle cherries with cornflour. Add water and juices, stirring till smooth. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Remove from heat. Add other fruit and marinate for at least 1 hour. Refrigerate overnight.

Cut 4 slices of bread in half diagonally. Place one half on a plate, spread with olive oil. Arrange dried tomato strips on top. Sprinkle with some chopped lettuce leaves. Top with a piece of prosciutto. Sprinkle with shredded Parmesan. Put other half of the bread on top. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, saute vegetables in a large skillet with oil over medium high heat for about 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender crisp. Toss together pasta and vegetables in a large serving dish. Add balsamic vinegar and feta cheese and stir. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

In a small pan combine the blueberries, orange juice, lemon juice, vermouth and the orange rind. Simmer over medium-low heat for 10 minutes. Stir in the butter. Strain into a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium-low heat. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the blueberries. Remove from the heat. Stir in the ginger. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Place the medallions in a non-stick frying pan. Add the butter. Cook over medium-low heat for 4-5 minutes. Turn once and cook for another 4-5 minutes or until the meat is just cooked through. Remove from the heat. Spoon the blueberry sauce over the meat. Garnish with lemon rind.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a skillet. Sauté the onion and garlic until fragrant and tender. Add the black beans and stir to combine. Add the cumin. Season with salt and pepper. Cook 5 minutes more. Heat sweet potatoes in the microwave for 5 minutes. Mash the sweet potatoes in a bowl. Mix with the beans. Heat the tortillas in a dry skillet over medium heat until just softened. Divide the bean mixture among the tortillas. Top with cilantro and cheese if desired. Wrap burritos tightly in foil or place in a ziploc bag. Store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days or freeze. To reheat, place burrito in a foil pouch or ziploc bag in a skillet over medium heat for 10-15 minutes or until heated through.
Place roast in slow cooker. Cover roast with broth. Add all other ingredients. Cook on low for 9 hours or high for 5 hours. Slice roast. Serve on buns.
In a small saucepan bring milk to a boil. Add hot chocolate mix and stir. Add brown sugar. Stir in cinnamon. Add chocolate syrup. Stir. Serve. Makes 2 servings.

Sprinkle prawns all over with seasonings. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add prawnscook until pink. Transfer to platekeep warm. Combine barbecue sauce, lemon juice and honey. Heat in small saucepan over low heat until warmed throughdrizzle over prawns. Serve garnished with parsley sprig. Sprinkle with chives.

Bring the water to a boil in a small saucepan over high heat. Remove the pan from the heat and immediately add the tea bags. Let steep for 3 minutes. Remove the tea bags and discard them. Cool the tea to room temperature. Peel the eggs and cut them crosswise into quarters. In a small bowl, combine the tea, mayonnaise, and tarragon. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Stir until smooth. Place the crabmeat in the tea mixture and stir until the crabmeat is well coated. Fill the egg quarters with the crab mixture. Serve immediately.
Cut up apples and celery and mix with Miracle Whip. Add pecans. Add cream and stir well. Add vinegar, sugar and pepper and mix well. Refrigerate for at least two hours.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl and stir well. Chill at least 1 hour or up to a day before serving. Serve as a dip with cut-up raw vegetables or on a sandwich instead of mayo.

Mix together the sugar, eggs, and condensed milk in a medium bowl. Heat the chocolate milk in a medium saucepan over medium heat until hot. Pour the hot chocolate milk into the sugar mixture and mix until well combined. Add the vanilla to the milk mixture. Add the semisweet chocolate to the mixture and stir until it is completely mixed in. Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker. Churn the mixture according to the manufacturers instructions. Place in a freezer-safe container. Freeze for several hours to allow the ice cream to thicken. Enjoy.

Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add onion and cook until tender about 10 minutes. Stir in the frozen orange juice concentrate and ketchup. Add the garlic cloves and cinnamon stick and cook for another minute or two. Add the chicken and hot sauce stirring well. Reduce heat and simmer covered for 20 minutes. Remove and discard the cinnamon stick. Serve over hot steamed rice sprinkle with fresh lime juice.

Follow package directions for mixing the dough for drop cookies. Add 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, and 1/8 tsp clove. Mix well. Divide dough in half and roll each half into a 15x8-inch rectangle on lightly floured surface. Sprinkle each rectangle with 1/2 cup raisins. Top each with 1/4 cup pecans. Cut each rectangle into 12 bars. Place on greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes.

Mix the white sugar and water in a large bowl. Add frozen concentrated lemonade and frozen orange juice. Mix thoroughly. Add grenadine and ginger ale. Pour into a large punch bowl. Add strawberries. Serves about 20.

Toss carrots with 1 tsp. of the butter and 1 Tbsp. of the ginger in a small bowl. In another bowl combine remaining 2 Tbsp. of the ginger with the pineapple juice, brown sugar and salt. Heat remaining 2 tsp. of the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the carrots and cook, turning occasionally until they are tender, 6 to 8 minutes. Add the pineapple mixture and the lime juice and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the glaze thickens and coats the carrots, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve warm.

Combine all the ingredients in a 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes or until the onions and peppers are tender. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake 2-3 minutes longer or until the cheese is melted. Makes 6 servings.

Remove the top crust from a frozen puff pastry package. Set aside. Spread about 1/4 inch of mayo inside the pastry shell and spread another 1/4 inch of roasted red peppers. Sprinkle with pizza cheese. Top with a second pastry crust. Press the edges together and seal with a fork. Place the pastry on a baking sheet. Brush with egg wash and sprinkle with parsley and chili powder. Bake at 425 for about 20 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.

Combine crabmeat and mayonnaise in a large bowl. Salt and pepper to taste. Spread cheese evenly onto the bottom of each English muffin half. Top with crab mixture and sprinkle with parsley. Place under broiler to brown. Serve with slices of lemon.

Saute onions in 1 tablespoon of the butter until soft. Add clams, cream-style corn, russet potatoes, water, chicken bouillon cubes, milk and instant potato flakes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 15 minutes or until thick. Remove bay leaf. Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter, green onions and black pepper. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Preheat the oven to 350°F. Combine the blanched almonds and sugar in a food processor and process until finely ground. Add the candied orange peel and process until well mixed. Add the flour and pulse to combine. Add the milk and pulse to combine. Place the chocolate pieces and butter in a microwave-safe bowl and heat until the chocolate is melted, about 1 minute per 10 ounces. Add the chocolate to the cookie dough and stir until combined. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat and divide the dough into 10 balls. Press a ball into a 1/2-inch disk with the palm of your hand and place it on the baking sheet. Continue with the remaining balls of dough to create 5 rows of 2 cookies each. Bake until the cookies are firm and set, about 10 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes and then move the cookies to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Add the flour and stir for 2 minutes. Add the hot water and stir until smooth. Add the salt and vinegar. Reduce heat to low and stir until thickened. Remove from heat. Whisk in the eggs and potato. Spray an 8-inch square baking dish with nonstick spray. Pour the egg mixture into the dish. Bake for 40 minutes or until the custard is set. Let cool 5 minutes. Cut into 1-inch cubes. Serve warm.

Prepare squash by cutting in half lengthwise. Scoop seeds out and set aside. Place halves in a casserole dish. Add onion. In a bowl combine sour cream, basil, red pepper and bread crumbs. Sprinkle over onion and squash. Top with cheddar cheese and sprinkle with paprika. Dot with butter. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

Peel and dice sweet potatoes. In a saucepan over medium heat, bring sweet potato cubes to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes or until very tender. Drain sweet potatoes in a strainer or colander over a bowl. Return sweet potatoes to the saucepan. Add heavy cream, butter, bourbon, brown sugar, molasses, salt and pepper to the sweet potatoes. Heat over medium heat until heated through. Stir in nutmeg. Serve hot.

In a large skillet over medium heat melt butter. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned. Add mushrooms, fresh sage, and a dash of salt and pepper. Cook until mushrooms are tender and most of liquid has evaporated. Stir in pasta sauce. Cook until hot. Serve pasta over mushroom sauce. Top with freshly grated parmesan cheese and fresh sage leaves.

Cut off top 1/4 to 1/2" of cake (depending on the size of your loaf). Remove the middle of the loaf (again, to your preference of how many layers you want). Mix together cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Spread between layers of cake. Spread topping of Nutella on top of the cream cheese. Sprinkle with toffee pieces.

Melt chocolate and shortening in a double boiler over simmering water. Add 1/2 cup marshmallow cream and stir until well blended. Add pretzels and stir until completely coated. Add white chocolate chips. Stir until melted and blended. Pour into 9x13-inch pan lined with waxed paper. Refrigerate until hard. Break into pieces. Melt white chocolate in a double boiler over simmering water. Spread over pretzels. Let set until hard. Store in an airtight container. Prep time does not include chilling time in the refrigerator.

Cut 5 lamb cutlets into 1/2-inch strips. Whisk egg white lightly to form a thin white paste. Put breadcrumbs in a plastic bag or paper bag with a pinch of sea saltshake to mix. Dip cutlets into flour. Dip into egg white mixture. Shake cutlets into breadcrumbs to coat well. Heat oil in a large nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook cutlets for 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden and cooked through. Serve with your favorite salad or vegetable for a quick weeknight meal.

In a small bowl whisk together oil, vinegar and fish sauce. In a salad bowl toss together lettuce, onions and avocados. Pour dressing over and toss. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and fresh cracked pepper.

Combine chicken broth and cauliflower in a medium saucepan. Cover and cook over medium heat for 15 minutes or until tender. Add carrot, onion and nutmegcook and stir 5 minutes. Add nonfat milk and pepperheat through. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.

Combine ground beef with salsa, bread crumbs and cheese in a large bowlmix well. Form into a loaf, place in a 13 x 9 inch pan coated with cooking spraysprinkle with garlic and parsley. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes or until no longer pink. Serve with sour cream and a sprinkle of parsley and chives.
Preheat oven to 350. Spread bread with pizza sauce and top with cheeses. Layer with ham, salami, pepperoni and green pepper. Bake in oven about 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

In a skillet over medium heat, brown the meat with salt and pepper and set aside. Add the oil to the pan, then the tortilla chips, feta cheese, and stir to combine. Cook until the cheese is melted. Add the meat back to the pan. Add the eggs, tomato sauce and jalapeno peppers if using and cook until eggs are cooked through. Remove from heat and serve.

Combine first five ingredients in a small bowl, stirring until smoothplace in plastic bag and refrigerate until ready to use. In a small bowl, combine next five ingredients. Rub roast with spice mixtureplace on rack in shallow roasting pan. Heat oven to 325 degrees F. Heat apricot preserves mixture in small saucepan over low heat until very warm. Brush beef with warm apricot mixture every 30 minutes during roasting timeroast in oven until beef is desired doneness (about 1 hour per lb). Let stand ten minutes before slicing. Yield: 6 servings

Bring to a boil sugar and water stirring constantly until sugar is completely dissolved. Let boil for 2 minutes without stirring. Add mint leaves and lemon juice. Turn off heat. Let stand 2 minutes. Remove and strain liquid through a fine sieve or collander. Store in a glass bottle or jar with a tight fitting lid and refrigerate until ready to use.

Peel and slice the peaches into 1/4 inch slices or cubes. Toss the slices with the sugar, nutmeg and cinnamon. Blend the tapioca with 1/2 cup of water. Mix the dry tapioca with the cinnamon sugar and set aside. Combine the melted butter with the flour to make a paste. Fold the peaches into the butter mixture then fold in the dry tapioca. Spread evenly into the prepared baking dish. Cover the top of the cobbler with the cinnamon sugar mixture. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes or until lightly browned.

Pierce potatoes all over with fork and place on microwaveable dish. Microwave on high for 8 minutes. Cut potatoes in half and add broccoli floret to each half. In small bowl combine sour cream and green onions and garlic cloves. Sprinkle over potatoes and broccoli and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
In a blender combine 3 scoops of vanilla ice cream, 1/4 cup milk and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. Blend until smooth. Pour into glass. Top with 1 tablespoon of chocolate fudge topping and a cherry. Repeat.

Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Cream the butter and sugars together until well blended, then beat in the egg yolks one at a time, add the almond extract and almond paste. In a separate bowl sift together the flour and baking soda. Add the dry ingredients alternately with the milk to the creamed mixture, stirring after each addition until smooth. Beat the egg whites until stiff and fold them into the batter. Drop by the rounded spoonful onto greased cookie sheets and bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown around the edges and lightly browned at the center. Cool the cookies for a few minutes on the sheet and transfer them to a wire rack. Recipe makes about 2 dozen cookies
Lay out 3 lettuce leaves on hoagie roll. Layer ham, swiss cheese, thousand island dressing, then top with dill pickle. Top with a second lettuce leaf and roll up. Cut in half.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the linguine and cook until just tender, about 10 minutes. Drain the pasta well and transfer it to a large serving bowl. Melt the butter over medium-low heat until it bubbles. Add the garlic powder, oregano leaves, parsley and lemon juiceseason with salt and pepper and stir until the butter is fragrant, about 30 seconds. Pour the butter over the linguine and toss well until it is well coated and evenly distributed. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch slices and place in a large bowl. Toss with flour and season with salt and pepper. Add butter and toss to coat. Spread potatoes evenly in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish and bake until potatoes are golden brown and crisp and cheese is melted and bubbling, about 30-35 minutes. Serve warm.

Powder the nuts. Combine the sugar, egg whites and extract and beat with electric mixer until stiff peaks form. Add the nuts and toss to coat. Spread in greased baking pan. Bake at 300 degrees for 1 hour or until nuts are glazed and dry. Remove from pan and cool completely.

In a large pot combine water, bouillon cubes and soup. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the mixture thickens. Add noodles and cook for another 20 minutes or until done. Remove from heat. Remove bouillon cubes. Add Veg-All, dill weed, bay leaves, celery salt, and pepper. Serve hot with crackers or crusty bread.

Prepare chicken rice mix according to package directions. While rice is cooking, combine chicken and dressing in large skillet. Cook over low heat until chicken is heated through. Remove from heat and stir in spinach until just wilted. Add tomatoes and olives. Mix well and serve over rice. Serve immediately or store in refrigerator until ready to serve.

Heat oil over medium heat in a medium skillet. Brown ground beef, drain and return to skillet with onion, 1/2 teaspoon salt and pepper to taste. Add watercover and simmer over low heat for 10 minutes. Uncoverstir in soup. Blend wellcook another 5 minutes or until heated through. In 8x8 inch baking dish layer 1/2 of potato chips, half of ground beef mixturerepeat layers. Top with remaining potato chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until bubbly. Serves 4 to 6

In a small saucepan, combine honey and chipotle. Bring mixture to boil over medium-high heat. Add pecan halves, return saucepan to heat and simmer for about 1 minute or until pecans are coated and glazed. Remove from heat and sprinkle pecans evenly onto a rimmed baking sheet. Sprinkle with cinnamon and salt to taste. Bake in preheated oven for about 10 minutes or until nuts are lightly toasted and glaze is dried. Cool slightly before serving.

Thaw black beans. Cook rice according to package directions. Add velveeta cheese product to the rice. Add the beans. Add the tomatoes. Mix well. Reheat. Serve over rice. Top with sour cream. Serve in tortillas.

In a small bowl combine pie filling and yogurt. Set aside. In each of 6 ungreased paper-lined muffin cups spoon about 2 tablespoons of filling. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the pineapple over filling. Top with 1 to 2 tablespoons cool whip and 1 to 2 tablespoons miniature marshmallows. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Mix all crust ingredients and press into a 9-inch pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes, or until crust is golden brown. Combine apples with lemon juice and 1/2 cup sugar, and let stand 30 minutes. Beat remaining 1 cup sugar and corn syrup until blended. Beat in egg yolks, vanilla, and butter until smooth. Pour over apples and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until apples are tender and filling is set. Cool 5 minutesserve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. In small bowl, mix flour, baking powder, cinnamon, salt and egg until well blended. In medium bowl, mix applesauce, butter, milk and vanilla until well blended. Stir into flour mixture just until moistened (batter will be lumpy). Fill 12 paper-lined muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted near centers comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to wire racks.

Saute onion and garlic in oil until tender and golden brown. Add salami and cook for an additional minute. Stir in mushrooms and tomato paste and cook for five minutes longer until liquid has evaporated and salami is browned. Stir in chicken, cook and stir until browned and heated through. Add sour cream and pepper. Heat through and serve. Serves 3 to 4.

Puto is a filipino rice-based cake that can be served plain or with butter, sugar, or grated cheese. Putos are usually made in a steamer. But here is the easier version for those who do not have one. In a bowl combine 1-1/2 cups Bisquick and 1-1/2 cups milk. Add egg. Mix well. Add 1/4 cup sugar. Stir to mix well. Grease an 8-inch square pan with butter or margarine. Pour mixture into the pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes. Cool. Serve.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine rice, water, milk, egg and sugar. Stirring constantly, bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, covered, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract. Spoon into serving dish. Garnish with raisins.

Heat the broth in a medium saucepan to a boil. Add garlic and carrots. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Add asparagus and continue cooking 5 minutes. Meanwhile, coat sole with flour. Melt butter in heavy skillet over medium heat. Add sole and cook for 5 minutes. Turn and cook 5 minutes more. Remove sole to 2 serving plates. Stir wine into broth mixture and bring to a boil. Boil for 2 minutes. Pour broth over sole and garnish with lemon peel.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Combine strawberries, brown sugar, and cinnamon in a medium bowltoss gently to coat. Arrange strawberries in a single layer on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake in the preheated oven until the berries are softened and bubbly, 5-7 minutes. In a small microwave-safe bowl, microwave nutella until it is softened enough to spread, about 30 seconds. Toast buns. Spread nutella on bunstop with strawberries. Serve with yogurt on the side.

Fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and crumble. Add diced onion. Cook until onion is clear. Add the spinach. Cook until wilted. Add the sour cream and hot sauce. Toss to combine. Layer the tomatoes in a serving dish. Add the spinach mixture. Top with the crumbled bacon and mozzarella.

Cut bread into quarters lengthwise and place in bottom of large casserole dish. Layer each piece with bacon, cheese and one egg. Season with mustard, onion and pepper. Repeat layers and sprinkle with corn flakes. Pour boiling water over the top of the casserole and cover with lid or foil. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes. Check for doneness by inserting knife near center of casserole and seeing if it comes out clean. Serve with toast if desired.

Slice rhubarb into 1-inch pieces. In a large saucepan, combine rhubarb, sugar, and water. Cover. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium. Cook until rhubarb is tender. Drain liquid from saucepan. Set aside rhubarb. In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder and sugar. Cut butter into mixture. Add eggs, milk, vanilla and rhubarb. Mix until smooth. Pour batter into a 10x15x3-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the sponge comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes. Combine whipping cream with sugar. Beat until creamy. Spread evenly over sponge. Sprinkle with coconut. Cut into squares to serve.

Mix together the butter, salt and sugar until crumbly. Add the cinnamon and mix well. Add the flour and mix well. Divide the dough into 6 equal portions and form into balls. Chill in the refrigerator for at least an hour and up to several days. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Roll each ball in granulated sugar. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Prepare instant butterscotch and chocolate pudding mixes according to package directions using skim milk. Let cool to room temperature. Fold cool whip lite into each. Place into the glasses. Sprinkle with nuts.

Melt chocolate in double boiler or in microwave oven on low power. Dip cone halfway into melted chocolate and place on wax paper. Immediately decorate with doughnut holes and candies as desired. After cone is decorated, place in freezer until chocolate sets. Melt chocolate in double boiler or in microwave on low power. Dip cone halfway into melted chocolate and place on wax paper. Immediately decorate with doughnut holes and candies as desired. After cone is decorated, place in freezer until chocolate sets.

Boil potatoes and leeks in salted water until tender. Drain. Chop coarsely and set aside. Mash cilantro stems. Stir together. Chop cilantro leaves. Heat butter in a skillet over low heat. Add anchovies and garlic. Cook until fragrant. Add cilantro and cook 1 minute. Pour over soup. Stir and serve.

Place sugar and evaporated milk into a medium size saucepan. Bring to a rolling boil and boil for one minute. Remove from heat and add vanilla, marshmallow creme and butter. Stir until completely mixed. Add walnuts and butterscotch chips. Spread into a greased pan. Cool and cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray 9x13 baking pan with cooking spray. Peel and core apples. Slice apples into 1/2-inch slices. In a bowl, combine the first 8 ingredients. Toss apples with sugar mixture. In a bowl, combine the oats, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda and butter. Spread over apples. Bake uncovered 50-60 minutes or until topping is lightly browned. Serves 8-10.
Spread peanut butter on one half of pita bread. Press banana slices onto peanut butter. Sprinkle with honey. Top with pitted dates and cover with other half of pita bread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine the corn with 1/4 cup of the oil. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat remaining 1/2 cup oil. Add the corn and cook for 5 minutes. Add the peppers and onion and cook for 5 minutes. Add the poblano and cook until soft. Add the cornmeal and cumin and cook for 5 minutes. Add the olives and the lime juice. Toss and cook for 1 more minute. Sprinkle with the cilantro and serve hot.

In a small bowl, beat together mascarpone cheese and kahlua until smooth. In another bowl beat coffee until it is foamy and pour it into a bowl filled with water. Sprinkle water over the coffee until it begins to sink to the bottom of the bowl. Add the sugar to the coffee/water mixture and stir until the sugar dissolves. Add the mascarpone mixture to the coffee/water mixture and whisk to combine. Pour into a tall glass or a bowl. Add the cherries to the top of the mixture and serve cold.

Place fish in a large plastic bag. In a small bowl combine all remaining ingredientspour over fish. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Preheat grill. Place fish in a single layer on oiled grill. Cover and cook 10 minutes. Turn and cook another 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a 2-quart microwave safe dish. Add mustard, pepper, and salt. Stir in beer. Heat until mixture is hot. Add cheese spread. Stir until melted. Place bread slices into cheese mixture. Cook on high until cheese is melted about 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease an 8x8 inch square pan with the shorteningset aside. Sift together the cornmeal, flour, baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. In another bowl combine the sugar and eggmix well. Stir in the cornmeal mixture and buttermilk until smooth. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the middle of the cornbread comes out clean. Serve warm.

Boil 8 cups of water in a large pot. Add shrimp, green curry paste, tamarind paste, brown sugar, fish sauce, chicken stock cube, straw mushrooms, carrot, green beans, Chinese cabbage and chili flakes. Stir well until all ingredients are well mixed. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Then add coconut milk and cook for another minute or so. Serve with rice, sprinkle with some chopped chives.

Peel yams and cut into 1/2-inch chunks. Combine the yams, butter and brown sugar in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir frequently until yams are tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in the Kahlua and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. In a large pot, combine rice cereal and karo syrup and stir until well coated. Cook on medium high heat for 2 minutes stirring constantly. Add sugar and continue to stir for 2 minutes then remove from heat and add peanut butter and chocolate chips and stir well. Spread evenly on a greased cookie sheet and press down. Cook in oven for 10 minutes and cool on a rack. Cut into bars and enjoy!

In a small saucepan combine brown sugar with prepared horseradish and lemon juice. Cook over medium heat until smooth. Brush glaze over both sides of the ham steak. Grill for 4-5 minutes each side or until ham reaches desired doneness.

Cut the avocado in half. Scoop out the avocado flesh. Mash the flesh with a fork. Sprinkle the taco seasoning on the mashed avocado. Spread the mixture on each half. Place a slice of cheese on each half. Place a chicken breast on each half. Spread salsa on top. Broil for about 8-10 minutes, until chicken is done. Serves 2.
Mix all ingredients together. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Mix mashed potato with onion and seasoning. Make into flat cakes and put into freezer for 30 minutes. Meanwhile mix the egg and the cornflour together and dip each cake into the mixture. Then dip into the panko breadcrumbs. Heat the oil and fry the croquettes until golden. Serve with tomato sauce.
In a large pot with oil saute onion and garlic. Add chicken and season with salt and pepper. Add beer. Bring to a boil and simmer until chicken is cooked through. Add bell peppers and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Mix crumbs and butter together until crumbs are well coated. Add flour and mix well. Add milk and water and stir until thoroughly blended. Set aside. Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain well and place in 9 x 13 baking dish. Combine bouillon cubes and boiling water and stir until dissolved. Add sour cream and chicken and mix well. Pour over noodles. Sprinkle with crumb mixture. Bake in 400 degree oven for 40 minutes. Add canned mushrooms and stir. Bake another 10 minutes or until crumb topping is browned.
Pour all ingredients into a shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water and drain again. In a large skillet, saute the onion and garlic until tender. Stir in the zucchini, bacon bits and lemon juice. Remove from heat and toss with pasta and cheese until evenly mixed. Serve warm.

In a small bowl, combine butter, extra virgin olive oil and garlic. Mash with a fork until a paste forms. Add the fresh cilantro, seafood seasoning and lemon juice. Coat the fish with the marinade. Place the fish in a dish. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Bake the fish for 10 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and ginger and saute for 1 minute. Add celery and mushrooms and saute for 2 minutes. Add shrimp and toss until they begin to turn pink on the bottom. Add the toasted sesame oil and red pepper flakes and toss to combine. Add the soy sauce and toss to coat well.

Preheat oven to 375f. Wash and drain chicken breastsseason with black pepper, garlic powder and italian seasoning. Place chicken breasts in a baking dish. In a separate bowl mix together the barbecue sauce and melted butter. Pour barbecue sauce mixture over the chicken breasts. Sprinkle each piece with cheese. Cover dish with foil and bake for 1 hour or until the chicken is done. Serve on toasted garlic bread or lettuce leaves with green onions and chopped tomatoes.

Cook the chicken breasts and broccoli in chicken broth. In a bowl, combine bisquick, milk, onion flakes, egg and seasonings. Spread into unbaked pie crust. Add the chicken and broccoli. Top with cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

In a small bowl combine the sour cream, dill, vinegar, salt and pepper. Mix well. In a medium bowl combine the onion and cucumber slices. Pour the sour cream mixture over the onion mixture and toss well. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
